Nearby are the historic Government House, Parliament House (Australia's oldest parliament), the State Library and The Mint.

A perfect stroll in a wonderful city. Located directly next to the famous Sydney Opera House, the Royal Botanic Gardens are really inviting. You feel far away from all the hectic a big city normally entails. Lots of places to just sit and relax and enjoy the fantastic view onto the water.

Beautiful Gardens. You can take a stroll around the gardens and then sit and take in the wonderful sites of Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. All this for free a great place to have a nice picnic lunch or just a lay in the sunshine. Good for anybody or group of people's.
Vivid light festival . Vivid light festival was decorated so nice throughout the gardens. Our favourite part was the the arch made of tiny flowers.

Beautiful. Walked though the botanic gardens and it was a beautiful way to spend part of the afternoon. Especially around this time of year (June) as it is warm but not too warm. All in all worth a visit

Quick tour of beautiful gardens with choo choo train. We had not planned on visiting the Botanical Gardens. However, because we got rebooked for a later Sydney Opera House tour (see my review of Sydney Opera House), we had some time to kill. Upon entering the gardens near the Sydney Opera House, we saw a couple small trains. We decided to hop on the 25-minute ride (you may hop off and catch a later train if you wish to look some more) to do a loop of the Gardens. The tour gave an excellent overview of the Botanical Gardens. We saw the various flora and fauna, including a tree variety as old as the time of the dinosaurs! If you don’t have a lot of time in Sydney and did not plan to spend a lot of time in the Gardens, the Choo Choo train is a great option.

The gardens look wonderful in winter!. We popped in here today to fill in time and give the kids a run around. They had a super time running everywhere, looking at statues, admiring massive trees and just enjoying the lovely feel of the gardens.

Calyx - Sweet Addiction. What a disappointment.We love the gardens and decided to visit the much hyped new attraction - the Calyx. The Calyx is a long living wall of plants, in itself of some interest, but currently there is an associated attraction called Sweet Addiction, The Story of Chocolate.It cost around $17 each to enter the facility, were we just interested in the living wall, but we still had to pay to see it. We were in and out in 5 minutes. it was most disappointing - we simply had to regard the entry fee as a donation to the gardens.Why not provide free entry with a donation box as occurs with many overseas institutions.Please do your homework before you go, we could not recommend this "attraction" to anyone at this price.

Great even on a rainy day in May. When I was first in Australia about 10 years ago I spent a fair amount of time at the Botanical Gardens as it was close to where I was staying and there was a lot of nice scenery plus a lot of great plants that we don’t have in Canada so it was quite interesting. It’s a great place to sit under a tree, read a book, chat with friendly co-eds and enjoy the outdoors, there’s always someone looking for an extra person to play soccer or ultimate so it’s a good social exercise. The Royal Botanic Gardens is celebrating its 200th anniversary this year so that is very cool and it is in great shape thanks to the dedicated groundskeepers. Great way to spend an afternoon walking the paths looking at the flora and close to the Opera House and Central Business District.
Don't know much about plants - but wow!. I know nothing about plants but the botanic gardens are stunning. On the Harbor, next to the opera house, we spent 2 hours walking the gardens and Harbour.

Great gardens with a view. The Botanical gardens in Sydney are well maintain with some of the best views in Sydney. They are family friendly and they try to keep up with times. They have a vivid display and I think this was the first year. The plants and trees are immaculately kept. A good place to visit.

Nice Walk. This was a must see while in Sydney. Many trails throughout the park leading to all types of hidden treasures. Stop in the shop for some different ideas for gifts. Take your time and take it all in.
In amongst the palm trees. Lovely open plan space with views out over the gardens. Fixed price lunch menu is excellent with attentive service. Shame its not busier.

200 years old and still a wonderful place. We love spending time in the botanical gardens as a family. There are different areas for the children to explore (succulent garden, palm garden, fernery, herb garden, rose garden, Asian garden, pond with cormorants nesting & fish & eels). It's a big place with lots of nooks and crannys to have a picnic, play a game or just hang out in the sun. We sometimes make it educational trying to get the children to think about the plants read the signs, sometimes we take our sketchbooks and draw pictures too.

What grows in Aussieland?. By the Opera House is an entrance to the Botanical Gardens which display an astonishing array of plant life from the region. I was in awe of the plantings, and the most interesting specimens have good signage so that you can understand more about the unique ecology and plant variety of the region.

Lovely walk. We walked through the Botanic Gardens and were able to get really close to a flock of white cockatoos for a brilliant photo shoot!Also went round the cacti and succulent garden which was like an alien landscape to us Brits!Well worth a visit!

Peaceful green area in vibrant sydney centre. Whenever downtown sydney, we pay a visit to these beautiful gardens for a bit of fresh air and rest, and maybe a pic nic. We always find some interesting plant we had not noticed before. Good toilet facilities just outside.
Lovely afternoon. The Botanic Garden is a perfect place for an afternoon picnic, reading a book or just some peace and quiet.

Great setting for a Botanical Garden!. Relaxing and peaceful in the centre of busy Sydney, this is the place to be. The gardens themselves are lovely with lots of places for a picnic, but the best part is the setting right on Sydney Harbour. Fabulous walks, fabulous views, and right next to the Opera House. Love it here.

Gardens. Visited the gardens at night and during the day and it has always been an amazing experience. The walk can feel a bit short at times - especially when all of the beauty is seen around you but definitely worth it.

Happy Birthday. We accidentally stumbled across the Botanic Gardens 200th Birthday Celebration.We were treated to free food and drinks, tables and chairs, music and entertainment not to mention all the exhibitions at the gardens. 200 years not to be missed!!!!

Don't miss!. It's a stone's throw from Opera House. At first my teens were grumbling about " going to look at plants" but they had an amazing time too. There are wild Cockatoos flying around and some small Australian possums under the brush. The birds are amazing. kookaburras and Ibis around everywhere. The different Flora is gorgeous.

Beautiful park, beautiful location. It's hard to imagine a more ideal location for a botanical park, than Sydney's Royal Botanic Gardens location along the shore of Sydney Harbour, right next door to the Sydney Opera House. The RBG, celebrating its 200th anniversary, is the oldest scientific institution in Australia, and one of the preeminent botanic institutions in the world.There is a main pathway that goes all the way from Mrs. Macquarie's Point to the Opera House, as well as many side pathways going through the four main sections of the park. A beautiful, relaxing place to stroll.

Oasis in the heart of Sydney. I'm not a botanist or a gardening enthusiastic but I love walking through these gardens on a nice day. Take an hour or two, longer if you are lucky and stroll through the gardens, stop and smell the roses.We even spotted Prince William there a few years back!
Beautiful. Well groomed, peaceful and big amazing trees. In summer beautiful flowers. Pack a lunch and have a picnic there.
So much to see. Walked through a number of ways and there was always more to see, great place to see on a sunny day so much to see

Vivid 2016 highlights the Garden's 200th anniversary. Vivid 2016 highlights the Garden's 200th anniversary in fantastic style. The lighting of the trees and the surrounding gardens continues to highlight the beauty of Sydney. Visiting at night provides a new prospective on the gardens as well as allowing great night views over the harbour.

Large stunning gardens, set on the bay by the Opera House. This place is huge and you need to give it time to look around slowly, if possible. The wildlife is amazing, as are the views, so enjoy it slowly.

Lady Macquaries Chair. There is a stunning little walk to do along the Harbour from the entrance to the botanic gardens, ending at a peninsula known as Lady Macquarie's Chair. You will have to do the walk to learn the story. Go at dusk and there are stunning, stunning photos to be had of the Sydney Harbour Bridge behind the Opera House. The walk is great for all access; big wide footpath all the way.
really nice and green. Royal Botanic Gardens are really nice and green. Just sit there and relax and enjoy the view to the ocean and Opera House

Such space!!. We had a short stay in Sydney in January 2015, though very warm the lovely shade and breezes off the Harbour made it pleasant.Well worth the walk through the gardens to the Sydney Opera House and Harbour.

One of the most beautiful Botanical Gardens on the Harbour Foreshore. This is a favourite location to attend and I do so at least once a month. Located on the Sydney Harbour Foreshore, these Gardens have sweeping views of Sydney Harbour. Gardens are well manicured, a variety of trees and shrubs. Lots of Cockatoos have made the gardens their home as well as kookaburras, ducks and other feather friends. If you are visiting the city, make this is a must....its free and well worth the visit.

Beautiful gardens..A must visit in the day & night for Vivid Sydney.. I visited Royal botanic gardens on 2 separate days one in the day to visit the different varieties of flora & fauna. The garden opens from 9am to 5.30 pm. And another day in the night to visit the Vivid Sydney attractions in the garden. For the night visit to the gardens only during the Vivid Sydney it reopens at 6 pm to 11 pm. A must visit during your holidays.I especially enjoy the vivid illuminated arched tunnel lights that you have to walk through. Took plenty of memorable photos during the day & night. Do wear comfortable anti slip shoes because it can be slippery when it rains.

Botanical garden. Beautiful nothing to say ,must go place at Sydney just explore thr garden and its sorrounfing, 3- 4 colour grasses,alpine with cactus as well as combo of tropical and temparate foredst plant

Wonderful sanctuary in the heart of the city!. Big, open, amazing plants and animals, just a great way to get out of the hustle and bustle of the city. If you're a local, you have to go visit the Friends of The Garden shop - they sell wonderful plants at very reasonable prices and are very helpful and informative. Great food at the cafe (especially breakfast), the one next to the big ponds, and lots of good walks!
Great gardens, lovely position. Lovely area, nice to be told to walk on the grass, hug the trees, this is your garden, enjoy it! We certainly did.

A wonderful backdrop to the Sydney Opera House and Harbour. We spent a wonderful half day strolling around Circular Quay, the Opera House and then on to the Royal Botanic Gardens. We couldn't have chosen a better day for our visit, as the gardens were displayed in all their splendour in glorious sunshine. We were indeed fortunate to see them at their best.

Nice Walk but kind of minimal compared to others. Compared to others around the world this is quite minimum. Its very good to walk through and very green but not even close the Kew Gardens in London or the US National Botanic Garden. Also, it does not open to 7AM and I was hoping to get some shots at sunrise but opens well after sunrise so its a disappointment. Now, if in Sydney its a great garden but nit sure I would rate it as a great Botanic Garden. My opinion.

Hideaway. Amazing garden, trees, animals. This place really worths a visit. I personally love to go johging there cause there is a lot of space and it's just amazing to do sport in such a natural and relaxing surrounding.

A relaxed beautiful park in the heart of Sydney. You can stay there for hours contemplainting all the exotic species of flora, walking, doing picnic or only seat in a shade of a tree appreciating the stunning view from Sydney Opera House.
Beautiful. Very well kept gardens adjacent to the Sydney Opera House. Great place to do some yoga, toss around a Frisbee, or just stroll through.

don't take the train. We love the Botanic Gardens, but the $10 train was a rip off for 20 min rip around one circle, and the two people running it had the personality of a brick, over sensitive, no personality or sense of humour.
Not sure how they got the job...

A world leader in Botanical Gardens. We've seen gardens all over the world and in different states of Australia. Sydney's Botanical Gardens is certainly a world leader. It's big, it has variety, it's structure is interesting. There are places to walk, sit, lie down, eat your lunch, enjoy the harbour views. Easy to get there by public transport. And located close to many other Sydney attractions. If you like gardens don't miss this Sydney attraction.

Beautiful gardens beside a beautiful harbour. The spectacular views from many parts of Australia's oldest botanic garden make this walk a special treat. Look out for the Wollemi pine, recently discovered in a remote location to the west of Sydney and now cuttings are available for sale to the public. Start your walk at the Eatern entrance, near the Art Gallery of NSW and walk down the path towards the harbour, exiting near the Opera House.

Gorgeous gardens. What a lovely place to wander around for a couple of hours. Lots of signs so that you know what you're looking at, and well maintained paths etc. Beautiful location and lots of good photo ops.

disappointing. We could not find any gardens only grass. But the vivid light show exhibits were good. A huge arch covered in fairy lights caused quite a people jam on the night we went. The trees are all lit up with coloured lights and the entrance has fairy lights lighting up the front display with rainbow colours.
Beautiful!!. I strongly recommend to do this walk!!!Amazing gardens!! Really, really beautiful!!!U can seat there and have lunch!! It's so peaceful!!
Don't Miss it!. Lovely walking through elegant gardens, and the variety of flora was incredible! From Golden Barrel Cactus to the iconic Ficus (Gum) trees, it is a relaxing and most pleasant walk.

Great Gardens. Beautiful gardens to just walk around and view. Great place to sit and chill out when the weather is good. Loved walking around under the beautiful trees and checking out the lovely gardens and fountains.

A great autumn afternoon walking through the gardens. As a couple in Sydney on a business trip we spent the afternoon wandering through the gardens. Great views of the harbour and although well used it still felt very calming and enjoyable. Walked around gardens to Opera House and Circular Quay and enjoyed the best that Sydney has to offer!

A must see tourist attraction!. The Sydney Royal Botanical Gardens is a must see while visiting Australia! They are celebrating their 200th anniversary this year. Just a stones throw away from the Opera House and Harbour! Short on time, enjoy the pristine grounds and arrangements!
Great park. The Botanic Gardens are centrally located next to the Opera House. You can enjoy a walk around the garden with great views of Sydney bridge and opera house

Great range of plants. A spectacular range of plants and trees from all around the world. I particularly like the huge Morton Bay Figs with their size and shape. Many birds inhabit these gardens as well as fruit bats. Vivid light shows are great in their too.

Go For A Stroll. FREE!!!
Most plants labeled. Spacious, lot of green grass areas. Paths weave back and forth through the grounds Has fern grotto. Has historic trees. Along waterfront near Sydney Opera House.
A magnificent place next to the Opera house. The Royal Botanic Gardens are incredible beatiful, highly recommended you take a stroll from the Opera House, the scenery is incredible and free!
Vivid lights were wonderful in the gardens . The gardens were lovely to walk thru, would like to do it now in the daytime. Great view of the harbour as well. Worth the visit

Cozy park for a picnic or cardio session for all ages. Strolled here in one evening and saw many Australians and tourists alike enjoying the park's flora and fauna. The lighting installations for the vivid sydney was up and drew photo snaps from tourists.
Wife was appaled by the large catfish while I was snapping photos of cockatoos busying themselves asking for nuts from human visitors.

A stroll amongst the trees and flowers. A place alive with flora and a different view at every turn. Stroll along the pathways through the gardens and open parkland, catch glimpses of the city, the bridge, the opera house, the harbour and bay. If you start at the city side and work your way down towards the harbour you can arrive at the opera house and then walk back into Circular Quay. A pleasant stroll whatever the time of day.

Beautiful!!. Well maintained, gorgeous landscaping, and so many unusual birds!!! A great place to spend a few hours in nature without leaving the city. Stunning views of the harbor, and one end of the park ends up at the iconic Opera House.

Very nice for a walk. The botanic garden is a huge garden with different areas in different styles. If you are at the opera for example is a Stone throw to the botanic garden and if u like to have a nice walk it is the perfect place to do so.

Stunning Place A Must See for everyone. Whether you are a tourist? or local. Everyone should spend a day in tho Botanic Gardens. It is simply one of the worlds great garden attractions what could better then picnicking on the lush lawns surrounded by exotic plants and Harbour views

Tranquil and beautiful. Just a few steps away from the hustle and bustle of the city, this peaceful garden offers the opportunity to relax in quiet, shady areas. Beautiful trees, shrubs and flowers with pond side seats makes this a perfect place to stop off for a rest with a cold drink on a busy, hot day.
Be Sure to Take the Train Ride. It was worth the price of the train to take the ride and see an overview of the gardens. Would not want to walk the grounds; too much space to cover.

Green oasis in the mid of concrete building. A big garden in the mid of Sydney CBD with thousands of trees, some are very old more than 200 years old, and this garden just recently celebrated its 200 years anniversary. It covers more than 30 hectares as well as the domain approx. with the same size. It is truly a green oasis in the mid of surrounding concrete buildings. Moreover, the visitors can also use the garden walkways with undulating terrains as the physical exercises paths for run, brisk walk or simply relax strolling around the garden. Simply, it just a free park for the family, some just use this place for a big family gathering, nice. A small train “the Choo Choo express” run every 30 minutes in this garden for visitors with $10 ticket adult, for 25 minutes exploration. Next to the water front and adjacent to Sydney Opera House visitors can combine these two places in one trip.

Superb , beautifully kept park - great views of ther harbour, City and opera house. We had just completed our visit to the Opera House and were wondering what to do next. The Botanical Gardens were right next door and offered a great opportunity for a relaxing stroll among lots of trees, shrubs etc. Plus an opportunity to see various kinds of birds. A great vantage point for some different pictures of the harbour and the Opera House. Also worth just putting a jacket down and relaxing for a few minutes to watch the locals go by. Its a very popular place to exercise There are no entrance charges and once in the park there many exit points for you to enter the city. So you can cover a lot of ground in 1-2 hours of strolling around. There are places to buy ice cream or cold drinks.2016 is the 200th anniversary so there are some special exhibits to look at.
Beautiful spot right in the city!. Incredible walk, at your own pace or brisk exercise. Lots of plaques to explain what you're looking at.

Always beautiful and in a studding location. The Royal Botanic Gardens lay between the Sydney Opera House and Mrs Macquarie's Chair on the foreshore of stunning Sydney Harbour. Easy access is gained from Circular Quay train station, ferries or buses. I highly recommend a visit.The gardens are beautifully laid out, have seats and expansive grassy areas for resting, picnicking or admiring the world class views. In Spring there are stunning annual garden beds.There are water features and ponds which attract a small range of water birds.Sometimes there are botanical art and other exhibitions on site.Often there are plants for sale run by volunteers but I'm not sure if this only occurs on weekends or not.The gardens have a basic café which could improve in food variety and quality, and a restaurant which I haven't tried.

amazing experience. We were not too sure whether to visit the Botanical Gardens or not but a walk through the gardens on route the Sydney Opera left us stunned.I would highly recommend to stroll through this magnificent garden with a great collection of trees. Such a nice retreat in the busy downtown.

Beautiful afternoon walk. The gardens are amazing so much to see if you're looking for a relaxing afternoon walk this is a must see! The birds and views are really so beautiful. I wanted to spend the whole day but only had an afternoon I will definitely go back - don't forget to stop in the gift shop great books!

Beautiful park with varieties of birds!. The Royal Botanic Gardens are beautiful with lots of different trees and plants. There are also birds to be seen! There are lots of shady spots to have picnics.

Big green beautiful. If you enjoy walking through a wide expanse of green lush parklands on one of the most beautiful harbours in the world then this is the place for you. These gardens are immaculate and full of plants from around the globe meshed together with eateries and seatings to look out across the harbour, the city and the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Perfect for not only the tourist but locals who need a space to sit and meditate

Nice park with good views of the city. This park is massive and nicely maintained. If you walk along the waters, you will eventually hit a great photo op of the Sydney harbor bridge and the opera house in the same shot.A good place for a stroll or a jog, bring water if you do this as the garden is quite big. You will find nice trees (very old trees). This is right next to the art gallery

Good weather - good walk. It's a nice way to relax - to buy smth at Circular Quay and go to Botanic gardens to sit and enjoy nice nature, silence and good air. Lots of flowers and plants, amazing views to the harbour - enjoy your time here! Works up to 7 or 8 pm.

Beautiful gardens in the heart of Sydney. Enjoy a visit to the Botanic Gardens, starting by the Sydney Opera House for lovely views of the harbour and a stroll among one of the best collections in the world. Good cafe in centre for a snack and a coffee.

Great walk on a sunny day. Starting from the Sydney Opera House, a group of friends and myself walked along the waterfront of Sydney Harbour in the Royal Botanic Garden. Amazing park near the centre of town with beautiful views and foliage, and Mrs. Macquarie's Chair. Worth the time spent.
A relaxing stroll. We spent three hours wondering around this amazing and beautiful gardens. With spectacular views of the Sydney Harbour.

Relaxing, outstanding grounds and views. One of the nicest gardens I ever been to. It is is certainly the one with best views. Plan to spend a couple of hours, wear comfortable shoes the garden is about 30 hectares. The garden has a number of sub-gardens with different themes. There are good signage to point you in the right direction if you prefer a guided walk they are offered for free at 10:30 and 13:00. There is also an Aboriginal heritage walk, this comes at a cost.

Spacious,beautiful and relaxing place in the heart of a busy city. The gardens are celebrating 200 years this year and there are special plant displays. I took the free 1 1/2 guided tour from the Opera House gates at 11am. Mostly they leave at 10.30am and it's a good idea to book the tour. Our guide was excellent. He was considerate finding shady places to explain the trees and monuments. His commentary was informative and interesting and sometimes funny. I've been here before but never noticed the eels in the pond which he told us come on ocean streams from New Caledonia and return there to procreate and die. If you don't have the time for the tour it's a wonderful place to wander around and bring a backpack lunch to enjoy. There is a café near the pond which serves coffee and snacks or a restaurant if you want something more substantial. There are several entry points and the one near the Mitchell Library has a statue of Governor Philip - the first governor of NSW. The gardens are extremely well kept and have plants from many exotic places. If it's history you like, beautiful views of Sydney Harbour, a horticultural buff or just looking for some peaceful place then this is the place for you. Best of all it's FREE.
Commute to work. I took this job only cause I get to walk to work through the gardens. Every day is new and exciting, I find a new way to walk each day and take pics, lovely way to start the day!

Tourist in my oen city . This place is just the most relaxing and peacful place to spend some time. The gardens are beautifully maintained and are great if you are in to gardening or if you just want to take in the bridge and opera house.Try to avoid the lunchtime hours if you want the full experience this place can provide, it gets a little busier from 12-2.

All together at the same place as opera and bridge. i like the garden, reminds me of Vancouver but thousands of miles away. It's very clean, safe, free! Bring food and picnic would be nice here. Wear comfortable shoes and plan to walk all day at this place.

A Cool Place to Relax with Nature in the City. The Botanical Gardens is conveniently located next to the opera house and is very accessible. There are several other exits and entry points to this garden. Plenty of trees and you can also catch some flowers blooming if you come during the right season. A nice place to bring a mat and have a picnic in the city. A popular spot for visitors and locals alike. Quite a large area to walk. You can refill your water bottle in the park.

Beautiful Free Gardens!. If you are in Sydney, then you must have a wander around the Royal Botanic Gardens! It's a vast expanse of beautiful trees, and plants.. We walked from one side of Sydney to the other through the gardens and its a lovely walk.. Although not very easy to Navigate!
great day out with the kids. top spot to go with the kids for a day in Sydney easy access gorgeous views and surroundings with historical land marks
Just another botanic garden. They have built it up nicely and have maintained it very clean and tidy. But I find it just another Botanic garden having travelled half of the world.

Peaceful place to visit to escape the busy city. I love walking around the botanic gardens then sit looking at the views over the water and of the city. You can also catch a little train around to get a good look at the whole place. It is also very close to the museum, Opera House and Art Gallery. Of course there is a huge collection of trees and plants as well as sculptures, fountains etc. A perfect way to escape the hustle and bustle of the city. It's one of those things you can do alone, with a partner or family.
A must-see botanical garden. Walking through this beautiful garden was fantastic! So many exotic plants, many I had never even heard of before. A wonderful start to our day!

So many beautiful flowers. We walked around this beautiful spot for hours, it is that big. There are so many different species of flora here and for us it was amazing to see so many plants that we have as house plants that were not only growing outside but were so large. There is a small building that housed special plants that needed extra warmth and was also housing varied types of butterfly.
What a gorgeous wander. We pretended to be tourists in our own city. We wandered around and enjoyed a gorgeous sunny afternoon, lovely views, lots of friendly people over the long weekend...

Take Your Time. This is an absolutely beautiful garden that can take hours to explore. You need to search out every nook and cranny and really enjoy all of the garden. It is a place you can come back to time and time again without becoming bored by it. There are restaurants and facilities within the garden too which means you don't have to leave!

Hooray, the bats have gone!. For the past decade Sydney's wonderful Royal Botanic Gardens were virtually a no-go zone for locals because of the thousands of grey-headed flying foxes (big bats) that had taken up living in the trees. The smell of their droppings was revolting and they shrieked and squealed all day. No-one would touch them because they are a protected species in New South Wales. But common sense has finally prevailed and the bats have been moved on (don't ask how, Greenies may be offended) and the gardens are again the most beautiful and relaxing spot in Sydney. Take a picnic and relax for a few hours scanning the harbour and examining the amazing diversity of plants. Entry is free and you are encouraged to walk on the grass.

Plants, Position, People watching - 3 of my favourite things!. I love public gardens. Everywhere I travel I visit them. I love, in particular, botanic gardens and their weird cultural planting quirks. Sydney Botanic Garden is stunning. Set on brilliant and beautiful harbour frontage and full of plants and wild life it is a wonderful place to visit. There is always something going on - exhibitions, plant displays, events, weddings, sport, its active, and inclusive and FREE!Great spots to sit and enjoy the views, a green band link between the City, Opera House, Conservatorium of Music and Art Gallery of NSW. There is a cafe and a restaurant or you can bring your own picnic.
Beutiful. One of the coolest places to visit while you are in Sydney. This is a great place to eat lunch or just kick back and take in all the plants and trees.

Lovely afternoon walk!. It has always been my favorite place. Starting the walk from Sydney Opera House and ending the walk in Hyde park, then a few blocks away to city or China town where there are plenty of choices for dinner and drinks, perfect way to spend in a sunny day!!!It's peaceful, beautiful and full of fresh air. With a little blanket and sandwiches, it's also a great place to have picnic with friends!
Picnic. A great place to meet up with friends & enjoy a picnic. Toilets & cafes are nearby if you'd prefer not to picnic. Beautiful gardens to browse within wonderful surroundings.
beautiful even in the fall. walk off the jet lag by checking out the gardenscockatiels eating seedseels and carp in the pondsorb spidersoh and the flowers, trees and plants are interesting
A true Sydney jewel. One of the world's most beautiful urban parks. Well-tended, waterfront and opera house views, cockatoos grazing on the lawns. A wonderful place to spend an afternoon

Great place to take a walk. If you already did some sights seeing, and need some productive rest, this is your spot. Enjoy a walk follow the trail to Sydney Opera house, enjoy the view of the harbor bridge.

A truely gorgeous place. Walking through the Botanical Gardens are always a treat. It's so relaxed and beautiful. This time we rode our bikes...but discovered that this is not allowed so we had to get off and push them. We felt there was plenty of room along the path I, but a rule is a rule. Luckily we were a few metres from the gate. It didn't spoil our time in these magnificent gardens.
stunning on a fine day. Simply a gorgous place to spend a couple of relaxing hours.A must do in Sydney. After go to NSW Art Gallery...or wonder down to the Opera House.

Tranqulity in the heart of Sydney. Hadn't planned to explore, but on the spur of the moment decided to walk from Sydney Opera house to Mrs Macquaries chair. A real treasure in the heart of a bustling city. The walk through the gardens was educational, beautiful and a peaceful respite. Highly recommend.

SIMPLY AMAZING. I can not say enough about how incredible this place is. Rain or shine it is an oasis in the middle of a metropolis. I felt uncomfortable not paying for something so beautiful. When in Sydney, carve out a few hours and lose yourself in the gardens. Can't wait to return.

Great views. This is a great place to view the city, the bridge, the harbor and the majesty of nature all in one visit. My wife and I walked the gardens a few times as it's peaceful and allows you to burn off some of the calories from all of the fabulous food in Sydney.

Peaceful and refreshing. A quick and easy stroll down from the opera house, the botanic gardens were family friendly and very peaceful. One can watch the boats in the harbour, read about the tree species, or hang out with the raucous cockatoos. The pathways are wide and easy to walk on, and the gardens themselves are a charming escape from the concrete and pavement of the city. There are maps frequently to be found along the paths and the walkways are well signed. Some lovely Greek statues towards the south side of the park.

Great view, must try the free tour at 10:30 am on weekdays. Visited the garden on May 9, 2016. Joined the free tor on May 9, 2016, Monday. Learned more about the trees and history of the early settlement in 1788. Very pleasant experience in joining this tour. The rose garden is awesome.
A peaceful quiet place near Opera House. Stroll along the paths in the park, see different plants and get some professional knowledge. Good views for city and harbour.
A superb experience in sydney. You must wander the paths and grasslands of this spectacular part of Sydney. All should get there regardless of age or nationality. It's free and fabulous!

Wonderful walk but the roses are not beautiful. Good to walk around the Royal Botanic garden as you can see many aged trees and have good view of the Opera House. Enjoy fresh air but you will disappointed with the roses in the Rose Garden, not as beautiful as you see, some even withered away.

Beautiful. The gardens are really beautiful. What I found interesting was how people are encouraged to use all if the grassy parts of the gardens. We saw many people relaxing with a book and their dogs.
Beautiful way to spend an afternoon. While there are tours of the park, just walk up to the middle of town from behind the Opera House. Lots to see and enjoy.
Beautiful. Beautiful way to view the Sydney bridge and harbour away from the crowds of tourists. A lovely place to relax and soak up the Australia sunshine
Nature at its best. Lots of special plants from the desert till the equatorial Love to walk and distinguish the different plants. A haven for nature lovers

INSULT TO CALL IT A BOTANIC GARDEN. Very badly kept. Grass was six inches long in most parts of the grounds. Rubbish not cleared. Trees and plants need a lot of attention. One of the worst Botanical gardens we have ever visited.

Gorgeous Views. walked from Hyde Park through the Royal Botanical Gardens towards Mrs Macquarie's chair, stunning array of plants and different areas of gardens, of course with the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge in the background. Fantastic for a stroll or just moving between attractions, well worth a visit.
wombleling free. Nice for a walk in the morning , lots of birds to see. Pond as eels in. A few hills in there so be aware if you are not fit.

Beautiful sculptured and manicured Gardens.. I highly recommend you walk thru the Royal Botanic Gardens. At first you might say, why walk thru another park, but the beauty and calm of meticulously manicured lawns and flower gardens and spectacular trees is a treat for the eyes. Do this in conjunction with a visit to the Opera House. From the front steps of the Opera House, bear left and thru the gates less than 100 meters. The area is narrow as Macquarie St. is on one side and the harbor the other, so you are able to view most of the Gardens. Good pathways also. I was blown away by the trees, shapes, and unusual and rare species for this part of the world. Nice coffee shop/restaurant to take a break.
Lovely . Well kept garderns and a lovely place to relax, have lunch. Beautiful views also.☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺☺There are some great takeaway places near by that are affordable and tasty.

Large area to wander find peace, and learn much about Sydney nature. Several antrances and pathways this is a unique insight into Sydney fauna and some bird and wildlife. The Fruit bats live here, so if you think it has started to rain, look up, there are probably hundreds dropping things on top of you. Watch the beautiful sight as they curl up in huge numbers at night and fly around the city, truly a sight to remember. Giudes and lebels thoughtfully placed around and some history of the park and its origins. Free and very large and quiet.
Lovely stroll. If you like wildlife, and particularly birds, don't miss this stroll. A cockatoo landed on my head while walking and this must have been my best Sydney experience!!!

Gorgeous gardens. An oasis in beautiful Sydney. Loved wandering around; took the Choo Choo express and did the grand tour, sat in the shade and read my book, visited the excellent little shop. Loved seeing all the runners, the workers having their lunches, both alone and in big groups, the mums and their toddlers and babies getting together. All in all I spent a pleasant 4-5 hours here.
Interesting plants. The Botanic Gardens are a lovely place to take a walk. There are some very interesting plants along the paths and you can see some lovely views of the Sydney sites from here.

Beautiful . These gardens are meticulously maintained. Beautiful plants and well maintained walkways. The walk along the water is very special. Lots of places to explore. Mostly flat but some hills and a few places with steps.
Beautiful walk. I love it here, a beautiful view and it is so green. This is the place that made me want to move here to Sydney. You can walk and walk without getting tired because of the lovely view

Beautiful. Historical. Free.. The Royal Botanic Gardens are well worth exploring when in Sydney. The views of the harbour and the Opera House are what you would expect but there is even more to be seen. The gardens hold a wonderful collection of plants from all over the world but also from throughout Australia's past. See the Farm Cove garden plots which show what was grown by those on the First Fleet while also learning about the impact on the indigenous people at the time.Dotted throughout the Gardens are rotundas and picnic shelters. It was raining, on and off, while we were there but we weren't bothered. It was a great nature break in the midst of a longer city break.
Great Park!. Great to walk around! Most famous park in Sydney! Beautiful plants with indications of where they are from and real name.

Beautiful. Enjoyed touring Government House. Tour is free but you must sign up in advance and provide passport or driver's license as ID. Gardens are beautiful. Also enjoyed a flock of wild cockatoos one of which might land on your arm if you hold it out! Walked to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair and Macquarie Point where you have great views of the Opera House.
Nice relaxing stroll. It's nice to get out of the city and enjoy a nice and peaceful green stroll and just sit down in the grass, take some sun and relax for the city mayhem

Lazy day in the sun!. wonderful gardens and walkways in the heart of Sydney. Go the extra 20 minutes and visit Mrs Macquarries chair. Go to the. gardens cafe/restaurant for a coffee & snack & sit outside where the birds will try to pinch your cake!
Pretty park and walk. Nice stroll and great place for a picnic. Interesting historical buildings and view of the Opera house from a different angle

Beautifulgardens. See and hear the colourful loud squeaking parrots and cockatoos, see the fish dive for safety as cormorants try and get'ed, smell the flowers blooming, sit on a bench and read or look at your photos you've taken, relax on the grass and look at your book, its all really calling and nice and pleasant here.

Excellent attraction & beautifully maintained gardens. I have previously walked through the gardens, and this was my most recent walk through after a few years. Entered the gardens just before lunchtime on Wednesday 27/04/16, the beautifully well maintained gardens are a delight to view, manicured gardens, water fountains & plenty of shaded areas to sit and relax. Restaurant inside the gardens & easy to find. Bathroom facilities also close to the restaurant. We walked along the pathway towards the opera house and a most enjoyable couple of hours walking before & after lunch within the gardens. Free admission and suitable for all ages to soak in the scenery.

Unexpected & great . We went to the opera house for pics as we transited through Sydney and noticed the wee train that does a tour of the gardens so we jumped on & did the tour. Thoroughly enjoyable & highly recommended.
Can't go wrong. No matter where you are walking, there is a beautiful view or interesting garden to be looking at.. Nothing beats a picnic on these grounds overlooking the beautiful harbour

Great sunny day activity on a budget. The Royal Botanic Gardens are a great spot to enjoy a picnic, view the Sydney harbour and relax with a book. Situated between the opera house and the NSW art gallery, the gardens are a great place to meet up with friends or family. Very peaceful setting with a large variety of native Australian plants as well as fruit bats.. Lots of fruit bats!

Beautiful, Beautiful Gardens. We could and have spent hours and hours walking around these beautiful gardens and there is still more to see than we have managed.There is so much space and things to see here, you need more than a day to get around fully.Every day there is something going on and in the holiday seasons, even more with open air shows, events and just groups of friends meeting up to have fun.Walking around the waters edge is lovely, but you don't get to see all the gardens have to offer. so head inland a bit and be surprised that you are in the middle of Sydney, but surrounded by amazing plants and flowers. Not forgetting the bats at dusk!
Beautiful to walk through. Unfortunately missed the free tour they gave but still had a chance to walk through it. Wonderful to enjoy nature in the big city.

Amazing . Take your camera, picnic lunch and friends. Whether you are a botanist or casual viewer, these gardens will make you enjoy life more.Just steps from the busy CBD, you will be amazed by the care, variety and thoughtfulness.

Nice soothing view of harbor!!. Dont get confused by the name. It is more like park for picnic and everything rather than a botanical garden. A nice place to be in the center of city. Good for a stroll and picnic. The best views are from the Mrs. Macquaries Chair from where you can have the view of both Opera House and Sydney harbor bridge.

Beautiful garden. I like the walk from opera house to Royal botanic gardens, it takes 30-45 min. excellent view of opera houses and harbour bridge. you can spend 3-4 hours in this garden, nice place to relax.

Networking in the Rose Garden. The Rose Garden at RBG was venue for a networking event I attended. It was a great venue choice, only a few minutes walk from CBD. Nothing quite being able to chat to old and new colleagues in such a tranquil and beautiful venue

More Park than Gardens.. Not the best Botanic Gardens I have been too. More of a park really. Amazing Views of the Harbour and a great place to go for a stroll or lay and read a book or have a picnic.There is a train ride tour, it is very quick and really not worth it. My advise to best enjoy this park is take a picnic basket and stroll around. Can't beat the views.

A must see in Sydney. . We spent a few hours here while visith ing Sydney. There was great weather that day, so it only made sense to spend some time here. It was a great way to forget you were in the city and spend time in nature.

Best place to start a trip. Our first day in sydney we started with a walk through the gardens. It is like having a central park in NYC only 5 times better and 50 times cleaner !! :) There are all sorts of wild birds and you can see cockatoos flying overhead and in the trees. You then walk along the harbor to the opera house. this is a great place to walk with friends and family and a beautiful park in the heart of the city
Mesmerizing. It is amazing to see so much nature in the city centre. You are surronded by trees and you can play with friendly cockatoos.

Beautiful Gardens! . We walked through the the Botanical Gardens almost every day of our stay in Sydney! So beautiful with well manicured plants/lawns...we did see some homeless people sleeping around the grounds. There are all kinds of parrots, birds, plants, flowers, trees to see. This was the only place we were able to see the Flying Fox at dusk ! Highly recommend walking through this garden while in Sydney!

Free walking tour of the gardens!. I joined the free walking tour of the Botanic Gardens led by the lovely volunteer Jill! Her knowledge of the history of the gardens was fantastic and she was a delight to be around! The gardens were beautiful and are well kept! They is also a nice historical timeline in the middle of the gardens that is worth a look! The location right next to the harbour is absolutely fantastic and so picturesque! Sign up for the free tours daily at the shop in the botanic garden!

Just visit. Fancy getting away from it all for a few hours? Visit the gardens. You will not be disappointed. Walked through at every opportunity. If you are not a walker, then there is a land train to take you round.

Nice place. These are very manicured gardens and nothing like the Australian countryside, but it is a very relaxing place to visit so close to such a noisy city.They gave a great view of the harbour and you don't have to be rich to enjoy it.

Enjoyable and relaxing walk. After spending a night in the CBD we spent an enjoyable and relaxing walk through the botanical gardens. The gardens are kept beautifully and have quite a number of walks which take you down to Lady Macquarie Chair, Sydney Opera House and the Art Museum.

Wonderful relaxing day and Free!. We thoroughly enjoyed a very pleasant day walking the beautiful Royal Botanic Gardens and this activity was free. Gardens are kept very nicely. I think they are very proud of this very old gardens and grounds and yes they should be. They share it nicely with visitors and locals alike. Make sure you check out some extremely old and large trees not too far from the Opera House. The roots above ground were simply astonishing! Thank you Sydney!

Nature in the City. The Gardens are extremely accessible and once you are there, you can lose yourself in the plants, open spaces and water. We took the red train ride which was well worth it -- in about 30 minutes we got a good sense of the geography and saw lots of highlights. You can hop off during the route and get on the next train, assuming it has space for you. Or after you do the whole route, you can walk back to areas of interest. A family could easily spend half a day in the Gardens and come out relaxed and peaceful.

Great Gardens. We spent a couple of hours walking around the gardens. Such spectacular scenery and also being able to get great photo's of the bridge and Opera House was a highlight. We also saw a lot of cockatoo's. So cool.
Pleasant walk along the Harbour. The botanical Gardens are located alongside the Sydney Harbour. One entrance is beside the Opera House. It is a very pleasant area to relax and walk through

Spare the time. You will not be diaspponited in this FREE activity. The gardens are beautiful, perfect photo opportunities within the garden, Sydney harbour bridge and the opera house. And you can even take a seat in Mrs Macquarie's chair. We spent 3and half hours on a glorious afternoon seeing true natural beauty. The free flying birds are a sight to be hold.

Peaceful place in a spectacular port!. Whether you have half an hour or many hours to spare you come away from the Royal Botanic Gardens in an energized city of 4.6 million feeling calmed and refreshed. It is food for the soul and a feast for the eyes.From ferns to colourful blooms to breathtaking sculptures to historical sites the variety keeps you searching for every hidden corner so as to not miss anything.One visit is just not enough!

Royal Botanic Gardens are a gem not to be missed at Opera House area. We wanted to go for a stroll in the gardens near the Opera House but were amazed at the diversity of what you could see. Here is a list of things in the Gardens as it is vast and has many places of interest to adjacent to it. The big picture. You have the gardens with ponds, Palm Groves, Palm House, Begonia Gardens, Succulent garden, Pioneer Garden , Rose Garden, Oriental Garden, Old Mill Garden. Palace Garden Areas of vast Lawns with harbors and trees and benches, Rockery and fountains. A wonderful stop in the middle is the Cafe and shop. Also found is the Maiden Theatre, plants growing and sales, Sydney Fernery, Education Centre, Government house and Parade grounds adjacent to Palace garden, Rathborne Lodge, Well thats a lot so i will post a pic of the grounds map and some of the things we saw. Kids will like the walkway train. Enjoy the bayside walk and work your way into the gardens on top of the hillsides and work your way back under the shade of the trees to keep cool. Stop midpoint at the Cafe for an icecream and drink but watch the Ibis as they will jump on your table and take your food. See pics.
Fill in a few hours wondering through these magnificent gardens. Beautifully maintaned parklands right in the middle of Sydney. Splended views of the harbour bridge, opera house, luna park etc.

Historic and pristine gardens with amazing views. Have visited many times and the location and presentation of the gardens is amazing. The history and importance of the gardens is emphasised by interesting and informative explanation of the trees and flowers. The bird life is spectacular and entertaining !
Beautiful. We spent a fair amount of time here as the gardens are beautiful. There is quite a bit of wildlife to see and on a nice day you can walk for miles.

Beautiful, Serene, Educational. Title plus full of wonderful photo ops. This great park is so large we chose to visit it twice, one day in the south end, another in middle and north Harbour end. Not only is the fauna wonderful but the gardens have many species of great birds to view and photograph up close like magpie, ibis and Sulphur Crested Cockatoos.

Great oasis with very knowledgable FREE guide. Did the free tour round the Bot Gdns at 10:30 yesterday. What a delight enhanced by the guides extensive knowledge and love of the place. Leave a morning free to do it then stop off at the cafe where the tour ends for some tasty lunch items at reasonable prices - bit like Uk National Trust offering
views are lovely. Just a lovely place to take a romantic afternoon walk looking at the harbour and gardens. A place not to miss while visiting Sydney.
Such beatiful place. If you are looking for a peaceful place and dont have so much time get away this is a wonderful place in the heart of Sydney.

A Garden—full of wonder and beauty!. It was here that I saw my first real lotus blossom! (see photo) And it was worth a trip half way round the world. This lovely garden is in the heart of this beautiful city. There is a cafe with outdoor seating and above it a restaurant. Just around the corner is a garden shop with many interesting gift items.

Gorgeous Park on the Harbour. This gorgeous park is historic as well as a beautiful place to walk through. Beautiful flowers and gorgeous views everywhere. Government House is located in the park as well. It's a very larger park so expect to walk a ways.

Beautifully kept gardens.. This was just beautiful walking through these botanic gardens, so well kept and lovely and green. Paths and signage all round, all within walking distance from circular quay and opera house.
For the budding Botanists. This place has interesting Aboriginal History attached to it . The aboriginal walk is a must. Quaint little sculptures lined alongside the bushes are an enjoyable sight
sydney botanic gardens. nice fine april morning walked thru botanics gardens from art galley end down to opera house, wife was disappointed that the bats had been removed

Huge park, lung of the city, do not miss ever !!!. It is very big park. You just walk, sit and relax or jogging in a good weather day. From this park you can connect to Sydney Opera House. There is walkway besides the water and you have a wonderful view from here. Again do not miss visit here.

Just beautiful...a must whilst in Sydney. Beautiful, vast gardens, with loads to see and do. There is an indoor rainforest experience (entry fee applies), a large cactus garden, ponds, wildlife, and stunning flowers and fauna. There is a restaurant, shop and kiosk, but it is lovely, and cheaper, to just take your own picnic. Start from the city gates and work your way down to Mrs Macquarie's Chair and Point. Take in the stunning harbour views as you walk down to the Sydney Opera House. Lots of photo opportunities. To fully enjoy everything on offer allow yourself 2-3 hours, longer if you are having a picnic. Great place to relax, recharge, and take in the ambience of amazing Sydney. Fantastic free activity for all ages.

My favorite in Australia. We caught a free docent tour a the Palm Grove Center. If you're at all interested in plants, this is a must do. Our guide was knowledgeable about all the garden plants as well as the history of the settlement. Saw many exotic ferns, a beautiful perennial border, a vegetable garden, and many trees that are not native to the Midwest USA.There's a train that non-walkers can take that covers much of the garden for a small fee.

Few days in Sydney. Wonderful place full of birds and trees etc It's close by the harbour and the opera house so easy to access
Good idea to ride round in the little train if it's very hot or if you are an older person or infirm
Must see the rose garden
haven from the busy city. Depends on which entrance you take, it could feel just like a large park, through another a complex botanic garden. What a great place to spend a couple of hours

Very relaxing . Spent a couple of hours wandering the gardens and experiencing a new way to see the harbour. The views are stunning, especially on the opposite peninsula to the opera house, although watch out for the spiders!!

try and be outside the gardens around dusk when the thousands of fruit bats that roost in the trees take flight. If you enjoy the murmerings of Starlings just before dusk as they perform aerobatics, position yourself outside the botanic gardens at dusk to watch the thousands of fruit bats that roost in the trees as they take flight for the fruit orchards outside Sydney

Great views . Nice activity on an afternoon to see the sun set over the harbour bridge, or any time of day really
Lots of different wildlife to see ( never seen so many birds in my life)
Closes earlier so go mid afternoon

Walking or riding in the train around the gardens is not to be missed. The Sydney Royal Botanic Gardens are not to be missed. You can eat at the restaurant or bring a picnic. When working I jogged through them most days so beautiful. Lunch time office workers and running clubs use the road way and stairs to keep fit and the run along the water is so relaxing. There are beautifully decorated bubblers to drink out of as well. Walking around you will come across a garden people can touch, taste, and smell herbs, chillies and lemons and other things. The rose garden has wonderful array of colours, you can walk around an old fashion vegetable garden, see fruit trees from other parts of the world, follow a small creek with gentle water falls with their family of ducks, to delights little children, and enjoy the beautiful flowers. Walk far enough up the back and see the many bats hanging from the trees. Also the glass house with exotic plants, and insects. The gardens are full of so many different things your day will be full. The gardens are for everyone to enjoy.
Stunning Botanic Gardens. This is right on Sydney Harbour and is worth an entire day. There are all facilities close by and is an enjoyable day.

Beautiful. This is a must see if you like beautiful things. It's meandering paths lead you by koi ponds and pagodas, flowers and willow trees, waterfalls and fountains. Every turn reveals another gorgeous vista. It is a true delight for all the senses with the sounds of flowing water, the lovely views, and the fragrances of the plants and flowers. Don't miss this.

green scenery and blue sky. we were at the gardens and spent a great time there with the birds and the plants. there is w gorgeous view of the opera house from there, definitely worth taken pictures! it's near by a train station - just 10 minutes walk and it connects to the harbor itself.

Stunning gardens with an even better view. One of the most beautiful places in Sydney. I think it offers the single best view of the bridge, opera house and city skyline. Take the time to walk the perimeter along the water but to also loop through the gardens themselves. There is a pavilion in the middle perfect for a coffee or lunch. There really isn't anything bad to say about this part of Sydney, spectacular!

The Green Lung in Sydney.... Hi guys, this gardens is the right place where to rest afetr a walk through the Sydney Harbour..it is really relaxing and is something that is good to see during your Sydney visit..
Nice walk. Nice relaxing garden to stroll through with plenty of seating in lots of areas to sit back and relax
nice activity. wandered through last thursday full of bird life and great casual walk type of activity, enjoyed the statues ans all of the different birds the were prolific

Amazing!. A great place for the kids to run around & a good picnic venue!
Definitely a must see in Sydney! :) :)
Relaxing. I spent 2 weeks in Sydney for work. The Botanic Gardens is the ideal place to wander around in and relax in on a weekend. There are so many spot to sit down and enjoy the gardens.

A great place to relax after the bustle of the city. There can't be many city parks that have such a stunning location as this. A great walk with changing vistas at every turn and that stunning backdrop of the city behind.
The restaurant is certainly worth a visit too!

Lovely Gardens with Fabulous Views. Gardens cover a large area. And I mean large. Various access points. One side is right on the Harbour. Lovely place to walk or just sit awhile even if you are not particularly interested in flowers/plants/trees. Government House is interesting to look around. This year is 200th Anniversary. The Gardens join the Domain, another park, and from there you reach Hyde Park. Then you are in Sydney's shopping district.

Enjoy nature in the heart of CBD. Great route for running. Suggest to start from the south entrance (Domain) near Hyde Park and run along the bay overlooking Woolloomooloo towards the best vantage point of the Sydney Opera House and Harbour Bridge at Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Stop there for a breather and some great photographic opportunities then continue on the path along side Sydney Harbour whilst enjoying the beautiful landscaping of the Botanic Gardens. End your run/ walk at the Opera House with couple schooners of well deserved beers, or coffee at The Rocks.

Peaceful, relaxing walk right in the middle of the city. Amazing place to visit, my husband and I catch the train to Circular Quay often and walk past the Opera House through to the Botanic Gardens. Very peaceful, pretty walk. there are plenty of pathways, we walked around the harbourside enjoying the view of the harbour then into the middle of the gardens. There are plenty of seats to sit and reflect in beautiful surroundings, there is a cafe in the middle of the gardens with lovely food. I truly recommend visiting these amazing gardens anytime of the year.

Wonderful park in the middle of the city. This was a delightful park to spend time wandering through. It was varied in that plantings were diverse and there were appropriate facilities for all tourists.
Slightly disapppointing as it was late autumn.. Worth a walk around and look at the herb garden in particular. I will go back at a better time of year.

Tranquil oasis for a world city. This is amazing to have such a diverse garden, exhibitions, places to sit, eat and think. The statues, rotundas, walled enclosures are full of history. There are so many paths, arches, lawns for children to race around itis no wonder so many families were there today. We loved the exhibitions of botanical art, that was quite special, and the place to find a treasure as a gift for a special celebration, birthday or whatever.
My favourite place in Sydney. This is by far one of the best places that Sydney has to offer. Chill out for a while and take in the views. It's just the perfect spot.

Beautiful Park in the heart of Sydney. Whilst staying in Sydney we walked from our hotel through the park to the harbour each day, what a great way to start the day. We sat and watched the boats on the water in the afternoon and also saw a wedding in the park one day. There is a cafe and toilets. Its so peaceful its hard to believe you are right next to the city.

Don't miss the Aboriginal Heritage Tour!. The Gardens themselves are wonderful and there's a lot of history as to how the plants got there, but the most interesting part for me was the Aboriginal Heritage Tour. Our guide had extensive knowledge passed down to him from his aunt and told us all about how the plants were used for medicinal purposes and spider webs used as rope! Sydney itself is so amazing and has such an interesting history it's easy to get caught up with the prisoner part and not learn enough about the original people of Australia. I highly recommend the Gardens and especially the Aboriginal Tour.

Lovely place to visit. The Botanic Gardens are a beautiful, peaceful place to visit in the middle of a very busy city. We sat amongst the flowers having a salad lunch and had a lovely walk down by the lake. The gardens have many interesting statues and also has a cafe in the middle. The afternoon started off sunny and warm, but just as we made it through the Park and back to our hotel, there was a tropical storm, which lasted approximately 15 minutes!
Must see. A must visit when in Sydney. For locals like myself, it is always nice to go for a stroll here and clear one's head. Recommended -
Beautiful. Lush green and beautiful place to be.If you would like to have some relaxing time you must head to botanic gardens
Beautiful and worth a stop. Although we didn't walk every trail, the botanical gardens were beautiful. Definitely worth a stop, especially if you're already in the area.
Beautiful gardens. A stunning place to visit and you can walk right down to the opera house. Interesting plants and trees and close to circular quay, CBD and the domain.

Bring me sunshine.... What could be nicer than an hour or so's walk in the autumn sunshine around the Royal Botanic. I've done the train ride before to learn a little of the history, now we can just walk and soak up the sunshine, the flora and fauna and the view.
Avoid lunchtimes; it's sweaty office-joggers' paradise flip-flopping their way around the roadways!

Pleasant walk but not greatly informative. . For those genuinely interested in learning about plants and botany these are not great botanical gardens, Melbourne's are much more educational and scientific. However, for a location for a walk/run with fabulous views over the water and beautiful planting then these are lovely. Think of these gardens as a public park and you won't be disappointed. Expect a scientific enlightenment and you will be.
Great Fauna and Flora. Some great examples of gardens and plants all around the gardens. Lots of birds too, with cockatoos and egrets walking around as if you were invisible.

Spectacular views. A must on a trip to Sydney. Loads of green space often described as the lungs of the city. Spectacular views of Sydney Harbour, the Opera House. If you wanted a city picnic location you could no go past this. Why not visit David Jones Food hall and treat yourself. There is a cafe on site and a lovely gift shop too with a good selection of gardening books.

It's huge piece of green. I must admit I did not go around the whole park because it is huge (to me) I passed by after taking photos of the Opera House but I am very certain that this is a very nice park in the city center and my short walk was very pleasant at the park.
Loved them!!. Must take a long walk or if you run take your morning run through the gardens, first take a walk all around the beach side and then get into the gardens, it is just lovely!

Had a great free tour. They do daily tours which are free if you meet outside the cafe. Just happened upon the tour as we were wondering through. Was a nice tour and we got a bit more info about the place than the pretty plants we otherwise would have just walked past.

Love love love it!!. Love the Botanic Gardens! They are so pretty, and even though I have been so many times, I still see things that I have not seen before! So pretty and smell so good. There is plenty of grassed areas for people to sit and relax, or have a picnic. You can even catch a live event during the dry months- usually spring. The bird life is extraordinary too. Such pretty colours. You can ealk to the Opera House, Or the Art Gallery of NSW, or up to Macquarie St, The choice is yours!! So much history there! Highly recommended!!
Pure bliss for nature lovers. A wonderful place to meander, walk on the grass, picnic, or just relax from the stresses of City Life! In the centre is a cafe and restaurant, if that is your thing!

Surprising large and very beautiful. A great way to spend a quiet afternoon and escape the hustle and bustle of a busy city. There is a lot to see here and so many beautiful spots for a picnic or to sit and read a book under an old and beautiful tree. The rose garden is stunning

Stunning. well worth the short walk from the Quay, or can be accessed from CBD easily too (the walk around the Opera house is a nicer walk though. At a guess, 10-15 mins at ambling pace. The gardens are extremely well maintained, some magnificent old trees, and sculptured gardens, with lots of grass for picnics etc. Plenty of birdlife, The views are of course spectacular across the harbour. Some hilly sections, but good paths throughout.

Such a million dollar view of Sydney Harbour and the Opera house while strolling through beautiful gardens.. This is a glorious oasis and resting place in the hub of such a busy, boisterous city; Sydney. From Mrs Macquarie's chair one can look across the whole city and the stunning harbour skyline. Then stroll to the art gallery in one direction, or to the Opera house in the other direction. The gardens have many sections and include tropical, water plants, rose gardens and herb gardens, among others.

A beautiful garden to visit while visiting Sydney, Australia. Garden is well manicured and maintained. Lots of beautiful flowers, trees, and birds to see while there. Also a wonderful place to lie on the grass and enjoy the sunshine. Great place to walk and there are directional maps everywhere. It is very near to the Sydney Opera House so you can actually make this a great detour if you plan to visit the opera house or Circular Quay.

Wide open green space. Beautiful, especially on a sunny day. Lovely to walk around the Opera House to the Botanic Gardens and see all the exhibits including the plants! Nice way to spend an afternoon.

Well worth the effort to visit Sydney's Botanic Gardens!. Best to arrive using public transport Parking is not all that easy. The Gardens are a good venue for any age group also from Solo visitors to Families. Does not matter what time of year management seems to make sure spectacular displays are plentiful - easy to have snacks drinks a cuppa or a coffee in numerous places - an enormous amount of spectacular trees and shrubs - always marvellous displays of multi floral beds and so very centrally located in the City. Also has a great tourist shop with lots of desirable gifts.

A beautiful, relaxing place in the heart of th city. The gardens contain lovely plants and is well laid out for strolling and relaxing. It is a great location to take a break when touring the city. Places to sit and relax and enjoy the beauty and sunshine Having visited many botanical gardens, I found these to be spacious and a great place for walking in the city without the hassle of traffic on the sidewalks. Would recommend this to anyone who enjoys plants. You can walk to the Opera House through the gardens.

Stunning..... We walked through the Botanic Gardens several time during our recent trip. It's a wonderful asset to the city, in a world class location. I don't know how anyone could fail to be impressed by the magnificent old trees, the unique birdlife and the general ambience and serenity in the middle of a big city. I will definitely explore further next time.

Peaceful Alternative to the Active CIty. A stroll from the Opera House through the Royal Botanic Gardens is a great way to relax and enjoy nature in this beautiful city. There are numerous theme gardens within the park

Stunning views. To get the iconic, sweeping skyline photos of downtown Sydney just follow the water until the end... There are plenty of shaded benches and rubbish bins so this is an ideal spot for a picnic! The gardens themselves are well kept and have some nice areas, but really, you go here for the view!! It closes at 5:00pm but for the best lighting for photos, head out first thing in the morning!
Walk a Mile. I was working on a cruise ship which had Embarkation in Sydney.I get used to run at the morning in the garden.It seems as a Greenland.Fresh air, ocean breeze. That's what I like.

Relaxing Place. Preparing for short Sydney trip we decided not to visit this place. All found descriptions were presenting this place in not too attractive ways.Living in nearby hotel one morning we decided to reach Opera and Circular Quay by walking through the Garden. It is so nice, green and peaceful place that it is impossible to omit. If you are not in hurry you can easily appreciate atmosphere and character of this park. Combination of blooming flowers, huge green areas beautifully maintained with blue color of sea and sky makes you soul be happy.We were very delighted to be there.

All that beauty just around the corner!!. We walked up to the Royal Botanic Gardens and were so happy we did. The plants and trees are beautiful. We also found the Government House and went on a free tour (RECOMMENDED!!) You can get to the Gardens by walking behind the Opera House or there is a small tram that will take you there. It loads near the overhead train on the dock, closest side to the Opera House.

Vast and Beautiful. I took a long walk through and around the Royal Botanical Gardens. Simply stated, they are phenomenal. You will see so many different types of flowers and plants. There are multiple walkways all throughout the gardens. You also have spectacular Harbour views from part of them as well. There's a quaint little coffee shop and restaurant if you want to grab something to enjoy. It is a beautiful part of Sydney that really shouldn't be missed.

Magical . A magical place and amazing back drop to the high rise Sydney buildings. Definitely worth loosing yourself in here for a relaxing welcome from city life. Beautiful plants, statues, giant fig trees and parrots galore.
Peaceful, elegant park. People come for the harbour view but I really like the fern house, the succulent garden and the rose garden. It's a great place to just sit with a book sometimes.
Really nice, huge relaxing gardens. These gardens are huge, and so lovely to relax or take a jog. With amazing views of Sydney and wildlife, you cant miss out on the botanical gardens!

Huge. This is right next to the Opera House so makes sense to walk through it too. It is huge with lots of scupltures as well as trees etc. Also wild cuckatoos and parrots flying around which was awesome to see. You need to walk right round the edge to see Mrs Macquaire's chair
Best park. A must see in Sydney. Big park that transmits peace to everyone. Great for weekends with family and picnics.

Great for Photo Shoots. This garden is not a mere green lush in Sydney's CBD but also a great place to take photos, especially if you are aiming for good pictures of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.
Amazing. I'm not a huge nature enthusiast, but this place is awesome. Wildlife everywhere, the grounds are immaculate and there's tons of history. I was not expecting to enjoy this as much as I did.
Nices Botanic Garden ever. I've never seen in my whole life such a stunning Botanic Garden like this. Perfect grass, perfect location, perfect view. Perfect!

Great place to explore nature. This extensive botanic gardens is a must for nature lovers. There is much to explore and great walks throughout the gardens. In addition, it gives a great view of the harbour. A busy place as both locals and tourists visit here daily.An added bonus is that in March/April there is an outdoor opera held on some evenings on a stage jutting out from the Gardens (fee for entry) and it is a great way to enjoy being in the gardens while hearing great music.
Wonderful experience.. To have such a breathtaking, peaceful and elegant botanical garden space in the center of such a beautiful city, is testimony to the foresight of past and current generations.
Peace and quiet. Tranquil gardens with lush plants. A great place to get away from the noise of the city.Walking by the water is so relaxing and the views from the gardens are superb.
Garden....with views. An excellent botanic garden along the banks of the harbour - great views over the harbour toward the opera house and harbour bridge.
Scenic and peaceful. Free entry, peaceful atmosphere and scenic vistas. Bring a picnic! We also enjoyed attending Handa Opera in the evening.

Nice for a walk. . The garden is just right next to the Opera House. From here, you can take some really good pictures of the Opera House and the Habour Bridge. You can see the Government House and all the birds. Good to take a picnic and just enjoy the park.
Nice Walk. We had been to the Opera House and were walking back to Darling Harbour. Nice and green and peaceful after the crowds.
Beautiful Botanic Gardens. We went on the 3 Apr 2016 Sunday. This is a beautiful place to rest and relax. Spotted some beautiful trees here. Took lots of photo, and need lots of walking.

Wonderful way to spend an afternoon. Magnificent park setting. Excellent for walking and enjoying the beautiful meandering walkways. Benches are found throughout if you wish to relax or spread out for a picnic. Great jogging area around the park. There is a small store on the grounds where there is a variety of items to purchase ranging from jewelry, hats, books etc. can be entered by several entrances such as the area by The a Opera House. Free admission
Such a beautiful garden. When I lived in Sydney I always went to the royal botanic garden to go for a run. It's such a beautiful garden/park and close to the opera house

Picnic lunch, the most relaxing afternoon and views. On a whim, we went for a drive to the Fish Markets where we picked up some seafood for lunch and a bottle of white. Not wanting to battle the crowds to find a seat on the wharf, we decided to drive to the Botanic gardens. A short drive away, we were extremely lucky to find parking immediately.We had an excellent 2 hour lunch sitting on the grass under the shade with views of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House. Surprisingly for a weekend, it was quite quiet and not crowded at all. One of the best impromptu afternoons in my favourite city!
Hungary. One of the best botanic garden ever! Clean and well organised, it needs minimum 3-4 hours to visit. My favourit was the succulent garden, it is amazing.

Great place for a jog, stroll or to relax!. Our hotel is quite close and this was my jogging route. Of note, gates aren't open until 7 am so don't start out too early! Later in the day, I came back with rest of the family and we did the $10 train tour which lasted about 25 minutes with 4 stops if you wanted to get off. It was a nice way to get a quick overview. I look forward to a few more runs while here!

Wide range of open spaces and plants. A beautiful area of open space in the heart of the city with cooling shade in summer. A great space to walk through after the compulsory photos of the bridge and opera house

Great walking and great views. You can spend a good 3-4 hours walking around the Botanic gardens. There is so much to see. Paths meander around the gardens. It is worth taking time to stop and look as you go. As you approach the harbour the path follows all the way to the Opera House. You can in fact have a guided tour in a small train from the Opera House around the gardens and back. If you have time the walk is worth the effort. There is also a kiosk for a coffee or lunch break. On a sunny day just sitting on the grass enjoying the sun and the view is worth the visit alone.

Very large!. We did a full loop of the gardens on Easter Friday. The footprint of the gardens is huge and you can walk easily from the harbor area. The local opera company had staging set up on the far side of the park, so it caused a slight detour to go to Mrs Macquires chair, but well worth the extra walk to set it. You get some unique views of the bridge and the Opera House.

RBC-just do it!. I'm not a big "Garden Walk" guy but this place is great. Carve out 2 hours and wonder around here to see unusual vegetation and birds you've never seen before like the Sulfur Crest Cockatoo, aka a big white bid with a yellow crown.
Huge Garden. This is in a central area of town so you can walk through it to get to other places - that's what we did. The gardens are lush and beautiful.

A must see whilst in Sydney. What a beautiful place this is. Truly lovely & relaxing. I did take a slow walk round but as it was rather hot I did end up taking the tourist train round the gardens to ensure I didn't miss anything.
