I would suggest that you splash the cash and first take the little Choo Choo train which winds its way around the main attractions in this extensive garden to gauge which areas you wish to explore further on foot. There is something to please anyone with a love of nature from historic trees to displays of agricultural methods, not to mention the many sculptures dotted throughout. Appropriately, there are several establishments available in the grounds for much needed refreshments. After immersing yourself in the history and culture of the Harbour Bridge and Sydney Opera House what better way to chill out than in the beautiful and peaceful Botanical Gardens?

Incredible botany in the heart of the city!. Rarely do you find such a beautiful, botanically diverse garden in the heart of such a metropolitan city. Staying at Ovolo Wolloomooloo on the pier, this was a quick 5 minute walk, on the harbour peninsula directly east of the opera house. I have toured many botanic gardens around the world and this one did not disappoint! A very enjoyable section was the tree fern garden, showcasing at least 12 different species, many of which I have never encountered in over 30 years in the horticultural industry. The succulent garden was equally impressive, covering a large area with high diversity. Definitely worth a repeat visit!

Do not miss!. Beautiful grounds. Great history walk of the original Aboriginals of the area. The palm garden collection is amazing as is the succulent garden. You could spend more time there than we did, but 3-4 hours is sufficient.
I loved it. This is an amazing park. It's full of different type of trees from all over the world. There are also rare birds. It's a nice place to take a walk.

Beautiful Gardens. I spent about 4 hours walking around the gardens (and the domain). The gardens are very nice and offer some good views of the city and harbor. The gardens are meticulous maintained which is no small feat given the enormity of the place. I liked the different themed zones and spent nearly 4 hours wandering about the space. I also ventured into the adjoining Domain and went and had a look at the Government House. There are definitely interesting plants/trees to see and everything seemed to be labeled so you knew what you were looking at.

Royal Botanic Gardens. This is a visit that must be taken. Situated near the Opera House, even people who are not into nature and gardens will find this an inspiring place. So peaceful away from the hustle and bustle of the City, extending to 75 acres of some of the rarest plants in the world so beautifully presented. If you are not one for a lot of walking, there is a very pleasant little train to ferry you round which you can get on/off as and when required. A particularly pleasant cafe and gift shop is one of the ports of call to quench thirst, dine or simply take in the atmosphere.One must always mention Mrs Macquaries chair is perhaps the most famous of all icons in Sydney and is a must for a photograph !!!So much to see and do and all free. To think that the first settlers only came into Sydney in 1788, so much has been achieved both in the city and more over in the incredible Royal Botanical Gardens. Enjoy.

A great attraction to enjoy nature and the views . Staying downtown at the Marriott made this attraction a great day thing to do since weather was nice and it was very close with stunning views, caves and rocks for kids to climb on and tons of birds (cockatooes and Mcaws too), flowers and trees amongst the spacious green grass.Surprisingly it's free and been there like 200 years. A must see to take a break from the eating, shopping at other site seeing.

Must see for nature lovers. We were delighted when we toured the gardens. Most cities we visit, we look out the city garden as an easy way to get over jet lag or de-stress. This is way more than that. Birds, plantings, the trails, harbor views, just terrific.

spend a day amidst nautre and beautiful flowers. And if you get bored with nature have lunch or brunch at one of the many restaurants in the gardens.
Beautiful spot that is on the must list for any travellor to Sydney

Beautiful setting . A stroll in these lovely gardens, so close to the city, provides a delightful refuge from the humid heat of Sydney in February. We enjoyed the cockatoos, the variety of plants ( including pink bananas) the verdant, neatly trimmed lawns and the huge shady trees. Worth a visit.

Big and Beautiful. We spent over 4 hours wandering around the multiple paved paths looking at trees and flowers. Many have placards with name and info, very helpful. Would go back again to see even more.

Stunning flowers in spring. Well worth a wander around, there's some stunning flowers and great views of the Harbour at Farm Cove. Also great history section about the European settlers and their struggles to plant food.

A delightful experience. My wife and I were spending our first morning in Sydney as part of our tour of Australia and strolled down to Circular Quay in the early morning sun and made our way to the botanical gardens.It was a delight. The gardens are beautifully laid out and ibis proudly paraded the greens in search of food oblivious to the many tourists taking photos of them. We saw beautiful jacaranda trees which were in flower and which were in abundance here and indeed everywhere we went in Sydney. Water features and statues abound. The flower beds are beautifully tended. Amorous couples smooched on the green lawns. There is something extra special about a park in a big city and the botanical gardens are no exception. As we made our way towards the Opera House we encountered the wonderful panorama of the harbour below us. This is an excellent walking experience, colourful, serene and tranquil with points of interest everywhere.
Place to relax. Near the Sydney Opera House a perfect place to relax. Lots of big old trees, beautiful flowers and birds. There's also a great view to the city

Sensational views... I am normally not into botanical gardens, but this one is a must visit. Located so closed to the CBD, yet extremely peaceful and quiet...true serenity.The biggest attraction for me at these gardens is the views. Amazing views of Sydney harbour; the bridge, the opera and the harbour views.
Beautiful Gardens lots to explore. Stunning gardens with lots to explore and learn with kids. You could spend a lot of time searching and learning new things.
An Oasis in the City. So beautiful with loads of nooks and crannies to hide and relax in. A visit to Sydney must include the beauty of the gardens right on the waters edge.
Well worth a visit . Take a ride on the Choo Choo express to help you explore.Beautiful grounds with lots of interesting sections and the train drivers are vey knowledgable in guiding your attention.
A Beautiful Place to Stroll. It is hard to imagine this lovely plac is so close to the CBD. The beauty of the gardens is amazing. This is a location worthy of you "bucket list".

Disappointing. I have been to botanic gardens in a variety of cities and countries and this one was by far the most disappointing. There was plenty of plant life and greenery, but not much in the way of flower gardens. Maybe I just had high expectations, but I thought there would be more blossoms of different flower varieties to see. What was there was attractive, but it just seemed more like a giant park with lots of open green space and a few flowers.One cool thing, though, was the lake which is full of eels...and which the interpretive board says was cleaned out of eels but then mysteriously they came back within 2 weeks. Creepy.
One of the old landmarks of the city. Many of the trees and plants there go back to the dinasour days. The care and devotion to the place showing by the staff is highly recommended.

Amazing gardens. This is one of the best botanical gardens i have visited and stacks up well against the one in Cape Town/ Singapore and Peradeniya Gardens in Srilanka. Location is great not too far form other sydney attractions such as the Harbour Bridge/ Opera House etc.Views from the gardens of the Sydney skyline is impressive.Gardens itself contains so many amazing plants and is well marked and i found it very educational.One could spend a whole day in there.

Peaceful afternoon. After our Sydney Opera House tour we walked along to the Gardens. Although not vast they offer a tranquil setting to gently relax. There were plenty of empty seats along the pathways. The Herb Garden was rather disappointing, with very little scent or touch to offer a passerby. The cafe in the park was good (carrot cake particularly), but those customers ordering hot food had a 40 minutes wait!

Beautiful gardens. Walking through the gardens was always so refreshing and beautiful. The gardens are quite extensive and there are so many paths and entrances. The flowers are very pretty. It obviously is a great place to run too as we saw a number of runners during our walks through the gardens.

Beautifully maintained gardens with great views. Really lovely gardens well maintained and cared for. Some great views of the opera house and the bridge, as well as the ocean. Beautiful trees and interesting statues through the garden. We walked from the gardens to the Opera House with the ocean on one side and the garden on the other. Came across it by accident but we were really happy to have discovered them.

the quiet natural heart of beautiful Sydney. Enter from Macquarie stree and go via Mrs Macquarie's chair to the Art Gallery and out via St Mary's Cathedral... or enter from the Cathedral and go past the Art Gallery along the peninsular up through the gardens kiosk and out through the Opera House... The botanic Gardens is the natural link for visiting a lot of beautiful places in Sydney. In other words get a map and think in terms of using the Gardens as a route to enjoy for getting to places. The very best view of the Opera house and Harbour bridge and harbour is to be had from the end of the peninsular at Mrs MacQuarie's chair... its the pic you must have if you come to Sydney.The Gardens in themselves are just beautiful.. natural calm fascinating exotic and native, framed by the harbour. good signage tells you what its all about and a great little kiosk is a perfect place to have a quiet rest or snack or lunch.If you leave Sydney without seeing the Botanical Gardens then you have missed a real treasure by world standards... and its free and its there for you to enjoy.. SIgns say.. Please walk on the grass!
Beautiful and the views are stunning. Made a quick trip here and could have spent the day walking around admiring the plants and the views, really worth the trip

The Wonderfully Picturesque Botanical Gardens. One of my favourite places ,Beautiful gardens ,unusual plants great views of harbour. Peaceful .Exhibitions in Palm House and other areas often. Highly recommended to visit.
Must see on your Sydney to do list. These botanic gardens are big and beautiful. For nature and fauna lovers put this one on the list to must see!
Awesome . This is where Australia first farmed crops for the colony. This beautiful park with so many international varieties of flora. Sit enjoy but don't miss the beautiful views of Sydney Harbour.
Relaxing. The Botanic Gardens is very relaxing environment overlooking the harbour and surrounded by wonderful nature and flowers.

A trip to the Gardens shouldnt be missed. What a wonderful way to while away some hours. Everything, not only including the beautiful gardens but the view around Sydney Harbour is fantastic. Best of all is that it doesn't cost anything. Not many places these days where you can go and not spend money. If you are interested there is a café in the centre with reasonably priced meals and snacks. Every time I go I see something new. If you really want to know more about the gardens I believe there are guided tours run each day by a volunteer team. If you cant manage the walking there is also a small train that travels around the gardens which you can join- at a cost- near the gates close to the Opera House- Well worth the visit

Gorgeous and peaceful. after the hustle and crowds of Sydney Harbor the gardens are a perfect, peaceful stroll! The views along the water are beautiful. We are not big garden people, but enjoyed the different species, the spider webs (and spiders) and lizards. Take a blanket and a book and find a spot of shade to relax in.

one of top highlights . we took the 10:30 tour with a former secondary school teacher about "useful plants" and his passion for the plants and for teaching was clear. I learned so much and really enjoyed it! by the end we had a really good sense of the gardens layout and went back again later on our own again. it's the right size - manageable, and lots to see. lots of locals jogging through too.don't miss it!

Beautiful views and relaxing walks. Great place to wander and explore the many walking paths and historical plaques. Plenty of trees to sit under and rest with a book or a picnic lunch. Very family friendly, but beware it does have closing hours

What every city needs. A large sprawling,well maintained ,curated gardens is what every city should have.Not many resting benches if you are not comfortable sitting on the grass,but its a fun thing to do in it's own respect.Some statues alongthe way,historical plaques. All in all a good place to kill a couple of hours until u make your way to the harbour for some amazing sunset views.
Fab...very peaceful.. Walked through and loved it. Really old trees and lovely kept park. Benches to relax everywhere.....you walk along the waters edge. Very nice way to spend an afternoon!!

Peace, Tranquility and Pretty all minutes from the CBD. We walked through these beautiful picturesque gardens, which are superbly maintained. a little uphill walking and stairs, take breaks and enjoy the views
relaxing. when you've been busy doing the tourist thing come spend half a day here & wind down a bit, very relaxing very scenic a nice walk or ride if you want the little tram that goes around

GORGEOUS SCENIC GARDEN. These gardens surround the harbor and opera house and provide views of the harbor bridge. 2016 is the 200th year of the gardens. As you tour the gardens, you experience the beautiful blue waters of the harbor with many sailboats adding the extra colors of red, yellow, and pink.Several areas are planted in colorful ANNUAL plants. There are gazebos, picnic benches, and statues.Lots of HUGE old green trees, and people sunbathing and picnicking on blankets.If you cannot walk for an hour, hop on the mini train to tour this PARK.ALSO if you are visiting on a Friday, Saturday, or Sunday, be sure and TOUR the GOVERNMENT HOUSE that is within the Botanical Gardens which contains Lovely Beautiful LAVISH rooms. Need another 30 minutes for this tour.
A relaxing walk. Any way you enter or leave, this public park offers a very relaxing walk near the Sydney CBD. Not sure if the open-air cinema adds any value though ...

Easy walk to Mrs MacQuarie's chair. Beautiful views as you follow the paved path along the shoreline from the Opera House... the Harbour on one side and the gardens on the other.Return through the gardens and wander to your hearts content enjoying flowers, trees and birds.A quiet oasis in the busy city

Serene Showpiece of Sydney. What a beautiful space! Walks in and around the botanical gardens were a highlight of our week in Sydney. Whether we were just out for a little exercise or doing some site seeing, we always managed to take a turn into the Botanical Gardens. We were in awe of the gardens and the fact that they are open to the public every day. Free!
Very nice. A great place that's very well maintained! Very clean and safe! Lots of room for everyone great plantings

Lovely views, interesting plant life. If you are a plant lover, allow most of the day to see this historic garden. Start early before the day gets too hot. If you just want to get the feel of the place there is s little tram that can give you an overview in 25 minutes.

Beautiful Gardens. This is a must see for your stay in Sydney. The Gardens are extensive with explanations of all the plants, trees and statutes and buildings. It is truly beautiful and great for nature lovers.
Love to visit. We always enjoy a stroll around the area, to look at the plants or simply to enjoy the harbour. I am a big fan of the bromeliad garden, but the fern garden is also a big hit.

Plants vs Heat. This experience was probably due to me wandering around in the afternoon under the sweltering sun but I was not that big a fan of the garden. The garden was spread out and was slightly difficult to explore. You do get to see many Australian plants. The view of the Opera House and the bridge was great.There was a paid trolley which take people around the garden. I wished I would have done that instead of walking around.

Delightful and engaging. We could spend hours exploring this beautiful place. Each nook has a different and magnificent look to offer which is a photographers dream come true. The types of flora and fauna available to explore is as interesting for a naturalist as it is for a layman wanting to soak in nature's beauty. Lovely place to relax with family and friends

Peaceful settings. This is a very large park which you can easily access by walking from the Circular Quay in a matter of minutes. You will need a map to help you find your way around since this is a very large place. The central pond is worth a visit, plenty of nesting birds, wading birds, beautiful plants and flowers. The rose garden was a little disappointing.
Great views, relaxing.. Plenty of postcards view. Great for walking, picnic, jogging and cycling. Great for family activities.

A Real Cliche - the Oasis in the City. Start at Hyde park and walk down through the Domain and then through the Botanic Gardens to the Opera House - it's a great walk. You can sit under a spreading tree, amble along the various paths or visit the excellent gardens shop. It is so relaxing after the pace of the city.
So Much to See. Had a fantastic day in the Gardens and still only saw a small part. We were lucky enough to take the free guide which is a great way to learn a little about the Park and Gardens.

A great way to spend a few hours.. The botanical gardens are truly beautiful. Acres and acres of gardens, greenhouses, walking paths, splendid view and the list goes on and on!!! Cannot get too much better than this and all free.

Beautiful grounds. We only had a little time to visit so only got to do a cursory walk from the gates down to the Opera House. But what we were able to see was AMAZINGLY beautiful. Tip, avoid the little pop up shop right outside the gates, the help is rude and everything is pre-made. There is a lovely little shop across the street that is accommodating and affordable.

Bloomin' Brilliant!. Maybe I'm bias, maybe I'm a horticulturist, but wow wee what a visual treat!I cannot recommend finding the time for a relaxed stroll high enough. Dazzling colours, sniffable sensations and even ideas to sprus up the Ol weed patch back home.Credit to the hard working men and women who have slaved and sweated to earn this reviewer's first ever 5/5.

Beautiful!. Really worthwhile strolling through this Botanical Garden. Made all the more scenic by virtue of the fact that you have beautiful views of the water and the Sydney Opera House along the way.

Calm and tranquility . The large and beautiful botanic gardens are situated close to Sydney Harbour and offer fabulous views across the bay. The gardens are well laid out and house a wide variety of plants and trees. There is also a shop and cafe.

Gorgeous. This is a place that you can not miss when you go to Sydney, this is an ideal and absolutely breath taking place that is perfect for a picnic or a run or just a walk around. It is relaxing and amazing
Fun for the kids. Beautiful garden and the kids loved the herb garden and climbing the big trees surrounding the garden. Nice quiet place in the city.

Take visitors here. The Botanic gardens are a wonderfull place to take visitors. For many reasons , the gardens themselves , the fact that you can walk around the edges and be right on the harbour. So spacious that you can always find a shady spot to sit and enjoy the view and the greenery Easy access from the city or from Circular Quay , leave the crowds there and sneak into the tranquility of the gardens
Beautiful grounds. The grounds are beautiful and lots of places to walk but there didn't seem to be much in the way of flowers.

Excellent Aboriginal Heritage Tour. Our family of four (kids aged 9 and 12) were extremely pleased with the excellent 2-hour Aboriginal Heritage Tour given by two very knowledgeable and enthusiastic young women. They explained so much and it was a great experience. The gardens, too, are quite lovely and a joy to walk through.

A relaxing wander . Beautiful gardens with stunning views well worth a visit.Spent afternoon lying in the sun after a wander round. Nice cafe friendly staff and accessible clean toilets. Well worth a visit
Beautiful !. A piece of beautiful quietness, where you completely forget you are in the middle of a city. I recommend to anyone !
Beautiful!. Just such a lovely setting for a stroll - the gardens are stunning and hidden statues/art work along the way make it full of lovely surprises.

Very educational. It is a great place to go and learn about Australian plants and see what they are all called. Its great to go into the bush and see them but there is alot more to learn. Its also very relaxing and there are alot of birds and animals who call the gardens home also.
what a site,. the place stunning full of flowerrs beds, stunning views all the bay to the bridge and the opera house

Always worth a visit in Sydney. Royal Botanic Gardens are always worth a visit when in Sydney. So beautiful, a green haven from the hustle bustle of the city. Every time I am here I take a different path and discover new things! Also great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge, and a cafe inside.

beautiful, tranquil gardens. lovely gardens close to the heart of Sydney with plants and trees from all over the world - also only a stones throw away from mrs macquaries point which has some of the most spectacular views of Sydney Harbour
Beautiful stroll. You cannot go wrong just going here for a stroll or to see all the beautiful flora. The park is large and offers views of the harbor and the Sydney skyline.

On our way to the Opera House. The Royal Botanic Gardens were on our way from our hotel to the Opera House. They were much more extensive than we thought with lot's to see, all well labeled. Highly recommend making some time during a trip to Sydney to at least take a stroll through the gardens.

Beautiful peaceful gardens in the center of the city. We stayed close to this area on our visit to Sydney, and walked through the Botanical Gardens several times. It is such a pretty, peaceful spot to walk around or relax. We were traveling around Australia on our honeymoon and our friends in Sydney surprised us with a basket full of goodies and a blanket so we could share a romantic, relaxing picnic in the botanical gardens. What a perfect afternoon! The flowers & vegetation is rejuvenating and the views from near the harbor are unbeatable. I'd highly recommend this spot if you're in central Sydney. Beautiful!

Hidden Gem in the heart of the City!. The beautiful views, the ancient trees, the amazing backdrop of Sydney Harbour and the Opera House... what more is there to say. Oh, apart from the fact there are beautiful people running around what seems like the whole city ALL the time! This place is seriously beautiful and an oasis of calm in an amazing city!

Big and beautiful. What a lovely interesting walk. These gardens are so well kept and just beautiful. Although there must have been many visitors it didn't seem like there was anyone there. Peaceful and some of the best views of the harbour bridge and opera house , we had great weather for our walk.

Beatifful quiet haven on Australia Day. After a morning jostling with so many thousands at Circular Quay and the Opera House watching the celebrations the beauty and calm of the Botanic Gardens was a wonderful respite. Colours and display enchanting.
Very interesting for the peace and views.. Some interesting sculptures and huge trees very peaceful. The walk to Mrs Macquaries Seat was a long trek but again worth it.

If you have time, spend the day. What a magnificent view, from any angle you look, you get different perspective of the city skyline, and the arboretum.gardens of course inspired by the English gardens well manicured and displayed, if with time, you must tour the Government House, very interesting.

A Beautiful Sanctuary. Ponds, flowers, trees, wildlife, birds, roses, trails, and tranquility. Every time I visit Sydney I make sure to spend a day here. I will attach pictures- a picture is worth more than a thousand words. Bring a blanket. Bring a picnic basket. Bring a loved one. There is magic in the air here.

Beautiful. This place had so many different flowers and architecture. I especially loved the large sun dial with the plaque on how to read the sun dial. The only problem I had was that it was a very hot day and most of the walking paths are in the sun. So maybe consider a journey on a cooler spring day rather than mid afternoon in the summer. Definitely worth the visit.

Midnight st the Oasis- Tourist trap. We spent NYE at the Midnight at the Oasis party. The only pro was location: just in the middle of the great botanic garden, with a direct view of the bridge and opera. Huge crowd to get in, bad signiling. Food was terrible, not tasty, long lines, disgusting. The live band was awful; unable to keep people dancing. This was an actual tourist trap.

a stunning landscape. the gardens occupy 30 hectares, slit into four major precincts are many smaller gardens and features as well as large amounts of lightly wooded lawn areas .The historic hand-hewn sandstone seawall that curves around Farm Cove from Mrs Macquarie's Point to the Opera House is a major thoroughfare with joggers a plenty to watch out for

Remarkable Collection of Trees. Aside from the scenic location adjacent to Sydney's CBD and the Opera House, what struck me most was the remarkable collection of very old and gigantic trees. A number of gums, oaks and mahogany trees are as old as the Gardens, just turning 200 years old! Also notable is the Palm Grove and just the serenity of walking around the beautiful landscape. A must see.

Nice landscape. From the garden, you can see the whole city in one horizontal landscape as well as enjoy the beautiful sounds of the ocean waving to the shore. Perfect for family picnic. Going by train, stopping in Wynyard and walking towards the garden are recommended.

An oasis in the centre of the city. I live in Sydney but I love this park because it provides many options for many people. I find the place relaxing and refreshing while I take in the fantastic views of the harbor.

Spectacular gardens in a beautiful harbor setting!. This was one of the most beautiful gardens I've been to. We visited in late September, and there were still an incredible array of flowers in bloom. The walking paths are paved and meander through different garden themes. The harbor acts as one border, so you're just surrounded by beauty. Definitely worth 1-2 hours of your time.
Best of Sydney. An absolute must if you love nature and want to explore the amazing flora we are so proud tto have here.

Blooming Botanic Gardens. Masses of plants, stupendous trees and interesting path ways await you here. Amble around the many acres and do pop into the gorgeous shop which has a host of unusual merchandise. The restaurant is also fantastic. Don't miss this incredible place.

Great part of Sydney. After spending a couple of days walking around the hustle and bustle of Sydney this is a perfect way to spend a few hours walking among the calm and beauty of these well landscaped gardens. My wife is a flower lover but most people would take some pleasure from this lovely quiet part of this wonderful city.

Lovely garden in the heart of the city. Had a few lovely jogs in the evening during my stay in Sydney. It is a great place hang out and to get away from the hustle and bustle in Sydney city. Great views of the Sydney Bridge from here too!

the gardens are blossoming. Sydney's botanic gardens where getting a trifle run down,My visit this month was a very pleasant surprise. The eradication of the bats and some really lovely bromeliad displays are a great improvement. The cafe has improved as well. I do believe there should be more native plant displays. A kangaroo paw one we be spectacular as would grevillias. The hot house under construction looks exciting and the fernery is excellent. The general vibe was very relaxing. Feeding the eels is also really cool.It's still a work in progress but definitely in the right direction

Delightful . So so beautiful. This is a MUST do whilst in Sydney. It's a great walk. You can walk for 1 hour or 5 hours as we did. Lots to look at along the way. Café in gardens which is lovely. Beautiful huge shady trees for laying under or just stop for a rest. You wont be disappointed. Great for kids.

Quiet, scenic gardens in the heart of the city. If I lived or worked near the gardens, I would visit frequently. The flora is stunning and well-maintained, and there are sprawling grassy areas that are perfect for picnics or mid-afternoon naps.Given all that surrounds it, you'd think it would be noisy but it's a quiet haven in the middle of the large city.

We didn't see it all.. It was threatening rain the day we were there. We did get to Mrs. Macquaries Chair and Point. What we saw was okay but not spectacular. It is a great walk with a lot of locals running around the Point.

Relax through the gardens.. For those of us that want a little peace and quiet every now and then. To see the wonderful skies open out in front of you.Somewhere to disappear to that isn't the beach. These beautiful gardens fulfil this need. Much of the garden is laid out in the European style - using a mix of native and world sub-tropical planting. Some formal areas (herb garden) while other areas are left open and semi formal. The succulent gardens are worth a look: contrasting markedly with the softer, greener, lush parkland.This is a well tended and safe garden.On site cafe offers an ok flat white and a selection of lite bites. Somewhere to rest before continuing through these marvellous gardens.

Natural Beauty. A most beautiful garden next to the worlds prettiest harbor.When in Sydney this is a must weather for a 30 minute stroll on your way to the opera house or to spend an entire afternoon.It is huge and well manicured with beautiful trees and flowers.Great walkways easily maneuvered by even handicapped people or seniors.

Pleasant environment with excellent views. Opened in 1816 it's one of the most famous botanic gardens in the world and the oldest in Australia. In the centre of Sydney, it's easily accessible and the views to the Opera House, to the Harbour,to the famous Bridge, to the Farm Cove and the CBD (business centre), are unique.It's free, huge (74 acres) and there is something for everyone. On a dry day it's a pleasure walking especially on the seawall path towards the Opera House and watch the Harbour traffic.The Garden, a large natural amphitheatre, is divided in 4 parts:Lower, Middle, Palace Gardens & the Bennelong Precinct. In the Palm Grove you'll find a Cafe, Garden Shop, a Restaurant and a bookshop.Huge trees like the Moreton Bay Figs, birds like sulphur-crested cockatoos and Australian white ibis, many pic-nic areas, beautiful pavilions and many sculptures like the Wuirrunbgwuri ecological creation, a rose garden and historical buildings to visit like the Government House and the Conservatorium of Music. Try to find out what suits your interests and choose the gate you'll start exploring the Garden, as there are many entrance gates and there is a long distance between them. There is also the Choo-Choo-Express, a hop-on hop-off train with 4 stops around the Garden. 3 carriages with 30 seats. The tour lasts 25 minutes and tickets are available at the Queen Elizabeth II Gate.

relax in the middle of the city. a visit is a must, the place is lovely and then you can take a nice walk to the opera house. Nearby is the Australian Museum is worth a visit (it's free), especially if you run into a rainy afternoon, which is not unusual in Sydney

Magnificent! . What a beautiful beautiful place. Every foot is just gorgeous and beautifully maintained. The walkways are pram friendly and the walk not too difficult for our toddler (downhill at least). The are so many diverse gardens and little spots to explore. We entered from Domain parking and walked down to the water all the way to the Opera House. I was dreading the walk back up the hill but we stopped halfway up to have lunch at the little Cafe. Also did the little train ride around which gave some good information on various parts of the garden. So glad to have done this and will definitely take our overseas visitors.

My favorite place in Sydney. I love botanical gardens and is one of new favorites! The volunteer-led tours (free) are a great way to explore NSW flora without leaving the city. Bring a book or a lunch and soak up the sun for hours. The day will pass before you can blink.

Nice stroll through beautiful grounds. The Royal Botanical Gardens in Sydney are worth strolling through. There are a lot of nice areas and we barely scratched the surface despite spending. 30 minutes here. Lots of people were taking advantage of the sitting areas to read or just look out on the surroundings. Very pleasant.
Nice garden. There were a lot of nice plants and just to take a walk in the garden was really nice. Amazing how many birds you hear there.

Can spend hours in these gardens. What a beautiful place this is that just goes on and on with some wonderful walk. You have a nice restaurant in the gardens a wonderful lake. Just the best place to spend a few hours

Large city park with plenty of space to walk. A great place to get a walk in. You can walk along the waterfront, or go inland. Plenty of different trees, plants, and flowers to look at. Lots of birds inhabit the park as well.

Review. If you're into wild life and gardens. This place is a beautiful setting for you to see. Great for family picnic and great view at the same time. Can see the bridge and opera house from here. Great spot for photos.
Free and great!. Is not huge as some other botanical gardens, but it is a great place to walk from downtown to the Opera house or port. Especially in the early morning.
Absolutely stunning . These gardens are a MUST to anyone visiting Sydney. Within walking distance of anywhere in the CBD (city centre) and so so worth it.

Amazing place. I went to Australia one year ago and I spent my first 3 months in Sydney. Sydney is a busy city but this place is just a corner of paradise. :) I had the opportunity to meet some workers and they are very passionate people that love what they do.Go there :)

Choo Choo train a quick way around the gardens. The Choo Choo tourist train is a good way to see the garden's highlights quickly. The tour takes about 25 minutes and gives a good overall introduction to the gardens.

A half day well spent. We had a wonderful time exploring the Royal Botanic Gardens. There is a lot to see and do. We walked around for a little while then grabbed some food and sat in the grass overlooking the harbor eating. It was a wonderful day!The gardens are right up from the Opera House. So it is an easy walk between the two. Make a day of it and see both as well as the bridge. Just bring your walking shoes and a bottle of water!

Gardens of delight. I must admit my bias as a paid up member of the Friends of the Gardens; but how can you ever go wrong in a landmark that is free, beautiful, harbourside, and always changing by season and exhibitions. The most beautiful place in our city

Peaceful oasis. Away from the bustle of commercial Sydney is this oasis of winding pathways, ponds and beautifully landscaped gardens. Pause for a quick snack at the cafe sitting under the trees or linger over lunchat the excellent restaurant. All this against the backdrop of the magnificent harbour.

Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens, great for a relaxing stroll, a number of colourful birds and lovely views of the Bridge and Opera House If we hadn't visited the Botanic Gardens in Singapore on the way back to the uk would probably given these gardens 5 stars.
Relaxing and interesting. The park is enormous so you need time to see it all, and you must be prepared to walk, but it's worth the effort. There's also a very good restaurant.

Fantastic, you must visit.... Wow, what a fantastic experience! visited the Royal Botanical Gardens during a spare day on a recent business trip, what a fantastic thing to do, truly wonderful, you must go if you have the chance!

Fantastic plants. A totally free attraction, beautiful gardens with loads of specimen plants and trees all labelled. Some interesting facts for children and a lovely tea spot in the middle. Well worth a visit!
Lovely. This park is well maintained with a beautiful view of the surrounding city scape and harbour. It would be a lovely place to go in the summer for a picnic or morning run.

Interesting gardens, lovely surroundings, stunning views of the harbour.. Well situated, interesting gardens, with some unique features (plots of different grasses for example). There are a couple of cafes as well, and a small gift shop. Interesting and pleasant, but nothing too exciting.

Tropical informality from around the globe..... A long and relaxed stroll through an informal park that's more than a park, with frequent views onto the harbor, plenty of benches to rest on when its muggy, it all goes to make these gardens a pleasure. Wandering ibis, colorful parakeets, ponds with fish and eels plus trees full of 'flying foxes'/'fruit bats' keep kids and adults amused. For the more serious botanists there's a 'fernery' and a great 'herbarium' (is that what they call it?) with interesting information labels for herbalists or cooks. The park is not just Australian but has many tropical specimens from around the world. I find it more mature and also more densely packed with interest than the gardens in Perth, far larger (for good reason) but also much more varied than the gardens in Singapore, and more 'accessible' and 'informal' than Kew in London, to give some comparisons. There's also an excellent park cafe and occasional displays. A very pleasant place to stroll, rest, picnic or chill and a must do on the Sydney scene. Hey, it's all free too!
Beautiful! . We had a lot of fun there. It has beautiful views to the Opera House and harbour. So many beautiful big trees. My 3 yo enjoyed it so much. Cafe in the middle of the park was nice too.

Lovely spot right on the harbour. This is not your typical cultured garden or at least not all of it is. There are plenty of trails through more lush greenery or along the harbour front. Although there are rose gardens and other culture and flower beds for those without interest period I took my coffee and just wondered for quite a while and it's very peaceful. There are trail maps throughout but even without using them I manage to find are the main areas of the Gardens. It's an easy walk through the gardens to get to the Art Gallery of New South Wales. Don't forget to stop in to see Government House on the days that it is open. The tour is free and you can see the grounds even without it would have their own beautiful flower bands.
Lovely . A really lovely Gardens to wander. A very easy stroll from the city. With excellent views of the harbour. Lots of varied areas to look at.

Most romantic park in Sydney. I spent the whole morning with my wife just relaxing and it's just wonderful to see Sydney and the harbour bridge. It reminded us what an awesome city this is and that we made a good decision moving here.

A great place to sit and relax.. Quite simply the is my favourite place to sit and relax in my favourite city. A view to die for of Sydney harbour and all its comings and goings. All within a short walk of the city. Stunning !
Fantastic gardens - world class. Gardens are breathtaking with the harbour setting. Gardens like these charge for entry in most countries. Really worth a visit.

Unparalleled views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. If you want excellent vantage points for both the opera house and bridge, then this is the place to go!! Both paths along the water and within the park are gorgeous, great for photographers. Also peaceful for those trying to spend some relaxing time just outside the city.

Walk on the grass and hug the trees!. No visit to Sydney is complete without a visit to the Royal Botanic Gardens. Situated at the end of Circular Quay, adjacent to the Opera house and with fine views of the Harbour Bridge it is a large green area of natural beauty. This year marks the two hundredth anniversary of the opening of the gardens and it has provided an oasis of peace and serenity for Sydneysiders ever since. .The well maintained gardens contain some magnificent trees and shrubs and an abundance of wild birds. Entrance is free, and you are positively encouraged to walk on the grass and even hug the trees!Tourists mingle with office workers on their lunch break, picnickers and sun bathers lie on the grass, local joggers speed past and peculiar ibises take it all in and will steal your food if you leave it unattended!There is a pleasant cafe near the centre of the gardens, an RBG shop and ample public toilets. There are free guided walks (although we did not have time to take one) or for 10 Australian dollars (5 for children) you can ride through the gardens on a motorised "train" and listen to a commentary from the informative driver.Sydney is justifiably proud of its magnificent Botanic Gardens and if you plan to visit this vibrant and picturesque city you should not miss it.

Stunning. Shame our visit was on an extremely hot day or we would of and could have spent the day here. The gardens are celebrating 200 years this year, and location with the harbour as backdrop is spectular. Spent some time under an enormous bunya tree watching helicopter training of some sort, amazing. As it was hot opted for the choo train ride through the gardens which stops at four well spaced locations with on board commentary. You can rejoin every 20 mins or so or just stay on board for the 30 minute ride for $10. Like all gardens there are fern groves, herbs, rare plants etc. But being such an old garden it is the very old and large trees that I enjoyed. Look out for upcoming special events. Enjoy our heritage.

A must do when visiting Sydney. The Botanical Gardens in Sydney are stunning - they are thought to be one of the oldest public gardens in the southern hemisphere. The gardens are just beautiful dotted with gorgeous pavilions and statues. The walking tracks are easy to navigate with clear signage and there are great views across the harbour to the Sydney Opera House. The Gift Shop is worth visiting as they sell Honey from the hives in the Botanic Gardens where they have access to all of the flowering plants. We had a really nice breakfast at the cafe which served a yummy bacon and egg roll and coffee and sat out under the trees to eat it. Definitely worth visiting the gardens which provide a peaceful break from the hustle and bustle of Sydney.

Serenity in the city. As a local I've been visiting the Royal Botanical Gardens for years. From picnics, to study dates with friends, to weddings, to casual strolls along the water, the botanical gardens offers fantastic views and peace and quiet amongst the bustle of Sydney.
Cafe delight. Small busy cafe with deliciously good toasted chicken and mayo sandwiches. A nice place to sit and eat after a stroll around the gardens.

Free and spectacular. From the Opera House around to Mrs Macquarie's chair. Wonderful plants and trees, lots of paths and sloping greens to lie on. Free entry, ponds with fish for children to look at, and a couple of eating options. Spectacular views of the harbour, opera house and bridge. Right next to the heart of the city.

Great place to explore in the city. I've been to the gardens countless times and never get tired of walking around. Apart from amazing varieties of flora and fauna there are spectacular water views and great area for family picnics.

Free walking tour @ 10:30am. We joined the free walking tour which leaves the i (information point) at 10:30am. The guide was knowledgeable and gave us a much better insight into the history, details and quirks of the gardens.

Aboriginal Heritage Tours was extremely informative and entertaining. We decided that we wanted to do the Aboriginal tour. It was everything we hoped for and more! We learned about the local species from an informative and passionate aboriginal guide. It lasted about 2 1/2 hours went around the garden and ended in an educational room showing the tools and artifacts used by aboriginals.
paradise in the midst of city. very well maintained gardens and you can even take a little train if you don't want to walk. however it is worth a little stroll as it has some nice features
Beautiful . For those green thumbs out thre this is the place for you as there are many different types and species of plants and themes all over the gardens

A beautiful public space. I'm botanically inclined, and have been to my fair share of botanic gardens. The RBG is amongst the very best I've been to - very traditional in design, with formal garden beds, plenty of water features, and lots of lawn space. Extremely well maintained, and the views of the harbour are great.The cafe was good (coffee excellent) as was the book shop.Sydneysiders are extremely lucky to have such a wonderful public place, and I'm very envious....When in Sydney, a walk through the RBG is an absolute must.
Pure nature. If you like nature and want to escape the crowded places such as the opera house and the bridge. If the sun shines take your lunch with you and watch the people who are passing by.

Walk to Mrs Macquarie's seat.. Had a wander up to Mrs Macquarie's seat, before the Botanic Gardens.
Well worth the walk with the view at the end. Dodging runners was an experience.
Great garden. Great garden that is free! And a nice location to take good view of the harbor bridge and opera house. Highly recommended. Good for whole family.

Serene vistas. Beautifully laid out gardens with a great walkway along the water. Super for joggers & walkers. A great place for picnics & family outing. There are activities for kids too but do check out the timings. The train is a great way to tour the gardens especially you have kids or elderly with you. You can board it from near the opera house. There is a cafe too. Of course you can simply walk to the harbour side if you want greater choices.

Free and Beautiful. This has beautiful view, and it's free, get some exercise, take in the view, in the middle there is a glasshouse which is amazing. the big old fig trees are amazing. Great for everyone, great for picnics.

Amazing Gardens and Vistas. Take some time to wander around the Botanic Gardens. The plants and flowers were spectacular and every time you turn the bend you get a fabulous view of the harbour bridge and Opera house. You may even get to see a wedding ceremony happening.

Lovely peaceful walk. After visiting most of The city sights we were pleasantly surprised after walking around the Opera House to come across the Botanic Gardens.This unlike the other main tourist sights is incredibly peaceful, tranquil and very pleasing on the senses.If it's a sunny day spend some quality time here.

It's free tho. Yeah as the title says. It is free. So don't expect it to be like Singapore's garden Lol. But nice garden anyways. You can find the most famous tourist spot in Australia by the end of it.PS : Carry a water bottle with you. You won't find many accesible drinkable water pump and it will be really hot in the summer

A highlight of any trip to Sydney!. I am so happy I wandered into the Royal Botanical Gardens. Once could easily spend many hours exploring all of the unique and diverse areas within. Frankly, the variety is outstanding. There is also a cafe within which was quite good and the perfect place to catch your breath. As there is no entry fee, this makes for a great place to spend a few hours.
Beautiful. Take a stroll through these gardens.. Very tranquil... Lovely to hear all the wildlife as you walk through.

Beautiful summer visit. Just be prepared to walk and walk, it's got lots of hills, but also places to sit & rest. Only disappointment was that among the beautiful gardens they had allowed a fellow with a drone out there, which was most annoying. Wish we would have gone for movie night too. Cool idea.

NYE--What a View!. I visited the gardens for Midnight at the Oasis for NYE 2015 and let me tell you it was worth every penny I paid!! The view of the Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge for the fireworks was unparalleled. We had a great view and tables with chairs at which to sit. The entrée, main, and dessert that we received were excellent, the band was awesome, and the five hours we spent there flew by. This was by far one of the best ways that I've ever spent New Year's Eve!

Beautifully kept gardens. The Royal Botanic Gardens are really worth a visit. They are beautifully kept and one can tell that the rangers / gardeners are enthusiastic about what they do. The gardens cover a large area but it is worth exploring because one forever uncovers something new whilst strolling.

Great place to spend an hour or two. Since the Garden is free and conveniently located near the Opera House and Circular Quay, it is a lovely place to take a stroll or relax to get away from the bustle.
A good day for a stroll. This park was on it's 200 years anniversary. The park is huge and well kept. It is just beautiful to stroll around after visiting the Opera House.
Beautifully calm. Beautiful place , very calm and peaceful to walk through to Opera house. Free , spotless and a lovely place to sit and watch the world go by

Peaceful and relaxing. The Hop on/off bus dropped us here for a very pleasant few hours. We had a very relaxing time walking round, videoing the birds etc. and each other! The shop had a good variety of items for sale including an amazing Australian 12 days of Christmas which I bought for my granddaughter to go with her previously purchased didgeridoo, tea towels, cards etc..The café was limited as it was near closing time when we ventured that far for a drink and cake - the birds were everywhere looking for scraps and crumbs. We walked back through the park and down on to The Rocks area, before heading back for the train to the Central Station.

What a nice place!. It is very hard to remember that you are in the center of a huge city when you're walking in this park. The atmosphere is very peaceful. The garden has good viewpoints on the opera, the bridge and the bay.In summer there is an open air cinema located on Farm Cove.

Stunning!!. I like to visit the botanic gardens in every city that I visit. They are always displayed differently and have a totally unique atmosphere about them. Sydney is no different in this respect and it's one of my favourites. Truly massive and with awesome views over the harbour, you really shouldn't miss it.
Scenic, panoramic gardens. Excellent maintained gardens throughout - great for walks, jogging & picnics (and just hanging out). Art Museum is right there.

Serene. After a hectic time in Sydney the Gardens offer the traveller some much needed down time and space while also offering some wonderful things to look at and some lovely harbour views. Places to eat or have a coffee and lots of paths to meander about.
Relaxing. After a couple of very busy days walking around Sydney it was nice just to get away from it all and walk at your own pace.

Beautiful. Stunning place and so beautifully maintained. Such a sea of tranquility in the middle of the city.
Great views of the harbour too.
Definitely worth a visit 😊

Absolutely Gorgeous!. These gardens are absolutely gorgeous! They are kept trimmed and neat, and the flowers are truly amazing. There is not one part of the garden that isn't amazing!!There are flowers, ponds, lakes, birds, ducks and many other things that will delight visitors!The best part is the gardens are free!! Locals hang out there and everyone respects and cares for the gardens.This was one of our favorite places to just walk and admire all the wonderful things!
Lovely walk and picnic. Great to walk around and chill under a tree after lunch. It smells so nice it is difficult to leave.

Beautiful and so well cared for. We strolled through the gardens on our way to the opera house. My goodness they are so beautiful with the most amazing range of specimen trees and shrubs with information provided in a very tasteful way, respecting the plants etc. It really is the most lovely place for a quiet stroll with seating and shade available for those roasty, toasty hot summer days - a real refuge. The views from the gardens are very impressive.We were with our 24 year old son who loved them too.

Beautiful well-kept gardens. My husband and I recently strolled through the gardens in early morning and found them to be beautiful with many types of flora and fauna, as well as nice views of the water, bridge, and opera house. We found the gardens to be neat and clean.
Nice place to spend an evening. The Garden is large and has lot of collections of the plants. It has restaurant which serves very good food.

Something for everyone. No matter what your interests are, these spectacular gardens offer something for everyone whether you're travelling solo or with a friend or your family. From a leisurely walk, a jog/run, a place to stop for a picnic, the gardens offer so many great vantage points to view Sydney's great harbour. And for budding botanists and gardeners, there is no shortage of inspiration from the beautifully managed gardens which have a history spanning some 200 years. Best of all, a visit costs you nothing. Do yourself a favour and visit it.

Worth it. Take a trip round by the Opera House and you come to the bottom of the gardens with stunning views .The trees and the plants are fantastic at the top of the gardens there is a rose garden well worth a look at.For people with limited mobility there is a road train which takes you round the park. At a small cost.In the park there is a cafe resturant or you can take away food .Also there is a gift shop were you can purchase books and gifts about the park and toilets at the side of the building.

Royal Botanic Garden Sydney.. Founded by Govenor Macquarie, the gardens opened in 1816, the gardens are the oldest scientific institution in Australia.
You get stunning views of Sydney Harbour and Opera House
We visited on a lovely sunny day, enjoyed our Walk and our picnic lunch.
wondeful. Fantastic - wonderful and just around the corner from the Sydney Opera house. Weather was lovely for March#.

relaxing and interesting. The walk around the garden is beautiful and very interesting. Many beautiful trees and plants are described on plates. But as being so interesting it is very busy and to me there were too many runners around at the path along sea front.

Beautiful Harbour Gardens. Strolling through the gardens by Sydney Harbour is lovely, with different styles of planting and everything well marked for the plant enthusiasts!
Great for a picnic and free family outing!

Better than Adelaide and Melbourne – sorry!. We’ve seen some fine gardens in Australia, but left thinking that this was the best of the three we had seen. The layout and directions excellent, the flowers, shrubs and trees were beautiful. And the sculptures thought provoking. We only walked through on our way to Potts Point and could easily have spent a few hours walking round what is an excellent Garden.

A relazing day. This a park with a board walk around the water front , you will also pass by a navel harbour two air craft carriers in the day we were there. Pretty but do not expect to see tons of flowers - but is is a nice walk continue past the opra house.

One of mmy favourite places in Sydney. The Botanic Gardens is one of my favourite places in Sydney. Take your time and explore all the nooks and crannies, including the herb garden and the cactus garden. The bookshop has a great selection of books and souveners.

A place to boast about!. A wonderful, relaxing place to visit. The views of the harbour, Sydney harbour bridge and the Opera house are breathtaking, plus more famous land marks within the harbour. Fantastic large areas to have a picnic, surrounded by huge "old" trees and colourful garden beds.Great for all ages and occasions. Very popular for wedding venues with a romantic atmosphere.Not far away from 4-5 star hotels, cafes and restaurants.Shops are not too far away.

Spectacular specimens from around the world. This place is so easily accessible it should be on your list of where to go and what to see in Sydney. Some truly amazing old (200 years +) trees. Incredible harbor views! So quiet and relaxing in the middle of the big city.

Always An Ideal And Relaxing Attraction All Times Of The Day. The extensive Garden is, without fail, very well kept and cared for. It having an entry point next to the Sydney Opera House and by the Harbour accorded it an absolutely unique position.

Impressive Gardens along the Harbour. Sydney is a large and teeming city. However, a short distance along the harbor from the main business district are these beautiful gardens. The collection of trees from around the world is impressive, but most stunning was how peaceful the gardens felt in the midst of the large city. Take a few hours and just wander. It is well worth the effort and the harbor views are terrific.

See it before it's gone!. A beautiful oasis in the middle of Sydney and home to one of the country's most diverse collections of flora. Sadly they've fired all of their scientists and dumped the many amazing volunteers that once worked there. It's now in the hands of a bunch of uninspired, ostensible corporate types.

Peace & tranquility. I love visiting the Royal Botanic Gardens when I visit Sydney city. It is the perfect place for some quiet time and to reconnect with nature. You can stroll down the many paths and have amazing views of the harbour. Free entry and the perfect place to meet with friends, go on a romantic date or for families to enjoy a day out together (leave your mobiles on silent for a while).

A cool oasis close to the action. The Botanic Gardens were a nice surprise! Lots to see and always that glimpse of the Harbour, the Opera House or the Bridge. A tourist train travels through the gardens and if you were time poor it would be a good way to see the main sights. It's not just for kids although at school holiday time it was pretty crowded with little people. We chose to have breakfast at the restaurant in the Gardens and it was delicious, well cooked and reasonably priced.
Beautiful. This is lovely to walk around. definitely go to the wishing tree and have a read of what you need to do! Dont get lost :)

Don't Miss This Park. This park is gorgeous and tranquil. I don't think I ever wrote a review about a park and never spent so much time at a park as I did at this beautiful place. While you walk through and enjoy the beauty of this park you also have the beauty of Sydney Harbour in the back drop. The trees have to be hundreds of years old, the plants are beautiful and the park is pristine and impressively immaculate. They even have a cafe but if I were you I would grab a picnic lunch and sit on the manicured lawn and just take it all in!.

After the rain. We visited this after the rain....free entry... live entertainment going on for young visitors under 8 need to book was popular.Gardens and walkways well kept.Made a refreshing change to just slowly walk to the harbour and see a dfferent side to Sydney.Park entrance less than 5 MINS from Sir Stamford hotel.

Beautiful!. Beautiful garden, perfect for a walk, a lay down on the grass, a run and a picnic. Plenty of greenery and amazing views Sydney harbour.If you are a tourist visiting Sydney then some time spent in the gardens is a must.

Fun for the family. We took our 3 children to the Botanic gardens on the weekend for a picnic and a look around at the gardens. Entry is free. Very nice place to have a picnic with nice views. Got the train that goes around the garden for a tour $10 adults $5 children & seniors. The train you can hop on and off at different spots but train gets full quick. Flowers and plants were nice though not many flowers as i remember when I was a kid. Probably better to go in spring time, might be more flowers in bloom then but still a fun day!

If only my garden looked like this!. Coming from dry WA it was a wonderful experience to walk through Sydney's stunning botanic gardens. Highly recommended to delight your eyes and calm your senses in the midst of a very busy city.

Waste of time. Going to the botanical gardens was a complete waste of time. It was just a plain park with trees. We did not see any flowers or interesting plants besides an extremely small rose garden. There were a couple of flowers planted in very small areas here and there, but they were very easy to miss, and they did not come close to my expectations. We were extremely disappointed.

Amazing place to spend New Years Eve. We brought in the new year with a fantastic start to 2016 at one of Sydney's excellent vantage points, midnight at the oasis. The Royal Botanical Gardens is well worth a visit during the day but our visit was specific for our New Years Eve celebration. We dined over looking the Harbour Bridge and the Sydney Opera House. An amazing night definitely an experience we will never forget.

A must see. Photographer's delight. One of my favourite places in Sydney, the gardens are wonderful any time of year. My personal favourite is in the spring. Plan to spend a few hours strolling through the numerous gardens.
Beautiful gardens. This botanical garden is very large. You could spend several days wandering about. There are many places to stop and contemplate life on a park bench.
friendly parrot. When my kids walk around and a kind of parrot fly down and walk close to my kids，it is very friendly and it love my kids slippers
Green. Lovely place to spend a sunny day in summer on the sea shore and opera house with lots of greenery around and beautiful flowers.
Perfect for a walk. Perfect for a walk, especially during the summer, with plenty of shade under the trees. Would also be a great place for a picnic.
Glorious for relaxing. Beautiful gardens, open spaces for walking and enjoying with family or friends. Beautiful plants, a cafe and a little train for a ride around and a talk by the driver!
A stroll in the park. really enjoyable to wander around the gardens with a big city..great views of the bridge and the opera house from the point

Stunning . Gorgeous day walking around the gardens. Really stunning, breath taking views. Everywhere was kept so beautiful, credit to the people who run it! Worth a visit. One tiny negative we found was the restaurant, it was very dirty, we had a drink there and didn't order any food as it was dirty.Other than that the gardens are stunning. Credit to Sydney!
Nice, longer walk. We spent the afternoon here. Nice view of Opera from other side. I wanted to find the bench of the lady. Finally we found it. Some trees were gorgeous .

First visit. Walked through the gardens on our way back to the hotel from touring the Opera House. Beautiful and well maintained. Clearly respected by visitors too. Like having the plants labeled too. Worth the visit and it is free!
Beautiful and relaxing. These are wonderful gardens and so relaxing just to wonder around for free. The views are stunning and a must visit

Beautiful way to see the city. The best part of walking through the Royal Botanic Gardens in City was the amazing view of the Sydney Opera House and the bridge. Quite possibly one of the best views we found. The gardens themselves were beautiful and well kept. What a lovely stroll through a park.

Wind in the Willows of the Botanic Gardens Sydney. A very child friendly play held in the beautiful grounds of the Sydney Botanic Gardens. Take a blanket, a picnic, some children, a group of great actors and the beautiful natural back drop of the main pond in the gardens, just perfect for Ratty's punting on the river and you have the Wind in the Willows. Some up to date political humour is included for Mum and Dad.A lovely early evening spent in the spectacular gardens on the edge of Sydney Harbour.
Great for a stroll, just gorgeous!. Walked through its so nice! Lots of seats and shaded areas. Would be nice for a picnic with friends and family.

Seasonal attractions. Always open to the public, the gardens are worth an unhurried walk. The trees are grand, flowers in the right season are attractive. Well kept and a terrific place to find wedding photos being taken.
Huge. Huge park. Mostly grass and trees. Spend the day with picnic. Start at Opera house and walk around. Wear hat and comfy shoes. Bring lots of water

Very little to see. I'm used to botanical gardens where there're less green lawn than plant areas. This was a lot of lawns and a few areas with plants and yes the plants was beautiful, but disappointing for me.

A wonderfully tranquil place. Considering the bustle of Sydney right on its door step, the gardens are amazingly tranquil. The huge area available for walking, picnicking or just chilling out is beautiful and you can very easily lose track of time. The cafe has an excellent range of hot and cold snacks and serves good coffee! The range of plants and wildlife, plus the views of the city make for a very restful and lazy visit.

Great Walk. We walked through the gardens late in the day on a winters afternoon and were amazed at the layout and appeal of the gardens. All the sections had something to look at. Great design leads around the sections. Even as a confirmed non gardener, I was impressed. As an added bonus people were hand feeding cockatoos allowing an opportunity to get up close.

Nice place for picnic and sightseeing. This is one of very nice garden that I used to go. There are many kinds of plant. Good place to take a photo. You can see Opera house and Harbour bridge from this garden.

Absolutely gorgeous!. Set right on the edge of downtown and the harbor. Can't comment on what it looks like in the winter, but we just went in December (summer) and it was gorgeous. So colorful and well maintained. Lots of bird wildlife along the way, and quaint ponds too stocked full of hungry fish! You'll find tourists and locals walking around, and for good reason. Make the trip.

Beautiful Place. Have been to the botanical gardens during my stay in sydney, and this is one of the lovely places that are to be visited when in sydney city. Calm, Clean, beautiful gardens that give a nice view of both the opera and harbour bridge.

Beautiful way to spend an afternoon. I love walking through the Gardens. The park itself is HUGE and you can easily spend a day wandering around, lazing on the grass. Sites to visit include the Governors House & the Art Gallery of New South Wales- both free!
Well worth a visit. Really lovely Botanic Gardens with wonderful views of Sydney Harbour. Well laid out with gentle walks.
Nice place. I very liked this garden, because here is very beautiful and a lot of trees and flowers. If you really want to relax and enjoy the speed of time go to this garden.

Beautiful gardens!. If you visit Sydney you simply have to visit the Botanical Gardens! I had the pleasure of having to walk through them in order to get from my apartment to the City every day. I opted to take a different route each time as it's so big that there is plenty to keep you occupied for an entire morning/afternoon. The only negative I have of this place is the service in the cafe that is situated within the grounds was painfully slow. I had to wait around 15-20 minutes for a coffee.

Spend some time here.... Amazing gardens and features to enjoy. From rose gardens to succulents to herbs. Many sculptures to enjoy and admire, places to sit, read or have a picnic. Restaurants around...
Lovely place. A paradise in the cbd...can't miss out...a great variety of trees and birds. ..ideal top gp worth a good camera and a good zoom as well....fairytale
Beautiful Gardens. The garden is beautiful with many mature trees and a nice variety of plants. It is a nice walk from here to the Opera House.

One of my favourite places in Sydney. The gardens are located on the harbour adjacent to the Sydney Opera House. The views are stunning, and you can stroll on level ground all the way from the Opera House to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. There is a lovely café and a mini train ride for those who are not feeling like walking. The flora is diverse and lush, or you can just sit on the grass and take in the atmosphere. This is a beautiful spot to get away from the crowds.
Beautiful and free. Must do. Great views of Harbour. Beautiful plants and trees and such variety. Lots of shade. Wear good walking shoes and brig a blanket and snacks. Nice signage within park.

Great for a walk!. Walked around the Botanic Gardens and it is so peaceful and beautiful. A lovely setting for a picnic or grab a coffee at the coffee shop. There is a good store there as well with Australiana and Botanical inspired gifts. I highly recommend this to anyone.

Great place to stroll. Even having been here several times before the many and varied paths and lawns make it a perfect place to enjoy nature and incredible views, right in the heart of this busy city. Well maintained gardens and super clean, even just 10 hours after New Year Celebrations

Beautiful. I wasn't keen on walking through this as I thought it was just another flower garden. I couldn't have been more wrong! Our entire family loved it (kids are ages 15, 18 and 20). Beautiful sights, views, birds, ponds, etc. Do not skip this! We walked there several times on our holiday!

Visiting the Botanic Gardens. Really enjoyed walking around the gardens whilst our children enjoyed the 20-30 mins mini train ride around the park. Lots to see in the flora and lots of people jogging around the park. Highly recommended for rest and relaxation or even for a picnic on a fine sunny day. Close to the Sydney Opera house

Lovely to step away from the crowds . Having been in Sydney over the Christmas period when it was very busy it was really nice to walk around this beautiful park and get some peace and quiet. We also went on the little road train which was good and visited the café. As a coeliac I managed to get a piece of gluten free chocolate brownie here that was really nice
Exploring our hometown. Another great day out in Sydney!Take the time to hop on and off the Red Train and go an explore.Great for kids.

Beautiful. Beautiful and very large grounds, with a very wide collection. Grounds are immaculate and provide amazing views on Sydney, the Harbor, the bridge as well as the Opera House. Great place for a leisurely walk.

easy to get lost. We wondered around several times - it is free and got very lost. We did not nearly cover it all but based on what we did see the Botanical Gardens are a wonderful green space with wonderful views of the Harbour, the Harbour bridge and Opera House as well as all the interesting plants and design of the garden on expects in a botanic gardens.

Fav place in Sydney!. This is my favourite place in Sydney! It's in the city and still I always feel like I'm on holiday whenever I spend some time here.It's so peaceful and so relaxing that I never have enough of this place!It is perfect for any occasion: Jogging, walking, sunbathing and for spending some time and having a pic nic with friends.The view is gorgeus! It's the perfect picture of nature and city combined together: From here you get to see trees, flowers, the Opera House, the bridge, the bay and the skyscrapers all at once!

Unique blossoms at every turn. Whether you are just walking through the gardens, out for a run, or joining the free 1-hour walking tour, take the time to sit quietly and absorb the beauty. Plenty of benches or just stretch out on the green areas. Marvel at the variety of tropical plants. Take-away lunch at the café fit in perfectly with this casual atmosphere.
Nice walk. It was a nice walk through the garden to the other side of the Opera house, then walked around to the front of Opera House.
Great views. Must do.Great views on the Opera House and Sydney Harbour. Wonderful on nice days.It doesn't take too long and it offers thousands opportunities for taking nice photos.

Excellent views and well maintained. The garden has been very well maintained and is lovely place to view both opera house and harbour bridge. The place is perfect for a summer picnic spot. One can enjoy the walk on the sea side towards the mcquarie chair which offers the perfect spot to see both opera and bridge together. There are often concerts organised at the park and on Sundays many marriage ceremonies happen which is a treat to watch. All you need is to sit, walk and relax....

lovely garden. Me and my friend took a stroll down this beautiful garden on a nice sunny day and it was perfect. Little ponds, bridges and plants makes the garden very enjoyable. Had lunch at a cafe inside and also had a great view of harbour bridge.

Lovely, well-planned trees, bushes and flowers. We walked in and were greeted with a number of different kinds of flowers and bushes in full bloom. What a sight! We sat on a bench for a few minutes just to take in the view of the gardens with the harbor in the background. The large grounds provide many photo-ops with or without the harbor, opera house and/or bridge in the background. Easy to get turned around in. Took us a bit to find our way to the exit. There are a cafe and gift shop if you need a bite to eat or a souvenir.
Good for a stroll. Excellent place for a walk. Spent a morning here recovering from jetlag. Good views of the opera house and bridge (we came in from the city centre side so ended at the OH).
Relaxation. Enjoy a picnic with spectacular views of the Opera House and Harbour whilst relaxing on immaculate lawns.
Lovely gardens for a picnic. Head here for a lovely picnic on a hot summers day. The gardens are fantastically maintained and overlook the beautiful Sydney Harbour.

Stunning. Away from the craziness of the harbour the botanic gardens are an oasis of calm and beauty.
Spend an hour or so walking round and chilling on a bench watching the world go by.

beautiful lush gardens. If you want to escape the hustle and bustle of the city, entered the Botanical gates and enjoy the peace and quiet. Lots of greenery and lots of interesting (historical) statues.

On a beautiful Sydney Day visit the Botanical Gardens. This is the location that can provide a 5 star feel without the 5 star price tag. Where else can you take a picnic lunch (a few rolls, some cheese fruit and something to drink) and enjoy the gardens and of course views of Sydney Harbour. For tourists it is close to the Opera House and of course to major transport hubs of Ferry, Train and Bus.On a beautiful Sydney day this is the place to relax.

Calming. Botanical gardens with Tarmac paths and walkways to access the many trees, shrubs and flower species on display, fountains and statues are found along all walking routes. Quiet areas with grass for sitting, benches and other areas. The gardens slope down to the harbour and can be accessed from the city, the opera house or from maquarie road. Very clean and quiet place, can be quite busy with people on event days and public holidays.

Wonderful . We visited on 31 December when it was shutting early because of NYE and again on the 1st January.It's a fantastic location. The plants layout is lovely. It is a very relaxing place. One could spend the whole day here.Definitely visit when in Sydney

Beautiful. Amazing plant life, guided tours, well-stocked gift shop with a wide selection of seeds, romantic views of the harbor, plenty of clean public bathrooms, and a nice little cafe.This garden is great for everything from a family picnic to a romantic walk to a long morning run away from traffic!
Perfect! Must visit! . Very nice place to be. Beautiful combination of flowers, sculptures and open area. Lovely view and very nice! A must visit for everyone!

Quietly surprised . We visited the gardens as a spare of the moment kind of thing as other plans fell through and we only had an hour till our dinner reservations.We thought we would go for a stroll and were very surprised by all the gardens had to offer. The kids were busy exploring and learning about different things as we wandered around the gorgeous gardens.... we could have been in the middle of nowhere it is strangely quiet for being located smack bank in the city.We have since googled the gardens and plan to visit again, they have regular events and lots of interesting things happening.

Don't Miss..... The Botanical Gardens are chock full of interesting plants and unusual animals...we made it a point to go back for a second visit and were surprised what we saw the second time around. Lots to see here and the views of the bridge and Opera House are hard to beat in the morning light.
A beautiful walk. Walk through lush historic gardens to the Art Gallery of New South Wales, with great art and stunning views of the Harbour. Free entry except for special exhibitions.
Sydney Botanical Gardens. Walked here from our hotel. Very beautiful and close to the Opera House. Well maintained and an enjoyable walk through. Worth the visit.

Lazy day in the sun. After New Years Eve in Sydney we chose to go the Botanical Gardens on New Years Day. We were really tired so we took a leisurely stroll around the beautiful grounds, had something to eat from the cafe (which was quite expensive ie $8.50 for iceblock and drink) and looked through the lovely Botanical Gardens shop. We had a lovely sleep under some trees and enjoyed watching so many people and families enjoying the well kept, diverse gardens. We decided to take in a ride on the little train which goes around the gardens. At $10 each the driver gave a commentary for 30mins. A nice way to end the visit and pleasant. Tickets can be obtained by the gate between the Botanical Gardens and Sydney Opera House.

Nice, but not breathtaking . For me the best part was the view on Sydney and not the garden itself. I am Probably too spoiled by the best European and Asian gardens. The Choo Choo buss is quite handy if you don't feel like walking for too long in the heat.
Very nice, but huge. beautiful place, but huge. Be prepared to walk. Or if you are not very keen, there is train called cho cho that drives around. The guide has a very annoying voice though.
Great walking place. Sydney's Royal Botanic Garden is a great place a for a nice walk or a jog. The diversity of plants is amazing. There are some specific viewing points that really adds up to it.
