The gardeners were planting a load of lavender first thing in the morning and it smelt beautiful. The park isn't astoundingly beautiful and doesn't have any amazing botanical species that will strike you as incredibly special, but it is a tranquil environment to stroll safely through as the heavy Sydney traffic sits outside in the surrounding roads. The walk down toward the Opera House is very scenic and that in itself, is a botanic garden view that you will not see anywhere else in the world. We exited through the gate nearest the Opera House and this was a great walk to start the day. We were there at 7.30am and the park was very popular with runners.
Great views of the harbour. Took the train ride ,$10 for half an hour ......you can get off at three stops if you wish but good overview

Beauty in the City. Could have spent hours walking around the gardens. What a beautiful spot in the middle of the city. So much to see and so many spots to just sit and take in the views of the harbour. Close to the Opera house. Do yourself a favour and visit this relaxing area when you're next in Sydney.
Simply awe inspiring. This place is stunning. Plants from all over the world in a single place. It is a wildlife and botanists dream come true. Be sure to go the the eel pond. Its pretty cool.
Take a free tour!. The gardens are large and complicated. Taking a tour gave us a piece to really understand and a great appreciation for the history and present work being done.

A pretty walk, a place to talk. On my last day in Sydney, we had a few hours of afternoon light to walk through the gardens and enjoy more views of the water. Though I was not as blown away by these gardens as friends who made the recommendation, it was very pleasant and quiet.
Enjoy The Gardens. A great break from city sites to enjoy the gardens. Good location, views of the harbour, able to continue walking to Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

Well worth a visit, we got on the train. Over 86 acres to walk, but great lie down, relax have a picnic, there's a fab little train that takes you on 4 stops , hop on hop off on each stop. Beautiful plants and trees

A Paradise for Plant Lovers. My wife is a fanatic plant person and would not miss the Botanic Gardens. I must admit that I also enjoyed the walk. My tip to you is to use the train that runs through the gardens (10 AUD) to survey the grounds before you begin your walk. Then you can prioritize your time and see what’s the most important and interesting to you first.

See the City across the water. The awesome Morton Bay trees form the backcloth to a beautiful view of the City skyscrapers,The Bridge and The Opera house across the water from this very old historic park. It is so peaceful and on the waters edge. The $7 an hour to park your car on Mrs Macquaries Road is expensive but worth it when you can walk around the waters edge and feel a lovely sea breeze. You will see where the Australian Navy parks it's ships and where the horses in WW1 sailed past here from Wooloomooloo Bay never to return home which brings a tear. There is a kiosk near Mrs Macquarie's chair for a stop. The Botanical gardens are very established and lovely with a cafe and shop. I always finish up at the duck pond which makes me feel that I'm almost in the country. An hour here is enough to recharge your batteries after the ghastly rush of the City.There is always a parking spot and more to see.

Vast gardens with spectacular views of the harbour. The Botanic Gardens is a vast expanse of open grassland and gardens in the heart of Sydney and alongside Sydney Harbour and the Opera House. It's popular in the morning, lunchtime and after work with runners so maybe go outside of these hours for less crowds.Lovely place to visit.

A fantastic run. Being a Sydney a couple of times and you will always see runner heading into the Botanic Gardens during lunch time, I follow suit and i understand why, it was very scenic, pretty much take the tiresome off your mind.
Good place to walk and run . This garden will take you away from the city rush and will show you a bit of the typical Australian plants and animal. Keep your eyes open for ibis birds and lorikeets.

A beautiful place to explore at leisure. While the botanical gardens are a worthy destination in their own right, they make a lovely part of a walk from Mrs Macquarie's Chair round to Circular Quay and the Rocks. The Gardens have all sorts of interesting and unusual plants that will be fascinating to the layman as well as the botanist.

Icon. You have not visited Sydney and see her charm without a visit to the Botanic Gardens. The best time to visit the garden is either in the morning or early evening when the fragrant of the plant is most vivid. I am short of a right word to describe how beautiful the park is.

Wonderful spot away from the Sydney bussle. I'd been to Sydney many times but never taken the time to check out the botanic gardens. It is spacious, but you can walk round it in an hour or two. On hot days there is shade beneath the trees, and good views to the Opera House, Bridge and across Sydney harbour. Highly recommended.

The most stunning gardens with the most iconic view. Returned second time around and this was the first place I visited on arrival. The garden are just so relaxed and wonderful. Especially perfect returning with someone very special once again.
Can see why people would wish to get married here.

Roses and many more...... Great walks, the area is serene and absolutely a must to see. This is the place to stop and smell the roses. You can buy some seeds in a gift shop and learn about other attractions so visiting one place help planning the trip to the next.

Beautiful garden surroundings . . . .. Botanic Gardens Restaurant is a great place for Sunday breakfast, popular because of the food and the beautiful garden surroundings. Great views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.
Restaurant is upstairs and cafe downstairs, great for a coffee and light snacks. Friendly efficient service. Lovely seating inside and outside. I'd be happy to recommend and look forward to returning.
A must see. Enjoy the train ride through the 75 acre park for a good overview. Takes about twenty minutes. Well worth it.

Gardens in Sydney are fantastic.. I was so impressed with the gardens in Sydney. They are beautiful and wonderfully maintained. Coming from So. California, I was stunned by the trees in this garden. Took lots of tree & flower pictures.
Beautiful, peaceful getaway.. Lovely to walk through, excellent views of the Harbour Bridge, Opera House and across the Harbour itself. Beautifully maintained gardens and easily accessible location.

Pretty garden. Nice garden with good view of the Opera house and Habour bridge. You don't have to walk far from the Opera House to the garden in order to capture best pictures of both the Opera House and bridge. Good place to have picnic, but it'd better to bring a mat with you to sit on as the grass tends to be quite moist. Wish I were a local so I could enjoy the park every weekend.

A piece of paradise in the edge of the CBD. There is nothing better than a stroll through the Botanical Gardens and no better time than on a Sunday. Visit the Sydney Art Gallery or walk through the gardens along the shore line to the Opera House. Lots of people sit in the gardens to enjoy a picnic of nap. Just remember to put on some sun cream!

"Green tranquility" in the city.. "after a half day working in the office, it is a almost not to imagine that there is a place, just 100 meters away where there is a tranquility,......unique in the city. Just for a break, a visit for a day, just for eating your lunch, just for relaxing. My place in Sydney town.

Beautiful gardens, pleasant place to relax. The Royal Botanic Gardens are a must have seen attraction when visiting Sydney. The gardens are very well arranged and easy to stroll through. The Opera House can be seen from a different angle from the harbour side of the gardens.

Must do in Sydney. The lush green gardens and sparkling blue bay alone are reasons to come here in spring. Walk all the way to Mrs Macquaries Chair and you also have the perfect view of the opera house and bridge!

Amazing. only one word, stunning!
It is so easy to walk around the Royal Botanical Garden, and enjoy the harbor. Just make sure you bring comfortable shoes.
Great civic gardens. Go visit, you will not be disappointed and it changes with the seasons.. Just do it. You will love the experience. Very well maintain and planned civic gardens close to the CBD.
Green oasis. My favourite spot is the Cactii / Dry Climate walled garden in the South East of the gardens. A walk around the edge of the cove & on to the Opera House is quite special as well.

The gardens. The Royal Botanic Gradens are magic. With the harbour and city as backdrops why wouldn't they be? Apart from the setting the gardens themselves are extensive, varied and relaxing - with plenty of lawn to sit on and watch the beautiful harbour or the world go by. A haven of peace and tranquility in a bustling city!

Beautiful and relaxing. I used to work close to these beautiful gardens and I enjoyed spending my lunch on a bench under the trees or walking around the extensive grounds. The different settings are very well thought of and they have a huge variety of flora.

Honestly one of my favourite places. . Absolutely love the gardens, it's incredibly huge and offers some stunning statues. Perfect for picnics, study or just being alone with your thoughts. One of Sydney's highlights.

Wonderfully calming . Due to time pressure, I was able to spend only about an hour wandering around. It was a beautifully tranquil place, with lots of interesting plants (not that I know anything about plants).
I'd love to go back with a bit more time to spend.

Relax, have long walk, right beside Ocean and near city!!. A great day out place, good for any ages. A huge park, garden to relax, play, have barbecue, etc. Great views of city. Just beside Opera. Those walky people, long walk along the shores. A must visit with Sydney bridge and Opera house.

Must See Attraction. Take your time as there is a lot to see. A great place for a picnic lunch. It's next to the Opera House and the harbor. The free tour was outstanding and you'll learn lot about the flora and fauna.
Beautiful!. I walked for hours through the gardens enthralled by the beauty.... reading every marker and sign there was. Don't miss these gardens!
Beautiful gardens and lots of birds!. Loved the gardens and the views from the gardens. Many beautiful flowers and plants. The song birds are incredible- always singing. Loved it!

Great experience. The gardens were beautiful and the day was not too hot. It was great to see the birds and flowers. We even saw some people having a picnic and a large bird (ibis?) tipping behind their backs to steal their food. If I am not mistaken, parts of this garden overlook the opera house and bridge. Great views!

TAKE THE TRAIN TRIP. Recenly visited the Garden with our elderley Mother. We decided to take advantage of the miniture train that does a circuit of the gardens.Price was reasonable and trip well worthwhile as driver gives a commentary as you go along. You get a good look at the waterfront as train goes along Farm Cove befoer finishing by the Opera House.This is a great trip for overseas visitors

Best Views of the Opera House. This is a beautiful park with interesting flora, rock formations and monuments. We spent much more time than we expected to here just wandering around snapping photos. The best views of the Sydney Opera House can be found here. One thing happened that may scare off some people though. A magpie attacked my baseball cap. He was hovering over me, squawking and pecking my hat. I guess he wasn't a Patriots fan! I was told later that that's pretty common with Australian magpies. I found it amusing but I know some people have a fear of birds.

The Spring Walk. I had not idea what a treat I was in for. I arrived at the beginning of spring and the flowers were in full bloom. This experience alone is probably worth scheduling your trip to Sydney in September. The restaurant on property is a bit pricey but the food is delicious and the views are amazing. I every got to hear an Aboriginal musician while I was there. That is also where I caught my first glimpse of the opera house. Wow!

Being refurbished. We decided to take the 25 miin tour by Choochoo Express since my wife has difficulty walking. Although there were some interesting trees and shrubs, we were a little disappointed that much of the garden is being refurbished for the 200year anniversary next year. The Harbour side walk is pleasant. There are also interesting historic houses,.Governor's House, oldest greenhouse. We would probably have seen more on a walk. Unlike others I cannot fully recommend this attraction.,...and I am a very keen gardener.
What a beautiful garden, perfect place for a leisure walk. We visited at their spring, so many beautiful flowers, nice breeze from the harbour. I feel like I am in heaven.
One of the best Parks/Gardens Ever. I had one of the best times visiting the Gardens. Its diversity and upkeep are outstanding, my partner and I enjoyed the gardens very much.

Stunning gardens and views of Sydney Harbour.. If your in Sydney, you must spend an hour or two walking through the Botanical Gardens. There are gorgeous flowers and trees at every step and amazing views of Sydney Harbour. You can start at the Domain end and walk all the way to the Opera House and see views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge. Have a bite to eat or a cool drink at the Opera Bar as you take in the sights of everything Sydney Harbour has to offer. On your way back, walk through Mrs Macquarie's Chair and back to Woolloomooloo or the Domain. It's an easy walk and the views and sights won't disappoint.

Leisurely weekend stroll ... ideal for visitors .... Visually not quite as appealing as the Bondi Coogee walk but ... the kind of leisurely weekend stroll that is fun to do with guests. Start with a drink at the Sydney Opera House, then walk through the Botanical Gardens to the Arts Gallery of NSW for a coffee and -- if you have enough energy left -- tour some of the standing exhibitions. If your visitors are from outside Australia make sure to see the section that features Aussie artists. Some great paintings there ...

City Hideaway and beautiful views.. Wonderful place to get away from the city hustle and bustle.Beautifully maintained and a huge variety of plants from around the globe.I recommend starting at the Sydney Opera House and following the foreshore to Woolloomooloo Bay, then cut back through the centre back to the city, all easily accessed from Circular Quay station and ferry terminal.
Visit any time of year. Such a wonderful place to visit any time of the year, you see different plants and animals so colourful and make sure you take your camera

Beautiful gardens.. These gardens border the Sydney Opera house and are well worth spending another hour to walk amongst the beauty of the parklands. There are many Australian native species and everyone has a plaque and information about the species. There is also a glass house containing exotic plants. The gardens are very European in layout but the setting against the Harbour is amazing.
Nice and relaxing!!!. I went here on Sunday 4 June with a friend... It was stinking hot but it was nice and peaceful in the gardens. A great place to just sit and relax and watch the world go by!

A beautiful relaxing place to spend half a day. I strongly advise visitors to join one of the free guided tours to get the most out of these beautiful gardens. Our volunteer Rosemary was extremely knowledgeable and accommodating and without her we would have missed so much. The tour is scheduled to take an hour but she generously extended this to cover our areas of interest. Even if your tour doesn't include it, it is worth walking out afterwards to Macquaries Point to take in the lovely view.The cafeteria serves a good range of light fare and there was plenty of seating available. You just need to watch out that the birds don't steal your food!
Lots of native plants to view in one spot.. Relaxing walk through lovely gardens with exotic plants. Great way to end a busy day of tours or have a nice picnic.

Stunning Botanic Gardens. Well worth a visit, the Sydney Botanic Gardens have many different areas to enjoy and all with their own theme and feel. Worth a few hours of your time, from the harbour-side walk ( starting at the Opera House) to the many different garden areas. There is a small shop,and coffee space as well. Definitely lovely to visit in Spring!

Green oasis in the city. This park is a great way to get away from things for a short break, take a stroll through on the way to the city, or for an excursion.It has historical fountains, nice landscaping, a variety of birds including ducks, and fish. If you like flora, there are cacti and heated growing areas. In location, it is beside the conservatorium, governor's house and the Opera House so a good extension for tourists. And for active people, there are trees to climb, bamboo hidey holes, and off the track paths, the swimming pool, grottoes and rock/sea areas beside Mrs Macquaries Chair to explore.There's also a long standing restaurant and café/takeaway beside a central lake which is always popular. Walking through, the views of the Harbour are superb. Something for many, and can help appreciate nature in a convenient place if you don't see enough of it. Recommended!

Royal Botanic Gardens. It was a good one but not too good. I would suggest if you want to rest a while, can go there, take the small train and just move around and do nothing. Views are good to be captured.

Such a beautiful, life enhancing place.. Make sure you take all your on seas and interstate visitors to such a splendid oasis of bliss. Such a wonderful place for visitors to find a haven of peace and quiet in a busy city. A

Best kept Secret of Sydney !. Out of the crowd ....you find peace and beauty in these gardens. I guess it takes 3-4 visits to fully enjoy the park. Amazing views on the water and Sydney opera but also a lot of hidden gems in the Gardens ......
nice. The botanic gardens are really nice and as a bonus, you can find great views of the harbour and the opera house from inside the gardens.

Don't miss this !. Beautiful gardens combine with superb views across the Harbour and several good restaurants at which to refresh. See the Pre-Historic Wollomi Pine growing and stroll the cool shaded walk ways or just lie on the lawns. Then stroll over to the NSW Art Gallery........
Botanically Beautiful!. Gorgeous gardens to spend a lazy warm afternoon having a wander, a sit on the grass or perhaps a coffee at the restaurant too.

A must in Sydney. As a plant lover, my visit to the Botanic Gardens was a wonderful treat. The Ficus trees are just amazing for a city so far south, and the sheer size of the Gardens could fit a whole town in them! Great visit!

a beautiful and peaceful place in the heart of busy Sydney. I have loved the gardens for over sixty years and have never been disappointed, fresh flowers, peaceful corners ,water views,art exhibitions, concerts and just steps from the heart of Sydney
Oasis. Great, big garden right in the city centre. Beautiful trees and flowers are blooming all year round. Quiet and relaxing. Have your lunch on the grass and enjoy life!
Botanic Gardens. incredible gardens - very well manicured - flowers and trees everywhere of all kinds. A good number of hot houses for various non indigenous plants

Excellent Walk @ Gardens. Pleasant, Rejuvenate Walk in the Gardens... When you are at Opera House, Walk along the Shore (On your left hand side from Opera House), beautiful scenic view of North Shore, North Sydney from Gardens. Play area for Children's and Long Walk in the Gardens very lovely atmosphere.. To your right you see the beautiful view of City..... Dont miss the Royal Botanic Gardens during your visit to Sydney and Opera house.
AMAZING FLOWERS. You must see these gardens. They arebeyond beautiful. There are plenty of scultures there too. Have a wonderful time.
Amazing.. Take a tour if you can. We wandered here almost daily and took several tours. And it was in winter too.
Wonderful. Not much else needs to be said. It's just great. Do it. Amazing foliage, great harbour views. Superlatives don't do it justice. Even the loos are great.

Large garden with various plants and flower. Worth to visit. It's free.
Wonderful garden with various flowers. You can use choochoo ($10) if lazy to walk.

Spacious garden with colorful flowers overlooking the sydney icons. Very beautiful garden especially in spring where colorful flowers blooming. Highly recommended for a morning walk, or even a romantic picnic while viewing the opera house and harbour bridge. There is no entrance fee, and this garden is open for garden wedding or private events. Nice place for photography. For senior citizen, they can board a tram to get around the garden until the entrance of the opera for only $10. Tips: walk to mrs macquaries point for a perfect photo session.

Gorgeous Gardens. We walked through the park at the Opera House entrance to the Aida Opera Stage as we were attending Aida in March. the flowers, trees, greenery is absolutely beautiful. we saw lots of cockatoos in the trees, gorgeous birds. Lots of other birds, animals running around the gardens. you get the best view of the opera house and harbour bridge from the Aida stage side.
A Great Gardens Right in the City!. A great place to walk around and definitely worth the trip and getting out of the hustle and bustle of the city. To top it off its free! Great Place for a Picnic!
Beautiful!. Excellent! we had a free tour with a guide, Ginny was great! Learned a lot. The gardens were beautiful. We had lunch at the cafe on the grounds, which was good, really handy.

Beautiful gardens and stunning views of the harbour. Beautiful gardens and stunning views of the harbour. Would loved to have visited Govt house but time restricted but very relaxing to idle our way thru a lovely setting

Walk the gardens. You have to walk through the gardens. They are beautiful. It feels surreal to walk through a beautiful park with large buildings in the background. The walk to the Opera House offers stunning views and a great way to unwind.
Walk, relax, take in the views. The gardens are beautiful, to walk around, take in the views or relax in the beautiful maintained gardens. A must see if u are Sydney.

Well worth a visit!. Really worth visiting. Lovely cafe and interesting trees. Huge Ibis foraging under the trees. Just sit and watch the boats on the river. You may look in the pond and see the huge eels! Difficult to see to begin with but once you spot one you will be amazed.
Lovely morning mooch.. We spent a lovely morning mooching around the gardens which culminated in a completely different view of the Opera House and Bridge. Unexpected.
Sublime. Beautiful gardens which are well worthy of one or more visits. The position is without parallel bordering the harbour and its stunning views.

Beautiful, Peaceful Gardens in Downtown Sydney. The Royal Botanic Gardens are a little piece of heaven on earth, in the middle of Sydney. They are very large which means the crowds have plenty of space to spread out so you can still find some solitude if that's what you are looking for. We spent well over an hour and I don't think we even saw half of the garden! The variety of plants included is mind boggling. Ironically, of the entire garden the herb garden was one of our favorites. If we ever return to Sydney we will definitely be coming be here again. Word of wisdom to the wise: don't come with a tour group. We saw two tour groups in the garden and the gaggle of noisy people completely ruins the experience...

Amazing!!!. The Royal Botanic Gardens is a great place to walk and relax! Located near the Sydney Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the Art Gallery of New South Wales. The rose gardens is extremely beautiful and when walking through the gardens make sure you pay attention to the trees with giant bats! Highly recommended!

Just lovely. I went for stroll here one afternoon and whilst I was in Sydney it became one of my favourite places to go for a couple of hours sitting in the sun on the way home from the CBD. There is a good view of the harbour and the flowers in spring are lovely. A great walk either to or from Circular Quay.
Favourite place. One of my favourite places in Sydney, have spent many many hours here. You can get lost looking around the gardens, and they hold great events here throughout the year.
Beautiful. A green, colourful, beautiful oasis in the middle of Sydney, ideal for a picnic, a sit on a bench with a book or a snooze in the sun. Gorgeous!
Lovely gardens with great views. Beautiful gardens. This is a great walk, especially in the early mornings. A great walk from Circular Quay. Plenty to see including cockatoos.

A hidden treasure. Not many people are interested in gardens however for my wife and I we are very interested.
This garden is spectacular and offers many varied landscapes.
Down by the bay is also special and there are these massive trees which have been there for a very long time.
Beautiful place and a must if you are in Sydney!

Awesome for Photography. I usually walk here which usually is a bit of a far trek for me. However, parking is on the medium side of from memory $8. Photography of landscapes and macros is really good here however its best to go in the day rather than night.
It's okay . I like botanical gardens in Australia, this one is not my favourite. But the view to the Bridge and Opera House is nice.

Take the train. This is a lovely place to visit, we did it at the start of spring, flowers in bloom and nature at its best. We opted to take the tour on the official 'Choochoo' train and the guide was very knowlegable, it allows you to get off at certain points and rejoin when you have had a look around
Beautiful oasis in the city. The gardens are stunning and well kept. the views of the city and harbour are beautiful. There is also an outdoor swimming pool next to the ocean.

Just a stone's throw from Opera House. This is a very good park, full of exotic and colourful flowers and plants right next to the Opera House. The best time to visit the Royal Botanic Gardens is in spring, when a lot of the flowers are in full bloom

Beautiful spot in the harbour area. A beautiful place to just relax and enjoy time off. If you want to go for New Years, be prepared to queue and be aware that on the premises only non-alcoholic drinks can be purchased.
close to Opera house. a well maintained and beautiful garden to take a walk..its next to the opera house, hence one can go around this garden before or after viewing the opera house.

Peacfule place and excellent to see the Opera House. One of my favorite place ! Huge garden, FREE, where you're invited to walk on the grass and hug a tree :-)
the plants and trees are amazing, beautiful when the Jacaranda have their purple flowers. You can go to a specific point to see the Opera House, really nice view. You'll spend hours and hours to explore it.

Royal Botanic Gardens - Sensational. It's not very often you find something amazing that is FREE. The gardens are amazing - the plants, lawns, trees and all overlooking Sydney Harbour, the Operar House and Harbour Bridge. The views are sensational - make sure to take a camera!

One of the best gardens I've seen. I have visited many botanic gardens, but I don't think there is one as beautiful as this was in September. We also were fortunate enough to talk with one of the managers, and he was incredibly helpful in telling us specific information about the gardens. Truly beautiful

Beautiful. It was a delight to walk around the Botanic Gardens. In a fantastic location behind the Opera House, I could visit the Government House and Art Gallery within its grounds as well. The gardens are so well looked after, full of perfect green field and colourful flower arrangements, it's full of photography enthusiasts.Also worth mentioning the security personnel around the Government House that were terribly nice and eager to have a chat about the building and functions held. And the little shop and café which were a great discovery.
Beautiful. wonderfully kept garden with so much to see and great views of the opera house. You can either take a quick walk around whilst in the city or spend a whole day here with a picnic.

Green belt in the middle of sydney. Lovely place to walk around and enjoy the great variety of trees, bushes and plants. Relaxing place to have a nice picnic on the grass.enjoyed the greenery amongst the city buildings. It can get busier some days but overall quiet and (for me anyway) relaxing.

Springtime. You can walk all over the lawns, go on a wonderful guided walk with the most informative guide, the displays are superb and on a whole I find it surpasses many other gardens around the world

An unexpected highlight of my trip. I nearly soiled myself in happiness striding through here. I was short-cutting from the harbour to my hotel in Wooloomooloo and ended up extending it zig-zag and wander across the gardens up to Mrs Macquarie's Chair. A 20 minute journey ended up taking an hour and a half because I got so waylaid. Some of the plants, birds and trees here are incredible. On the outdoor edges you look one way to the lush greenery and cockatoos and look the other to see a bustling city. A couple of minutes of walking further in though and the city is long forgotten.The view across to the harbour bridge and opera house from Mrs Macquarie's Chair is one of the best. Was lucky to be there at sunset.

Nature in the middle of the city. Really nice garden in the middle of the city. Don't miss this garden, stroll around or just enjoy a pick nick in the middle of the park. If you walk a bit further you come to a point were you can perfectly take pictures of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.

Spectacular!. The spring walk was amazing - not only cherry blossoms but a host of other flowering shrubs and plants. The ficus trees are a sight to see! The grounds are meticulously maintained. A great place to relax and enjoy the beautiful surroundings of Sydney harbor.

Peace and tranquility. The gardens are a haven of peace and tranquility in the hectic pace of Sydney. A wonderful expanse of open garden in the city centre with exotic plants and blooms and lovely water features.

Beautiful Gardens with some unique plants. This is a place were you can take a quiet stroll, take your shirt off and lay on the grass during a hot sunny day, read a book, or simply enjoy all the greenery around you. For those who wish to do so, there is a small train (fee applies) that rides around the gardens with the driver giving touristy information. Definitely worth a visit.

A must do walk through experience. What a site! With harbour views all round and many varied plantings, some going back to early colonial times. The bat colony is worth finding as is the cactus garden.
Do not miss this park. Fabulous especially in the Spring! Magnificent trees, roses and a great place for a relaxing picnic.

Expansive cultured gardens. After visiting botanical gardens in both Perth and Cairns it was really interesting to see the gardens here. These gardens are considerably more European in their design and planting, but are still very beautiful. There are many different areas with different types of plants, all of which were really very pretty. Definitely somewhere worth visiting.

Nice for a city day break. A great place to wander, read, or just take some time out. You can walk through the gardens across to Mrs Macquarie's chair & whittle away your day. Well worth a pit stop here.
Enjoy!. One of my favourite haunts of Sydney! Absolutely spectacular..walk,jog,bike,sit & ponder,take a nap..whatever suits you really..

A pleasant Sunday afternoon. We enjoyed a Sunday walk and ate at the lower café in the gardens...below the expensive and fully booked restaurant. Nice food and quick service. It was very busy but we managed to get a table for six by waiting and watching!
The Spring Walk of flowers was beautiful in almost full bloom. A lovely afternoon.
Beautiful . Nice gardens. Lovely colorful floker, fountains and walking bridges. Quiet large but if you are tired and still want to se all there is an overprized minitrain that rund rounds

Worth It. Do make an effort to come here while in Sydney. ( or for locals this is a great spot to absorb a nice day) The grounds are kept immaculately clean, the gardens are stunning and you can finish the park off by walking along the harbour and ending up at the Sydney Opera House. There is also a little restaurant in the gardens that is nice to stop off at for a coffee or small bite to eat.
Love the garden!. This garden was not in the list but we saw while walking to Sydney Harbour. Such a nice garden and we had a stop.... many type of roses! Smell simply owesome!

Relax in the middle. Just beautiful,walk to your hearts content,get the feel of the city around you while enjoying the calm and serenity of the place.Walk through wonderful landscape and then along the harbour front.I just love having a coffee in the middle of the garden and exploring the huge variety of plants and specialty gardens here.Fantastic views of the city and harbour.Take your camera
Great day out. The flower displays were just beautiful, it was a lovely easy walk with bubba in pram. Had a great day among the plants with great views of the harbour and opera house

Gardens in the city. Absolutely beautiful place....
Stunningly laid out.........from ancient trees , flower beds and
Lovely wildlife and views we sat there all afternoon watching he ibis and the cockatoos
Loved it
Great walk with wonderful trees. Take a beautiful walk through this garden with grand trees and gardens, some great sculptures. Walk to the opera house and circular harbour.

Defintely worth it; gorgeous trees and plants; educational. We squeezed-in a trip to the Royal Botanic Garden on a weekday late afternoon. We had a busy schedule during our stay in Sydney but are so glad that we made the detour on the way back to hotel at the end of a busy day. We saw beautiful trees, plants (not all indigenous) and artwork along with interpretive signage. All of the walks are very easy. Our 7-year-old really loved the gardens.Prices at the cafe are reasonable. I believe it was $4 AUD for a pot of tea. There is also a gift shop -- we bought honey made by bees at the the garden.

Beautiful . I went to royal botanic garden sydney last sunday. We got off at Martin Place station and it took us 10 minutes to reach the royal botanic garden. It was exquisitely beautiful. The flowers were a pretty sight. Then tulips were the best place to be. The walk along the water is nice and relaxing. Its a good place to have a picnic and enjoy nature.

Green amongst the grey. Superbly kept gardens. You can spend a lot of time here relaxing. Admire all the beautiful plants and the way the gardeners have landscaped them. To have something like this on the edge of the centre of the city, truly wonderful. Go and spend quality time here.

If you have time to kill.... ?..a fter walking down to the opera house, take time out by walking through the gates and into the garden. In September, the 'spring walk' is alight with pastel shades: tulips; cherry blossom; wisteria along with various other spring flowers in a gentle riot of colour. Kookaburras chattering in the trees completes the picture.

The perfect day. stunning dayI was walking through the garden and was so happy to se all the plants from all over in bloom under this perfect sunny day.A must at this time before the hot day to come, you can have lunch or purchase good at the kiosk.a must day for everyone

Lovely Gardens & Plants. When on the chuffer train around the garden but it only stopped at pick up points for a few seconds to let people on and off and so is not recommended for photos disappointing

Beautiful gardens in the middle of the city. Wonderful break from the urban surroundings. You don't feel like you are in the city while meandering through the grounds. Could definitely spend half a day here enjoying the many beautiful bird species and garden displays. Would definitely put it on your list of things to do while in Sydney.

Piece of Paridise in the Middle of Sydney. Our wander through the RBG was just a meander through a place where any thought of being in a major city was dispelled by the tranquility we experienced. The magnificent trees, the open lawns, the fernery, succulents garden, herbarium and so on just added to the wonderful day we spent enjoying this public treasure. It is sad that the glass pyramid of the tropical centre must go but by comparison with other tropical centres around the world it is far too small and restricting in what it can exhibit. the restaurant and shop on site are a great place to refresh and charge the batteries. Don't miss this scenic gem.

A must see, free activity when in Sydney. The Botanical Gardens are one of the best places to wander in Sydney. The views are magnificent and the gardens themselves are diverse and beautiful. A lovely place for a picnic, for the kids to roam or just for a stroll. I particularly like the rose garden and the kitchen garden, but there are so many wonderful sections to the gardens. You could spend a few days wandering here and every time I am in Sydney with some time I like to go for a walk in the gardens.

This is a Friday must. I have lived in Sydney for years but hadn't been to the Gardens for years. Today my friend organised for us to do the Aboriginal Heritage Tour which runs on Fridays. It was terrific, a must for anyone who has an interest in Australian history and its flora from an Aboriginal perspective. Our guide Henrietta was passionate, knowledgeable and very engaged. This tour will now be incorporated in the itinerary of my overseas guests. Thank you Ruth for getting reacquainted with the Gardens.

Take half a day if you have it and the weather is nice. An amazing escape to nature within the city.Great view of the harbour, many kinds of trees, flowers and bushes.Take your lunch and have a picnick.You won't be sorry.
nice cool walk in the evening. located in a very convenient area just next to sydney opera house and the harbour with multiple gates allowing convenient access into and out of the grounds.
Spring surprise. I was surprised to see so many bulbs in an area with palm trees. A great place for a walk. And the bats are gone. Nice gift shop, too

Spring has sprung in the Royal Botanical Gardens. The gardens are already beautiful at the moment but will be more so in maybe another week or so with all the different colours of the cherry blossom trees in bloom. This section is where the Lion Gate is.It's such a pleasant walk from Circular Quay (whether you arrive by bus, ferry, or foot) and then to just meander inside the gardens. Even with alot of people visiting you never feel cramped.The herb garden is worth a visit too.The cafè has decent coffee and food when you need a rest.Worth a visit....and it's free!

Don't Skip This in Sydney. For some crazy reason, it's free to visit the RBC - it's huge and beautiful and has some amazing trees we've never seen before, and yet it's free! There are so many paths (well marked so you can choose what your'd like to see) that we're not sure anyone could see everything in a single day. We visited twice during our stay and could still have gone again to see different areas. Beautiful paths, wonderful gardens, nice small restaurants. Who could ask for more?
A lazy stroll. A lazy stroll through these wonderful gardens sharing a picnic or dine at the cafe is a must. On dusk you'll see many fruits bats flying over the tree tops.

An oasis on the harbour. Start at Circular Quay and walk around the harbour foreshores - the Gardens are a wonderful place to experience some solitude in an otherwise busy city. There are the usual wide open spaces but search out the little alcoves that are tucked away. Plenty of room for the children to run around. There is also a scenic tour on the 'Choo Choo Express' cost around $10 for adults and $5 for kids. Views of Sydney Harbour are incredible

Best Botanical Garden . It was next to the Sydney Opera House. It has many interesting trees which are very different from we live, North America. I never saw that many colors of poppy flowers. It has a very beautiful setting. As a matter of fact, it is one of the best Botanical Gardens in the world.
Beautiful. Its a well established, well kept garden. The trees are beautiful. The flowers were in bloom and the scent was lovely.
Gorgeous . Walked through the botanic gardens this morning. Really beautiful and immaculately kept. Heaps of birdlife too.
An exotic oasis. A stunning gardens with many exotic plants and with superb views. A great place to take some time out from the shops and busy tourist sites of Sydney.

What a gorgeous afternoon. Wow, what a beautiful park in the middle of such a large city. There are impressive gardens within the park - I had no idea that many types of palm trees could survive outside the tropics. Many water features dot the acreage which attracts plenty of ibis, ducks, and other water birds, and one pond was full of carp and eels. Flowers were plentiful despite it being winter right now so I cannot image how colorful the park is in the spring and summer. We lucked out and got to watch a pair of rainbow lorikeets eating these red flowers off a shrub, and had a close encounter with a couple dozen cockatoos who are not shy about landing on your arm or head! There are restroom and restaurant facilities in the middle of the park, and there's a gift shop with very nice items. Walk the entire waterfront perimeter for all the views but be sure to venture into the interior to enjoy all the gardens. We also saw lots of people enjoying a picnic lunch, jogging, playing games, and even one wedding. Gorgeous!
Pretty even in winter. Great place to spend an afternoon. Take the tram ($10 Aus) for a quicker tour to see the highlights. There is a cafe on site. Free otherwise.
Beautiful gardens with views.. Incredible beauty within the gardens, with views of the harbor, the Opera House and the bridge. A must do. Nice and quiet too.

The wild cockatoos over the grounds,. The Gardens is a must for every Sydney visit. Gorgeous and tranquil right in town and near Circular Quay. Very peaceful and relaxing to stroll around. Just be aware of lock up time at the day's end so you don't get shut in.

Absolutely beautiful . Been visiting the Botanic Gardens since I was a child. It's such a beautiful place. Pack a picnic and meet your friends or eat at the cafe there. Great place to jog or get some exercise in beautiful surroundings. Take some bread if you have little children and they can feed the ducks in the pond. Gorgeous views of the harbour. Walk to the Opera House along the sea wall as you view all the sail boats, cruise ships, ferries and other harbour traffic passing by. Beautiful in Winter and Summer and also Spring with all the flowers blooming. Highly recommend visiting here.
Very beautiful. Well worth visiting. Great variety of plantings. Very beautiful with marvellous views. We walked from Hyde Park through to the Botanical Gardens. A great afternoon.
relaxing walk in the gardens. had a great time at the gardens spent 2 hours taking photos very well kept,there is a little train that can take you around if you do not want to walk,very enjoyable.

Scenery at its best. Wonderful walk around the gardens. Flora, fauna aromas. Different birds to see. In spring and summer I would imagine beautiful area for picnics. Joggers paradise. Great views overlooking the Opea House and Harbour Bridge

Relaxing, free, plenty to see. Plenty to see at the gardens plus plenty of wildlife, was shocked to see the eels and you can see them
Perfectly as they come to the surface plenty of birds to see and the there is plenty of different types of plants and trees, relaxing
Beautiful. These gardens are amazing. Take a long stroll to see all the beauty it has to offer. A must when visiting Sydney.

Walking in the garden. This place is totally amazing first you don't need to spend a single cent to enter you can take your time to explore yourself there is a few cafe in the garden. Toilet can be found within the park can say down any place you wish see the sky there is bird in the garden as well.

Enjoy the beauty of the Botanic Gardens. Lie on the grass and enjoy the sunshine and being surrounded by gorgeous and perfectly maintained gardens. We enjoyed a beautiful walk around the gardens followed by a nice coffee in the gardens cafe. The gift shop sells local honey made from bees in the gardens. Go in and say hi to the very helpful and friendly staff. The walk around the harbour from the Opera House to Boy Charlton pool provides beautiful views of the harbour bridge and the opera house. Listen to the cockatoos screeching in the trees and just enjoy this beautiful park right in the city of Sydney
Amazing spring walk . Came here for a half day walk today, start of spring, and it was amazing to say the least!!Beautiful in every way

Big hand to Sydney government for such a good Botanic Garden. very lush garden by the harbour, with good layout to suit all strenght. Easy access to. Most Botanic Garden in other city is hard to get to. However, this one is very easy to get to and with bonus of connected to Opera House.

Get the Choo Choo Express. This is a huge Garden so get the Choo Choo Express at the entrance from Opera House so you get to see the important attractions. I thoroughly enjoyed our ride and I felt like a big kid. I love being outdoors and in nature so this is ideal for people like me. We spent a good few hours here, the Opera House, admiring the Harbour Bridge, walking along Circular Quay and beyond so it's a magical day out especially at the weekends when the crowds is buzzing.

Spring time.. Now is the time to visit the Royal Botanic Garedens in Sydney.Walk down the avenue of spring and take in the beauty of the spring flowers. Where else in Sydney would you be able to view the abundance of tulips and other colourful displays of flowers.

Lovely day in the park. The gardeners do a great job of keeping up these extensive gardens. I need to bring one of them home with me... So peaceful to walk around these gardens. And then stop at one of the cafes and have a glass of wine or bubbly. The perfect way to spend an afternoon.

Spring is in the air!. I have visited the botanic gardens over many decades and am always in awe of its thoughtfully laid out garden beds and of course its position on the shores of the world's most beautiful harbour. This time was our first with our grandson and we entered through the Lion Gate. I don't know how I have missed this beautiful part of the gardens with its historic stone cottage and manicured garden. The plantings of tulips along the pathway were breathtaking. The gardens are an ever changing canvas throughout the year and a peaceful oasis in a vibrant city.
Nice place for a picnic. A lovely spot for a family picnic but not enough seating or shade in summer and there is very little parking so lots of walking.
30th August 2015. . Friends took me to see these gardens. I as a horticulturist loved it. It was nicecto see where the first farm actually was. I loved the fern house.

Gorgeous park!. The Royal Botanic Gardens are a must see when you're in Sydney! I highly recommend going there to check out the beautiful gardens and to escape the chaos of the city. It's the perfect place to lay in the grass and relax. Besides that, the views on the city are amazing!
Harbour Delights. Take a walk along the harbour to Mrs Macquaries Chair, very pretty! The Botanic Gardens is gorgeous to explore on a nice day and a perfect spot for a picnic also
Quite nice on a busy day. Make sure you sit and look out over the bay where Mrs Maquarie's Chair is - a perfect spot to chill.

Beautiful. Lovely gardens. Was a beautiful day of weather which helped. Nice to walk through and stop and have lunch. Good place to view opera house and harbour bridge so we got some nice photos in too.

Relaxing walk. On a Thursday morning we entered the botanical garden in Sydney and in less than 5min we we're hooked to the place. Why? Not too many plants! Simply because of the relaxing experience and location. Having a botanical garden next to the marine coast is unbeatable! Simply because of the openness to the sea the whole experience changes. Birds are always present and they share the public water fountains, which creates a great distractions for the visitors. I saw many people just relaxing on the grass, deeply asleep and I felt at home in this place.

Lunch break relax. Have always enjoyed taking time out of busy city work life and enjoying a few moments of quiet, in such a vibrant city, The grounds are really well kept and there are often lovely little surprises to see, a wedding, baby ducks, beautiful flowers, so much....
Just short of Spring but lots of flowers out.. We had lunch at the restaurant at the Gardens - expensive ($58) each, no booze included. Great location and good staff/service.
just lovely and free to visit -. we enjoyed out visit to the gardens - lovely trees, planting and a great place for peace and quiet in a busy city. also offering an excellent café -

Stunning gardens in amazing location. These gardens are absolutely stunning! The grounds are set on Sydney Harbour which makes it even more perfect! With the gardens, Opera House and Circular Quay there is at least half a day here. Perfect for families, couples etc, etc
Stunning. Spectacular. Walked from the Opera house back into the city and really enjoyed the experience. The different areas were amazing.

a whole day excursion. went to the governor house for the fourth time and finally got to see it .worth the trip if you go to the botanical garden visit the governor hse too. so beautiful.lovely plants and train ride and sculpture in the garden.one needs a whole day to see everything there.we had sandwiches in the garden and pity we did not sit down to soak in the scenery as there was too much to see.we went to see mrs acquires chair too.

Nice stroll. Nice place to just walk, relax, see the flowers, the exotic trees and a few birds. There are a couple of beautiful water fountains. You can go across and shortcut your way from Darling Harbour to Sydney Harbor.

Gardens. The botanical gardens was a lovely way to spend a morning. Naturally beautiful and even had bats in the trees resting up during the day..Pools and fountains and an easy walk made this a pleasant experience.

Beautiful even in the winter!. The Royal Botanic Gardens is adjacent to the Opera House. Hours are from 7 a.m. to dusk. The gardens started in 1816 on the site of a farm that supplied food to the young colony. Throughout the area are placed dedicated to specific plants such as succulents, bamboo trees, rose garden and rainforest groves. The large trees are quite unique with their twisted roots/trunk system.This is such a peaceful park to enjoy the harbor views

nice walk on a hot afternnon. This is a nice place to go for a stroll or to sit down and enjoy the views of the harbour.It has some lovely tropical flowers and is generally quiet regardless of how many tourists are in Sydney.Worth a stop to take a few photos
The Garden. Take a stroll along the park and enjoy the scenery. Best to visit during end of the year. Nice weather and great company if you bring along your family together.
An oasis of calm in a busy city. Beautiful, natural gardens with plenty of wildlife. Excellent to walk through looking at a great variety of flora and fauna. Good cafe for light refereshments.

Beautiful and filled with experiences with everyone in the family. Our visit to the Royal Botanic Gardens was very pleasant. We started from the Opera house end, where we rode the train around the garden which stops at 4 stops through various points in the garden. We got off at the 4th stop and travelled to Macquarie's chair. This area has beautiful views of the Sydney CBD skyline and the water. The gardens are beautiful and worth the visit. It was a magnet for our kids and we visited several spots, especially the Macquarie's chair every day as they loved playing in the rocks by the water.

Lovely gardens. The Sydney Botanic Gardens are a tranquil and welcome relief from busy Sydney streets and just a short stroll from the CBD.On my visit I joined a free 90 minute tour which was lead by a volunteer guide, Lynne.As we went on a leisurely stroll through the garden Lynne shared her amazing knowledge of the garden’s history and it’s plants.If I hadn’t joined a tour I would have missed features such as epiphytic orchids growing high up in the trees and a resident owl sleeping in a tree top.The gardens were very well maintained and early spring flowers were in abundance. To see all of the Botanic Gardens and it’s features you would need to spend several hours exploring the exhibits.For anyone interested in plants and gardens this is a ‘not to be missed’ venue.
Lovely. Go to the Royal Botanic Gardens and see all the wonderful plants and animals who have gravitated to living there. Its a very beautiful place and you will love it!

Relaxing and Beatiful. This is a great place to take a chilled walk while you are in the city. I stayed close by and the receptionist advised me to walk through here to get to the Opera House instead of the city and I am happy of the recommendation. It is so peaceful and beautiful. Further down by the water there are lots of people out exercising and there is a good energy about the place. I went back a few times and took my book. Just lovely.

Amazing !. A beautiful garden amid the hustle and bustle of the city, the Royal Botanic Gardens lies a short and scenic stroll along the waterfront from the Sydney Opera House. The gardens were established in XIX century sprawl on 30 hectares of themed gardens with towering trees, palm groves, orchids, ferns, and flocks of fruit bats.

Peace and tranquility. Had a walk around here this afternoon to walk off the lunch we had eaten. It's a truly relaxing place which takes you away from the city into a peaceful environment. If you have some spare time then have a walk around the peaceful side of Sydney.

spend 3-4 hours there. Love it!! I regretted not allocating more time for this beautiful garden. Flowers are blooming even in the winter. TIP: spend 3-4 hours there, and of course, visit the famous Mrs Macquarie's chair

Large garden, but. I visited the Royal Botanic Gardens during a business trip. In between meetings, I was able to nip out and take a walk through the gardens. Whilst it is large, I found a number of the areas to be not quite up to scratch and/or outright closed.That being said, there was wonderful biodiversity and colours on display. If you are staying in the CBD and are looking to take a walk, you really can't go wrong as it's free and a nice alternative to the concrete jungle on which it boarders.

Beautiful and free!. The Botanic Gardens are lovely, the perfect place to wander on a pleasant day. We visited in the winter; there were a few bare trees, but surprisingly, much of the garden was in bloom and so pretty. Plants are labeled, birds are abundant, and there are cozy spots to sit as well as open, expansive views. Lots of maps to guide you at the path intersections. Best of all, it's free!
Relaxing. I love the Botanoc Gardens, there are many places where you can sit, enjoy the views and relish in the sunshine

Green space in the City Centre. These gardens are beautiful and well worth a visit. You even get free educational tours of the place if you want. The trees and flowers are excellent all year round and the bird life is impressive too. Plenty to see here and a nice way to walk through town and arrive at prime tourist spots like Circular Key and the Opera House - go the other way and come out at the magnificent Hospital, Parliament buildings and St Mary's Cathedral. Great!

Time well spent on a Sunday.. Beautiful place to spend 2-3 hours. Take a picnic to enjoy after you finish your walk/run :). There are multiple entries to the garden and they close around 5:00 PM. Check the timing before you enter.

Relaxing Walk Among an Abundance of Flowers. We have visited many cities and walked through many major city parks. The Royal Botanic Gardens is one of our favorites because of the excellent grounds keeping and the abundance of flowers. It is well designed and well maintained. The cafe is an excellent spot for lunch and not too expensive. The Gardens are also close to the Art Museum, which is a great way to cap off your walk.

A Proper Garden. The Gardens are a great way to slow down and relax. If you don't care to relax, then the gardens are also a great alternative walking route to the Opera House, Hyde Park, Art Gallery of New South Wales or the lower CBD. Beautiful regardless. The gardens do close at night.

Very Impressed by the gardens. The Botanical Gardens offer a bounty of plants and local wildlife. You can enjoy well kept and manicured grounds. Within the park you will be able to see many local birds in the area. The grounds are very large and you could spend a couple hours walking around and not see it all. If you are into birds and local wildlife there is an information booth near the restaurant and kiosk near the park. They also offer free guided walked and brochures to help you identify the local flora and fauna. I could walk through these gardens every day and still enjoy them.
Lovely peaceful gardens in the heart of Sydney. These gardens are just near the Opera House and perfect for a pleasant peaceful walk. They are free to enter, well maintained and well worth a visit.

Nice gardens. The Royal Botanic Gardens are just opposite the hostel I was saying and we walked through them to get down to the harbor area. They are very nice and they have some Australian plants with information.

A MUST DO in Sydney!!!. This should be on your do NOT miss list. The gardens are meticulously maintained. And spend some time up by the rose gardens and feed the Cockatoo's they just come down and will eat the nuts from the trees out of your hands. Have your camera ready!!! Meander around, have lunch at the cafe, and enjoy and relax.
Gardens. Lovely place to have a walk,great place to sit and have a picnic, or a quiet walk or to just sit relax and chill out.

A quaint space for a breath of fresh air in the city. This is one of the most beautiful space in the city. You can wonder around all day and simply get list in its beauty.
Rather going for a picnic, a walk, or just to rest from the busy city. This is truly a wonderful place to vusit. Full of history, and interesting features.
Nice walk. The garden is very big, clean with a lot of birds. But It is not as good as Kew garden in London for example.

Very nice garden in the middle of the city! Recommended!. A place to be, Sydney's famous "Central Park".
Nice to visit, stroll in the park, a little picnic or coffee and enjoy the smell of flowers and trees :-)

All this & stunning water views as well!. We were staying near the Gardens at Hyde Park and on our last morning I walked through them to Mrs Macquarie's Seat. There were very few people around and I enjoyed all there was on offer - beautiful old trees, interesting garden beds, diversions, shrubs, tulip bulbs galore as well as great signage and explanatory notes. Perfect to take anyone as there is easy access for wheelchairs, pushers & prams.

Be careful with the bay parking!. Be careful with the bay parking - keep your receipt! ~ parked and paid using coins, one month later find a parking fine inside my engine bay. Definitely paid but after one month I can't do much to dispute it so expensive trip for me!

Relax and just enjoy that beauty from Sydney. Its just a must to go there and walk through all the beautiful ways and garden landscapes.. its so nice, so relaxing and unforgetable. Enjoy the Rainbow Lorikeets, white cockatoos and other birds.. I do not miss the flying foxes !

A day in the park!. We visited in Feb 2015 (I was there for the cricket world cup). The area is really nice. you get a good view of the Opera House as well as the Sydney bridge. You can pack sandwiches and spend the day there just relaxing. It was a good stroll and we really enjoyed the weather. A good way to spend the day.

best view. One of the best Botanic Gardens in the country! you can have the best view of Sydney harbour from the Garden. There is a beautiful walk around the harbour as well. It is free and you can host a picnic when the weather is good! Best place to relax and enjoy the the harbour city.
Oasis in Sydney. The Royal Botanic Gardens in Sydney are so beautiful. Where else can you get such a beautiful view of the Harbour, Opera House and Sydney Harbour Bridge.

Beautiful escape in the heart of the city. This tranquil and picturesque park on the city fringe is worth spending time. It has spectacular views of the harbour as well as beautifully planted out gardens. Take time to bring a picnic and smell the roses!
The beautiful Royal Botanic Gardens. There is so much flora to see and the views of the harbour are priceless. Take a picnic lunch or find somewhere nearby to eat.

Must see..... Beautiful and extensive garden in a peaceful setting in the heart of Sydney. You could spend days in here and not see everything. A great place to take time out of the hustle and bustle and have lunch or just sit and enjoy the tranquillity. Something every traveller to Sydney needs to experience.

Nature's Beauty with views to match. The Royal Botanic Gardens is an absolute must if you want to get out of the hustle & bustle that is Sydney but still be close to the CBD. The array of plants is amazing, the lawned areas ideal for a picnic and the views of Sydney Harbour sublime. My mother brought me here regularly as a child and I have fond memories of every visit. I regularly make this a must on return visits. There is a great little restaurant within the gardens precinct and you are only a stone's throw away from the Opera house and Circular Quay, with its bistros. But my recommendation is pack a picnic lunch,walk into the gardens through the Domain enjoy the surroundings and exit via the Opera house gate. A fantasic day out & one both you and the kids will enjoy. Whats more, it's free.

Tranquil and beautiful and free to enjoy. Royal botanical garden full of Australian plants, trees, bushes.Also is a glass house with typical indoor plants living in the hot weather condition. The walk is wonderful - absolutely beautiful and tranquil. We ate in the restaurant which was nice. Just a wonderful way to enjoy a couple of hours.

Wonderful (free!) guided tour of Gardens. Our volunteer guide, Toni, was wonderful and full of interesting information about the gardens and its history. The Gardens are beautiful and afford excellent views of the harbour and Opera House. A must-see on any visit to Sydney.

well we do know that Sydney harbour is one of the most beautiful site on earth.. We do know that Sydney harbour is one of the most beautiful site on earth. Well Sydney harbour has it side complimented with the Royal botanical garden full of Australian plants, trees, bushes.Also is a glass house with typical indoor plants living in the hot weather condition.Restaurants are averrable or a lovely picnic on pedicured gardens and grass. I did cut this title from the web page for you to plan your visit accordingly.Planning your visit | Address & contact details | This month | All year | Opening hours | Entry fees | Map | Getting there | Disability access | Visitor facilities | Shop & services | Walks & tours | Restaurants, cafes & kiosks | Weddings, venues & exhibition spaces | Visitor code & regulations | Weather | Fast facts | History
Perfect. We can get the perfect picture of the Opera house and the bridge in the best angle. Especially with panorama mode. Its just PERFECT.

for visitors you can see the australian flora. spend half a day in this botanic gardens , its beautifully laid out 'you can start from 2 sides , from the opera house steps turn Right walk along the pathway ,view the gardens in sections , they have guided tour, walk towards the Maquarie Place take photos, have a picnic lunch, there is a steps leading up. Have good walking shoes and have water with you, in Oz summer it can get hot.
TAKE A RELAXING STROLL. After visiting the NSW Art Gallery walk down towards the harbour through the Botanic Gardens, there are always interesting plants, sculptures and views over the harbour.

It's especially beautiful in spring. The Gardens are always beautiful with their splendid views of the Harbour. But in spring, when the tulips are flowering and shortly after when the blossom trees are flowering, it's even better. It's hard to believe you're in the middle of the city.

Spectacular Gardens w/views of Opera House. This is a must see! Nothing better than a nice stroll through a beautiful park with the Sydney Harbor as part of the distant back drop depending on where you are in the gardens! Simply beautiful and better than I expected! Birds roaming freely, some flowers in bloom, magnificent trees with amazing trunks and roots! Nothing like holding hands with the one you love! Lots of walking - huge place! I think better than Central Park in NYC! It's free and even though it was in their winter month; the sun was beaming and it was a really nice and warm day! I took some great pictures!

A Stunning Oasis. You'd be forgiven for forgetting that you are in one of the world's largest cities when you visit these stunning gardens. The Harbour views are spectacular and the gardens themselves offer some hidden treasures that make the visit worthwhile. Keep an eye out for the artworks and sculptures scattered throughout, enjoy a coffee or a bite to eat at the well stocked eateries, and be sure to sit back on the soft grass, remove your shoes and just relax. The gardens are quite large, so be sure that those shoes are comfortable!

It's beautiful and free! . It's right by the water front with the city as the back drop. You get some epic views of the opera house and bridge and was just a lovely place for a stroll and to see Sydney's awesome birds!

Beautiful gardens, but be aware of parking. The Great:The gardens are a beautiful place to visit and a good day is needed to explore and appreciate the area, we even caught the little train which was really good way to see parts of the gardens as well. You can get on and off the train at 4 different spots once you board near the opera house.There is food facilities within the gardens which is highly recommended as well.Great for all ages, don't forget your camera!The bad: Be aware of the parking in Mrs Macquaries Road, we honestly thought we had paid via credit card and still got a parking fine, which with no printed receipt thanks to the "new" meters or transaction on our card we could not prove we honestly tried to pay, sour grapes with a fine of $106 when we did try to do the right thing. Appealing the fine was a waste of time as well!Advice on parking, look into using the "app" which may give you a receipt or park elsewhere where you have proof of payment.
Magical. The gardens are so tidy, clean and beautiful. I totally recommend to see them even if you're not a plant/flower lover because it's worth it. Very close to the Opera House.

The best garden in city!. This is one of my favorite garden. Free entrance. No pet allowed in the garden. The nearest station to get here is Martin Place. There are restaurant, cafe and kiosk inside. The garden is very huge, you can do jogging, walking, relaxing by sleep on the grass (very comfortable), you can enjoy the city (you can see Sydney Opera House from here and Sydney Harbour Bridge), and i love it. Compare with Melbourne, i prefer this one.

Free walking tour was wonderful. Did one of the free walking tours here a few weeks back with one of the guides, Philip. I have lived in Sydney all my life but I learnt so much from this tour and would recommend it to other Sydney locals. Philip had an amazing knowledge of fauna, flora and early Sydney history. Learnt so much from him and have a new appreciation for plants. I also saw a Powerful Owl! Never even heard of them before the tour but now know how to spot them ;)

Great collection of Australian Flora. My partner and I regularly visit the Gardens as she is a vivid gardener and is always looking for inspiration for her next garden bed. There is an abundance of local flora as far as the eye can see. Lots of big open spaces for picnics, playing, and relaxation. Not a massive tourist attraction so would definitely recommend a visit to the Gardens. Easily accessible via a short walk from Circular Quay Train Station and/or Ferry Wharves.
Enjoy. Walk through lovely gardens and have a rest on Mrs. Macquarie's chair before moving on around the harbour wall.

A must if you are in Sydney. I love the botanical gardens. Really worth a stroll. You can fool yourself into thinking you're doing some healthy exercise while looking at the amazing plants and wildlife.My partner and I always head down here after our flight from London arrives. We take a stroll and then lay on the lawns and doze. TThere is a nice cafe in the middle to grab a bite or you can lay on the lawns and admire the ducks and cockatoos

Gorgeous! Loved it!. Not sure I can add much more than what others here have posted. It is a joy to walk through this gorgeous waterside park. Part of our top three favorite parts of Sydney (along with the harbour itself and Manly beach). Well done Sydney!
Beautiful. Truly beautiful with a mass of variegated plants and tropicals. Got to take your camera. Well worth a visit.

Stunning gardens with best view of Opera House / Harbour Bridge. Lovely peaceful gardens with the most stunning views of the opera house and harbour bridge - how every first view of these infamous attractions should be seen.
Contains a delightful little cafe in the middle.

Rainy tour in winter. Our guide, Philip, was like the US Postal service - rain did not deter him. We had a wonderful tour through it all. And would you believe, as soon as it was finished, the rain held up, so we were able to wander around, armed with the knowledge that he had imparted. This was not my first visit to the Gardens but I learnt a lot
Relaxin, Enjoyable Day. Nice, Peaceful and Relaxing. Very nice in Autumn when all the flowers are out.Quite a few Weddings happen in the gardens which makes things more interesting

Very Beautiful!. It was so nice! We decided to take the train around for $10! This was a good idea, even though it was hard to get in and out of (too small). It had 4 stops! #3 was a cafe and $2 coffee with your ticket! We enjoyed seeing the beautiful trees and hearing about it as the driver explained things we saw! It is free to walk around which surprised us! It said a 5 minute walk to the chair from stop #4, but I think it was more like 10! The view of the bridge and Opera House along the water was spectacular from there!!!!!!!

Must see to believe. We loved to visit this garden. We admired all flowers and trees. We visited several times during our a few days trip to Sydney. One of most amazing attraction. Do not be afraid white parrots they are very friendly. Stretch your arms and they will come to make pictures with you. They will appreciate nut or seeds you could collect on the way through the park.

Convenient location to other Sydney iconic attractions. Loved walking through these beautiful gardens from the Art Gallery to the Opera House. Wished we'd had more time to linger and enjoy different garden displays.

A Must To Visit. I love this Garden! It is huge and beautiful. There are so many different plants and flowers. The grass is lush and people are encouraged to walk, sit, lie and play on it. There is plenty of seating, and it is just off the Harbor. There is a restaurant and cafe in the Garden, there are plants for sale and it is right by the Sydney Opera House. Most weekends we would spend some time here.
Beautiful views. love this botanical gardens, views, beautiful plants, bird and animal life and a good walk. You can get do a good walk and then have a coffee near the opera house.

Beautiful Gardens. We enjoyed our stroll through the gardens. It's a beautifully laid out park....with lots of interesting things to see. We had lovely weather the day we were there....and enjoyed the peacefulness the park afforded.

lovely. This was my third visit to the gardens, they are lovely. If you don't want to walk, or haven't got time to walk, there is a little train that takes you around (there is a charge). If you have time walk to Mrs Macquaries Point, on route there is a lovely view of the opera house. There is a cafe in the gardens but I didn't use it so cannot comment.
amazing. This was one of the highlights of our stay in Sydney. It i one of the most beautiful gardens I have seen and it is open to all free of charge.

Worth a morning. I really enjoyed the harbor views and the Araucaria trees, especially the Wollemi pines. The bunya and hoop pines were not as big as they can get further north. I found it interesting to see some Moreton Bay Figs that appear to have been planted in the ground, instead of in a tree top. Winter was probably not the best time to visit, since there were not many flowers in bloom. However, it was a beautiful day and there were lots of ibises and cormorants in a rookery in the the pond. It was neither the best nor the worst botanic garden I have visited.

One of my favorite spots in Sydney . Such a great spot in Sydney - a must go to place. You got several places with amazing views and great spots for a picnic or to play games with you friends. Truly a great place!
Lovely gardens for walks and picnics. Huge botanic gardens that are gorgeous! Great location by the opera house. Perfect for a nice day to have a picnic or walk :)

Take a stroll through the gardens...... A leisurely stroll through these gardens is wonderful whatever time of year, especially when it's sunny. The experience is spectacular when wandering along the foreshores. On occasions, one can come across newly wedded coupe having their photos taken.

Well worth a visit!. Beautiful gardens, even in the winter when we visited. Well worth a visit. The herb garden was especially interesting. It rained while we were there, but there were lots of little spots to sit and wait it out. Magnificent view and immaculately kept.

A great way to spend an afternoon/ whole day. This is one of the secrets in our opinion and barely explored by many. Even we didn't do it full justice. I liked it compared to the other gardens in Oz - because if offers views of the amazing skyline, and has different pockets of special offerings from shops, restaurants to glass houses, and speciality trees etc.There's a nice wishing tree to walk around. Some speciality trees where parrots/ hang around.the only disappointing thing is the train journeys are not as frequent and make you wait for a long time, also with limited capacity leaves a lot of folk disappointed.What you need to watch out for is the limited (only One) toilet deep inside the park, and has long queues. (the females finally used the men's room!). So the best way to do this is to use the opera house facilities before you walk into the park

Amazing natural piece of wonder in Sydney.. Amazing natural piece of wonder in Sydney, the Royal Botanic Gardens are massive. Choose your pace, trail and walk on. We were lucky to catch the bridal march of a wedding. I can understand why this place would be a popular wedding venue.
Green gem!. Located within the city a perfect place to enjoy nature! Stroll along beautiful trees, observe wildlife, relax on grass!
Great. Great for long walks! Really enjoy the fresh air and ambience, It is very close to sydney Harbour too

A great place to relax. A great place to spend the afternoon. Lots of places for the children to run, have a picnic, or just take in the views. In my opinion a much better Botanical Garden than the one in Brisbane. Don't forget to check out the Gift Shop, it has some really great gifts.

Beautiful. The Royal Botanical Gardens are a plain beauty! The trees, plants, walk along the seaside, the garden shop and tiny special gardens inside calm you from the inside and also prompt candid photos
Wonderful garden. The place is perfect, in a sunny atmosphere and in front of Sydney Bay : well placed trees and floewes, fountains, small and large areas... a wonderful promenade
Great for a leisurely walk or jog. Great place to walk around or run in the mornings. Well marked trails and surprisingly good for bird watching/viewing.

Great garden in the middle of the city. This is a must visit in Sydney.. Specially on the summer and spring time..it's wonderful,,relaxing to your eyes and soul.. The place was so huge..you can take a pick where you want to stop and put the blanket and have a bit of RnR..It's also give you a great spot to take picture that show in background harbour bridge and opera house..Variety of plants and flower will make you feel so refresh,

Nice place to relax. We wnet for a stroll in these gardens early morning. The atmosphere is very pleasant. The lawns are lush green and the walkways are well maintained. The differrent types of trees are well cut. The views of the harbour from these gardens are exquisite.
Nice place to go for walk.. Get break from your day to day routine. Royal Botanic Gardens is recommendable. Have a stroll to rewind. The park is beautiful.

Terrific location. The gardens themselves are nice, and parts are interesting, but it's the location - right next to the CBD and on the harbour, that makes them a haven of natural surroundings for a weary traveller.

Big park. This is a really big park very close to the OperaHouse & St.Mary's Cathedral. I spent my whole afternoon in the park & it was a nice experience. I wish they planted more flowering plants, and provided picnic/ communal spots in the park.
Exotic and lovely!. The gardens were a very pleasant surprise! I walked through on my way to Mrs Macqueries Chair and ended up spending an hour or two. Great place to get pics and rest for a bit.

Lovely. Even in winter, the gardens are one of sydneys most beautiful places to explore. Whether its by the train or walking around, the garden grounds are amazing and the views from Mrs Maq. chair are the best in the city. Pick a nice day, take a picnic and make the most of this lovely unspoiled area.
beautiful. Beautiful! We really enjoyed the gardens and wandered around here for a couple of hours. Had lunch at the little cafe. very good!

Very large and beautiful can stay all day. This is a place where you can spend the whole day. Unfortunately we only had a few hours but enjoyed the walk through part of this huge park very much. The train is beautiful and although we did not ride in it (there were a lot of people), we would like to go back and view the garden from that angle.
# 1 Reviewer. No the best garden in Australia for sure and over rated. I went to find an ancient tree, you would think it would be posted but couldn't find it very disappointing
