Higjley recommended this place, suits anyone from children to aged people.

Full of surprises. I like these gardens more than Melbourne's Botanical Gardens. The walks are more interesting, and there are surprising little relaxing areas off the main walkways. All culminating with the walk to the harbour's edge.

Peaceful and beautiful. Go on the Choo Choo Express!. We visited the gardens last week and thoroughly enjoyed our 20 minute narrated ride through the gardens on the Choo Choo train. The young lady who was our driver/tour guide was enthusiastic and natural, while giving us plenty of historical details about the sculptures, buildings and trees we passed along the way. Well worth every penny of the $10 each it cost us. Even my 18 year old daughter who is not into gardens at all, enjoyed herself.

Beautiful and quiet oasis. The gardens are beautifully kept and very quiet even if they are right in the heart of Sydney. They are also much bigger than you expect and you only scrape the surface in a few hours. Well worth a visit with great views and a nice cafe.

Pretty gardens. Beautifully manicured gardens with many different varieties of plants. You need a good hour to walk around the gardens- minimum Make sure it's a sunny day for this visit and entrance is free to all. Definitely worth a visit
Lovely. The gardens were one of my favorite parts of visiting Sydney. It's quite beautiful and an excellent place to take a walk or jog.
Something about beautiful gardens. The Aussies...like the English...love their gardens. We love them too. Almost makes you want to pick up a trowel and get to work.

Location is breathtaking. Gardens magnificent. Sydney's jewel is most definitely the harbour and these Botanical Gardens are right on this magnificent harbour. The size of the gardens is amazing. We actually took a ride on the "choo-choo-train" to tour the gardens. While this was a complete rip off (run but a private business) it did take us around the gardens in less than 30mins. we were on a bit of a clock so it fit in for us but I would say give the train a miss and stroll at your leisure and save some of your hard earned cash.

Choo Choo Express a plus!. Spent a lovely morning in the Gardens. A little too late for the Spring display, but enjoyed the lush flora! A big thanks to Brittany and Megan, the "engineers" of the Choo Choo Express. Having limited time and low energy level on the day of our visit, these young ladies took us on a great little ride, narrating along the way with great information we never would have heard without them. The Gardens, which are free, are a great respite in this busy city. It is so much fun to watch families enjoy the grounds, as well as the many runners and walkers using the extensive walkways.

Beautiful. Take a leisurely stroll, walk or run through this area. It is located on the harbour adjacent to the Opera House. There are rose gardens and many other plant and fauna species throughout this area. Make sure you visit these gardens.

Relaxing. Located in the very heart of the city, the Botanic Gardens of Sydney offer you the possibility to walk or to rest in a very peaceful area. Free admission and some fantastic points for taking nice pictures of the nature and of the harbour area.
Awesome. I love the royal Botanic Gardens! There so beautiful and I recommend it for everyone who wants to see an amazing garden.

Oasis of peace. Wonderful botanical gardens, quite extensive and well planted and stocked. Free admission and lovely views of the harbour - good place to picnic, or just stroll or rest awhile. There is a cafe on site, with a more formal restaurant above it, but I didn't sample either.
A pearl. Amazing park with ornate trees and flowering shrubs an oasis in a urban setting. Fantastic views over to the harbour and bridge .Take a blanket and a picnic and chill here

Exceptionnal and Beautiful. You enter the botanic garden, and you fell like in an other world, peaceful, quiet, full of birds that come in your hand to grab some food, wonderful species of plans, flowers and trees, you can go there quite often as nature is changing constantly and it's always the same pleasure
Walk, talk and enjoy. A regular visit for us. A great way to exercise, enjoy the gardens and see the best city-scape views of the harbour and city.

Nice walk. Loved the gardens. They aren't the most complex of municipal gardens, but have a huge range of species. Probably the most impressive are the number of trees that have grown to massive size over the course of a century or more.
Beautiful. Not much else to say.. Again, not much to say other than you must see it. It's really beautiful and worth spending at least a half-day walking in it.
Maybe the wrong season?. Maybe it was just the season but few blooming plants. We visited the end of November. I did enjoy the singing birds though. Hyde Park was nicer.
Beautifu. Loved the open spaces and colour. So glad that every city we visited in Australia and New Zealand had large gardens.

Peaceful and very relaxing. The Royal Botanic Gardens in Sydney is situated right behind the Sydney Opera House with the city right behind it. It is right on the harbour, so a fabulous spot to walk around and enjoy the peace and quiet. The garden layout forces you to slow down and enjoy what it on offer which is fabulous flora. Some of the trees are truly majestic. Take some time out if you can, it would be worth your while.
Absolutely love them!. I love visiting the Royal Botanic Gardens anytime of the year! Don't forget to take your camera and visit the gift shop too.

A garden in the city centre.. Lovely plants and trees in a setting beyond equal on the shores of our harbour. The first class restaurant offers fine dining with friendly service and beautiful food, much of it locally sourced produce.There are also food outlets for economical meals and snacks which could be enjoyed as a picnic in the gardens.We also attended a wedding there in the Rose Garden, really spectacular and so Australian!

Absolutely wonderful park. Located near the harbour and stretching a couple of miles, this park is a gem. Easily walkable from the Opera House, it is filled with beautiful scenery and attractions. We actually biked around it (you can't ride bikes through the park) and stopped to walk around parts of the gardens. Beautiful flowers, magnificent trees, fountains, lakes, and historical buildings are scattered throughout. Best of all, it's free!! A wonderful place to stroll around or spread a blanket and have a picnic. Lots to see so give yourself plenty of time.

Stunning Gardens. This is one of the most wonderful places in Sydney. Just ask any bird you see pecking around. Each tree and flower seem to be so lovingly placed. Everyone walking around seems to be as happy to be here as the birds!

Beautiful Serenity in Heart of the City. So very pretty and peaceful with heaps to see and relax and enjoy. Fantastic views around Harbour from there too as well as views of city. Fantastic way to take time out and relax and enjoy your break in the city, well worth a look.

Sydney botanical gardens - tranquility in the city. The Sydney Botanical Gardens have to be one of the best in the world that I have been to. Such a vast array of plant species set in an incredible landscape that is Sydney Harbour, and only a short walk from the city. The gardens can be accessed from several different areas so it's worth getting a tourist map or check online to get your closest entrance. If you are a tourist to Sydney, make time to visit the gardens, but not just an hour as there is so much to see. Individual gardens contain a large amount of cacti from various countries, some of them huge, enormous Moreton Bay fig trees with large butruss roots that children love to play around. There are many varieties of palms and bamboo, sensory, rose and herb gardens, and a modern glass house with tropical plants - so much to see. There are also older glass house containing orchids and other species. A large colony of fruit bats resides within the central garden area that a lot of visitors would not have seen - they remind me of broken umbrellas hanging in the trees. There is a coffee shop and restaurant available within the gardens when you need a break. The Lion Gate Lodge occasionally has art exhibitions so it's worth checking at the information booth. Throughout the gardens you will get wonderful views of the harbour and city so ensure you take your camera. In the Garden House, an impressive sandstone building near the cacti garden you are able to buy souvenirs and books etc. Walking through the gardens will take you down to the harbour and on to the Opera House and Circular Quay, so if you are staying in the city you can make it a circular walk. All in all a great place to spend part of a morning or afternoon in Sydney.
Royal Botanic Gardens. Lovely, well placed gardens close to everything. A beautiful asset to the city, that must remain in public hands, and not developed.

A wonderful park!. Don´t miss the Royal Botanic Gardens while you´re in Sydney! The city has so many different faces, just enjoy this one. It´s quiet, cosy with nice animals, nice plants, blossoms and trees...

Botanic Gem In the Heart of Sydney. as a lifelong Sydneysider it is my pleasure to give our own Sydney Botanic Gardens 5 stars. An absolutely idyllic large horticultural garden with many specialty areas. The perfect place to contemplate life and admire the wonderful plants.

Keep visiting these gardens. I love this place. The trees. The wandering people. The volunteers. Not so much the cafe and the knocking down of trees. But you can move around this wonderful space with your small kids, your elderly parents or just in your own company. Take a cozzie for a swim at the Boy Charlton across the road or a picnic and your sketch pad if you're feeling less active.

Natural Beauty in a City on the Harbour. Sydney's Royal Botanical Gardens is a small oasis nestled between the cityscape and the tranquil waters of the Port Jackson waters. Hidden behind the sails of the Sydney Opera House, the gardens stretch between Hide Park and St Mary's Cathedral out to the point of Lady Macquarie's Chair. The gardens themselves contain exotic plants from all around Australia and some imported trees from neighbouring countries. The Botanical Gardens is a wonder place to sit and read, take a walk, or have a picnic lunch. It is free to enter and enjoyed all year round.

Sydney Botanic Gardens, a 'must see' attraction.. In a magnificent setting,with the harbour, the CBD and Opera House adjoining and with wonderful views, the Sydney Botanic Gardens are a haven of peace and natural beauty. The landscaping and the variety of trees and plants provides endless interest, not only to those with horticulural leanings.
Stunning!!. The botanical gardens are stunning! They are very well maintained - very beautiful. Some really interesting birds on the lawns.. If you are in Sydney, don't miss these Gardens..

Tranquility by the Harbour. I have often visited these gardens to reminisce as I spent a great deal of time there as a kid, it seems a lot smaller now, but is still beautifully kept and full of all the interesting botanical information. The kiosk is good and affordable but there was a problem with ibises jumping onto the tables (hope thats been sorted) The restaurant upstairs is quite expensive but by all accounts very nice. If you work in the city its a wonderful spot to have break, lay down in the sun and relax during lunch.

A must for the visitor to Sydney. Whether you are visiting from overseas or a local wanting a beautiful place to visit in Sydney , this is a must....... The views of the Opera house and the harbour are spectacular .... The walk along the foreshore is lovely and the gardens themselves are a peaceful oasis from the noise and bustle of the city. Take a picnic or enjoy one of the restaurants ...... Whatever you do it will be well worth the visit

A beautiful space on the harbour. Take time out to visit this beautiful and well-maintained garden. Visit the cool and peaceful fernery, walk through the huge collection of palm trees, edible garden, world class collection of Begonias, tropical garden. Enjoy a picnic under a tree on the extensive lawns overlooking the harbour. The bookshop is well stocked and you can buy a wide range of rare and unusual plants at the Growing Friends Nursery.

peaceful spot in the city centre. Quiet oasis in the city centre with beautiful views, don't miss out on the succulent garden and palm grove. Great for jogging in winter too. Check out the Andrew Boy Charlton Pool around the corner for some laps if you're a swimmer.

Green Oasis. The Royal Botanic Gardens are a green oasis in the centre of Sydney. They serve as the lungs of the city as well as providing an excellent viewpoint onto Sydney Harbour. The Gardens are only a short walk from the City as well as providing a home for the Art Gallery of NSW. Not only is this tranquil place a haven in the City but it also serves as a centre of research on plant life and botany in general.

A walk through time. This relatively small site is one of the few remaining green zones in or near the Sydney CBD and harbour that is not overcrowded. It is thoughtfully set out and signposted with satisfactory seating for time to rest and time to think. It is positioned well across from the State Library and is very convenient to transport and a walk back towards central Sydney offers a variety of cafes and coffee shops if you can overlook the many members of the legal fraternity who often cluster at this end of town. More seating would be nice.

Picnic in the park. It's not unusual to see people taking afternoon naps under the cool shade of some of the most beautiful trees in Sydney. The gardens boasts one of the most spectacular collections of flora in the region. There's plenty of space to lay down a blanket for a picnic, a nap, or an afternoon coffee with a friend. Get outside and visit the RBG. You won't be disappointed.

Botanic pleasure. Whatever attracts you in a botanic garden can be found here, in an ideal location besid ethe beautiful Sydney Harbour. Most days a small train is available for a fee for those not inclined to wander at will around the gardens which cover many areas of interest

Beautiful Haven in the centre of Sydney. A wonderful walk through beautiful gardens to the harbour. We took a packed lunch from one of the many eateries in the city and ate it at one of the many benches in the park, overlooking the opera house and the Sydney Harbour Bridge. A million dollar view for free. A great way to escape the madness that is any city.

The calm amid the storm.. The Royal Botanic Garden is an oasis of calm and beauty in the heart of a bustling, cosmopolitan city. You can forget that you are not in a forest or jungle as you stroll through this wonderful place. The only thing that gives away the fact that you are not in some lost world is the numerous name plaques of different species of plants and trees. Walking on through the gardens, you emerge at Mrs. Macquarie's Chair, a seat cut out of stone, looking out over the harbour with the Sydney Opera House on your left and the harbour stretching out to the right tantalising you to get on a Manly Ferry and explore what is 'down harbour'. At dusk, the enormous fruit bats emerge to come and gorge on the fruit of the Moreton Bay Fig Trees which are in abundance there. As the sun sets beyond the Harbour Bridge, you have completed a day and you can 'sigh' just as the land does at the end of every Australian day.
Lovely gardens. The gardens were very nice, small and compact so you could actually walk them and see them at one time. Great views.

A jewel in Sydney's crown. I always am impressed when I find beautiful gardens close to the CBD in any city. Where land is valued at such a premium It is refreshing to see a priority given to nature and gardens. There is a huge amount of varied gardens to see. Lots of thought has been given to educating visitors about the flora and even fauna. Tranquil and relaxing place to be.

Beautiful scenery. Absolutely stunning and clean gardens. Lots of plants and trees all well kept and beautiful views out over the harbour and to the opera house.
Great way to spend the day away from the city.

Gorgeous well maintained planting overlooking one of the world's most beautiful harbors. We loved the very well maintained, beautiful grounds. We loved the amazing views of the Sydney harbor and the location right in the heart of things. There were some steep steps without railings, not very clear directions of how paths connected, so we were very appreciative to have a wonderful guide who knew every inch of the gardens leading us.

Quiet get away. We spent a morning walking around here. The views of the harbour and opera house are pretty special. The gardens themselves are immaculate and a great place to picnic on the grass or even just sit and watch the world going by

Beautiful gardens. The gardens are free. It is 74 acres and a lot to take in on your own. There is a small train that runs every 1/2 hour for $10.00 that stops 4 times that you can hop on & off. Highly recommend that. The streets are marked but not very well. Saves you walking in circles. The guide/train driver points out things of interest along the way. Truly a must see in Sydney
Just lovely. Great to walk down by the harbour, view the bridge and Opera House and wander back up through to the city. Not to be missed.

Be surrounded by fertile floral fun.. What a great find that i had ignored for so many years of visiitng Sydney. A friend turned me on to the features of the Gardens, and now i love to wander through, stop to sniff the roses, walk among the Tropic Raingarden plants, spice row, changing exhibits in the showrooms, the most aromatic roses i know, and it all leads out above the harbour, where you can walk to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair, carved into the hillside, and look at a completely different view of the oh-so-famous Harbour.It's just a great retreat from reality so close to the city. don't miss it!
A lot of to see in the Gardens. My wife's landscape architect and we really enjoyed the Botanic Gardens which have free entrance and a lot to see there. Well organized, clean and not overcrowded.

Lovely :). When we go its always peaceful, always kept and very picturesque iwouldnt recommend going when its too hot (who wants to go anywhere when its too hot except to the beach?). Also there is hardly water fountains/bubblers so if you have children, take lots of water and fill up your bottles. Otherwise, its lovely, beautiful views, lots of places to have a cute picnic, the cafe is not that expensive either so thats good too! A lovely walk around :) My favourite is the mexican ish sanctuary where all the cactus' are, pretty rad!
Well Looked after. great to se the Gardens looking so fine, nicely mown lawns and NO rubbish we really enjoyed it was like not being in the city at all

Fantasitc Walk. Went for an afternoon walk from the cathedral n the south all the way to the opera house.The gardens have fantastic plants, some very nice looking curved billed birds walking around free range... And some magnificent trees juxtaposed against Views of the CBD - really good - 1-2 hour walk - but you could probably have a great picnic here if you have good sunscreen/shade.
Fantastic. Who ever does not believe in evolution should go to Australia..... Flowers and trees are unique A piece of heaven in the middle of Sydney.
A place to relax. This is the perfect place to stroll and relax while in Sydney City Center. The variety of plants and tress was amazing. Recommended!

Wonderful relaxing experience. The beautifully kept gardens have an immense variety to enjoy with the incredible backdrop of Sydney Barbour and Opera House. Also enjoy coffee or meals at the restaurant and cafe on site or just relax under a shady tree.
Lovely, but. This would have rated all fives from me, as I really love plants, but the place was significantly dirty, I.e. trash lying about, that it was not a great experience.
beautiful. take a stroll through the gardens. you won't be disappointed. beautiful flowers and the gardens go on forever... easy to walk over to the opera house and bridge from here.

A must see (walk) for all Sydney visitors. We had several lovely walks in the gardens on our trip to Sydney. I'm quite interested in gardening and really appreciated the fact that nearly all the trees and shrubs have signs explaining the name of each. It's a great place to compose before heading back into the hustle and bustle of the City. On a sunny day this really is a great place yo visit.

Sydney's Central Park. A short walk from our centrally located hotel led us to the Botanic Gardens. being Australian summer, most of the plants, flowers were in bloom. Strange birds (to an American!) were walking around, flying around!. A number of mothers with their little ones were sitting in the shade having lunch. A great, quiet respite from the hustle and bustle of the City!
Lovely garden. This is a really lovely garden with lots of nicely planted areas. The lake is pleasant to sit by and there is plenty of shade on hot sunny days.

Sydney's Central Park. Just a lovely walk around one evening, we saw lovely greenerie, flowers in bloom, exotic birds everywhere! Making it out to Mrs Macqueries chair is a must - great view of Operahouse-Bridge-harbour!

Good view of Sydney Opera House. Gave a good view of Sydney Opera House and read that there was a point which gave the best view. We didn't spend much time there but if you would like, you can cut through to the Operea house through there.
Enjoyable day out. Good place to take visiting friends and family. I have always liked to visit here from time to time. Combine with a visit to the museum for a nice day out.

Beautiful. there was a free tour at 10:30 which provided information on the plants and historic background. Wonderful examples of indigenous plants. Mrs. Maquarie's chair is a beautiful point to see the Opera House

Wide open spaces in the city. Lovely grounds to walk through, some great sights of the city, guides very knowledgeable.
Nice place to pass a few hours and a nice coffee shop 😃

Lovely Sunday afternoon. Can't believe how clean and serene this place was on a Sunday afternoon. The residents and tourists both respect the beauty of these gardens. Free access. Very unusual trees and gorgeous views of the Sydney skyline and harbor.

Worth a visit. These gardens are located in a fantastic location with stunning views of the Harbour bridge, opera house and the Sydney CBD. The gardens are world class and definitely worth a visit especially in spring.

Ok but not the best in Australia. if you've not been to kings park perth or melbourne botanics you'll think these are wonderful if not like me you may be disappointed highlights are very spread out good view though

Wonderful place to take a stroll and relax. The Royal Botanic Gardens is one of the highlights of my stay in Sydney. I was surprised by the size of the park, the variety, organization, and presentation of the plants, and the large open grass fields where many people exercises and relax. I wish I lived here.
Lovely walk. You can enter from just opposite the Opera House and take a gentle stroll through the gardens. Lots of water fountains and places to sit. An oasis of quiet and well worth the visit.

Lovely walk, right in the city. If you're in Sydney then no doubt you'll end up at the Opera House, well the Botanic Gardens are just a short stroll away from there and it's absolutely worth your time to make the trip. Really lovely place to spend a few hours of your trip. I'd give it 5 stars but I'm biased towards Kings Park in Perth and if I had to give one of them a perfect rating it would be my local!

Amazing Views from the Gardens.. Easy to access from Circular Quay. The elevated part of the gardens looks out over the harbour giving amazing views. The home of large fruit bats. Quite extraordinary to see them flying during the day. The gardens are extremely well presented and a pleasure to walk through.

Incredible scenic walk through the Royal Botanic Garden. Don't miss the Royal Botanic Garden! It is incredible with how much tender this garden has been built! Separated into different areas with different groups of plants - all plants are have sign on which you might read where they originally come from, their names etc. With a bit luck you find some of those huge cockatoos and get a closer look at them (if you are not used to those birds). The atmosphere in the hole garden is quiet chilly and relaxed - feel free to do sports at any time as the locals do.
Always amazing. Gardens constantly changing and so well maintained! Tours (fee!) worth doing - each guide gives a different perspective. Cafe not so brilliant however.
Brilliant views of the harbour. Great views, lovely gardens. The tour is interesting...but not for children, but a little too intense for children. Cafe serving fair priced snacks.
Beautiful and relaxing. What a Jewel in the middle of the hustle and bustle. We took the little train and just hopped on and off at leisure. One can easily spend a day in the gardens.
Great way to spend a day. You don't have to be a plant lover to really enjoy walking around these huge and beautiful gardens. We went for a quick visit and ended up staying the whole day.

Garden lovers will enjoy this. I am a bird watcher and it is a great place to see a few of the Australian birds. They even have a guide to the birds of Sydney that you can get when you enter. A relaxing way to spend some time if you flew into Sydney and are getting over jet lag.

Beautiful Botanical Garden - Tick. A lovely walk, a lovely view - bordering the Harbour, great views of the Opera House - home to Handa Opera - outdoor opera and moonlight cinema (check times of year). There's a little gallery there - sometimes (particuarly during Head On - photographic festival), good exhibits, otherwise a little bit old hat. If you go at dusk you can see hundreds of bats taking off (where do those dudes go?) ... Anyhow gorgeous, unique and free Sydney attraction.

Stunning, and Free. The Royal Botanical Gardens are open from sunrise to sunset, and if I was a Sydneysider I would be a frequent visitor: all times of day and seasons of the year.The native plant section on the north end, closest to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair, was the most interesting to me, since many of these plants are unlikely to be encountered north of the Equator.However the Aussies have taken some immigrant flora to heart, such as palm trees from Baja California, the spectacular jacaranda from Brazil (you can see more in Hyde Park and south of Darling Harbour, as well as a pair of fine ones bracketing Sydney Town Hall. Birders will have fun: shrill cockatoos, nose-to-the-grindstone ibises, and plenty of others.Keep a sharp eye out for the First People-style carved tree trunk, and the overturned dragon's blood tree. Actually, there's an almost limitless amount of flora that's worth keeping a sharp eye out for. No need to keep a sharp eye out for those pesky little flies: even if you don't, they'll find you!

Relaxing stroll. Beautiful gardens with marvellous views. If you go on a Saturday you will likely see several wedding parties having their photos done. I saw at least 5 different brides on my visit. There is also a very nice shop and café.

Absolutely the best place to waste an afternoon. This is a great place to just enjoy a gorgeous afternoon. I went to the Opera House in the morning and then spent the afternoon just walking around the gardens. It was very peaceful despite all the people around. Lots of joggers and other people just out strolling around but you didn't feel packed in. This is just a great place to go have a picnic or enjoy the outdoors. I highly recommend it.

Very well maintained. The Botanic Gardens in Sydney compare very favourably to others around the world, both in terms of the views as well as the quality of the gardens themselves. It's well worth taking the time for a stroll around to absorb the sights.

A better place to be. I live in Sydney and work about 200 meters from the Palace Gardens Entrance on Macquarie Street. I walk through the gardens regularly and they are one of my favourite places in Sydney - an oasis away from the hustle and bustle of working life. There are so many different 'gardens' within the Botanical Gardens so you should take time to enjoy as many ofctgese as you can. Space forceveryone to get away from it all and fantastic views of the City Skyscspe, Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Harbour are at your feet.Great place, not to be missed.

Delightful. Whether the Gardens are your destination or you're passing through on your way to and from another destination, you will have a very enjoyable and pleasant stroll through this lovely park setting in a major city. Both the flora and fauna (mostly birds) are wonderful to see and hear. I was staying in Potts Point and cut through the Gardens often on my way to the harbour area. But I'd slow down while in the Gardens to get extra time to enjoy the beauty and peacefulness.
Great views of the city & Opera House. A quiet oasis from the bustle of Circular Quay with a superb view of the Opera House and Fort Dennison. Plenty of bird life and yes, there are flying foxes!

Very relaxing place. Best place in Sydney to chill out, read a book, pick-nick or just appreciate the view. I spent some hours there, but you have the time just sit on the grass, and enjoy your time. Sydney people also use to jog a lot during lunch time at the botanical, so doing it also, would be a goof call.

fantastic place for kids to run about. probably the best views in the whole of sydney - genuinely spectacular views of the bridge, harbour, opera house and city, especially from mrs macquarie's chair.the cafe and restaurant area in the middle is very reasonably priced with plenty of seating, and provides a welcome interlude out of the sunshine if you're there through the day.there are plenty of open spaces, with the majority of the harbour walled-off, so you can let kids play until their hearts are content!

Gorgeous. I always love to visit the Royal Botanic Gardens, the walk along the harbor is breath taking, the gardens are well maintained and the have a sculpture exhibition called Artisans in the garden, which is held for a week during October with the theme of nature in the gardens with all sculptures on sale.
Great vistas, great views of Sydney.. Just quiet beautiful gardens, with great views the Opera House, the Bridge, Harbor, nesting birds. A great place to retreat for peace of mind and relaxation!
A huge garden. Nice place to wander around. Be sure to check out the tour for the Government house. Don't forget to look up and spot the bats hanging on the trees during daytime.
A must visit for garden lovers.. Centrally located - well signed - free entry - an excellent place to visit which can be combined with the Opera House which is adjacent.

Beautiful place for a picnic. These gardens are just beautiful. Its a peaceful place in the heart of the city. Best of all it has free entry. We parked at the domain carpark and it was a 5 minute walk to the gardens. Maps were provided at the front gate and we were able to navigate the gardens easily. We took a picnic and enjoyed the serenity and the view of the water. Worth a visit!
Great Urban Park. Good place for a walk, run, or laying in the sun and having a picnic. It felt very safe, although it does close at night.
Simply Stunning. Brillant, beautiful place to wonder around, for pleasure or exercise, just so pretty well Done Sydney for looking after this iconic place
lovely stroll. Cutting through the gardens was the fastest way for us getting to the center of the city from kings cross, so it was both convenient and beautiful!

Good Botanical collection. My wife and I wandered through the Botanical Gardens and although I am not that much into plants and stuff quite enjoyed the collection there and it was nice way to spend a few hours and take a break from busy Sydney... and free too.
Fantastic!. It is an amazing garden! The best thing is the view , also nice the flowers and the birds . I really love to spend my free time here.

Take a picnic. Great day out take a picnic as park big will new a day to fully explore. Great place for taking pictures of bridge and opera house.The only problem is the hundreds of Sydney lunchtime office workers jogging.
Hard to beat!. These gardens are absolutely magnificent with some of the most impressive trees I have ever seen - also located near the Art gallery and the Opera house as well as the edge of the bay.
Worth the visit...lovely gardens. Visited in late Oct/early November which is spring. Lovely roses. CAFE is also nice. Did not try upscale restaurant. nice book shop.

Nice place to go for a walk. love this garden since not like some other places always is a sea of people. This place is very peaceful and clean, u can lie on a lawn enjoy the blue sky and Australian sunshine with the air of full of fragrance of flowers. Plus, u don't have to pay the entrance fee for such a nice place.

Beautiful park for a stroll. if you hear lots of birds look for the rainbow lorikeets in the trees, they are gorgeous and make for great pictures. Nice and relaxing place to bring a book or stroll along

Beautiful sights, sounds, and smells. The Royal Botanic Gardens in Sydney are a must-see. Sprawling, diverse, tropical, and lush--set on the beautiful water, with views of all the best Sydney has to offer, including the famed Opera House, I spent three hours wandering. Not a 'bird person' normally, they were one of my favorite elements.

superb view of the harbour. I am not great a fan of botanical gardens but this was special. it is situated in the middle of CBD and it is truly beautiful . entrance is free. it has breathtaking views of harbour and opera house and after seeing the gardens you can go for a leisurely stroll to the opera house house.parking on a weekend can be done at Domain parking for a flat rate of 10 dollars.  St Mary's cathedral close by and should pay a visit .

I really wanted to see the herb garden. So I came back once again before I left Australia, but was unable to see it because someone was having a wedding reception there. But it was a beautiful peaceful garden to see with alot of different plants and flowers. It would be wise to get a map of this place since the footpaths wind around and there just is too much to see. I believe there is a cafe there, but I never got there when it was open
Beautiful. An oasis of peace in a modern bustling city. In fact it is so peaceful it is possible to forget that you are in the middle of the city.
What a view!. The views from the botanical gardens are spectacular, especially those of the Sydney Opera House. It's a lovely place for a leisurely stroll.
Absolutely beautiful. The gardens are beautiful. Great for packing a picnic on a Sunday. Great for watching sunsets by the harbour
Beautiful. Lovely gardens, well kept and lots to see. Well worth a visit, take a picnic but DON'T feed the birds, you'll be hounded thereafter.

get lost exploring. Very beautiful i did not expect them to be so large. a map is very handy. there is also a train which takes you around the gardens for only 10 dollars, this is very useful as its easy to get lost. the cafe is very nice and the shop has some lovely items and very friendly staff.

Peace in the city. The botanic gardens abut the opera house and part of Sydney Habour (Sydney Cove). They are very pleasant and well maintained with quite a range of families and species. The tropical greenhouse is well worth a visit. The herbarium is one of the best in the country but access is restricted. There are great walks in the gardens. One exit is to Lady Macquarie's Chair. Another exit is adjacent to Government House.
Beautiful gardens. Absolutely stunning gardens and so close to the CBD - easily accessible by bus, train or ferry and a great place to escape the normal rigours of city life.

Can't buy the view!. The vantage point is at Mrs Macquarie's Chair where one gets the best view of the Opera House against the backdrop of the famous Harbour Bridge.It is stunning, even in the night time!The grounds are impressive, well maintained and gives a good representation of Australian trees and plants. Signage is good and there is ample room for everyone to just sit and relax or take a good long walk .The gate closes at about 5.00pm. Entry is free
Favourite place in Sydney. I popped in and out of here during a week's visit, discovering new areas each time. Fantastic views too.

Excellent gardens. Yes, most people come here and rave about the views of the bridge and the opera, but this is really unfair to the Botanic Gardens itself. The landscaping work done in this place makes it one of the most beautiful parks and gardens I've ever visited in Australia. The gardens are dotted with sculptures, is equipped with facilities, and its location makes it easy for tourists to include in their itinerary.Definitely a beautiful place to enjoy with the family, friends, or even alone, for a picnic, a jog, or a game of frisbee.

Beautiful garden - don't miss the herb and the cacti gardens. The Royal Botanic Gardens are a 'must visit' part of Sydney every tourist (and local) should see.. The setting is amazing - right by Sydney Harbour with great closeup views of the Opera House and glimpses of the Opera House. The gardens are beautifully laid out, there is clear signage and a lot to see. They have an excellent display of Australian and exotic plants. The herb garden and the cactii garden are personal favourites. The gardens have regular exhibitions, always worth a look and the shop is really good fpr plant related books and gifts. The best thing about the gardens is that they are so tranquil and relaxing. Just the place for a walk, a picnic and to relax or even have a nap on the grass. A bonus - free entry. HIGHLY RECOMMENDED.

Beautiful Gardens. These are truly stunning gardens. You will find something different each time you walk through it and around each and every corner. The grounds are beautiful and well maintained and are so very peaceful if you want to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city for a while. Downside? Loads and loads of people who run through it especially around the bay itself but doesn't distract from the gardens.
Running. Great tracks for running. Start at Macquarie Street and just run toward the harbour then go right for more harbour views or left to the Opera House.

A place to relax. When needing some me time i find there is no better place than a good coffee and a stroll through the Botanic Gardens, look at the gardens or just relax by the water either way a great way to spend time
Stunning walk. Get out of the hustle and bustle of Sydney and hang in the gardens. The cafe is pretty poor so take a picnic and drink in the views among the flora!.

Gardens for everyone. These are wonderful gardens full of diverse botanical species and unique walks, you can even through a bat colony and see the bats high up in the trees. One of the most impressive aspects is, that unlike many other gardens, you are invited to take off your shoes and walk on the grass. Sydney-siders have family picnics, weddings and parties in the gardens, there is usually a concert to be found, there's a cafe and restaurant and a little train takes tourists and kids around the whole gardens. Don't miss the huge Moreton Bay fig trees. And of course the harbour sights and sounds are lovely - you can watch yacht races on the weekend and at sunset. A lovely place to be.

Art Exhibition at the Palm House Exhibition Centre. There is always an excellent exhibition on at the Palm House Exhibition Centre. It is located near the information centre but any of the gates have maps and other information.
At present 12 local artists are exhibiting mostly Australian scenes and wildflowers. The current exhibition is on until 12 November 10-4, open every day.

Well worth a visit. If you visit Sydney you must visit the Botanic Gardens. I love that they tell you to walk on the grass and touch the plants and trees. Go and look at Mrs MacQuaries chairs, summer and winter. You can go inside Government House for a guided tour, but must have photo ID to enter.

Royal Botanioc Gardens. If you are staying anywhere in the City of Sydney Its a nice place to visit to see many of Australian and other flowers especially in Spring/ Summer Its nice and close to the Opera House and the harbour around it/.

Beautiful gardens in the heart of the city. The Botanic Gardens are one of my favourite places in Sydney, and, even better, they are free. The Gardens provide absolutely fantastic views of the Harbour Bridge from Mrs Macquarie's Point, as well as the Opera House. The only downside is that if you go at lunchtime, and follow the path along the sea wall, expect to be inundated by hordes of joggers, which can make things a bit unpleasant.

Forget the gardens - go for the view!. That's a little unkind, but while the gardens are nice (more of a park really) the best bit is the view of the Opera House with the Harbour Bridge behind itYou need to go in the morning for the sun to be in the right place for photos, with the best views from Mrs Macquaries Point and also slightly inland from there on the upper walkway.

Nice. I'm rarely bothered by gardens/plans etc but these are so pretty. We walked around them for hours (mainly killing time until the hotel was ready) but I would have happily walked around them again. Check it out!

Pleasant city centre gardens. Well-tended gardens very close to the centre of Sydney, so provide a peaceful refuge from the hustle and bustle of the city, but not as impressive as Melbourne's gardens.

Disappointing.. Wherever we go we try to find botanical gardens and always compare them to the best we have seen - Singapore and Buchart. Sydney just does not compare with either. More like a big park and as such is very nice.
Beautiful. Fantastic botanical gardens, laid out around lakes with sweeping vistas down to the harbour. A perfect antidote to the hustle and bustle.
Cute quiet walk. Nice and relaxing to get away from the busy city! Is very well kept and a nice place to chill out and admire the views of Sydney harbor

Love these gardens. Now I am not into plants and flowers whatsoever. If your like me and just looking for a nice place to sunbathe in the city, with great views of circular quay and the opera house, hit the botanical gardens. Take a towel and some food and drink and have a nice picnic in the sun. There is a cafe if you need to buy things there. Plenty of toilet facilities to. Best cbd sunbathing spec in my opinion...

Great for running. While I've never just wandered through here to take in the plants etc. I do often run around the gardens in my lunch break.I like running here because there are lots of different paths that you can take, and on hot days, a lot of those paths are shady.There's also a lot of grass where I can stop to do stretches an exercises. Given the amount of others that I also see running on their lunch breaks, the gardens would benefit from adding a few more water bubblers.

A delight. The Botanical Gardens are a true gem in sprawling Sydney. They are well maintained with a huge range of unusual and typical plants. All the plants are well labelled and there are informations boards all over the place. This is a beautiful area just to visit and relax well worth s visit if your in Sydney you won't be disappointed.
Beautiful. I really enjoyed the gardens, I cannot say anything bad about it. We ran out of time to see everything, so allow enough time if you enjoy gardens
A zone of peace. One reason we like to stay in the Potts Point area is so we can always include a visit to the gardens. Always something interesting to look at, well maintained, a place to wind down.

Beautiful Gardens with Plenty To See. The botanical gardens is a must see if you are interested in exploring around the rocks, circular quay, opera house, etc as they are all relatively close. Assign about an hour to explore the gardens plus additional time for some of the other adjacent sites including the state library, government house and the art gallery. Some of the more memorable experiences was strolling through the herb garden, learning about the imported crops from the UK and laying in the grass more concerned about being bitten by an ant, near the big triangular looking pyramid structure Overall the gardens are beautiful. Definitely go!
Lovely. Nice place for walk. The white cockatoos are every where around lawn 29. Check out the website for a map.
jo. We walked there after seeing the opera house , the gardens are beautifully maintained and all the plants are plaqued so you know what they are , really beautiful .
Only in Australia. The botanic gardens display plants, trees and flowers only found down-under in Australia. A truly magical place.

Beautiful. Lots of wonderful areas to discover, sculpture to see and birds to listen to. Benches at great spots to sit and while away the time whilst you admire the garden or harbour views. Don't miss this.

one of the favourite garden. Went there about years ago and was one of my favourite botanical garden! fabulous view to lookout to Habour Bridge and Opera House. beautiful flowers and very comfy walking ground. There is a part in the garden have gather all the bats there which present another type of atmosphere of the garden.
Beautiful. Discovered the botanical gardens during the Night Noodle Markets, unforgettable experience. Make sure you check out the memorial closer to the Eastern side.

Fabulous gardens. If you have a couple of hours to spare, the guided tour which leaves from the Palm Grove Centre is a must when you are in Sydney. Our guide, Phillip, was extremely knowledgeable and gave us lots of information about the flora of the Sydney area.
Beautiful grounds. A must see. Its a bit of a walk to get to Mrs Macquaries chair, but the view is worth it. And the gardens themselves are absolutely gogeous

It's a garden by Sydney harbour what's not to like. On a sunny day pack a picnic find a shady spot and relax. This is a pretty garden and perfectly compliments the harbour. It's also fun walking around it.

Royal walk. The Royal Botanic Gardens is a must see on any visit to Sydney - absolutely beautiful (especially in October) and well maintained and laid-out - no trash, no overnight guests, etc. We went twice just to see as much as we could and should have gone a third time.
Take a walk. Quet place in the middle of city. Free admission, very helpfull information desk. Wisit also the shop.

A very relaxing place.. It's one of the best parks in Sydney. You can also spot parrots and cockatoos flying around. Flowers and trees are really amazing. It seems like the whole place are highly-maintained which is great since many people are visiting it daily.

Similar to the Auckland domain. It was fine. Lots of grass and trees. Nice view. If you live in Sydney or a big city it would probably be a lot more exciting for you than it was for us. Well maintained.

nice walk through. Easily laid out and nicely located close to Opera House for good views and areas to relax. Free to enter but I think there are some venues you pay to go into. Nicely laid out for touring, or even a morning jog before it gets crowded.
Lovely views. Spent the morning here, having walked round the opera house. Take a picnic and sit out if it is sunny. Also go round the greenhouses.
Very relaxing... and a must see.. This is another of Sydney's must see free attracrions. I suggest you have a picnic here... I will be next time.

Well maintained Gardens ..stunning flora. Give atleast half a day to visit these gardens . beautiful views of the opera house and harbor bridge are an added attraction .. Absolute haven for plant lover like me
A must!. One cannot visit Sydney without spending time in this splendid sanctuary. Try not to follow your map and get lost in the gardens

Beautiful and free. Definitely worth a visit! Stunning flora and fauna, beautiful views of the Sydney Harbour Bridge, Opera House and the skyline. A perfect spot for a walk, jog or a picnic and a quiet time with a book.
Go as far as Mrs Macquaries Point
A wonderful oasis. A week working in Sydney. Every day, after work a walk in the Botanical Gardens was a must. Wonderfully relaxing. A true oasis in the city
Less known. A place less known to the tourist crowds, serene, peaceful. You get great views of the city and harbor from there.

Beautiful Gardens with Wonderful Views. I really enjoyed our visit to the Royal Botanic Gardens. Entry was free, and the grounds were peaceful and beautiful. The gardens are huge! They also offer stunning views of the Opera House and the Bridge.
Great day out. Beautiful! What a great space. We just went for a walk thru the gardens and the bathroom facilities were clean.

Great place to get away from the hustle and bussle. On our last day in sydney we had the morning to kill so we decided to go for a walk in the gardens. My bf being sensitive to the sun even thought it was great with not all of the gardens in the suna nd not all in the shade he found cover when he needed it. It was a peaceful place to just go for a walk, take some photos and you can hardly hear the city at all.
Worth a visit. Well laid out. Peaceful surroundings just a stone's throw of the city and Circular Quay. Amazing selection of plants, shrubs and trees. A variety a birds/

Beautiful. Large and is an enjoyable walk. At this time of year it was just starting to be springs, so by now there are probably more flowers in bloom. But there are still lots of greenery and variety of species to enjoy>

Gotta Walk It. Strolling through the immaculate and expansive gardens is a breathtaking experience. They are so ideally situated, a real must do as part of a Sydney walk-around tour. Well worth an afternoon or two. You'll be transported to a completely alternate transformational landscape between a seemingly endless number of garden settings.

Day trip to the Botanic Gardens. Had a lovely day here. Weather was lovely so we decided to spend it outdoors. Free entry which is a bonus..
Bring some bread to feed the gorgeous colourful birds. They eat straight from your hands..

Peaceful moments in lush green environment. Free entry from the opera side. Just walk in the gate and get amazing pics with opera house and harbour bridge in background. There is no rush and you can get fantastic views. Take a walk around or just relax in the garden.
Ride the red train. We has little time to walk the whole gardens. The train was great, (hop on hop off) takes you through the whole gardens to Maquaries point.

Have an hour or two in the schedule? Visit the Gardens.. If you're waiting for friends/family or perhaps to see your favourite Puccini at the Opera House then the Botanic Gardens are the diversion for you.Spacious enough that you can spend an hour or two wandering around without getting bored - lots of plant diversity (tropical/cacti/greenhouse areas), some water features, some art and a large amount of spiders. Don't know why I stated the last part - you're in Australia.There's also a wishing tree - if you walk around it x amount of times it supposedly grants your wishes. I wished for a fantastic holiday and a happy relationship - and I had the best time of my life in Australia!

Take the Choo Choo express great fun!. We liked this as we could see the entire 74 acres of the Botanical Gardens without walking too much enjoy the guided tour - just $30 for 4 people. Our kids loved the experience and the last stop is the Opera House! Wonderful plantings - quiet and peaceful too!

Like touring Ferngully.. We found this place accidentally, when aimlessly wandering the Opera House/Circular Quay area because we weren't ready to return to our hotel yet but didn't have any real plans. We decided to see where the big steps go... turns out they go to this wonderful garden and park. It is beautiful and exotic, filled mainly with bizarre, enormous, gorgeous trees from all over the world (mainly south america, it seemed). Lots of weird funny little birds too. It was a great way to kill the afternoon.
Good to strol. Very relaxing and nice to see different kind of trees here...good place to enjoy God creation...I even found a funny tree from Socotra island!...yippeee....

Go now while you have the chance. Sydney's Royal Botanic Gardens are a real treat and very handy for the centre of the city. But they are under threat. Government cost-cutting means that they are struggling to survive and may have to start charging an entrance fee.

Beautiful Gardens. I just love visiting the Botanic Gardens in Sydney. As a runner, for me a run through the gardens is a must. Just a short stroll from the cbd, actually almost in the cbd, you just have to visit the Botanic Gardens when you head to Sydney. A great way to leave the hustle and bustle of the city behind.
Always a pleasure to visit. Sydney's climate favours evergreens, making these gardens a leafy delight year-round. The birdlife is also a delight. I love watching the ibises.

Beautiful way to spend a few hours. We really loved walking around the gardens, taking in the gorgeous views of both harbour and city, bird watching, and admiring all of the beautiful plants and flowers. It was quite warm the day we visited, and the heavy tree cover provided not only shade, but also a nice breeze. It's a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city and just relax for a few hours.

One of the visit to do in Sydney. Quiet and marvelous place to visitYou can enjoy the nature, the flowers and the trees, you can enjoy the birds which are very beautiful and you can definitely enjoy the view at the Opera and at the Harbour BridgeIf you have the opportunity, you can make a free guided tour with local volunteer who are just here to make you enjoying the garden, it was a very pleasant experience
Beautiful park with alot of variety. great place to escape the noise and stress of the city centrum, buy some takeaway and enjoy a lunch under the trees.
Beautiful. Amazing place, lots of species, great view on the city cbd and it is really quiet ! Good for a lunch, a nap or to play with kids on week-end !
A good outing. These are fantastic gardens to visit. Lots to see, relaxing and plenty of stops to take a break. The protected Wollemi pine is a precious must see !

History lesson. The park has an excellent range of plants from all over Australia. I particularly liked the signs which told part of the history of the invasion by the British and the expansion across the continent.
Take the ChoCho Express. This is of course a world class garden. So much to see, and learn from. Take the Chocho- even if you don't have kids- it is FUN! and worth the small fee to move around.
Beautiful..!!. just metres away form the hustle and bustle of downtown Sydney, Royal Botanic gardens most amazing place to visit.

Exciting flora variety. Right in the middle of the city is this beautiful oasis. The abundance of variety of plants that they have is truly amazing. The view of the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge is simply astounding.

Breath taking sights Fauna & Flora. the amazing diversity of foliage ... unique to Australia and brought in throughout the years. Trees, shrubs, roses and other amzing exotic flowers.... hugh garden with too much to offer. One visit is not enough. You must come back again and again to maximise your appreciation of the gardens.

Beautiful. It is Spring time here in Sydney. It is one of the most beautiful gardens in the world It is on the edge of the ocean near the center of beautiful Sydney town
Spring Time is magic
There are so many flowers and flor to see and enjoy
Exotic Australia flora and the Japanese Gardens

Beautiful garden. Whether you're just passing through or plan on spending a few hours, the gardens are great. A lot of places to walk through and you can always find your own quiet spot. Whether to have a picnic, just relax and be it by yourself or with someone else you'll enjoy the quiet relaxed atmosphere of the area.
Beautiful. A huge park where you can walk for hours and enjoy the cityscape above you and the beautiful old trees all around.
One of the free attractions in Sydney. It is one of the Best in the world and be it a morning stroll or Evening walk. The garden will give a breather from the city. Love it!

Beautiful. Fortunately these gardens were right by our hotel so we got to see them on a few occasions. They're very well maintained and very beautiful. You feel like you could be out of the city while walking through them. Such wonderful gardens right in the city, perfect for a sit down lunch or romantic stroll.Spring flowers were out when we were strolling through, so we spent a good couple of hours out and wondering through on our first visit. Truly lovely.

afternoon at the gardens. The Royal Botanic Garden, Sydney, is a place of natural beauty, where people come for peace, relaxation, education, and to learn more about plants and horticulture. The surrounding parkland of the Domain is a place for sport, entertainment and recreation.It is situated near Opera house and you can view both Opera House and Harbour Bridge from here. You can easily reach here by train,ferry or bus.I have been living in Sydney for last forty years but every time I get new thrill when I visit it. In my opinion it is one of the best sight in the world to explore, enjoy and experience. I was there yesterday and the garden is full of spring flowers of various colours.Families with young children were sitting and enjoying while joggers were on the foreshore sharing the space with walkers.Great place and FREE.
A little piece of heavan. Right next to the city centre . A very pleasant and delightful walk. Well worth taking an hour out to explore this area.

Love it!. These gardens have been one of my favorite places since I first went there ten years ago. The grounds are beautiful and varied. There are so many vantage points to just watch the ships and ferries move around the harbour. There are gorgeous birds and bats in the trees which I always find so incredible in the middle of the city. I could spend so many hours in this park!

Lucky to have in a city. Truly lucky to have such a wonderful space in the heart of the city, the team do a great job in maintaining the gardens for everyone to enjoy, I get to enjoy them every day, thank you
Picturesque. I walked through here to get to the Opera House. It made for a beautiful day and morning. Definitely worth the walk!

Amazing!. I've traveled all the way from Melbourne to Cairns and been to Perth, but I have to say that the Sydney Botanic Gardens are one of my favourites! Definitely worth a visit, it's almost like you're not in a city. There are some lovely views and great photo opportunities too.
Wonderful spring flowers. Spring Flowers are in bloom, enjoy a few hours strolling through and lying on the grass in the shade

Still wonderful. Been more than 10 years since I've been a tourist in Sydney and good to see they haven't sold the Botanic Gardens off. One of the highlights of world touring is wlakin g through the gardens and coming around the corner to see the Opera House.

Gorgeous grounds, amazing views but lots of roped off areas.. We walked through the botanical gardens on our way from Macquarie's point to Circular Quay. The grounds are immaculately clean and we'll kept with signs and information plaques on all species.The foot paths are all well signed so getting lost or confused as to one's direction is impossible.The only reason we didn't rate this a five star experience is that there were so many areas that were roped off and there was also quite a bit of construction going on. This caused some foot paths to be blocked off. There was also a stagnant pond near the Chinese Lions that was most unattractive.Well worth a walk through as you explore the harbour area.

Great place, wrong time of year. My mom, sisters and I didn’t have the botanical gardens as a “must do” on our list of things to see in Sydney because we figured it wouldn’t be the best time to go. With that being said, when we arrived at our hotel and found out it wasn’t ready yet, we had to find something to do. The gardens were not far from our hotel and we figured we could walk through leisurely and for FREE. The gardens really are beautiful. It’s too bad we were visiting in winter. I’m sure they are gorgeous in spring/summer. There were some plants that were just starting to flower, which was nice to see. We enjoyed the oriental gardens and enjoyed being able to walk around at our own pace.There are many bathrooms around the gardens, which we also appreciated. There were cafes also open with outdoor seating despite the cool day. One thing I was disappointed in was the greenhouse that wasn’t open. It would have been nice to see more flowering/tropical plants.The gardens really are centrally located. You can easily walk to the Sydney opera house and along the river. I would recommend going!

A garden with unrivalled views. Overlooking one of the prettiest harbors in the world, flanked by the Sydney Opera House at the bottom and the Arts Gallery of New South Wales at the top, this park is worth the trip just to savor nature at its best, all within a short stroll from the hustle and bustle of the heart of Sydney CBD. The garden is large (about 30 hectares) and diverse enough to appeal to all ages and interests, be it a simple jog through the well maintained pathways, have a family picnic on the beautiful lawns or explore the rich world of plants. In additional to the wide varieties of plants in general, there are a number of special sections, for example on herbs, tropical and succulent plants and palms. There is plenty of literature to guide potential visitors to the highlights and features of this magnificent and significant piece of greenery, and depending on the interest and available time it would be easy to work out a suitable itinerary, be it a short trip or a daylong outing- all free too.

Very good guided tour. We were escorted through the botanical garden by a knowledgable guide who taught us about the history of plant life in Australia and how natives made use of the native plants. Botanists figured strongly in early gardens on the island as well.
Oh so pretty. Walked from rocks through to art gallery....such a lovely walk passing through opera house, gardens, harbour to lovely cafe with clean toilets. Beautiful walk in middle of city

Huge park, a lot of options. Whether you're a big fan of the outdoors or more of a cultural geek, you're gonna love these gardens. They offer a nice escape from the city and are so big, you can get lost in there for an entire day.

nice landscape, a treat for the eyes. A very nice landscapes. So big and very well organized, many objects to photograph.The place is huge , you can do sort of things. We end up having picnic under the tree, my husband even took a nap. Its a relaxing day. After that we walk to Sydney Opera House, it took us around 15 minutes to get there
Lovely running trail. I took a run through the gardens. The paths are clean and make for a scenic running route. Well maintained and provide lovely views over to the opera house.

Exquisite. What a beautiful place to visit! Loved everything. Definitely worth a visit. I especially enjoyed the succulent garden, but it's all good. Just a pity the temperate pavilion is closed until 2016!

peace and tranquility. an enjoyable wander through the well kept city gardens is a lovely way to spend an hour or two. The trees are superb, the lawns well kept. I was sad that the bats have gone now as that was a magnificent sight seeing so many hanging from the trees, but I guess for they had to go when they spread disease. The café tables were rather wonky, but still enjoyed a coffee watching a cheeky Ibis helping himself to crumbs off the table next to us. Feeling very chillaxed, we re-joined the wonderful hustle and bustle of the city feeling refreshed
Absolutely worthwhile. During the month of September is ideal to stroll through these gardens Wasn't thrilled with the restaurant meal

Beautiful Place. Its a really huge garden to stroll. Take a slow walk to enjoy the view and nice environment. Lots of things to see. and if you feel a bit tired you can always get on the tram (with AUD 10 charge).
an amazing garden in the heart of sydney. just takes you out of the hustle and bustle of the immediate city for just a short while. Great to explore or just relax

jungle in the city. i was surprised to find this garden in the center of sydney with such great sceneries on the opera house or harbour bridge withparrots everywhere ! if you like to run it is a good spot to train with a spectacular view and close to the bay.
Lovely walk on a lovely day. We were lucky to visit on a sunny winter morning. With the bright sunlight, you get better pictures. Also more people out in the gardens make it more cheerful.
Beautiful gardens and views. We walked through the gardens to the ocean to Lady Macquarie's chair. Great views of the harbour bridge and Sydney Opera house.

Lovely walk through the park. You shouldn't miss this to get away from the hustle and bustle of the City. Go in the morning and take a nice leisurely walk through the park to the look out point. Then make your way around the outside performance stage and over to the Opera House. There are some wonderful species of plants and flowers, though I am no horticulture expert, so I'll just say it was pretty and worth the time spent there.

One of the best gardens. Like everything else in Australia, the Royal Botanical Gardens are gorgeous, vigorous, and on a large scale. The Gardens and adjacent Domain are very popular with locals for walking, jogging, exercising, and just cutting across to get to work. The gardens have extensive and well-labled exhibits, and well-paved and signposted flat paths. Check on line for 1 pm free docent tour and the (commercial?) trolley, if you don't want to walk.

CBD oasis. If you're staying in the CBD, get your running or walking shoes on and find your way to the massive RBG. Slow down in the middle and wander the paths (good maps posted everywhere) and enjoy the flora and fauna. The cockatoos are ridiculously loud and their call is shrill, but go with it. Between birds and the interesting trees, it looks a little prehistoric in places (in a good and interesting as in you are not a home kind of way). The path along the harbor is spectacular for photos of the iconic bridge and opera house.
Tranquility. An amazing place to escape the bustle of Sydney, with beautifully manicured gardens and spectacular views, and so easy to wander around.
Highly Recommended. There are many interesting flora and fauna to be found here. Close to the city. Very peaceful with excellent water views too.

Nice and quiet. The Royal Botanical garden is a good place to spend your lunchtime close to the Sydney business area. Just bring your lunch and enjoy the relaxed atmosphere in the shade of an old tree or have a cool drink at the cafeteria
A place for peace in the CBD. Wonderfully laid out with description plaques by the plants / trees. Take a picnic lunch and enjoy the peace, or enjoy the Botanic Restaurant in the middle of the park.

Beautiful name. The name ROYAL Botanic Garden is more impressive than the garden itself. The location is fantastic, especially if you walk from downtown to the Opera House through the Garden. But that is all.
A quiet oasis. I love the contrast of seeing the tops of the CBD office buildings while being surrounded by the beauty of the Botanic Gardens. A slice of serenity in a buzzing city. Must see.
Exciting garden to visit. It's a beatiful garden, and for me as a Swede it's of course very different from home. Loved the flying foxes hanging from the trees as well.
Botanic Gardens. The gardens are beautiful and worth the trip. The gardens are expansive and deserve a couple of hours to really enjoy.

ABSOLUTELY SPECTACULAR..especially the bats. Dont be fooled, these gardens are HUGE...and we walked and walked and walked to ensure we saw all of it. It offers French, English, and Japanese garden elements with surprises. The huge trees were unlike anything I had seen with their long vines. My favorite was watching the fruit bats. They were enormous (yet very safe). They would hang in the trees but watching them fly was spectacular. The gardens follow along the Quay offering excellent views of the harbour, Opera house, bridge.
Enjoyable place to spend a few hours. This is an exceptionally peaceful spot away from the hustle and bustle of the city. Just walking around is a lovely way to spend a few hours.

An Oasis in the City. A great place to escape the city. The location is perfectly situated next to the Sydney Harbour. There are numerous walks taking you through many different gardens that feature plants from many countries. The walk around to Mrs Macquairie's Chair is very picturesque and well worth the effort, just for the views.
Good place for a nice walk. We walked from the Circular Quay to the the Gardens. You will see lots of trees and flowers. Be ready for long walk. If you are a fit person, you could have nice jog.
beutiful retreat. This is a must see for every one who need a solitary moment in the busy life of Sydney. here you can feel rhe nqatures rythm and reload your batteries.
Great Gardens to walk around. Doesn't get any better with beautiful harbour views, do in the morning. It's a great way to start the day and work up a hunger.

Scents and bird songs. I was staying at Paddington, and loved walking there with my book... chose thoroghly my spot and read my book in the company of the most amazing scents and bird songs.... love it!
Good view of Opera House. Had a early morning walk from our hotel to the Botanic Garden. Walk towards Mrs Macquarie's chair. Best view of Opera house. Go early to avoid the crowd.
Great place for a walk. Lots of walking and lots to see. It would be beautiful on a sunny day and even on a cloudy day. You can get food and drinks at numerous places in the gardens
royal botanic gardens. There is nothing to dislike. The setting overlooking the opera house and harbour is wonderful. Clean open spaces to picnic and meet friends.

A must see in Sydney. it's a must see place and it's one o the best places to visit in Sydney. You can enjoy a lovely and memorable day at Royal Botanic gardens. It's a beautiful garden with a lot to offer. You can visit art gallery of NSW which is located here and you can also have a fantastic walk to Sydney Opera House and believe me, you'll never forget this visit!
Beautiful.. We enjoyed our walk through the Botanic Gardens. Lots to see, some of the indigenous plants are very different from those we typically see in the US (East Coast). Lovely!

I'm not an outdoorsy guy, but this place is amazing. As the title suggests, I don't really go on outdoors-type activities but when I was in Sydney with my wife for our honeymoon we went here and it wound up being an incredible afternoon. I could go on and on about how pretty the vast varieties of trees and flowers were. I could also talk a lot about all of the different types of birds to see, and even how relaxing it is to sit by the lake or look at the spectacular views of Sydney while overlooking the harbor. But really, you just need to see it for yourself. We planned on only staying for about an hour, but after walking around a small potion of the park before we knew it we were there for more than 2 hours. My wife and I had to keep reminding ourselves that we were there "during the ugly time" because it was the end of winter when we visited, but it was still sooooo beautiful. Certainly a must see place if you spend any time in Sydney.
Aaa ah! Serenity. Beautiful gardens, looks of places to sit and watch the world go by! The view of the Harbor and the water simply beautiful! Worth a visit

Lovely breakfast in the gardens. On a sunny day it's one of the best places to visit , you can check out the views of the harbour , really worthwhile seeing from a different angle , the gardens are also worth the walk especially the rose garden , that's something special

Worth a visit. We did the gardens on our last day in Sydney, I,m glad we took the time, A gift shop / toilet facilities , excellent photo oppurtunities Of the bridge etc.From the gardens you can then visit Government House
Beautiful Park. The park is a great place to have a Walk... It gives you a good View of the City & the Harbour.... My Daughter got Married in the Park..... So do many Couples.....

Birds in the botanical gardens. 1. I was amazed and mesmerised when I encountered a Poweful Owl here. He was quietly watching me when I looked up. He was sitting on a branch of one of the many beautiful and exotic trees. I will never forget this. 2. Although they can make a mess and they make a hell of e noise as well, the hundreds of Fruit Bats hanging upside down in the trees are certainly something quite extraordinary to behold.3. What I always love is the huge Ibis wandering about and flying up to sit in the trees. There are many many birds to admire here in this wonderful paradise!

Easy access to Sydney's oasis. Public transport to the gardens makes your day easy. The train to Circular Quay gave us a short walk to the gardens and wonderful views along the way of the harbour life which is always interesting, as well of the dominating structure of the famous harbour bridge.From the station walk east past the ferry terminals and you will see a lift to the garden level. Alternatively you can take the longer route past the Opera House.The gardens are timeless and always new discoveries to be made. Take your picnic and enjoy the relaxing atmosphere with camera at hand, or purchase your needs at the café in the centre of the grounds. Allow time to walk along Lady Macquarie's Chair. For your return you can consider the alternative transport of bus or taxi from the top gate. Allow at least half a day.

Do the guided walking tour. The Botanic Gardens are a real haven between the city and the harbour, a great place to relax or to learn more about local trees. Volunteers provide free guided walks twice every day, starting from the visitor centre / shop.

Must see!. Excellent gardens with lots to see, both planted areas and open grassy spaces to relax, and the bonus of wonderful views of the harbour. Lots of birds - cockatoos, lorikeets, ibis etc. Make sure you stop at the cafe which is really nice too.

Lovely green oasis of calm in the city. Coming from London which boasts many magnificent parks, my expectations of the Botanic Garden were low, but I was proved wrong. It's small but exquisite, with beautiful landscaping and nice little buildings dotted around. We were lucky with the weather - on a sunny day, the view of the harbour was simply amazing. Perfect place to have a relaxed stroll after a long day of sightseeing.

Here's where Australia's history began!. The Botanic Gardens are not just like any other garden in Australia. Here's where there is the history of thecrop fiels of the first prisoners. You also have the best view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge from Macquarie's Point.Beware of the joggers however

A Beautiful Garden S Close To The City. Like many Australian cities the gardens on the edge of Sydney are excellent, well maintained and quite interesting. I would rate it lower than Melbourne's Botanical gardens but worth a visit and a great asset for the city
Lovely Walk. Just a lovely walk through the gardens with the wildlife, birds etc. Got to do it if you go over there.
Beautiful. Beautifully kept botanic gardens, full of local plants and trees. You get amazing views of the harbour and Opera house from here. Walk all the way out to Mrs. Macquerie's seat and relax.
Quiet walk with amazing views of city & harbour. Enjoyed a quiet morning walk on a perfect day with amazing views of the city & harbour. Make sure you visit Mrs Mcquaries chair as well.

Brilliant Day Out. We came across this park by chance, hadn't seen it promoted or advertised anywhere, but spent a lovely afternoon there. The little tourist train is cheap -AUD5 each and tours the park allowing you to get on and off at various stops, including the lovely cafe and gift shop. There's loads to see and lovely lawns to rest on. Well worth a visit and a peaceful haven to escape the noise and urgency of the harbour area and city.

Super Gardens. We thoroughly enjoyed walking through the gardens, though disappointed with cafe in the grounds tables not cleared and generally seemed grubby. Nice to also see activities organised in the park areas for visitors and residents.
nice relaxing. it is a beautifull park in the city, big, signs tell you the way where you can go. and a good view towards operahouse and harbour bridge.
Lovely. Relaxing, lovely and a bit romantic. I recomanded this part if you want enjoy the view of the city and take faboulous pictures. I think it's a must for the visit of the city.

Definitely worth a visit. Royal Botanical Gardens is a very beautiful place near the Sydney Opera House. It's worth going there. Lots of local trees and plants(with name tags under them). We really enjoyed our day there with my family. It's a good idea to have a picnic there in the shade, it gets very hot walking around Sydney on a sunny day, so it's a nice relaxing break. Also has amazing views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.
average. some silent and serene corner in the middle of busy sydney. walking around here from the opera house is quite good. the place is very clean and well maintained too.
Lovely. Definitely a welcome respite from busy Sydney life. I love the winding paths, though I found some of the signs to be a little confusing.

Lovely even in the winter.. We walked from the Opera House thru the Gardens to get to the Museum and then again after the museum. Saw lots of families just enjoying a beautiful day in the park. I can only imagine how it looks in summer because winter was simple beautiful.
Well worth a visit. Lovely views of the Opera House and stand and listen to the birds for a while! Take a walk around the grounds, though there is a road train.

Loved the gardens. The botanic gardens are charming. It is right near the governors house. There is a charming tea and gift shop. Lots of fascinating plants and it is right on the harbor so the views are fab. This is a must do. They have free guided walks at 10:30am and I wish we had done that. There was probably a lot we missed. There is a little train that goes through the gardens which is perfect for children and older people. They do charge for the ride. The nearest station is Martin Place but we walked from the opera house. Very close and a scenic walk..

Not to be missed. The gardens were superb. Right along the harbor with wonderful views of the Opera house and the busy waterway, there are tons of little garden areas with different types of gardens. We'd planned on spending an hour or two there but ended up spending almost the whole day. Watching the birds were fun, too, and just sitting by the harbor and watching the boats go by was so relaxing and wonderful. My favorite place in Sydney.
