Peaceful. Nice break from the traffic and crowdsTrain would have been fun but a bit expensive for a family $20

Breathtaking... Well worth a visit.. Beautiful to wander around the gardens.. The trees are fantastic, such a wide variety.. The are stunning.. Peace and serenity in a busy city.. And best of all it's FREE too...

Great place for kids and parents. We had lunch in the cafe, rode the train and wandered all over the gardens. Lots of birds and grass for kids to enjoy. Gift shop is great place to pick up small things to take back home. Don't miss it, it is a must visit rain or shine.

Lovely to wander in the sunshine. Beautiful trees and green space, very well kept and full of happy people. Some lovely cafes along the route.
The gates are closed after dark.

A Garden with a View!. My trip to the Royal Botanic Gardens in Sydney was one of the highlights of my time in the city. The admission is free, the weather is usually amazing, and the views are spectacular from virtually anywhere inside the Gardens. What more could you want?I walked from my hotel in Darling Harbour to the Circular Quay area of Sydney Harbour, which took around 30 minutes. However, the walk was very pleasant, and I got to stroll through the historic district of The Rocks enroute. When at Circular Quay, it is only a matter of minutes to the world famous Royal Botanic Gardens of Sydney. The gardens are as much noted for their views of the resplendent Opera House as they are for its flora and fauna.Aside from the omnipresent seagulls, I saw lots of cranes and cockatoos when I was walking through the gardens, although to my disappointment, I did not see any lorikeets. However, it was still enjoyable to see those wild birds in such lush foliage as we see here at these gardens in Sydney. It must be heaven for birds in this park, with so many trees on which to perch, and so many little nooks and crannies in which to hide from the tourists.Another thing that impressed me here was the use of life-size statues to add character to the gardens. Not one hundred paces went by without seeing another eerie statue staring at me. I took plenty of photos of each of them, and occasionally you would get a great big tree or tropical plant next to one, which works wonders for photography!Although I did nothing but walk around these amazing gardens, and admire the views from within and across to the Opera House, I hazard a guess that it must be a very nice to have a picnic here in the autumnal sunshine. There is a café in the park, which gets very crowded throughout the day, but if I ever went back here I would pack myself a lunchbox and just sit around and people watch for an hour. Check out my video tour of the Sydney Botanic Gardens here: https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=_spHUy54hQI
Beautiful!. The Royal Botanic Garden, Sydney, is a place of natural beauty, where people come for peace, to learn more about plants and horticulture.
2000. Used to live a short walk away from here. Great place for taking a walk or just chilling out with friends in the sun having some food or drink on the grass. Great place.

nice way to relax~. this is a great relaxing walk. we tried to be law abiding but if I could do it again I would take lunch and a bottle of wine down there on a nice day and just relax. seemed to be what the locals did.

Great place to take a nap!. And really! do it!Just take a walk between the rare trees and flowers, find you epmty corner (which you can find easily), get you backpack on the floor and take a sleep while you can hear the waves and the birds.The best park EVER!!

Beautiful Royal Botanic Gardens in Sydney. Highly recommend hoping on the little Red Train to get around the gardens, great for kids and lots of information for the whole family.Best on a lovely sunny day, enjoy the whole area.
A walk in the park ....nice. Do spend the afternoon / evening there....like I did, it was breezy, cool and delightful and not to mention the blooming roses were beeeyootiful....great for couples :)

Magical place. A great getaway to nature in the midst of the hectic city. Fresh air and enjoyable quietness is a theme. Lying down on the grass in a sunny morning is also a pretty meditating experience.

A definite must. A Sydney visit without having been to these gardens would be a crying shame. These gardensare a sheer delight, an oasis in the middle of a big city, with grand views of the harbour andthe city skyline. Wonderful for walking, resting, and meditating. Also a greatl venue for a picnic.Do not miss!

Grogeous in summer. The gardens are stunning during the summer months but naturally not as pretty during winter. However, you get some stunning views of Sydney Harbour at any time of the year. It's a lovely place to just sit and watch the world go by or have a picnic under the trees. Certainly worth a visit.
Excellent. I love the whole experience, it was a bit smelly but that was part of the fun. Great for family or just alone time to think and reflect. definitely a place to visit at least once

Very interesting, tour guide recommended. We visited the gardens on a rainy day, but it still was beautiful with the giant bats and colourful flowers. We joined the guided tour which was exceptional. The guide was able to explain aboriginal knowledge and modern biology at the same moment making them seem very complementary. He included not only various plants, but also animals and stories of the history of the Sydney area.

Best thing to do in Sydney (after the Bridge hike). Gorgeous gardens, well maintained and marked. Several nice choices to eat. I love Botanical Gardens and this one is really special, and an easy walk from central Sydney hotels. By all means take a tour, and if you have extra questions as I did, sometimes you can snare a staff botanist to lead you on a private walk. I will go here every chance I get when passing through Sydney.

Nice set up close of Opera House. The gardens are close to the harbour area and an easy walk from the Opera House. They provide a nice break from the city and lead to some of the historical buildings such as the old parliament house.
Beautiful. Such a lovely place to walk through Spend as long as you like ,revisited a few times Nice cafe All freePlenty to see and explore

Beauty however tiring. The walk was absolutely beautiful. From the views to the harbor with its boating traffic to the gardens. However I found that there weren't many seats, a problem if you are disabled, and there wasn't any amenities or places to by a drink.

A must do in Sydney but don't expect too much. During my trip to Sydney I visited the gardens a number of times and enjoyed each visit. Off the bend of the Harbour there is a fantastic view of the opera house and Sydney bridge. Also, the grounds themselves are very nice. The gardens themselves weren't overly impressive compared to other botanical gardens - but that was likely due to the timing of our trip to Sydney.This is definitely a must see in Sydney.
Great park. Very clean and conveniently located near the harbour. The roses were in bloom and looks and smelled great.

Heaven. We visit Sydney often, and walking to and through the Botanic Gardens from the hotel is always the first thing to do. There are always new areas to discover and explore. The promenade around the water is beautiful, the collections are amazing. An absolutely fantastic asset to the city and part of the corridor of awesome open, green spaces through the city. Heaven.
Awesome!. Being here is just great. The atmosphere is relaxed, it is right on the water, overlooking the Opera House and harbour bridge. A must see!

Beautiful. We decided to walk through the gardens when we had a free day in Sydney. The grounds are well kept and luscious and there is information to be found on all the plants. You can also do tours through the gardens as well. The only downfall was the main eatery in the gardens was over run by birds that were pooing all over the tables and trying to eat your food as you sat there. When patrons would leave the birds would be on their plates in an instant. It was pretty disgusting! But overall the gardens was gorgeous

BEAUTIFUL VIEWS AND AMBIENCE. A must see to enjoy not only the gardens, but the views over the harbour. Much to see and enjoy and a lovely central café/toilets for a comfort break. One of my favourites was the herb gardens, which were very quiet with nice seating areas and an abundance of scents. Great to see the everyday and more unusual herbs used in out cooking.

a great visit - shame about the cafe and the toilets. The SBG is a very good garden. Lovely vistas, mostly well labelled trees, good paths and perfect morning out. But the cafe needs a manager who can motivate the staff to clean up. Tables were covered in litter at 1030. The adjacent toilets are a disgrace. They stink and need a thorough clean. certainly the worst public toilets in Australia.

Harbor, gardens, weather. Is there anything else?. This is a really beautiful spot. Accessible, picturesque and relaxing. Just a short walk from the city center along tree-lined walkways. Really an urban oasis.
Nice walk. We've seen nicer ones but it's free and the paths are well used. The gardens are sparse though. Nice place for walk.

Beautiful walk. I dont even remember when i saw such a beautiful place for the last time. Its very big and full of beautiful birds and plants. You just need to be careful for spider webs that are everywhere!

Stunning. Absolutely stunning. Gorgeous to walk around the grounds and they've got plants native to other regions (and information on them). Get lost in the gorgeous park right next to the urban jungle, you'll forget you're a stones throw from the city. Take a picnic and eat whilst looking of Sydney harbour.

Peace in the city. The gardens are beautiful and a nice respite away from the hustle and bustle of the city. There are so many unique plants I've never seen before and lovely fountains and statuary. And it's free!

lovely walk. lovely walk; a large open space with a lot of different species of trees. A great place for a picnic or a sit down at a cafe. The site includes flower gardens and all you would expect to find.

A slice of paradise. The Royal Botanic Gardens are an oasis in the middle of a busy city. The gardens are beautiful and the view over the harbour is wonderful- a perfect spot for photos and to relax and enjoy the view. Plenty of room to have a picnic or go for a stroll to take in the beauty.

Stunning. Walked through the botanic gardens most days during our stay and never bored of all the flowers, birds and not so pleasant spiders and huge spiders webs. The gardens are stunning - no other word for them and so well kept.
Beautiful. LOVED the gardens; nice and quiet and beautiful and plenty of views and interesting things to see. Rose garden awesome and the grounds are meticulously maintained.

Serene, peaceful lots of places to sit & admire the view. Go for a picnic or to get 30 minutes sanity time!! Right on the edge of the CBD, walk past the Opera House and thru the gardens. Lots to see if you have the time. Well labelled plants, nice café, lots of interesting places and buildings inside. you can spend hours there or just walk through.

Take a Stroll. You know when you're in for something unique when the sign to the garden entry encourages you to stop and smell the roses, walk on the grass and hug a tree! Unlike other botanical santuctuaries, this one encourages you to experience the flora and fauna by touching too. Lots of unique species reside here and the grounds are impeccable.

Botanic Gardens. The gardens are pretty and there is a lovely old church next to them where there seemed to be a few wedding groups having photos. The gardens are nice to walkthrough and relax on a hot day.

A giant park.. This is more like a giant , well-tended park with beautiful trees, and less of a Botanic Gdn. Nice cafe. Took the "choo-choo" train down to the Opera House. Cockatoos, Ibises, "Noisy Miner" birds in abundance. A good experience!
Interesting. Lots of interesting landmarks within the Botanic Garden area, like the Government House, The parliament House and The Mint Museum. Lots of greenery and plants to admire
Pleasant walk. Great place to spend an hour or so. Also great t walk through to get t the Art Gallery of NSW. Also liked the shop very much.

Beautiful gardens. We enjoyed a wonderful morning exploring the gardens. There is plenty to see and do. My 5yo enjoyed climbing the rock features and would have liked to paddle in the fountains. The maps were a bit hard to find, maybe a bigger sign.
Worth the time. Spend a lot of time enjoying the gardens as a place to relax and a walkthrough to Potts Point. FYI - In early morning the Sulphur-crested Cockatoo can be VERY noisy...

An oasis in the city. It was so peaceful that I forgot I was in the City and spent a relaxing afternoon strolling around the beautiful gardens even though there was a light drizzle. Sitting on one of the benches watching the world go by and birds and insects coming and going, I had the chance to admire the beautiful plants and I have fond memories of my visit.

Such a beautiful place.... The gardens are worth to visit. There is no entrance fee and you can spend the whole day with a lovely walk, picnic or taking photos in the gardens which are in the city but you have the feeling that you are in very romantic and peaceful nature. We visited the gardens few times and always enjoyed it so much. Just love it :-)
Very relaxing. The well maintained gardens are a delight to walk around or sit and relax with a picnic lunch. Great for people watching.
Stunning beauty. Take a nice slow stroll around the garden and you'll find yourself in the paradise. Enjoy yourself.:)
Hot Hot Hot. In the glaring sun of summer it is too hot for me. But should you be a hot weather person you will love it.

Expansive and gorgeous garden. We enjoyed leisurely walking through the many gardens. The tropical gardens were closed and undergoing renovation. Seeing the Sulphur-crested Cockatoo's flying around and feeding off the fig trees was a treat, and feeding the friendly Ibis's was also nice. The fresh water eels in the main pond were quite large.
Take your time .... I stayed in a hotel that was walking distance to the Botanic Gardens. They are truly stunning - plenty to see and with fabulous views over the Opera House and Bridge.
So relaxing, so beautiful. What a place! The ideal place to go to after a long day in the hectic city. Clean, quiet, relaxing, the place has it all. Loved every minute of it.

Photos and descriptions do not do it justice. . Please make it a point to reserve early morning hours (2+) for this. The sunrise over the Harbour is amazing and has to be seen in person to be truly appreciated.

One Visit is Not Enough. The Domain and Royal Botanic Gardens have so much to offer at so many levels that it'd difficult to know where to start. If one wants to see the harbour and the iconic views of the Bridge and Opera House this is the place to do it from. If one wants to see plants and birds and trees and study them or just relax and enjoy them then this is a very rewarding place to do it. If one is a walker or jogger or runner then join the throngs on the Domain paths doing just that (it's busy at lunchtime it has to be said). It's quieter in the Gardens. There's plenty of opportunity for food and drink and bathroom facilities. It's possible to mingle or be alone. One can spend time watching people play chess on the big outdoor board in the shade or once can have a game. One thing you can't do is go to Sydney and not visit the Royal Botanic Gardens.

Idyll in the city. We used the road train ride, which certainly comes recommended as an introduction to the Gardens. Could spend hours wandering, absorbing the plants and the views, or simply using the Gardens as a park. Given lots of time, you could have a really seriously interesting academic botanising time there too.
Great stroll. These gardens are beautifully placed, near the water. Walked in them two different days. Lovely spot for wandering and relaxing.
Brilliant in every sense. Too good. Clean, Humungous, great walk, has many sitting areas, excellent for kids and taking pictures.
Nice retreat.. In the midst of this big city are the lovely gardens to wander through and see the harbor. Lots of local trees and good descriptions on signs. Have a lunch in the cafe.

Relaxing and inspiring. After a couple of busy days wrapped up in the hustle bustle of the City, the Royal Botanic Gardens was a most welcome escape. The gardens are beautiful, relaxing and a fantastic diversification to help recharge ones batteries!Highly recommended

Nice walks. Situated next to the Opera House this is an ideal stroll thru the various plants and trees.Lovely views over the city.Look out for(although you can't miss them)the parakeets and cockatoos with all their calls.If you are 'lucky' they may land on your head.A truly lovely experience.Thankyou Sydney

Definitely worth a visit. Of the 3 we saw in Eastern Australia - Melbourne, Adelaide, and Sydney - this was a close second to Melbourne: the hothouse was closed, and a number of name labels were missing. Still, it is a lovely island of tranquility in this busy city.

Nice walk; not extraordinary. We enjoyed walking through and around this botanic garden, but frankly did not find it as interesting, impressive or well-organized as others in Australia (Melbourne and Perth in particular). Still, a nice afternoon!

clean, tidy and very scenic. as my title says, it was very warm and we spent a good few hours here. the gardens are very nice and very clean and tidy. lovely views of the bridge and opera house as well in certain locations

To lazy to walk. I am usually walking a lot when visiting new cities. But I did not have the energy to walk the botanic garden so I was very happy to learn that they have this mini train going through the garden ! I used it and got to see the garden. Which is very nice indeed !
Lovely place for a walk. This is a 75 acre park in the heart of the city, with herb gardens, flowers, tropical displays, artwork and walkways throughout.
Stunning and relaxing,full of unusual trees and birds !. Loved walking around here.Very large gardens full of interesting trees and shrubs,very peaceful and cockatoos everywhere ,just gorgeous !

An oasis of calm in a busy city!. Lovely amenity at the side of the Opera House although signage could be improved as easy to miss for new visitors to the area.Some improvement works being carried out along the pathway at then side of the gardens so some small detours necessary but this does not really affect the pleasure of visit to these gardens. From Friday to Sunday it is also possible to visit the Governor's residence within the Gardens and well worth a visit to learn some of the history of the area and the first settlers.

If you have any interest in plants or just like a pleasant walk. If you have any interest in plants or just like a pleasant walk through beautiful gardens, do not miss going to the Botanic Gardens.If you have a green thumb (or dream of having one) you will find endless inspiration here.Some of the plants are just utterly jaw-dropping!Even if you just go for a walk through the immaculately maintained gardens and always lush green lawns, you will not have wasted one second, no matter how long you stay.

Delightful!. We were lucky enough to stay in a hotel to the east of the city. This meant we had to cross the Botanical Gardens to access ferries and the city centre. What a joy to meander through these gardens and stop a while. We took in one of the guided walks, 10.30 and 1.00 every weekday, when one of their knowledgeable volunteers showed us his favourite parts of the garden. There is always something different to look at. If you start at the Finger Wharf as we did, follow the water around Mrs Macguires walk to view the harbour, then around the next headland to the Opera House. This will give you a taste of the size of the gardens. We walked these gardens every day for five days and discovered more...an absolute treasure!

Place to get away from the bustle.. What a wonderful place! Well laid out, with a huge variety of flora. This free attraction is a must see. The views of the opera house and the bridge are not to be missed. On-line you can find walking tours as well as a description of each of the statuary. Look at their website.

My favourite spot in Sydney. Relax, unwind, have a picnic and take in the scenic surroundings, or go for wander and get lost in all the splendid sights and sounds of what nature used to be like in Sydney. Glasshouse is a must see. Great photo opportunities for tourists around every corner. Do visit!

Beautiful Gardens. We spent 11 days in Sydney and enjoyed our runs & walks around the Botanic Gardens ~ this was one our favourite spots in the City and has some of the best views of the Harbour. Not to be missed!
Beautiful tranquil place. Couldn't believe the extent of the beautiful plants and trees in the middle of a city. Walking through here each day really added to our experience of Sydney

A great place to leave Sydney behind you. A great place to leave behind the bustle of a great city. Flanked by water on two sides this is a huge green area to walk, sit or explore the many monuments, art and statues. It also has lots of shade. For those that dont want to or cant walk there is a small roadtrain that does a 25 minute tour. You can get this at the Opera House end.
An oasis in the middle of the city. Beautiful old trees and sweeping lawns and gardens here. Catch a free guided tour to get the most from your visit. You can happily spend all day here.

a haven of greenery. Although beware the joigging masses, I thought the saying g was "mad dogs and Englishmen" but now feel it should be "mad dogs and Australian fitness fanatics go jogging in the midday sun." Some may even find them adding to the views. Routes are clearly laid out, and as a single traveller I felt very safe. Found a lovey little cafe in the middle, great views of the bridge and opera house and an exit out to the opera house where I carried on my walk.

Amazing walk!. Very nice place to have a stroll around and relax. Nice views, great for picnics and playing. would recommend going on the afternoon, to be able to visit as a whole. Sydney conservatorium of music is also a nice visit.. You can easily access this from the top of Martin Place or from the Opera House. It is free to walk around and enjoy the well manicured lawns and get the best photo opportunity of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge.

A nice refugee. The Royal Botanical Gardens is a nice place to take a break from the hustle and bustle of downtown Sydney. Very peaceful, great scenarios, good for walk , meditate, bird watching or just to seat on the grass and relax.

Great landscape. The highlight of the garden is that it is adjacent to Opera House. The scale of the garden is impressive. However, do not expect to see big scale flowering plants. The gift shop in the garden sells good quality hats for shielding the strong sun. We bought the Chu Chu train ticket and were able to enjoy the view through a nice rate as my mum has difficulty walking the big garden.

How beautiful is our city. Have been many times you can always see something difernt there, so many little areas from the cactus area to Rose garden , have a coffee , lunch in the cafe its indoors or out, walk to end and back see the boats go by very pleasant and all for free to view.
Lovely Walk. Close to Sydney Opera House, a lovely walk on our first day in the city. There was quite a few boot camps and personal trainers around.
Utterly beautiful. The range and diversity of floral life in the gardens is like nothing I have ever seen. You could spend a day just walking round admiring the beauty of the displays.

Lovely stroll through the gardens. It was a warm and sunny day when my wife and I decided to walk from our hotel in Potts Point area to Mrs. Macquaries Point. The park was alive with Sunday visitors and there grounds were well kept. Along the walk we strolled through the Royal Botanic Garden and thoroughly enjoyed the pleasantness of the grounds. There was an African music concert taking place and I assume there are many activities that occur in the area on weekends. Stoll to the point of the park and get a good look at the Sydney Opera House and the Sydney Harbour bridge from a different perspective. Also you will be able to see Fort Denison from the tip of the park. Enjoy

Beautiful gardens and free. Walked through these large gardens and they are lovely. Highlight was the large white parakeets that are very friendly and come down to feed and will even land on your arms and head. A lovely tranquil location in a city.
Loved them and the Fountain. Beautifully maintained and very green.We walked through every section.Loved the statues and fountains.A lovely oasis in the middle of town
Stunning garden with spectacular views. A beautiful, peaceful garden set in the centre of a bustling city! Grab a lunch and picnic on the lawns in the shade of the trees.

Great park with view of the water. The central park is enjoyed by many in various activities. Got a chance to see a wedding on Saturday afternoon, right on the waterfront. Mixture of flower gardens and wide open spaces with a view of the bridge and the Opera House and boats on the water. Very spacious and clean.

A must every time we visit Sydney. Just a pleasure to walk around and enjoy the trees, views, and even the enormous bats!
Don't miss the eels in the lower lake.
Take Some Time Out. I took a wander through the gardens on my last trip to Sydney. Loved it. Had lunch in the restaurant too. My favourite spot was the fragrant herb garden.

Beautiful!. My husband and I walked through here twice; once during the day, and another time during the evening to get some pictures of the Opera House and Bridge. These gardens are a great way to spend some some, and it's completely free of charge.
Peaceful Walk. Expansive gardens, many paths that are well marked. Specimens are labelled. Overall, a beautiful area to walk through and enjoy nature.

Red train tour. This tour was terrible! We are a family of three children, parents and grand parents who bought tickets. One of the adults in our party could not reach the train before it left and the guide refused to stop and let mom board with her children. She was 50 feet away. We asked the driver to stop, but she refused. Mom had to chase the train to the 2nd stop to board, while we all watched. The tour guide was unkind and gave a robotic presentation. At the end of the tour she huffed off and gave us dirty looks.

Very relaxing. The garden is extensive and very relaxing . We spent about 2 hours in the gardens and could have easily spent more time. The variety of trees and flowers was truly amazing. You also get an excellent view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge from Mrs. Macquarie's Point.  Our only disappointment were the crowds around Mrs. Macquarie's Chair. At the time we were there tour buses from a couple of cruise ships were constantly dropping off hordes of people at the point. Just getting a good photograph of the rock ledge seat was difficult.

Peace and tranquility. Beautiful, simply beautiful. I loved being able to walk around and just admire the scenery and even though plenty of people were walking the gardens it felt incredibly peaceful and quiet. A really enjoyable 2-3 hours and some wonderful photo opportunities - do not pass up the chance to go here.
Superb and best in the World. How could you miss out on the gardens, we have been there 4 times out of the last 5. They are absolutely Superb and not to be missed many times over.

Lucky Sydney city dwellers. What a lovely location for a park. Beautiful harbor views, the Opera house and bridge. A great place to walk, relax and people and/or water watch. I loved watching the wild Lorikeets and cucoktoos eating and flying around.

Beautiful Place. What a great place to escape the noise of one of the best cities in the world. Walk into the gardens and the volume is switched off! This is a lovely place to wander around, read a book and take in the view.
A visit to the Governor's House is very worthwhile and is free.

A peaceful oasis in town. During our three week stint in Sydney, passed thru the Gardens a number of times. Really nicely laid out and welcoming. Not too formal but more pleasantly neat. Nothing beats sitting on the grass under the shade of some of the magnificent trees with a picnic. Away from the noise of town, with a view down to the water.
Peaceful haven. Lovely gardens where signs actually say "please walk on the grass". Walk through them to Mrs Macquarie's Chair for great views.
Amazing place to visit. So many things to see, but prepare to walk a lot as the botanic gardens are huge. There are sometimes bats in some of the trees which could startle unsuspecting tourists.
breathtaking. Nice afternoon walk..beautiful garden and sculptures. Try to bring your own water so you don't have to buy it at the garden cafe.

Lovely park to spend a few hours in. Great open space for a picnic or walk, lots of different plants and areas. Great views of the city. Good cafe for a break with delicious fresh juices and ice-creams.

What a lovely place!!!. Royal Botanical Gardens - SydneyIf you enjoy spending a nice time in a quiet, relaxing environment, walking or sitting and admiring nature around you, this is the place!The Sydney Royal Botanical Gardens occupy a large area close to Sydney Opera House, and it is really pleasant, with its beautiful trees (lovely pine trees, some other very old trees with amazing roots and trunks), ponds, flower beds, sculptures, among other nice things.From it, you can enjoy lovely views of the Opera House and also admire the boats sailing the calm waters.Can you imagine?I observed, on the other hand, that the Royal Botanical Gardens are also used for events attracting large audiences, as one of these were being prepared when I visited it. Among the things I enjoyed most in my visit, I should mention: the lotus flowers, the oriental garden and to observe the lovely cockatoo birds at close distance.

A Peaceful Day. The gardens are large and very peaceful. It is nice to spend a morning, afternoon, or evening walking and just relaxing. I would recommend staying 2-3 hours.
You can get stunning views from with both the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour Bridge from a great vantage point in the Botanical Gardens (I believe it is called Mrs Macquaries Point).

Just beautiful very relaxing. Brilliant day in the botanical garden extremely clean,can have a picnic or just walk around easy to navigate around the gardens you can even get married in the Gardens very pretty

Just wonderful. After three weeks holiday in Australia this is the location I look back on with the fondest memories. An oasis of peace and quiet with a wonderful selection of trees and plants spread over a wide area including views of the harbour, the Opera House and the bridge. Simply a joy to be there.

Great open space. There is so much room to wander and look at the trees and plants. Good layout with well signposted areas. Good place to find out about native plants. Great for a picnic and also good tearooms and snacks available.
just gorgeous. Harbor views to die for and superb botanical gardens.very close to the art gallery of new south Wales which was wonderful and free

Perhaps the best located gardens in the world. The botanic gardens are true to name, showing many varieties of plants and plenty of information about them - but what makes this place truly fantastic is that it is located right on the edge of Sydney harbour. It's also free! Plus you can walk, play and picnic on the grass, watch for the bats and visit some exhbitions. Not to be missed.
I love these Gardens. I could spend all day in the gardens. I loved walking through the garden and just watching the world go by. Everyone should visit this garden when they are in Sydney.
Beautiful and fabulous views of the harbour. Really lovely to walk around - closes around sunset so don't get locked in! Lovely views, lovely trees and flowers and lots of wonderful birdlife.

Lovely place for nature lovers. After a short drive around the main areas of the city and a short stop at Sydney Opera House, to buy tickets for the evening, we headed to Bondi beach area but my mother-as a nature lover- insisted on to visit Botanic Garden first. So we spend about an hour in the park with a fast walking.Sydney botanic garden is a very well kept garden with lovely flowers, birds, large trees, fresh air, people doing sports and some art installations.

Great Views While Enjoying the Gardens!. We enjoyed a relaxing morning touring the gardens and walking the paths along the water with awesome views. You can spend an hour or half day if you want to just wander and have lunch in the gardens. Not to be missed…and close to the Sydney Opera House and the Rocks to combine multiple activities.

fabulous treasure in central city. beautifully cared for, wide variety of plantings all enhanced by outlooks across water to the harbour, bridge, opera house.
A real retreat yet so close to central city
Lovely gardens. We took a tour on the small "train" around the gardens which are beautiful in themselves. The tour is great value and very interesting.

A good way to spend a few hours. If you find yourself with time to spare ( perhaps waiting the departure of a cruise ship ? ) , this is an ideal place to spend time . It is within 10 minutes walk of the international cruise terminal and offers a large area with plenty of botanical interest and good views looking towards the Harbour bridge and Opera House . Tip...Drop our luggage off at the ship but don't board until nearer departure time ....some cruises ( including ours ) do not allow you to come off once you are registered aboard .

What a lovely walk. Lay down and relax enjoying great views from the harbour.The botanical gardens are beautiful and the atmosphere is really relaxing. I love to spend afternoons walking around and sit down on tbe grass for a picnic.It is a must see

Away from the hustle and bustle. Piece and quiet awaits you and the sights and smells of the exotic plants surround you with views of Sydney Harbour to die for, with many interesting museums within the grounds of the gardens .

Loved walking through the gardens!. We stayed in Elizabeth Bay and were lucky to be told the route to walk from there to Circular Quay via Pott's Point and through the Botanic Gardens. we went several times taking a different path in the gardens each time - there was just so much to see! We loved each visit!
Huge sprawling and totally wonderful. Well kept and varied gardens in the midst of a huge city.The walks are cool under spectacular trees with statues and curios of all types along the way

Royal Picnic at The Gardens. The Sydney Royal Botanic Gardens is an excellent place for travelers to visit because it links together other Sydney highlights.You can enter the gardens after visiting the Opera House. Just follow the path along the water and you're in there!If you are interested in plants there are a variety of sections you can visit, I like the Palm Grove very much.There are sprawling lawns and huge oak trees under which you can shelter from the sun on a hot day.If you are inclined you can visit the herbarium and the greenhouses. Though these can be hot and humid.Grab some food at the restaurant in the middle of the park, it's a little pricey but top quality.If you prefer, the snack bar underneath has pies, sandwiches etc at reasonable take away prices.Depending on your interest, you can spend a couple of hours to a whole day at the gardens.
Beautiful and peaceful. I'd say this is one of my top 5 favourite things to do in Sydney, and it's free! Take a walk along the harbour to Mrs Macquarie's Chair for a picnic and enjoy the view!

Peaceful, amazing views. A very special place in the heart of Sydney. Stunning views across the harbour, plenty of places to sit and watch the world go by or lie down and gaze at the clouds. The rose gardens are lovely.
Australia's history in plants. Beautiful gardens in the heart of the city. Take the guided walk to get a fascinating insight into not only the plants but the founding of Australia and Sydney.

Absolutely amazing!!!. Probably the best botanic garden i have ever seen. You should make like 2 hours time and just walk, look, smell, enjoy...its pleasure for all your senses. And the best is that you can make even picnic with lovely view of Sydney opera house. Its definitely must see place while you are in Sydney!

Lazy day in the gardens. Beautiful laid out gardens, with formal areas and natural areas. They actively encourage you to bring a picnic and sit on the lawns. The toilets are clean, but there arent too many of them.Hundreds of varieties of plants and trees, all labelled. very easy to spend a day in here, looking, lazing and wandering.

tranquil walk. This is a lovely respite if you have been trudging around the city .It is a good way to connect visiting the Opera House with a visit to the art gallery or just getting back to the heart of the city.

Best botanic gardens we have ever seen. Just amazing, flowers everywhere. Wonderful colors, took lots of pictures. Walked for hours. Paths and directions well marked. Must see while visiting Sydney. Favorite local spot for weddings.

Great setting, lovely trees. If you're into trees and plants, you will really enjoy this array of species, both endemic and those introduced later. But even if you're not a plant enthusiast, you are bound to enjoy yet another tranquil, well-maintained and picnic-perfect place right in the middle of the metropolis. It's awesome to see the magnificent trees with the background of all the business centre buildings. I believe white collars from other countries really have something to envy here! The entry is free of charge.

A tranquil place. Just a short stroll from the opera house the Royal Botanic Gardens are a lovely with one end rolling down to the sea, with great look out points, and stretching right back into the city. Apart from the many plant/tree species there were interesting sculptures dotted around and lots of birds.
Good walk in the cactus garden.. We spent the whole day at the different gardens maybe an hour with the cacti. The views of the bay and the Opera House are well worth the walk.
Fab corner inside he city centre. They're well maintained and make a great escape from the skyscrapers. You can walk on the grass which is quite unusual for somewhere so pretty
Worth a visit. The gardens are pretty and well maintained. A very safe walk. Lots of joggers and visitors. Very close to the heart of everything in Sydney

Stroll through the gardens. Much more of a park like setting with lots of open space. We saw sculptures, many different types of plants and most of all a lot of different birds. Right next to the Opera house and easy to walk around.

relax and unwind. walked to the gardens from the opera house just to unwind,nice short stroll around the gardens,plenty of big trees for shelter.lovely view here to take in the habour views and the magicial sight of the opera house.
good place for a nap as the trees add a tranguil setting and coolness at this time of year.....loved the cool grass..

Beautiful Botanic Gardens. A visit to the Botanic Gardens wasn't something we had planned to do on our trip to Sydney, Australia. However we had less than a couple of hours to wait before our tour of the Opera House so walked over to the Botanic gardens, so glad we did. We saw the Choo Choo train and as this trip only lasts 25mins booked two seats on the next train as best way of seeing the park hi-lights in a limited time. You can get on and off the train at four different pointd in the park, have a wonder around and jump back on the next train. Loads of unusual plants, trees and sculpture pointed out whilst on the train by the driver. Would have been great to have spent a half day here but time didn't allow, a relaxing spot in the busy city.

Beautiful gardens...and free. This is a wonderful garden in the center of the city. Easy to walk around, and there are small guided tours with volunteers should you want to spend time this way. There is also a "train" ride thru the gardens if walking isn't for you. Highly recommend.

Picturesque beauty in the heart of the CBD. Take a picnic and enjoy the beauty that the Royal Botanic Gardens has to offer. The grounds are beautifully maintained and the views over the Harbour are unparalleled. A beautiful way to spend the day in the heart of the CBD.

Great way to spend a few hours. A walk around the botanic gardens in the summer is lovely - there are some beautiful shade trees to relax under and some great garden displays to wander through. There's also a great view along the harbour front.
Nice park. A lovely park in the middle of a busy city.Ideal to relax in and good views of the harbour and opera house
Jumping fish. The botanical gardens are lovely, with a range of different sections and layouts. In the pond there are jumping fish, to quick to get a picture of but fun to watch!

Lovely.. This is a wonderful botanical gardens and it is nice to step away from the city a bit and look at all the nice plants and wild life. A breath of fresh air. A beautiful place and I will return.

Great place for a stroll. A great respite from the bustling city. My tween & teen thought this was one of the best parts of Sydney...they are not city-loving kids. Check out the eels in the pond. Interesting art installations. Many Ibis and Moorhen, also noisy cockatoos in one area. Good people watching. Beautiful views.

Tranquil refuge from the city. These beautiful gardens provide a welcome oasis of calm within easy striking distance of the Opera House and City Centre. Free entry and stunning views of harbour bridge, Opera House etc. . Watch out that you don't get mown down by phalanx of joggers with headphones but don't miss it.

A great city park, beautifully landscaped. I was so glad that we made time to tour the Botanical gardens. It's nicely laid out and well-manicured with many beauful vistas. There's a good variety of trees, flowers, palms. A great place for relaxing, soaking up some rays, bird (and people) watching.
always loved gardens. I have always loved flora fauna and this is just a perfect place to observe the birds the garden, really I love this place!!
Wonderful sights and sounds. You could spend a day in here. The flora and fauna are wonderful. A very peaceful and relaxing oasis in a wonderful city.
Delightful city park. A large, beautiful urban oasis. Many areas, great for strolling, looking at birds, the bay, and trees. Many runners.

Beautiful place to visit and walk through. The Botanic Gardens are a magnificent place to explore, walk through or sit and read quietly in. I recommend walking from the Art Gallery or the Domain to the Opera House via the Gardens.

Beautiful, well-maintained botanical gardens and park. On a sunny afternoon in Sydney, these botanical gardens offer a green respite from the busy streets of downtown. We only had time to visit a few of the areas in the park, and we were impressed. The plants are well marked and beautifully arranged along easy to stroll walking paths. Our kids had a great time scampering around the boulders and paths as well as stopping to see some of the unusual plants. There was always another statue, pond, or flowerbed to see around each corner along the path. We walked out along the point to Mrs Macquaries Chair and enjoyed the great views of downtown Sydney, the Opera House, and the Harbour Bridge across the water. We saw boats cruising by and could get down to the water in spots.

Simply Beautiful. We didn't get to see all of the gardens. And that is after going on two separate days. What we did see was gorgeous. The views of the Harbour are some of the best. The gardens themselves are diverse. There is so much to do and see. It is hard to describe. It is best if you just go and see for yourself.

A beautiful respite from sightseeing. The gardens are simply gorgeous. It is so incredible that the Government has left this prime real estate (outstanding harbor vies) untouched and untouchable. The variety of gardens, ponds and trees are amazing and it is just minutes away from the bustle of CBD and Opera House. A great way to walk through on the way to Darlinghurst or other parts of Sydney.

Royal Botanic Gardens.Sydney. Overlooking the Harbour with great views Join a guided walk led by a knowledgeable volunteer to learn about the plants and animals located in the Garden as well as the Garden’s history.So much space with plenty to see & explore and well sign posted so close to city Check out what’s on: http://www.rbgsyd.nsw.gov.au/welcome/royal_botanic_garden/Whats_on
Heaven on earth !. There are no words to describe this place. All the colors of the plants, wide grases, tropical trees, the opera view and the water in between. WOW !

The green heart of the city. The Botanic Gardens are one of the reasons Sydney is my favourite city in the world. Being able to walk around the green open spaces is a luxury you don't find everywhere. And I love the signs - here in England you wouldn't be encouraged to walk on the grass, hug the trees and talk to the birds ;-)

Beautiful gardens for free. Just beyond the Opera House from Circular Quay are Sydney's Royal Botanical Gardens. These cover a vast area right in the city centre and are free to use.The park is home to a vast array of plants, trees and birds and also the views from it are magnificent. We can recommend walking a little further round the first bay to Mrs Macquarie' Chair for more super views.If you have time, include a tour of the Governor's House inside the park. Entrance is free and the tour is excellent.

Beautiful gardens to take a walk or rest from the city. A magical part of Sydney, which is unfortunately no secret to the countless tourists! It's a beautiful and well kept park that makes a nice break from the often hectic city with easy access to the Opera and harbour area.

An oasis of calm. The streets of Sydney are busy with traffic and tourists. Not so, the Royal Botanic Gardens. It is nice to have the option to walk to the harbour through the gardens, rather than on the busy streets. The gardens are large and quickly the sounds of traffic fade away. There are many tropical plants, and birds, and pathways to get lost on. There are lots of grassy areas on which to take a rest.
Beautiful gardens. These gardens are not too big to walk through and there is lots of lovely plants to look at. A must when you are visiting Sydney.
A beautiful way to the Circular Quay. This was a lovely, immense garden that made for people-watching as we walked each day. Enjoy a variety of vegetation and beautiful gardens.

Magical Gardens. Take a few hours to wander through Sydney's Botanical Gardens, then end up at the Art Gallery and restaurant for lunch - the perfect morning out. A great variety of trees and plants and bird life. Well worth the walk.
Paradise in a City!. Really great place to walk, relax and picnic in the heart of Sydney! The variety of the flora is great! Don't expect Central Park or Hyde Park but it is a nice place to visit.

Amazing spot for New Years Eve. We paid quite a bit to celebrate New Years Eve here. You can get free entry if you turn up very, very early on 31st December, and the free area is packed tight, and behind a large fence.If you pay, you get your very own camping chair (that you can take home), a lovely gourmet hamper, and we got front row seats. The view we got was of the Opera House, with the Bridge behind. The best spot for the New Year Fireworks.Perfect. I would highly recommend the Botanic Gardens for New Years Eve. You only live once though, so pay for an amazing view

Haven in the Midst of the City. The Gardens are large, beautiful, and tranquil. Although they are well-used and full of people walking, reading, sunbathing, and picnicking, they feel worlds away from the bustle of the Harbor and Sydney's Central Business District. Fingerpost signs provide guidance to specific areas including the distance and walking time to each. There is ample shade from large, old trees as well as flower gardens throughout, a lake, and specialty areas of herbs, cactus and succulents. For anyone seeking some serenity or a great place to walk or jog, this is the place –– an easy walk from either the Harbor or the CBD.
A Tranquil Oasis. The Royal Botanic Gardens are stunning and very large. It is easy to get lost but there are occasional signposts to get you back on track. Highly recommended
Average garden.. Too many tourists ruining the garden. Other then that, everything else is okay. Nothing spectacular about it. Glad it's not dodgy at night too.
Wonderful. Brilliant place for picnics over looking the Harbour`,no dislikes.Can view Government House most days...saw a couple of weddings taking place.
A lovely garden. A lovely garden with a great variety of plants and trees. The location is just great! We loved the scenery and the atmosphere. It was a great pleasure to have a walk in the garden.
Somewhat Disapointing. Maybe it was the time of year but I was disappointed by the lack of flowers. Also the ongoing work on the sea wall spoiled some of the views.

Calm and tranquility alonside the hustle and bustle of Sydney CBD. Really enjoyed wandering aimlessly through these gardens - just a stones throw from Circular Quay and Macquerie Street - taking in the great views and finding one's own little patch of tranquility to chill. Only downside was the number of joggers reminding me that I really should be doing a little more exercise myself. :)

Gardens are nice, views along the harbour walk are better. The gardens were nice, but they were not the typical botanic gardens I thought I would see (eg rows of roses and other flowers). These gardens are mostly made of greenery with places to relax and enjoy some of the nice views. That being said, it is a nice area with places to read a book, take a nice walk, or relax with a nap. Could even be called romantic if you took a picnic. The walk along the harbour (Circular Quay) to Mrs. Macquaries Chair really do provide the best views and photo ops so it's worth a trip.

Beautiful park. Walked through the park several times to and from my hostel. Nice to have such a large park close to the downtown and great to see it being used by people just relaxing on a nice evening.
Oasis in the city. I went for several walks here during my lunch hours while in Sydney on business recently. Like Central Park, it is a shady and green oasis in the middle of a busy city.

great place to chill. interesting place to walk in relatively calm surroundings, interesting plants and wildlife. They seem to have got rid of all the bats, which although were causing all sorts of problems, were interesting for tourists

Wonderful gardens and a so-so cafe. I have to say that as botanical gardens go this is one of the good ones though I do think the one in Edinburgh is better as is the Melbourne version. Still, the setting is stunning and the views to and across the most beautiful harbour in the world compensate. So it is worth walking off the beaten track and exploring the various nooks and corners. The cafe, popular with families and children, is, however, average and the counter system far from efficient.

Blissful afternoon on the last day of the year. Shady trees, stunning views, coffee shop, people relaxing, romancing, spending time with family and friends. Simply a perfect place to while a way a few hours.

A great day for the family. Whenever I am in Sydney, this is a favorite place to hang out with my family. Breathtaking beauty as you enjoy the flora in the gardens and the views of Sydney Harbour.Take a blanket and a picnic lunch. This is Sydney's best free spot and you can easily pass an afternoon here.

Botanic Gardens. Well worth a visit even if you are not into all the plants and don't have green fingers. Very spacious grounds and a great place for a picnic. For $5 you can take a train journey around the gardens if you are not feeling that agile for the walk.
Lovely Walk. Really pretty to walk around, and a great view of the Opera House and Harbour bridge for pictures. Make sure to check out the wishing tree!

Great Garden. The herb garden was our favorite part of this garden. We also enjoyed the walk through the garden to the Opera House. Might take one all day to really visit this garden. I would state it is a top 10 attraction in Sydney.
Must see if you have time in Sydney. Beautifully laid out gardens, be careful you might get lost, tranquillity very close to the bustling city. The café is good too.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful gardens with interesting plants and trees for we, UK , visitors. Lots of photo opportunities.
relaxing way to spend an hour. these are not as good as the Melbourne gardens in our opinion but well worth an hours relaxing stroll and great views of the harbour too

NYE's in Lawn with a View in the RBG. When we decided to spend NYE’s in Sydney, we decided to look around and see if we actually need to pay to get into an event, or if we can just stay in one of the free vantage points. On further research, we learned that to get a good spot to view the fireworks, we would have to line up early on the 31st of December – and I mean as early as 9am. The advantage is that it’s free – the disadvantage is more than 12hrs wasted on lining up and saving our spot, crowded public toilets, crowded spaces, etc, etc.So we decided that since we are just visiting Sydney for the NYE’s celebrations, might as well make the most of it. We chose the Royal Botanic Gardens’ (RBG) Lawn with a View Event for 2 reasons: It still had good views based on the photos, and it is the least expensive of the 3 events that RBG offers. We paid ~$250 each for the privilege of not having to line up early – we only went to the gate at 6.30pm and were there with plenty of time to spare before the gates opened. We managed to secure a good spot (sort of in the front, but with the view above the grills covering the harbor bridge. There seemed to be a sufficient amount of space for the number of people allowed in. Our only gripe is around 8pm – a large group of Brits decided to squish themselves on the small amount of space between our blanket and the next group’s – if it was just 1 or 2 people, it would have been fine, but they were 6 or so. This drew the ire of the people around them, but they didn’t care. They were very loud and drunk early on and didn’t have any respect for the people who were there first. There were more than enough spaces further at the back which would have accommodated them. I think since we all paid a good amount of money, there should have been some intervention from the many staff in the area to prevent incidents like this.The entrance fee also includes a gourmet picnic dinner – which was quite good. It had a bottle of water, bread roll, bread sticks, dipping sauce, fruits, dessert, and roast chicken for the mains. One hamper of food was sufficient for two people. The other hamper ended up being partly eaten halfway through the night. There’s a licensed bar inside the venue which sells alcoholic beverages for a reasonable price – 1 bottle of sparkling wine was $38 – shared among 4 people, this wasn’t so bad.There was live entertainment through the night care of two guys. This went on until about 9pm – before the first fireworks show, and until 11.30pm before the main fireworks.The view was quite good – we were very near the harbor bridge. However, because the Opera House was also right in front of us, we didn’t manage to appreciate the scale of the fireworks encompassing the whole harbor bridge/opera house section. From the photos we saw afterwards, we now realize why Macquarie’s chair is a popular spot, and why the other two events hosted by RBG near that area are more expensive.Overall, I would say this is a good event to go to if you want to have good views of the fireworks on the harbor bridge and if you want to save time in lining up and waiting for the fireworks. For another extra $50 or so though, I think the Midnight at the Oasis would have been a better value event as you can see both the opera house and the harbor bridge light up with fireworks.

Relaxing. Relaxing and enjoy walking much here. Freedom totally at weekend! Open eyes here with a variety of plants. This is a suitable place for picnic on weekend! More leisure for family with young children
The best park i have ever seen!. Stunning views of the harbor, and the Sydney opera house, we walked for hours, beautiful statues and gardens in each corner of the park, well worth a visit.

Beautiful, peaceful, well tended. I just LOVED strolling around the RBG, admiring its huge trees, funny plants, flowers, areas ... you can easily spend hours there and not realize how time flies. If you like parks and greenery, then you should add the RBG to your list of sights to see. The shop has an appealing and wide range of gift items to buy which are of good quality and not the usual "touristy" stuff you can buy elsewhere. So make sure you do stop by.There is also a café and a restaurant, and free guided tours (check their webpage for times).

A lovely walk. Had a long walk through these very large gardens. We were lucky as the day we chose had cloudy patches. It was lovely to see various species of plants only seen in books and also to see and hear the wildlife. Some of the trees are beautiful and so old, well old for Australia!!Definitely worth a relaxing wander through.
Relax and enjoy Sydney. While Sydney is busy, in the Botanic Gardens you can relax in the city. It's big and a nice spot to have a picknick.
Great sea wall views.. Next to the Opera House, cafe in the park.You can walk around the point to Woolloomooloo bay.Or visit Government House.

the best views of the opera house. The gardens are in the middle of the city and right next to the ocean. When you walk to the end of the garden to Mrs. Macquaries point you can the best views of the Sydney harbor bridge and the Sydney opera house together.
Peace and tranquility in the big city.. Beautiful views of the harbour, lush gardens and scenery, a great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the city.
awesome gardens. so much space with plenty to see & explore well sign posted so close to city really had a great walk enjoying the gardens so clean & tidy will recommend

Lovely and Free activity. With many winding paths along lovely trees, plants, vegetation and the harbor, you can walk or run until you drop. There are also multiple benches to rest on and play areas for children to play. The views are varied and interesting. Very colorful flowers, the opera house, and the harbor bridge can be seen from the paths. Don't rush through this area. It is lovely.

A Stroll In The Park. A lovely gardens to while away half a day, they actually encourage you to touch the plants and trees, picnic on the grass and take in the views. Plenty of birds and the walkways are well signposted with toilets free water stops and great views of the city skyline and harbour, take a picnic and enjoy the gardens.

Excellent city centre gardens. We're not botanic experts but had an enjoyable hour or two in the gardens. My favourite aspects were the views back to the city centre skyscrapers, plus the views from near Mrs Macquarie's Seat, from where there's an excellent view of the Sydney CBD, Opera House and Harbour Bridge all together.

Beautiful!. The gardens are so beautiful! A wonderful place to stroll on a nice day. I wish there were more directions--I was looking for the aboriginal garden and never found it. Had a lovely time anyway!

WOW.... Really, there's nothing to dislike about this place. It was AWESOME to say the least. Open spaces with lots of flora and fauna on display. Best to come in the afternoon, take a stroll and then lie on your back in the open fields. Very relaxing place.

Beautiful Garden. it's a long and large garden, calm and serene. Good for little picnics, and a great place to admire nature. a big thanks to the people who looks after it because it's very clean and very well maintained.

Fantastic fig trees and beautiful landscaping and views. A nice walk in the heart of the city with beautiful harbour views. Parrot sitings. Some construction near Mrs Macquaries for the outdoor theatre.

A very special place.. I have never learned so much or enjoyed myself more. Even if you have only a passing interest in botany/gardening or landscaping this place is wonderful. Wait tip you see the flying foxes!!!

Find the bats!. So awesome that this is just in the middle of the city. So beautiful with so many types of flowers and trees and tropical birds are everywhere! Find the bats...you'll know when you find them because they are so loud. There are just thousands hanging from the tops of the trees and it was so neat to see.

Free and Gorgeous; more like a park. There are many circuitous paths to follow and various exits to take that will lead you to other city sights along Macquarie Road or up to St. Mary's Cathedral or the Art Gallery of New South Wales. The view from Mrs. Macquarie's Chair is terrific. There is also a swimming pool at cost. Look for the tree that tipped over in the wind. The Farm Cove is also a lovely walk and a great place to admire local Australian sculpture.

Beautiful. Amazing views of the bridge and of the opera House. Extremely beautiful and peaceful lots of places to sit and chill out and watch the world go by. And all within a short walk from the center of Sydney, well worth the visit. Best of all its free!

Spectacular. The gardens are located on the shores of Sydney harbor and the opera house and circular quay are also visible from here.Taking the choo choo express will ensure that you get to cover the major portions of the garden and seep in the beautiful views of the place. The entry of the place is free and has lots of benches and spots where you can savor good shade or take up a picnic. This perhaps might be the only place where you are encouraged to walk on the grass without anybody running after you shouting to keep off the grass. There are a whole lot of scopes for photographs and the place ensures good time for those who visit it and with a lot of views around, this place is a must visit.

Peace and tranquility in a bustling city. Best place for iconioc view of Opera House and Bridge.Just a short walk from circular quay with refreshments, walks, and plenty of places to sit and enjoy the view
beautiful. Because of the very warm weather, it is nice to find a shade and Botanical Gardens are the perfect place. You get lovely views from there too.

Royal botanic gardens. Really beautiful gardens. I went with a friend one afternoon whilst visiting the area. We had limited time to spend there so road the 'Choo Choo Express' driven train around the gardens. Guided around most of the beautiful gardens and given dome really interesting information on what was there. A lovely hour spent there.

Excellent gardens - good place for a picnic. 74 acres of lovely gardens. Entry is FREE! The botanical gardens are in the heart of Sydney adjacent to the Opera House. There are vast lawns and plenty of comfortable park benches on which to sit and soak up the atmosphere. They encourage you to "walk on the grass"! Take a picnic and while away a lazy day in relaxing surroundings. Mature trees provide welcome shade from the sun. There are numerous well-appointed toilet blocks spread around the grounds and a small cafe and a gift shop. The views over Sydney Harbour with both the Opera House and bridge make for great photo opportunities. A large number of the trees and flowers have details of their botanical names and there is a large rose garden which was in full bloom during my visit.Wild life abounds and the birds (I'm sure I heard a kookaburra...) have become use to people and relatively tame. There are quiet places but, with the city, harbour and small dockyard surrounding the gardens, it can be a little noisy in places but quieter corners do exist. Definitely worth a visit. A rare zero-cost attraction!

Lovely place for a stroll and visit to Government House. We took a walk through the Botanic Gardens and were lucky enough to be there when Government House was open to the public so we got to enjoy that free tour as well.

green space in the city. This is a great place to watch the people of Sydney never mind all the plants and trees. It is an excellent spot to take a picnic and relax in the centre of such a vibrant city

Beautiful. These gardens are fantastic. I walked different parts of the gardens on different days. Be sure to take your camera - the view of the bridge and Opera House are spectacular in the morning. Lots of runners, too, on the path in the morning. Just gorgeous.

BEAUTIFUL!!!!!. Easily one of the nicest botantical gardens I have visited. Easy walking distance from any city Hotel and situated right next to the iconic Opera House. The gardens are very well maintained and well worth a visit!
Great in the middle of a busy city. Beautiful garden close to the Opera house. Nice green place in the busy Sydney - a nice walk in here.

Royal botanical gardens. This is a lovely walk and a nice break from the city even though it is right in the city. There are many spaces to rest and many flowers to see. The different exhibits are all interesting but this space is just restful and a good place to slow down for a bit.

Magnificent green space in the heart of the city. What a peaceful change from the pace of Sydney CBD! Lots of different styles of gardens and plants, winding paths with surprises around each corner, and the magnificent views of the Harbour towards the northern edge.

Majestic and Well Maintained !!. The best way of enjoying the garden is to make a picnic out of the visit. Go in the morning, soak in the sights and sounds, have a snack, relax on the garden, stroll around and then return in the evening. You can also head out to the garden to watch the new years eve fireworks over the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.Points of interest that should not be missed while in the park are: Man O' War Steps (in-front of the Opera House), Dragon’s Blood Tree Fall, Mare and Foal, Mrs Macquarrie's Chair.

Amazing gardens with a city view in the heart of Sydney!. You'd second guess the fact this amazing park is located right in the heart of the city, a world away from the hustle and bustle and large crowds of Pitt St Mall. Location is convenient easy stroll from George street or Circular Quay with one of the entrances right next to the Opera House.Make sure you follow the waterline all the way around to the east side of the park where you'll get an amazing view looking back over the harbour at the city skyline as well as the Opera House, Harbour Bridge and the Lower North Shore where you can sit back and relax. Walk around a little further and you'll catch a glimpse of some Navy vessels. Then start to head back within the centre of the park and you'll pass some interesting trees/flowers and a nice pond, the castle style Government House is also located within The Royal Botanic Gardens as is a small restaurant/cafe if you feel like something to eat.

A little goes a long way.. We walked through a small portion of the Royal Botanic Gardens on the way to the Sydney Opera House, and had a picnic there. We would like to have seen more of the gardens had we had the time.
great for a relaxing lunch. Very well kept and peaceful place to visit, take your luncha nd sit and enjoy the view out across the ocean while you eat, especially worth a bisit on a sunny day.

As I remembered. It had been 4 decades since I walked the Botanic Gardens and the allure was still present. Plants and trees I had never seen before in such grandeur. The tree trunks are impressive as are the heights of the pines. Easy to walk and places to put out a blanket and absorb the surroundings. Yes, I did notice the changes of the tall buildings now encroaching the gardens however that does not take away from the gem that lies within the garden.

Unmissable. You can't miss it if you're into gardens and parks. Was lucky to be there on a sunny day. Great collection of trees and flowers, great views of the harbour and Opera House. It is well situated, so you can easily walk from the Gardens to these other attractions or to The Rocks.

Lovely place, lots of variety. Fabulous views, huge variety of fauna, plenty of birds to see as well. Loved all the native plants. It was very interesting to me after spending six weeks in New Zealand and coming to Australia to see how different the plants were between the two countries. Very enjoyable stroll through the Gardens on the one day layover we had in Sydney. A must see!
I love it.. Most beautiful parks with lots of flowers .. I enjoyed a lot. must see parks . Perfect for photography and relaxing .. I will visit again whenever i travel to Sydney again

Wonderful gardens with fabulous views. These are some of the best botanic gardens that we have ever visited (and we've been to a few!) They are well laid out and colourful with some beautiful statues and vistas, not to mention the harbour views. A must do in Sydney

Beautiful. Unfortunately it was pouring with rain the day we decided to come to the gardens, but still we could see the beauty of the trees and flowers, would be lovely I am sure to come for a run or a picnic. Just a short walk from the harbour and opera house etc so very convenient location!
Beautiful!. Beautiful and free ~ right on the harbour. DIfferent plants, trees, flowers, and animals can be spotted. Great walk or morning run spot.

World renowned Botanic Gardens.. So conveniently located like many other world gardens, BUT, this one curves around the world's best harbour, making for an extra special leisurely walking experience even if you aren't a garden lover.The gardens are adjacent to the city, the NSW Art Gallery, Circular Quay & so much more. A wonderful place to saunter, relax, take in the amazing variety of plants or, like 1,000s of office workers, jog. All that fresh air.

Highly recommended - great place for a walk or jog. This was one of my most favorite spots in Sydney. I spent 9 days in Sydney for a professional conference and took several runs and walks through the gardens. They are really wonderful! It is a really nice break away from all the people and shopping. I saw many people laying in the grass, reading books or taking a stroll through the gardens. Several people were having picnics. I don't have much training in botany but it seemed to have lots of diversity in the gardens. Many species were labeled which was interesting. If you plan on walking to the opera house, make sure to plan your route through the botanical gardens. Be sure to visit the gardens early in your stay or you might regret it later!

Not the very best botanicals, but very nice. This is one of the rare free attractions in Sydney and no doubt one of the most rewarding. The plants themselves are interesting enough and the grounds are well kept. There are all the appropriate water features and a few labels on plants as you would usually find, but these botanicals are a lot more park-like than those found elsewhere. There's lots of room for picnicking and there's lots of wildlife like cockatoos that will come down and join you. The views are also great, you get some different angles of the water and it always sparkles in the sunlight!It would have rated higher if the information and labeling was a little better - sometimes you could just not find out what a plant was - and if there were a few more garden display parts rather than parkland. I guess I should time my visit to one of the tours.
Beautiful Gardens. The Botanic gardens are an oasis in the bustling city of Sydney. It's definitely a place to visit. If you can get there for 10.30 there is a free guided tour.
Beautiful garden in Sydney. This is a beautiful place in Sydney to visit. An absolutely must see stuff even if you not are a flower / garden interested person.

Wonderful free attraction in the city. As you enter the gates of the gardens, there is a large sign that says, "please walk on the grass". I loved this! This park is definitely made for people to enjoy and the whole philosophy of the "friends of the garden" is that when people learn to appreciate and recognize plants, they will care for them and possibly grow their own. Their mission is accomplished because they have created a beautiful place to wander through and enjoy plants. There is a native plant section, a herb section, and an interesting area of succulents. Winding paths, well-situated benches and lots of shade trees make this a great place to spend a relaxing half day.
Good for the eye and the lens. Good place to visit for the nature lover. Heaps of biodiversity and ample options for the one with a camera.

Nothing great!. Unless you are a tree lover there is nothing special about this place. you will pretty much get the same experience in any good garden in any other city of the world. coupled with the fact that it had rained in the morning and had turned sunny post that, our 1 hr walk through the gardens was a humid and tiresome experience which we definitely didnt enjoy.

Governors House was surprise!. The Gardens were in full bloom and we enjoy meandering around. We found a large structure in the Park which is called the Government House, which is the residence of the Governor of New South Wales. You can tour the house free of charge. The house and the tour were an unexpected surprise which we really enjoyed. The café in the middle of park is a nice place to have a bite or a cup coffee. The view of the Sydney skyline are picture perfect.
Beauty of nature. Visit the beautiful gardens! It is the best park for the whole family, adults and kids alike! Free from urban rush, you will have a true rest and relaxation!

Sydney 1 Rest of World 0. My favourite big city park/gardens in the world. Great place to spend a lazy day. Stunning vistas of the harbour abound. And you're encouraged to walk on the grass. Take a good camera.

Stunning. I was in awe of these gardens. The Botanical Gardens is so large and you can't believe you are in one of the largest cities of the world - it is SO relaxing. We walked through most days on our way to Circular Quay.The gardens were beautiful and we couldn't believe that they were free. Really recommend taking the free guided morning tour. Lynn told us so many interesting facts.  Make sure you walk over to Mrs Macquarie's chair, the views over the harbour are stunning. I could have spent forever here.
Lovely gardens in the center of the city. A beautiful collection of native and foreign plants and trees, a peaceful island in the heart of the city.

Enjoyable picturesque stroll. Very large area so altho plenty of people around, never felt as tho crowded. Amazed at all the joggers. Was able to take some brilliant photos. I don't recall seeing much explanatory marking for the plants. Can sit outside at the cafe but beware bird droppings, may be best behind the meshed windows hwere birds cannot get in. My don says watch out for the spiders in April - he may just be kidding

A Lovely Experience!. The botanic gardens were lovely. Well kept and just a nice place to stroll through and relax. I only spent about an hour here which was not enough time to enjoy the whole garden, but it was enjoyable never-the-less. Bring a picnic and enjoy a relaxing afternoon!

Paradise. Really enjoyed our walk through the gardens and right next to the city. Such a peaceful oasis. Sydney is so lucky to have such a beautiful park within the CBD. The gardens are so serene and it was so relaxing to wander through the gardens and enjoy the peace after an enjoyable wander through the Rocks and stroll by the Opera House. Worth taking the time to organise a snack pr picnic and find yourself a spot and enjoy the surroundings.

Absolutely amazing... a wonder.. When in Sydney, do not miss a walk through this beautiful park. Four days later and I am still in awe of what I experienced there. The size and variety of the trees are a wonder in and of themselves, but the setting is equally impressive. MY only disappointment was that my camera battery died just as I got there, but my visual memories are a treasure.
Don't miss. Although the weather wasn't too good the gardens were very beautiful with some beautiful trees and flowers. Amazing to think that this little piece of paradise is in such a vibrant city.

must do on a visit to Sydney. I think the Botanic gardens is one of the best free things to do in Sydney. So much to see and it's a real haven from the rush of the city. Great place to read a book or get some sun.Easy to spend a day in here. The gardens are so large and the harbour views some of the best in the city.Please make sure you enjoy the gardens on your next trip to Sydney :)
Flowers Are Blooming. The modern Julie Andrews within says if this had hills, than they would be alive with the Sounds of Sydney :)

Highly recommended. It is a beautiful open place to enjoy in Sydney on a sunny day. The gardens are well maintained and right on the waterfront with stunning views. I loved walking around and admiring the plants especially the chinese garden.

Free and beautiful. It's free to enter the gardens and it's utterly beautiful! On hot days, the breeze is terrific :) If you need some work done for a conference or something, that's really the place to be!
Special place. This is a beautiful place, walk around, bring a blanket and do a picnic with your family with the Opera House as the background view. Incredible place

A great walk in this beautiful and peaceful garden.. It's free to get into Royal Botanic Garden. The park has a beautiful rose garden where you can see different types of colourful roses with big and small petals, it's like a heaven for rose lover. Every plant here is well indicated and the whole park is so tidy and refreshing! We enjoy a cup of coffee at the bistro in the garden with beautiful wild birds walking around. From the botanic garden you can walk yourself to the mrs Macquarie point to get the best spot of the Sydney opera house and harbour bridge with the magnificent Sydney city skyline. This would probably be the most memorable photo you have taken in Sydney.

like it there. great place for relax,lunch,watching plants, herbs, trees, feeding birds and specially sulfur crescet cockatoo,buy some seeds in coles and feed cockatoo from hands... great pictures of cockatoo, bridge and operahouse. dont forget something to drink and a snack! happy strolling

Simply Stunning. My wife and I recently walked through the Royal Botanic Gardens from the Opera House to the Wooloomooloo exit. The range of plants are amazing and these are presented in a variety of well thought out and presented gardens. The grounds are maintained to an excellent standard. The harbour backdrop complements the gardens very well. It was a picture postcard summer afternoon in Sydney and it was stunning. Lots of families and young couples were enjoying the serenity of the park. A hidden gem in Sydney and one that is definitely worth the effort to visit.

Your recommended. I took the 10.30am tour with a very experienced volunteer guide.
