Romantic walk in the middle of a busy town. Amazing to walk through the Botanic Gardens while having the view on the buildings of CBD. You can see exotic plants and animals, find places to relax as well as exciting walks along the harbour to see the bridge and the Opera Hlouse.

Beautiful, in the Heart of Sydney!. A mere stone's throw from the bustle of the Sydney's downtown core is this oasis of lush Australian flora. There are numerous paths and a labyrinth of trails that take you through some lush, native plants. It is bordered on the southern side by the seawall walk that skirts the harbour. This walk takes you towards the iconic "Rocks" district in one direction and towards Mrs. Macquarie's chair in the other (east). It is hard to beat these city paths and trails on a sunny Sydney day. Highly recommended. A perfect respite in this busy city.
A must visit. A must visit for young and old, take a picnic basket or take a stroll, this is one of the best Botanic gardens in the world with breathtaking views and fantastic photo opportunities.

A good place for a short nap! =). Almost every city has a botanic garden. But whats cool about Sydney's Royal Botanic Garden is that it is so comfortable to just lie on the grass and sleep during the winter month. It's pretty clean and I bear testimony to that. During my short nap there, there was no problems with insects or people disturbing. It's really a good way to enjoy the sky and take in the surrounding.
beautiful. In the heart of Sydney you won't want to miss a walk through the gardens. . see the Opera house and tall skyline in a lush green tropical oasis. .

Always worth a look. With the stunning harbour as a backdrop the gardens, if not pretty enough, are well worth a visit. Grab a blanket and picnic basket for a great relaxing time right in the heart of the city.

Missing but one thing. This place is missing but one thing - a decent playground. Coulnd't find any. Thank goodness for the birds, sculptures and variety of plants that dragged my kids from one place onto another.Playground would really be useful.
Nice to walk around. We walked daily during our one week stay innSydney. Daily from our hotel to the city centre.beautiful 8-9minutes walk that gave usva great start to our day in this beautiful city

Wonderful walk. Hubby and I took a stroll through the Botanic Gardens up through Hyde Park. Scenery was lovely and we totally forgot that we were in a major city! It was nice to see many people in business suits obviously enjoying a bit of time outdoors during their lunch breaks. On our next trip we may explore a bit more.
A Nice Stroll. Do not miss a stroll through the Royal Botanic Gardens - we went on a misty day yet enjoyed our stroll very much from end to end.
amazing place.. take a picnic and just hang out there all day. what a spot. wild life in a city and one as beautiful as Sydney. best to go easrly before it gets too hot

great spaces.. lovely mature plants of exotic and native species. took my drawing class here we had a wonderful day capturing the amazing plants that fill these gardens not to mention the amazing views of the harbour

A favorite in Sydney. The view, the trees, the domain... Everything here is stunning! I love the feeling of people doing picnics or just laying on the grass on a sunny day to relax between shifts at work.

Botanical Gardens at Circular Quay. The Botanical Gardens are a great way to get out of the city for a little bit and enjoy walking (or jogging) along the waterfront and through grassy fields. I was there the first day of winter and was amazed how many flowers were blooming. The views of the Opera House from the Gardens are worth the walk! Definitely worth the time to walk through them.
Botanic Peace. Just beautiful and well looked after.Great for that leisurely stroll to take time out - Spring obviously is the best time
Relaxing. More to it than just plants.Good views of Sydney from many different aspects, a great place to relax and chill out.

One of my favorite places in Sydney.. Take your time and walk through these gardens. Brilliant vistas...the government house...(make sure to walk in back of it...the views are spectacular and the back of the house is as impressive as the front)...During late August, the tulips were out...you'll love it!

Really nice walking area. The Gardens go around the coast and it was a really pleasant walk to go through them towards the Opera House. There is a pond and some tours, a sense of history here - well almost!
VERY REWARDING. Great afternoon spent at the gardens. Nice relaxing walk, after the vide of the city. Immaculate gardens, and a very tranquil place

Spectacular. This blew me away. I initially was hesitant to go inside, figuring it was just going to be a bunch of trees and I could simply go to a forest if i wanted that. Was I ever wrong!!! Very impressive and well done. New areas kept me engaged and wanting to walk deeper into the grounds. There was a variety that made each area feel new and fresh.  Unlike the Botanical Gardens in New York that you must take a train to access, this is right in business district and has great views of the city and waterways as well. There are exotic birds in the trees and at dusk you get to watch the bats come to life. Very worth while trip and a must see.
Fabulous setting. What more could you want when visiting the Botanic gardens in Sydney. Great setting and lovely menu, although limited well presented and fresh ingredients. Good service!
Weddings. Lovely gardens. Was amazed at the number of people getting married all over the place. I think this spoiled the lovely open spaces!!!

Very relaxing. I went to the Royal Botanical Gardens with friends who were living in Sydney and I went with no real expectations. The RBG were simply amazing! We spent probably the better part of an afternoon there and I could have stayed longer. All the various plants and flowers were beautiful but what surprised me was the amount of wildlife. There were birds, bats, squirrels and I sure other things we missed. It was easy to get to and just something you should do in Sydney!

Highly recommended. Very nice walk, refreshing after long flight. Very aesthetic park worth spending couple hours. No rush, just walking around. Me personally not being really excited about 'plants' but I liked this one very much. Do not miss it.
Beautiful grounds with trees, flowers and birds. Take long walks through the gardens as well as a tour offered at 1030 AM and 230 PM daily to learn about the native trees and plants in detail.
Beautiful garden. Take the train for a ride around the garden. Great variety of plants and flowers. Highly recommended if you love gardens.

Peaceful Oasis in the city center. Lovely Botanic Gardens on the Harbor with great views of the Opera House and downtown. Interesting variety of trees and plants. Especially liked the butterfly garden.

Lovely. The gardens are really nice and well worth exploring. They are free to visit and have lots of amazing plants, including the worlds rarest pine tree. We were really lucky and saw lots of roosting flying foxes too. Amazing!

Great Views. You can stroll around this area, while watching the fitness fanatics run and work out in this beautiful unspoilt area of sydney. Far away from the hussle and bussle of people, cars, buses. When you walk around here, you don;t feel as if you are in the city, but in some tranquil area. You can take a picnic lunch, and sit besides the ponds, or take the kids and kick a ball for hours at a time.
Everything a Gardener Yearns for!. Simply the best experience. The trees are magnificent and the whole area is so well kept. A gem Sydney must be proud of.

Walking in paradise. A stupendous oasis of green and blue in the middle of Sydney ...so much to look at , so much to hear as the parrots and fruit bats circled , a feeling of space and we loved being invited to hug the trees !! The walk along the seafront to the Opera House is epic

Stunning Gardens with Stunning Backdrop. Beautiful city centre gardens. Stunning botanical native examples, with the Sydney cityscape acting as a back drop.Wild cockatiels everywhere and budgerigars zooming all around.Links in with the Opera house at one end and the National Art Museum at the other.There are the main gardens that are free to walk around and a specialist area that have an entrance fee to gain access. you can spend as little or as long as you like wandering.It is the location to get the Opera house and Bridge into the same photo!A definite experience on the Sydney "to do "list.

Beautiful and Peaceful. Sublime tranquility in the middle of the city - perfect for long walks, picnics, romantic proposals, wedding photos (including my own), and family times with the kids running around.

A Wonderful Destination. I love the way everyone shares and uses the gardens. Parents with young children, overseas visitors, lunch time runners and just those who want to sit in a peaceful place on the grass and read. And, of course, there are those who not only appreciate the overall atmosphere, but who enthusiastically explore the impressive botanical collection. Sydney is very fortunate to have this beautiful space so close to the city and harbour.
Walk in the botanical garden. Beautiful...so serene, so peaceful. If you have time then take a book and spend sometime at that botanical garden. We went for walks couple of times.
Beautiful. Don't miss the Botanic Gardens which are close to the Harbour and behind the Opera House. There is nowhere more beautiful to walk in Sydney.
Beauty is unbelievable. Just like fairyland...so many flowers and trees and fountains. Also, dont miss the parrots that fly freely from tree to tree. And they seem to stay right in the park
Beautiful part of Sydney. Lovely to walk through and the weather was amazing.You get some good views of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.

Wonderful stroll - pity about the runners. Excellent gardens in harbourside location; the tropical glasshouse is an often overlooked attraction. The best place in Sydney for a leisurely stroll but avoid lunchtimes when hundreds of under- worked public servants descend to run through the gardens and annoy the patrons.
Beautiful. Had a lovely time hear, really beautiful, clean, nice to sit and relax and completely free! Can't ask for more.

Beautiful, and free!. The Botanical Garden is great for those interested in plants, a casual stroll or picnic! It is a bit big so if you don't have a destination, you may get lost! However, there is a fabulous view of not only the Opera House but also the city!

Go for the free tour and pack your lunch to eat on the lawns. If you don't have much knowledge of nature (Like me), it is best to take a tour around the Gardens. The best part? It is free. Just be outside the gift shop at 1030am on weekdays, and sign up at the volunteer tour booth.We were led by Russell, a very enthusiastic volunteer guide, who gave us insights of stories behind plants which were part of Australian's historical landscape - how how some were brought in by the British and their colonies, or how some were used by Aboriginal people.Frankly, if not for the tour, I would be just walking "blindly" and admiring the plants, without knowing their significance.The tour lasts for a comfortable 90mins, and there were just 5 of us on the tour (4 tourists and one Aussie, so there were a lot of opportunities to ask questions) . And I would suggest bringing your lunch to eat in the parks. Just pack a sandwich, and sit on the lush green lawn (especially the ones facing the Opera House)...Perfect!
Excellent gardens!. Great gardens, perfectly located, enjoyed all of the palms, florals, and sculptured gardens. Easy to access from several major roadways. Within easy walk of harbour.

Great park to relax and it's free!. Found this great park just next to the Opera House. My first intentions were to visit the Opera House, but this park was far more interesting! Do come early as it get's bit crowded in the afternoon. Encounter many exotic trees, have your lunch on the grass, feed the lovely birds, have a nice view of the towers next to it, and do some sports!
stunning. A most beautiful walk, stunning scenery, the harbour at its best and the grass is enought to make you want to lay on it.

Beautiful Gardens. The Royal Botanic Gardens are lovely. You could easily spend all day wandering around and is perfect for a picnic or afternoon nap. They even have signs posted inviting you to take off your shoes, walk in the grass, etc.

Beautiful grounds. The RBG is a beautiful park/garden in the center of many tourist attractions which makes it a nice "escape" in the city. It is easy to access and right near the Opera House. It is a great place to people watch, wander, or maybe even have a picnic. I found the signs indicating the layout of various parts of the garden somewhat confusing to follow, which made it difficult to navigate for a first-time visitor.
loads to look at. loads of flowers and plantation to see. nice place for a stroll and views of sydney harbour. viewing benches scattered around. free to enter. closes early, 1730.

Great to be in for a whole day. If you are looking for a walk in a relaxing environment then this is the place you are looking for. Lots of variations available. Have a snack with you and spend your day in this relaxing environment.

Wonderful amenity. How wonderful to have such an amenity right in amongst the main tourist area of this city. It was an easy walk - what a walk - past the Bridge and Opera House - from my hotel and I spent a happy seven hours just wandering. The plants were mainly well and informatively labelled, and there was much to be learned. It was enjoyable doing this among Sydneysiders just having a lunch break etc. One downside of the gardens was the crowds (of which I was one!). There was constant noise from various groups. But this is a small price to pay for the pleasure of being in the Gardens (free, also) on the side of the Harbour.

Marvellous!. Don't hesitate!..... Don't Miss It!.... The Royal Botanic Gardens is the 'showplace' of Sydney city, and should be visited each and every time you happen to be in Sydney!....... A Knockout!
special spot. Don't go very often but when I do I wonder why. everything is so peaceful, the gardens spectacular, the views are fantastic. and its a short walk to the Opera Bar
Good free attraction. Take a walk in the botanic garden, it's free and very pleasant. Lots if different plants and birds. From here you can easily walk to the opera, the harbour and museum.
Interesting. Such a huge garden in the middle of the City. Good place to relax after all this busy city center. Great location for wedding with a nice view on Opera House!

Another Sydney highlight.. The park is within walking distance or a very short taxi ride from central downtown Sydney and a beautiful peaceful refuge in the middle of a large city. We spent 2-3 hours, walking and sitting and looking at the plants and sights and really enjoyed it. It deserves to be one of Sydney's highlights.

Absolutely Stunning. If you are in the Sydney City area or visiting the Opera House, don't miss this beautiful oasis which is literally next door! Deceptively large with an excellent variety of different plant life to view, it's worth spending at least a couple of hours if you have the time venturing around and taking in all the different sites.The CBD area of Sydney is a bit of a concrete jungle so this offers a wonderful, unexpected escape. Don't miss out on it!

Perfect situation for a wonderful garden. Sydney Harbour is the central feature of Sydney and siting the Botanic Gardens with the Harbour forming one of the sides was total genius. The gardens are beautifully kept, but they encourage visitors to walk on the grass. What a change from the precious "Keep Off the Grass" signs we see in parks and gardens in Europe. The range of plants and shrubs is just too numerous to itemise. But we particularly loved the camellias, the massive Yuccas and what we call the Angels Trumpet tree in one of the smaller areas. Everywhere we looked there was colourful blooms, varied foliage and birds, lots and lots of birds. It was in the Botanics that we saw our biggest flock of white Cockatoos. (And we know, they are considered a pest species, but we loved how the underside of their wings are tinged with yellow to match their crest!) The views of the Opera House and the Sydney Harbour bridge are spectacular. It took our breath away to come up along a beautiful lawn and suddenly we could see both framed by a wonderful sky on top, the harbour to the right, the City of Sidney on the left, and lush green grass at the bottom. It's the perfect spot for a picnic or a relaxing lunch - or at least it is if you stay out of the way of the manic runners who crash through the garden focussed only on their own agenda. We found them aggressive and lacking in consideration and they certainly did not impress me. I just thought they were crazy not to be able to enjoy this beautiful place. When they've driven their joints to dysfunction, I hope they'll be able to take the time to just enjoy what they have all around them.The runners were a complete contradiction to the people we met in and around Sydney. They were charming, helpful and informative. And the same can be said for the staff in the Botanic Gardens. If you go to Sydney, make sure you take the time to walk around this beautiful place. And above all, enjoy the peace and beauty.

Peaceful and interesting, but. Some fantastic historical aspects if you poke around here. Great gardens but don't drink too much as a distinct lack of public toilets can be a bit of a problem even if there are a lot of trees!

Large oasis in the city. The Botanic Gardens are huge, with several different areas to explore. We walked along the western edge and enjoyed the rose garden and the Government House grounds. While the map showed a route up the western edge, we ended up having to leave the gardens and cross busy roads to head north to the Opera House. There must be other paths, but we didn't seek them out. While you can still hear the traffic noise in the areas of the Gardens we walked through, I'm sure the interior areas are more serene.
Beautiful place to relax. My first destination here. It's a charming place. Love the buildings and nature in the surrounding. It feels kinda dreamy. The cool breeze might have a part to play in this.

Excellent Garden. During September it was spring and it was beautiful. there are various sections specially the oriental section was very nicely done. the garden itself is very big with lot of different types of trees and flowers. so enjoy the leisure walk inside. There is an old governor house inside. nice and pleasant time spent

No more fruit bats!. Unfortunately (or fortunately to those who are not keen on the fruit bats) the fruit bats have been moved on so you can no longer see or hear them squabbling in the Botanic gardens, but can see a few of them over the Harbour of an evening still.
Enjoyed the Gardens. Wonderful trees of all kind at one place. Treat to see them. You can see the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge also. Must visit when you are in Sydney.
A must to do in Sydney. The opera house is a stunning place to tour and the Royal Botanic Gardens are in the same category, Stunning a must to do.

Lovely. Peaceful, well maintained and enjoyed by tourists and the locals. There are plenty of signs identifying species of plants/trees. Equally important are the signs which clearly show you where you are going! The cafe is a nice place for a coffee or light lunch. Just on the fringe of the city but very peaceful.

Perfect way to spend an afternoon. After a fifteen hour plane ride, what a lovely time we had relaxing in the botanic gardens. Gorgeous flowers and foliage, birds singing and people watching were a lovely prize for our long day of travel. Loved the "Please walk on the grass" signs!

Lovely gardens with great spots for photography. Lovely gardens with plenty to see and a nice coffee place for a drink. the park has many vantage points from which to take amazing pictures of the opera house and also of the bridge.

Just a park really. This isn't really what I would call a botanical garden. I've been to various ones all over the world and this one is clearly missing the breadth of plantings and helpful information. It's really just a big public park. The good thing is that you don't have to pay and if you go far enough into the park, pretty much way down by the water, you can enjoy some peace and quiet in the busy city.

A must on a Fall day. We walked there on this visit from the Art Gallery. The gardens are beautiful, well maintained, and well visited both by locals and visitors. The location just calls to you. On that particular day, a young couple was getting married on one of the lawns. There were families, individual just strolling or sitting and enjoying the gardens and the day. Plus, the area offers some of the most stunning views of the bay and the Opera House with the Harbor Bridge in the background. And, you get the sounds and slights of some beautiful birds. On this particular day there were some parrots eating seeds from a flowering tree. On our visit to this park a few years ago, we got to see and hear a kookaburra in its natural setting. And, we left the park by way of the Opera House on our way to Circular Quay.

Simply Stunning. I attended a wedding at the Botanic Gardens and it was magical. The gardens are very well maintained, there is no park fees and you can spend hours in there admiring the beautiful surrounds. You forget about the hustle and bustle of Sydney for a moment.

Nice walk and beautiful gardens. The Botanical Gardens are absolutely beautiful with lots of great places to picnic, rest and reflect. It is free to get in and there is a café in the center of the gardens. If you are too tired to walk or its a hot day, you can ride the train for $10 per adult and $5 per child. There are 3 stops within the park and you can hop on/off.

Peaceful oasis in the city. The flowers, trees, and birds in the gardens are a MUST see. A short walk from a lot hotels in the area. Its an oasis in the city. I loved the walking around however I loved just sitting in the shade enjoying my surroundings.

Beautiful Walk Through the Gardens. We really enjoyed walking through the gardens and seeing a lot of bird wildlife in the trees. It was great to see how many people were enjoying the park when we went there.
go there. go when the sun shines wAalk around. get fit and get the best view of the opera house and gardens that you can... loved it

Peace, quiet and interesting. I make a point of visiting the gardens whenever I am in Sydney. As I usually travel on business it is difficult to get a feel for a country from just a city. The gardens provide a glimpse at some of the Australian flora and fauna. they are also educational. This year I came across an interesting planting of grasses showing popular lawn varieties! I know sounds thrilling! However it was interesting to see such variety and why some are used for different things. There are also gardens showing the impact of the first settlers and why their first crops failed. I visited three times over several days, spending an hour or so wandering different parts. I have been coming for almost twenty years and I doubt I will ever tire of the gardens.

Lovely.. Located close to the Sydney Habour Bridge & Sydney Opera House the gardens are lovely to walk through on your trip to and from the cbd.I stopped to smell every variety of rose!Allow at least 2 hours to enjoy this attraction to its fullest.

loved this place. The first time i visited the gardens was with my parents and actually heard and saw a Kookaburra which delighted us. We had afternoon tea which was lovely The next time was when I was staying near the gardens.Overall lovely experience.Highly recommend

Beautiful city gardens. Some of the most beautiful gardens in the world. Lovely break from the city on a nice day. So much to see. Keep an eye out for parrots and the huge beautiful spiders as you walk.

Great Place to Chill. We loved the Botanical Gardens, tranquility between the city and the sea, lots to see here colourfull shrubs, plants,Owls Cockateels and Parakeets; Great place to relax for a while, only downfall was the number of joggers and lack of seating.
Dinner in the gardens. We spent a lovely day walking round Sydney and ended up in the gardens where we had a lovely meal then we walk through back to the harbour beautiful place must go again soon

Lovely For A Stroll. Huge beautiful gardens with all sorts of different plants and animals. The gates start closing at 6pm so be sure you don't get stuck inside. The gardens are wonderful to stroll around and take in nature. There are several wild parrots that make the gardens their home.
Relaxing!. Take a stroll through the park and stop by the opera house to watch the boats go by. Very beautiful and should definitely stop by on your visit.

One of the best anywhere. We have had the good fortune to visit outstanding gardens throughout the world. We have seen none better. There is an astounding variety of mature specimens, and an engaging landscape plan.

Beautiful gardens - for free!. We took a leisurely walk from the Opera House around to the gardens and they were beautiful. It was a particularly hot day but we were still able to enjoy the different areas of the gardens and enjoy the shade of the magnificent Moreton Bay Fig trees. The stop off at the Garden Cafe was a welcome interlude and we enjoyed tea and cake there. All in all well worth the walk around and of course it costs only time and some effort - enjoy!

Wish I could go back again. This is one of the nicest gardens I have visited. So many different flowere we have never seen before. We took so many pictures!! Loved the "Fernery" and also the "Cactus Garden" It is such a lagre area that you never felt like there was very many people there.When I need "quiet time" I think of our walk through this beautiful garden.

stellar escape from the city. We arrived in the gardens from a side entrance from the opera house and were enchanted by the lovely pastoral space. Amazing layout of fauna native to australia and quite a bit of bird activity, which was especially appreciated by my birder traveling companion. Would visit again!

Fantastic Green Lung in Central Sydney. The gardens with views of the iconic Opera House, Sydney Harbour Bridge and Sydney Harbour is an attraction not to miss when visiting Sydney. Also make sure you do not miss the lake, the Governor's House and the great collection of plants and trees. Saw several different types of birds including many noisy cockatoos.

kick back in lovely surroundings. Ever changing views and a great place to picnic are available all day for nothing. The gardens are big enough for a pretty good walk as well especially if you walk right around past Mrs Macquaries chair and end up at the Art Gallery.

Take a walk in the park.... Not to be missed! A world class garden on the edge of a world class harbour and close to the city. Photograph the Cockatoos, they will love you for it. Walk from the Art Gallery of NSW through the gardens down to the harbour and follow the path round to the Opera House. But take your time, there is a lot to see on the way.
Gorgeous. Take a book and chill out - take the TOURIST Mini train. On a hot day this was lovely - also had enclosures to explore too.

AMAZING!!. This place is just fantastic! It has a lot of nature, good places to take pictures... you won't believe it is located just few minutes from the City. Please, be sure you visit Mr. Macquire's Chair, because it has a perfect view of the Opera House and the Bridge.It is a perfect place to do a picnic or just hang out at the afternoon! :)
Wonderful Spot. To get away from the hustle and bustle of the city come here and see all the native flora and fauna of Australia. Great views of Sydney Opera House and the harbour.
short walk. my girlfriend and i do a nice walk in the gardens.. relax in the sun and have a great time... saw opera house.. we did this after our blue mountains tour

Beautiful. We entered the gardens from the side of the opera house. This place is huge! Lots of walkways and benches. You can see everything here from ocean life at the sea wall to duck ponds and flowers. I especially enjoyed the wild birds that were everywhere. Cockatoos and lorikeets. Many others that I don't know the name of.The gardens are very large and maps and signs are a little confusing to read, so be mindful of not getting lost. (We did for a bit) The entrance sign says it all..."please walk of the grass. And stop to smell the roses, hug a tree and picnic on the lawns"

Great view of Opera House, Harbour Bridge and Sydney Bay. During our stay in Sydney we were used to walk almost everyday through the gardens as shortcut going to Circular Quay. The Gardens are just amazing... Not only the several kind of plants and flowers but also the nice view on the bay, of the Harbour Bridge and Opera House.If you like working out, there are several paths to try and if you are more lazy you can do a picnic on the green areas all around. An amazing place perfect for a first experience of the city and its view and for a relaxing walk all around.

Relax in the middle of buzzing Sydney. This assembly of wonderful and very diverse trees and plants is very well maintained and has very informative information signs explaining the different plants. There are special activities by month and day, so it is worthwhile to look at the web-page prior to your visit. The park is a perfect invitation to rest on park benches or the lawns, but also attracts the sportive visitor to jog. With Circular Quay, Sydney Opera and the financial district nearby, this park is a definite must on your visit. There are different segments - featuring herbs, palms, roses, begonia, rain forest and bush garden, tropical gardens and other assembles - and there are lots of animals from flying foxes to rare bird species.
Very refreshing. Beautiful and green, beside the harbour, lots of space, the herb garden, the rose garden, the palms, the huge trees - all lovely. But in the middle of the city.

Perfect location and great vegetation.. The gardens are perfect. They are clean and have great plants from all over the world. The only downside is the cafe - the quality and options are poor and definitely overpriced.

Gorgeous Gardens. One of our favorite spots in Sydney. Includes Mrs. Macquarie's Chair, great views of the harbors, and so much flora and fauna. It was amazing to see all the beautiful birds just sitting in the trees.

What's not to like?. If you want to slow down a bit and smell the flowers, go to the Royal Botanic Gardens. It will feel like you are far away from the fast paced city. You don't have to spend hours there, as just a short walk will make you feel relaxed.

The best gift of God to Sydney!. If Sydney is one of the most beautiful cities in the world then its Royal Botanic Garden alone is a very good reason for this. Set near the Sydney Harbour,the Botanic Garden is surrounded by unfenced botanical parkland known as the Domain, which is accessible to the public 24 hours a day. Its green spaces, playing fields and harbour views makes it a must see for every visitor. This place is vital for Sydney’s biggest festivals, celebrations and events and in the recreational, sporting life and physical fitness of the city dwellers.You need a lot of time and interest to roam around and enjoy the Herb Garden, the Oriental Garden, the Palm House, the Camellia Garden, the Succulent Garden, the Begonia Garden, the Macquarie wall and the Rain forest walk. Beautiful sculptures are scattered all around the lush green parkland to give it a serene and peaceful ambien. There is also a Herbarium and Plant Science museum and many other pearls which you will have to discover!
Lot's of interest. Very good variety of displays including rare trees, floral displays and succulents. Well worth a visit.

Not the extraordinary "garden" in our view. This is a large park-like venue that seemed to us to be more of a gathering place than an "attraction." There are wide expanses of grass/lawn and some botanical displays, but frankly we did not assimilate what all the fuss is about. Yes it is pleasant, yes it is large, but extraordinary it was not to us.

Really cool for a workout or picnic. Definitely head to the botanic gardens if you have time to spare. They have a super relaxed attitude - a sign up at the entrance invites you to walk on the grass, talk to the birds, hug the trees. A really great place for a picnic and worth checking in the summer to see if the open air cinema is on.

This is a MUST while in Sydney. What a beautiful place in the midst of a big city. Once you immerse yourself deep into the Gardens, the noise of the city dies down. Incredible collections of beautiful trees and flowers plus the abundant wild white cockatooes at the park makes it a wonderful expereience.

Good on Yer Sydney!. My wife and I most recently visited this attraction in March and again in April 2013 as a cruiseship-walk before dinner...and before lunch…and before drinks, although not necessarily in that order. In other words, this attraction is within easy walking distance of the ships, is free and is …great! We particularly enjoy the sheer proximity to the city, with the contrast between the hustle of Circular Quay, The Opera House and the railway station being especially poignant on a balmy evening or early morning. The Sydney-siders are very blessed to have such a facility on their doorstep. The beauty of the gardens is amazing to be within a major world city within walking distance from the CBD and cruise terminal. Attractions abound, including fantastic trees and all indigenous plants, usually well labelled and identified. The gardens also host a great botanically themed gift-shop with sensibly priced souvenirs. There is also a Mini Train for those with difficulty walking, although you are more likely to see a procession of joggers, walkers, dedicated and seemingly under-nourished marathon runners than overfed cruise passengers (like us) who rarely seem to get that far…go for it guys…this is iconic Aussieland…Good on yer mate!

The gardens are great and nice to walk and sit. We enjoy for some hours and look at the magnificant trees and flowers. There is a map available. The vieuws to the waterfront and opera house are fantastic.

Absolutely wonderful. The botanical garden was an absolute delight for our family. We first visited the opera house and entered through the queen Elizabeth II gate. Large beautiful trees that provided good shade. Highlight were the white cockatoo that allowed us to get up close for beautiful photo opportunities. There is also a beautiful Garden restaurant in the middle of the park - good food and EXCELLENT desserts.

Nice to look at, sort of. Don't invest too much time in this area, especially if there are other things you really want to do- the chances are that the other things are much more worth while. They're nice for an amble though, and interesting when you're in the midst of so highly built a city.

Beautiful view. A lovely place to spend the morning, afternoon or the evening, with a splendid view. I found the botanic gardens a great place to relax when I was recovering from jet lag in the sun. Its a fabulous setting only walking distance to the bridge and opera house with all sorts of going on. I would highly recommend this as a stop if your spending a couple of days in the city!
Free and green. Entering gardens is free ,enjoy stroll along green landscape.You can see the government house which requires a free ticket with a guide.

"Please walk on the grass.". This sign alone was enough for me to give the Botanic Gardens 5/5... Coming from China where you are likely to be met with a tirade of abuse from a man in an ill-fitting uniform for daring to tread on the unattractive grass was a sight for sore eyes. The gardens are beautiful, there are sights (flowers, trees and plants), sounds (birds singing and insects buzzing) and smells (flowers and herbs) to be enjoyed. Couple that with the fact that you are encouraged to touch and feel your way around the gardens and you have a perfect place wander, relax and enjoy.

so very worthwhile. Start your walk at the wooloomooloo wharf and see the quiet unpolluted side of the harbour it is truely spectacular on a sunny early morning, or better still finish at the wharf with a nice coffee!
Walk on the Mild Side. A lovely place to stroll relax and watch the harbour activities. Welcoming signs to walk on the grass. Fantastic vistas of the harbour and the surrounding city.

Absolute greenery within the city. The Royal Botanic Gardens is a place of greenery, peace and natural splendor. Make sure you have enough time to enjoy the walks and scenery. It is laid out across the harbor and there are little benches to catch a breath if you run out of one!Perfect place for everyone!
Free and worthwhile. Lovely gardens with great birds, walkways and flowers. Lovely way to walk over to the Opera house. Fantastic views of the harbour bridge and Opera house as well.

Hug treeds, talk to birds and please walk on the lawn. i copied this title, it is the welcome-sign to all visitors: lovely. the botanical garden stretches from the city to the harbour, numerous paths to walk, benches to sit, trees and bushes well explained by signs, lawns to play - it is endless what this botanical garden is offering - do it, its free!
wothwhile. the foliage is really impressive but the gardens could be kept in better shape, i saw several cigarette butts lying around

beautiful and green oasis. walking in these gardens is not for those who do not like to walk because they are big.check out where the toilets are! lots of interesting trees and plants. Nice places for a drink or lunch. surrounded by the buzzing city! we walked last time through them to go to the art gallery. dont try to see all of them in one visit unless you are a super athlete or you dont fear exhaustion..
Lots to see on a comfortable walk.. Loved the herb gardens. Wonderful sculpture in surprising spots. Great view of the harbor. Easily accessible from the Opera House and Circular Quay.

Calm Oasis in the City. The park was a lovely distraction sandwiched between the Harbour and the City. There are a wide selection of plants and trees to observe and lots of wildlife to observe too. Well worth a stroll!

A very relaxing place. I love royal botanical Garden in sydney. refreshing relaxing place to spend the weekend with the family. Spent our half day walking around the garden, sit and chat on the grass, well it was totally refreshing and relaxing. And ur kids will love the funny train (i dont know the name sorry) they provide for people to enjoy around the garden.
A lovely place to chill. The area was so clean and well tended, the setting could not be more spectacular, we spent a few hours causally walking around here admiring the scenery, totally relaxing

How many days do you need?. The gardens are splendid. Not to be missed a free guided tour of the Governor Generals House. Also an installation showing the Cadigal Aboriginal plantings. A splash of weddings made for at least a few days of visits.

Screetching Birds. The gardens are well worth a visit. There are some huge trees and the inhabitants of the trees could not be described as songbirds more shouting birds. The gardens are well laid out and have a magnificent backdrop down to the water. It was strange being a tourist having ibis birds wandering about but great to see the variety of bird life sustained by the gardens.

Was expecting to see a variety of horticulture. The gardens were vast and impressive for that, but reminded us of a huge park, not botanical gardens....seemed like walking forever with mainly trees and grass. Also, the famous Mrs.Mcquarie's chair was a big let down, as the view from there is of an industrial building and a crane. Just up the trail, the views of Sydney are good. We were underwhelmed by it all.

Don't miss it. The Royal Botanic Gardens are very beautiful, with great views of downtown, the Opera House and the bridge. and no entrance fee :-). It's one of my favorite places for walking and photography in Sydney. I love to walk there early morning form the Opera house to Mrs Macquarie's chair and have an ice cream there.

Beautiful. So many different species of plants than we experience here in America. The grounds are beautifully kept and signs ENCOURAGE one to romp, play, hug the trees, and smell the flowers. Try to tour the Governor's house (when she is not in residence). Great way to learn more on the political system of Australia while seeing a beautiful home.

Botanical Gardens worth the walk. Sydneys Botanical Gardens and the Opera House are situated very close together and provide a great view of Sydnedy Harbour, the Sydney Bridge and the Opera House all from one setting. The gardens are an easy walk from the Main Ferry Terinal of Circular Quay. The gardens are beautiful and provide a bit of a break from the city itself.
beautiful, well worth it. beautiful walk, lots to do, if you are walking from wiliam street side of sydney to the opera house walk this way rather than the polluted main streets

Put on your walking shoes!. The garden is VERY large and you will get in a lot of walking. It was beautiful day, and the weather was perfect, take your time and enjoy. We happened to be there for the Art show and that was special. We walked from Margaret St, down George St, to Queen Victoria square, over Park St, through Hyde Park, up to Cathedral Square, through the Domain, to the Royal Botanical Gardens, keep on the path and it goes by the Opera House, along the Harbor back over to George Street then to the hotel on Margaret St. You can have a double ice-cream cone after that.

Diverse. What a delight these gardens are .In the middle of the city and so vast.The hot house has a diverse range of jungle plants.Well worth a visit.Wildcockatos and budgies fly free here in the gardens , bats slumber in some of the trees.The whole gardens are manicured and well maintained.

a morning walk in the Botanic Garden. If you want to see some Birds native to Australia, then this is the place. We saw many birds in the wild, cocateils, kookaburas, parrots and more. We even saw a possum scurry and hide, even thought they are nocturnal. The plants were all lovely and the garden is in superb condition. It was very hot and sunny even in the early morning. Bring water and wear sunnscreen. They have a little gift shop and the friends of the garden had a plant sale that day, wish I lived there, so I could have bought some.
Beautiful!. Excellent, so peaceful and such a large green area near the water! But,there were no flowers when we went in the large gardens (apart from the Palace Gardens).

If You Love Gardens, Don't Miss These!. It's easy to get lost in Royal Botanic Gardens; there is so much to see for plant lovers. We especially liked the succulent garden with a dramatic sculpture incorporating cacti and succulents. There are numerous shady places to rest between viewing flowers, trees and plants. It's a beautiful place to spend a day--and it's free!

Peace and tranquility in the middle of Sydney. As a student 20 years ago I used to lay in the gardens on a sunny day to do my studies. Now I go there to enjoy the gardens and the amazing views and nothing has changed if at all the gardens have gotten better
Beautiful Gardens. These gardens are a tribute to the care that Sydneysiders expect in their gardens. They are beautiful and well-maintained.

Lovely gardens in the heart of Sydney. Really nice gardens that you can enter free of charge , and spend some time looking around the gardens or chilling out , sunbathing etc. Plenty of married couple also go there to have their reception.Can be a bit windy , with the wind blowing of the harbour but it has great views of the Opera house.

Dreamy. Beautiful gardens, flowers and surrounding, right near the Harbor and opera house. What a lovely walk through grab a bit of lunch and gaze into the beauty of nature. A must see in Sydney, you will be taken to another place by simply viewing the beautiful landscapes.

Wonderful -- and its free !. Brilliant, we spent about 3 hours in there and could easily have stayed much longer.
The cafe resaurant is very good if a little pricey.

Take your rest. search for a nice spot next to the water and enjoy the rest this park has to offer you. from the most northern point just out of the park a great sunset can be seen over the city ski-line with the harbour bridge, this is were you get these mouth opening holiday pictures.
So beautiful. Beautiful lush scenery, cute birds everywhere and gigantic spiders! We loved walking around taking in the scenery and chilling out. Theres tons of joggers and we loved people watching.

Great contact with nature within a big city. RBG is a great place to take your family, girlfrind or even go yourself.
You can feed the cockatoo, walk around the place, be really in touch with nature.

Amazing Flora. We had a great time and learned a lot about tropical trees. The sausage tree was my favorite. I also liked the silk tree that was blooming. The water lilies are nice, and the overall feel of the garden is great!

Beautiful and Relaxing Gardens. A sign on the front asking people to walk on the grass and hug the trees sets the mood. The park is quite large and thankfully had a café and several restrooms. The various views of the Opera House and the bridge were as wonderful as the variety of plants.
Loved it!. Took along a picnic lunch and spent the afternoon at the Botanic Gardens. Really enjoyed this and would fully recommend spending some hours here!

An attractive, peaceful haven right next to all the main tourist spots. Located just in from the Opera House, and offering the best views of it, this is also worth a visit in its own right for a walk and/or sit to catch your breath a little. As a previous reviewer comments it is a complete contrast from the high-rise CBD just behind it. As you'd expect plenty of plants, flowers, trees and birds.

good with kids. the gardens are free and the children can run around. they were each given a leaflet all about the colourful birds with a box to tick when you spot one. made a great educational competition. loved it. also great picnic spot with benches and toilets in the shop.

Really nice place to visit.. The gardens are a great spot to visit, having lived in Sydney for 6 years I had never visit the gardens. The have an amazing view and really beautiful places to stroll. Good for families, friends and couples on a picnic.

Another lovely walk through the gardens. Nothing not to like about the gardens. Beautiful, tranquil and interesting (if you're in the mood to learn, there's plenty of informative signs). I will alway love the sign when you approach the gardens from the opera house that says 'please walk on the grass'.

Look out for the parrots. The gardens are beautiful and extensive. They are bordered by the harbour on one side and the Central Business District on the other - it's quite a contrast to leave the high rise buildings of the CBD to find yourself in the peace of the RBG.I'd recommend visiting the gardens more than once if possible at different times of the day as I found the character changed depending on the time, especially first thing in the morning when there were few people around. Look out for the parrots (rainbow lorikeets) in the trees.

Special. We did the touristy thing in Sydney for a weekend. Botanical gardens were well worth the effort. They have been well maintained and looked after, and there is a lot of great information around it as well. Not many other Botanical Gardens have such a spectacular view (possibly the best in Sydney) and such a great location for tourists - within walking distance of many great Sydney attractions.

Too huge to see everything on one outing. This fabulous garden merits at least a couple of visits. A good way to get an overview is to take the little train ride, which departs regularly from near the Opera House.

Botanic Gardens are FREE in Australia. I haven't found a free Botanic Garden in the States but I guess it might be that they don't get funding support from government sources and they must have this type of funding in Australia. Regardless, I love the fact that this park is free to wander through. You have drop dead gorgeous views of Sydney Harbor from the park and there are great limestone (or similar) outcroppings that you can duck under if it happens to be raining. The path winds through many varied plants/trees and there are dozens of birds flying around. There are plenty of benches if you have the mind to sit and stay awhile and restrooms facilities. The gardens are beautifully maintained and I observed several caretakers out and about tending to the plants and the grounds. It is hard to imagine such a serene place so close to the hustle and bustle of downtown Sydney. The gardens are well worth your time, even if you don't have much available.
Worth a Visit. Great to walk around and a fantastic array of flowers and trees.The only shame is the expense of entering the tropical house

Lovely place to wander. The Royal Botanic gardens have a lovely location on the waterfront beside the Opera House. You can spend a lot of time wandering around the extensive area, looking up to see the flying foxes, admiring the various plants or just sit down & people watch.I would recommend joining a free guided walk from the Garden Shop at 10.30 or 1pm Mon-Fri. Our guide was very informative & passionate about the flora & fauna. She showed the small group things we would never have spotted without her. Well worthwhile if you have the time. It takes about an hour.

Oasis in the city. If you are visiting Sydney I would recommend a stroll through the Botanic Gardens. It is free to visit and the views over Sydney Harbour are stunning! There are numerous paths meandering through the well maintained gardens. A relaxing way to escape the hustle and bustle of the city.

Nice walk. We didn't have lots time in Sydney,We went to see the garden Before we got on our cruise ship.What the beautiful garden. You can got amazing view of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge from waterfront walk.

A green oasis. What a huge place this is.Fantastic landscaped and planted areas.Lovely to see the birds wandering freely around and workers having their sandwich lunch breaks. Only let down was food outlets,bit shabby.

I could spend days exploring this place!. I've walked through the gardens on numerous occasions and it's never enough. I could spend days in this place, there's just so much beauty to see. Look for the bats (the 'flying foxes') that sleep in the trees at day then swarm across the city and the bridge at night.

Brilliant. The gardens are quite extensive and have a wonderful range of plant varieties, including a range forest section. It is peaceful walking around the paths or sitting on the seating provided throughout. Well worth a visit.

Very Restful. This was a lovely place to relax away from the bustle. We took a little train to look around as we were a little weary by the time we got to the gardens. The driver was typical OZ - full of good humour and with lots of interesting things to say

Flowers and trees. Well, you go to Sydney and your thinking, so much for city life, what to do?Go to the circular key and take your pick however the gardens are the icon. Forget the bridge, harbour, the pubs ( yes proper pubs!!!), the cafes, the gardens and parks - the botanic gardens are the place for that perfect, never forget photo with views of the harbour, bridge and opera house!
Lovely respite from the hussle and bustle. Beautiful area, so close to the city centre for walking and cooling down. Well worth a visit if you have time, take a picnic lunch and rest the feet!

Beautiful Botanic Garden. A must see for any visit to Sydney. Apart from spectacular views of the Harbour Bridge, the Opera House and the bay, the Gardens contain The Governor's House, a beautiful public swimming pool, restauants and special collections of palms, tropical plants and, my favourite, the Fern House. There's also a fragrant collection of medicinal plants and many shady ans scenic walks where fit people run and jog at all hors of the day. Also visit the NSW Art Gallery, situated in the gardens.

Disordered.. The botanic gardens in Sydney was a disappointment. There are flowers and trees, sure, but the lack of landscaping lets it down. All areas are the same - paths with lawns and flower beds. The oriental section does not feel oriental. It's all jumbled. The Chinese Friendship Garden was MUCH better - unless you are a botanist or want to take a photo of the Opera House, try that instead.

Botanci Gardens. It is nice to have a stroll through the gardens but not really special and the high buildings on the background reminds you continuously of the city. But it smells good in the gardens.

Royal indeed. Must see in Sydney - well marked, wonderful garden shop, shade on hot days, beautiful to walk/run or bike or sit and read/relax. Great place to get a photo of both the bridge and opera house in one shot or sunset over the harbor. Warning - check closing time in the summer, it may still be light but they lock the gates and only have one exit which can be quite a walk and even that locks up.

Free and walking distance of both downtown Sydney and the Cruise ships. Large free garden with tons of places to get good exercise/jog/bike in gorgeous scenery. Lots of huge trees that remind me of the trees in the movie, "Lord of the Rings". Has a Cactus Garden and a Rose Garden. Playgrounds for children are there but difficult to find (near the walkway between the Botanic Gardens and the Opera House along the ocean).Greenhouse was not open.You definitely can spend at least 2-3 hours exploring. I didn't even realize that the Botanic Gardens stretched all the way to the sea until I took the Walkway between the Opera House and the Botanic Gardens.Tons of places to take pictures with great views and FREE!
Beautiful gardens. The gardens are great. One of my favorite parts was seeing all the flying foxes hanging in the trees. It was full of beauty and a really pretty walk.
Beautiful. An excellent display in superb surroundings , but , given the climate it should not be a problem . There were a lot of Cranes present , which , for some reason are presenting a problem?
Picnic under the big fig tree. Love the sprawling lawns and soaring trees and countless picnic spots... Laid-back, effortless, picture-perfect Sydney.
Peace and quiet in the hustle and bustle. Just the most relaxingly beautiful stroll I've had in a long time. Lush green, blue sky shining, perfect backdrop. I love you Sydney!

Quick tour via the Choo Choo Express. I was short on time, but wanted to get a look at the gardens. There's much to see, and the grounds are lovely. I'd definitely go back to explore it some more when I have time.
An ideal location for a picnic, or a walk, or even just to sit around and stare at the sky.
An oasis of quiet in busy Sydney. We spent hours strolling through the various nooks and crannies of this expansive garden. It's a great place to relax and escape the noise of the city.

Great Way to Spend a Day (or Two). When in Sydney, you definitely have to set aside a day (or two) to wander through the Gardens. Start early in the morning and head into the center of the park. If you are a birdwatcher (or even if you're not), watching the cockatoos and lorikeets going about their morning activities is fascinating. Take your camera and be prepared for some spectacular shots.Be sure to explore all of the paths, especially the amazing walk that goes along a long stretch of the harbour. If you walk past the Opera House, you can catch a bite to eat at the restaurant by the Circular Quay and then head back to the Gardens for a late afternoon stroll.

Lovely walks throughout park. This was the last Botanical Garden park that we went to on our trip and found it to be plainer than most of the other parks that we had enjoyed. Lots of shade though to get away from the heat. Maps of the park not available at all entrance gates. Do take a tour of Government House if you are there on the weekend. The tour guide was quite interesting. What we did find unusual is that we were told we could walk on the grass but at Government House they had signs saying Keep off the grass.
Perfect for a lazy afternoon. The Royal Botanic Gardens are so beautiful - the energy FEELS so good - and are probably best enjoyed on a Sat or Sun with a picnic lunch. A must do while in Sydney.

Immaculate and cared for. On my first day in Sydney I walked through the gardens on my way to the Opera House and was smitten with it. It is such a beautiful place and immaculately mantained, Sydney can be very proud of its Botanic Garden.
Lovely. The Botanical Gardens are beautiful. Lots of different areas to see. The lilly pond was lovely. Great to get some fresh air away from the noisy city.

A green oasis. In the heat of a Sydney summer this is the perfect place to unwind although don't be surprised to see a non-stop parade of runners and joggers along the water's edge whatever the time of day. Without a 'keep off the grass' in sight you're pretty much free to wander wherever you please which is great because there are plenty of hidden surprises tucked out of view. The sculpture trail (details in the gift shop) makes for an interesting distraction and if you've got the time to dwell a walk up to Mrs Mcquaries Chair and the less manicured Domain is definitely worthwhile for more photo opportunies.This side of the bay also has an open air cinema during the hotter months - we didn't have the time to go but it's worth asking your hotel for details of what's showing and booking ahead. Against a backdrop of the Harbour Bridge it would certainly be memorable.
wonderful views. The view across to Harbour Bridge and the Opera House are wonderful. Lots of shady spots. Cafe was average. Gift shop pricey.

Great for a picnic. On a pleasant, sunny day, it's a great place for a picnic... From a certain spot you can enjoy fabulous views of the water, the Sydney Harbour Bridge and the Opera House, as you soak in the sun. Some of the best things in life don't cost too much!
An oasis of calm in the city. I was so surprised at how quiet it is in these gardens especially since it's in the middle of the city
Quality moment. If you are in Sydeny, you should allocate some of your time to walk in this magnificent park! You have a great view of the Harbour bridge!

So relaxing. Full of different corners, flowers and not forgetting the bats !! Wouldnt miss it. The cactus garden is so well designed. Minus was the cost of the sandwiches in the tea room - $17 for a basic sandwich !

gorgeous!. I am so glad that we happened upon the gardens, it wasn't really on our 'to do' list for our visit, but we loved it so much we went back to take pics! It's tranquil and beautiful. Make sure you see it!

Best in the country!. We went to the botanical gardens in Brisbane, Cairns, Adelaide, Portland,Mebourne and Sydney. This was the best and not to be missed and the views of the city and the harbour were spectacular.

More than just flowers.... a pleasant walk with lovely views of Sydney Harbour. Ibises and storks wander around amid the lovely flowers, trees and shrubs and there are amazing sights such as flowering bamboo, "bird of paradise" plants, bat nests in the tall trees and pretty butterflies.Worth a visit even if it's just an hour or so.

Just a lovely way to spend Australia Day. Always enjoy wandering around the Botanic Gardens. Australia day is a great celebration and Government House was also very interesting. Tours going during the day.
Beautiful. In the USA, you have to go to a pet shop to see cockatoos and lorikeets. Here they are flynig around free!

Glorious Gardens. The Royal Botanic Gardens (to give them their full honorific) are magnificent! The botanical aspect is marvellous; the setting is superb; the amenities are fine. There is something for everyone and space and ambience to spare. I cannot imagine a more beautiful outlook and a more seductive setting than we hav here in this Australian spectacular attraction.The Gardnes are easy to access; they are rife with information about the plants and well signed. Go and enjoy time out right in the heart of a bustling, vibrant cosmopolitan city.i
A must see. Great gardens to walk around with amazing variety of plants and trees. Wonderful views of the city, opera house and bridge
quiet spot. enjoyed the gardens and a lovely spot to take a time out from walking around the Opera House and surroundings
herb garden. I loved the Herb garden, and Rose Garden, we caught the choo choo train and it still took us 4 housr to see most of it

Breathtaking...... This attraction is one of its kind in Sydney. Good place to walk around and a short walk from Sydney CBD.You should be there for the whole day to enjoy and explore what the Garden has to offer.

A Favourite Walk to Circular Quay!. This 75acre stunning garden is the oldest in the country established on the site of the first farm in the new colony. I particularly enjoy my walk from the entrance opposite the State Library at the end of Martin Place ... majestic Moreton Fig Trees, the Tropical centre with its rare ferns and orchids, the Garden Gift Shop and cafe, and various splendid themed gardens highlight the walk. Plan your excursion to finish with a walk along the foreshore at Farm Cove ending at the iconic Sydney Opera House and Circular Quay.
Lovely gardens to stroll or get out and run. .. In the heart of Sydney you won't want to miss a walk through the gardens. . see the Opera house and tall skyline in a lush green tropical oasis. .
Beautiful Gardens. To stave off jet-lag, I headed to the Botanical Gardens and spent a few hours walking the paths and admiring the many gardens. It's a beautiful large park. Highly recommend!
Beautiful!. Make plans to visit these and take a leisurely stroll around. The views are just amazing. This is a very enjoyable activity

LOVE this place. A fantastic blend of relaxation, sights, festivals and culture. I come here with my family quite regularly, sometimes for a picnic. Often we are lucky enough to catch a festival happening. This week we happened across the opening of the autumn festival and lay in the shade watching the Japanese drummers, what a sight!! Against the background of the opera house and the gardens it's just a fabulous place to while away the hours. AND it's completely free!!! I've done the little train tour a few times and that expensive what what it is but most informative. I haven't yet been into the old government house but I will on my next visit. I've been to a wedding I the gardens too and that was lovely. Interestingly theres a while program of things happening in autumn, including a show about one of the aboriginal elders and where she grew up- looks really interesting.. this week I saw that a stage was being erected for a show, judging by to 20ft sign visible for miles i think its Carmen.. What a fantastic venue for a show. I'll go back time and time again!
Beautiful. Stunning gardens that are easy to walk or you can take a small train around. The gardens are right next to the Sydney Opera House and easy to get to.

Nice Wildlife. This is the spot if you want to see some cool wildlife. I walked around for about 2 hours on a very hot day, yet still managed to enjoy it despite the sun beating down. The only place in Australia where I finally saw a Kookaburra, as well as many different parrots and a colony of flying foxes. There are also many interesting trees and plants with some areas being very fragrant. There is a great view of the harbour bridge and the opera house from there as well.

gardens are worth a day of tour. These gardens are magnificent--filled with great plants--many in bloom--don't expect everything in bloom any time of the year since they don't have seasons like we do--stuff blooms on and off all year long

The best?. We were told that 200 staff look after these gardens and can well believe it, they are magnificant and the best kept we have ever seen. It is spinkled with information both on plants and history. Go, but if you give the gardens the time they deserve take your own refreshments, I thought the cafe area dire although I did see some white table cloths upstairs, presumably for lunch, or dinner?
good place to visit and relaxing. It is very different from Vietnam, we can step on the grass and everything here are very arrangement... nice and natural

An Oasis in the busy city.. A very interesting place. The best area for us was the dedicated to explaining what the early settlers found when coming to Australia and what they grew. The whole place is interesting and tranquil. I like the notice the said 'please walk on the grass' !

Beautiful gardens with beautiful views. The Botanical Gardens are a lovely place to visit. There are plenty of plants, trees, and flowers to enjoy, as well as gorgeous views of the Opera House and Harbor Bridge. The area is very well maintained and there are bathrooms available. Although I did not spend a lot of time here due to other plans, I would suggest that you give it a shot. I would go back again. Very nice photo opportunities throughout.
Beautiful and well maintained.. We walked several paths in the garden. So many beautiful trees and plants. Great views of Opera House and Harbor Bridge from the point.
lovely setting. loved the food selection and location, The sounds of the birds is a bonus. There were not enough tables.

Beautiful day and withing walking distance of hotel. It's a nice way to spend a few hours while strolling around the Quay, Opera House, and Darlington Harbor on connected walkways. I love the way the city and harbor is designed. Very pedestrian-friendly with beautiful views!

Excellent. Thoroughly enjoyed our leisurely walk through wonderful botanic gardens. Large, mature plantings of plants I have only seen in pots or pictures. What a charming way to spend the afternoon with the Ibis as they walked around the grassy areas. We only had 3 days in Sydney, but an hour or so here was definitely worthwhile.

Great place for a walk/run. What a wonderful garden/park area for those in and around downtown Sydney. During a recent stay I took many walks here and runs in the morning. Be sure to check the hours of operation as this is not a 24 hour type garden/park. Wonderful escape in the heart of the city!

beautiful gardens right on sydney harbour. beautiful gardens right on sydney harbour and has almost every plant and fauna you want from all around the world this great garden is a must place to see and you need at least all day to go throught this magic parl

Great views from the gardens. Very well kept and some nice displays. Not as large as I had expected and merges with the very nice harbour park so it feels quite large. The tropical house was closed when we were there so did not get to see that.

Beautiful!. Beautiful gardens and trees. Could spend hours just relaxing, having coffee or lunch. Peaceful even with tourists around.
Tip: This is a good spot to take good photos/panoramas of the Sydney Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.

Stunning and free?!. The gardens cover a huge area on the harbour front in Sydney and it is definitely worth spending several hours strolling through them. They are excellently maintained and the flora and fauna us stunning. Make sure you look up in the trees to see the fruit bats and macaws in the trees. Don't forget your camera!

Lovely location and a pleasant place to spend time. In Macquarie Street and quite extensive. Can be approached from the foreshore and worthwhile looking across to the harbour. Cafe here is quite good. A good place to stroll around, lie down and relax, have a picnic; no alcohol.

Beautifully space. I had a few hours to kill before checking in to my hotel and decided to have a wander around the gardens. They really are beautiful and you can spend a long time here. Lots of different trees, flowers and birds are on show and the whole area is wonderfully well kept.If you start from the art gallery/Domain end your trip with culminate with a view across the water of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge.

A work of love. Take your time to walk along the beautiful paths and trails within the gardens. I was here in late Feb. so many of the spring blooms were lonf gone. Take you time in the rose garden to enjoy the many varities of fragerant roses. We arrived after a few days of heavy winds and rain and the staff had done a spectacular job of resoration.Pack a picnic lunch and enjoy the many great features of the gardens! My favorite was the fern garden.

You could get lost in these gardens... I loved the Botanic Gardens so much history, art and I love different flowers from all over the world plus I love the way they have different gates linking with different parts of the city so I walked from Potts Point over to the Harbour with a lovely view of pretty flowers :)

Beautiful Gardens. The best part of this visit is that it was FREE! What a beautiful oasis in the city near the Opera House. It is certainly worth the time to walk through and enjoy a leisurely stroll.
Impressive. Unbelievable that such a big city can afford such nice cute gardens. It makes the views of the opera house even nicer.

Lovely gardens. We spent a few hours in the gardens to kill some time but it was a fantastic destination in itself. There were so many different areas to wander around in and the higher parts give fantastic views over the harbour so you can see the bridge and Opera House. There were plenty of people enjoying the park and I wish we could have gone back again to explore further.
Royal Bore Gardens. Glad this was free. Not many flowers and half the trees were palms. Not well kept and watch out for the joggers.

Beautiful, relaxed, varied. You may only want to take a walk in a beautiful place, or you may want to know more about the flora of Sydney. It's perfect for both. Specimens are labeled, but members of the staff can also locate trees that are not labeled.

Awesome flora and spots to relax. Garden is very well maintaned and plants are great and most look quite exotic. Lots of spots on lawns and under trees for taking a rest which is what locals seem to be doing over lunchbreak. Great way to walk down to Opera House from Eastern suburbs.
Stunning Gardens. A Lovely place to visit in Sydney with terrific restaurant. Beautifully maintained and wonderful plants and trees. Pop in to the Conservatorium of Music while you are there.

Beautiful and fantastic views!. Great to walk and run around and simply beautiful! The views and gardens are wonderful. Really close to the harbour restaurants and cafes and you can go on to continue walking around the harbour. Great to picnic with family and friends if you are wanting to show the sights and local attractions. Highly recommend it.

Wonderful. It was so green and calm. Weird looking interesting trees. Very peaceful and serene. I had an evening walk so the sea breeze was just perfect to catch a refresher. Away from the city hype. I liked the Umbrella Tree very much.

morning run in the garden. The morning run in the botanical garden (or around it before 7am - since doors are closed overnight) is a highlight in Sydney downtown. This run brings you to various scenic viewpoints at the Opera, at Macquaires chair and in the middle of the garden. Beside the various plants you'll also encounter bats, wombats, ibis and many other birds.

A City Escape. The Royal Botanical Gardens its a place I always loved to go in Sydney. They are close by and provides a breeze of fresh air helping me to relax and recharge. To have such a relaxing environment in the middle of the city is something truly amazing.There is such a big collection of trees and plants that a botanist will be crazy. Really nice place to spend the day and have a nice family day.

Location is Terrific. Minutes away from the hustle and bustle of Sydney central this open, airy and beautifully positioned restaurant in the heart of the botanical gardens was an absolute pleasure to visit for lunch and more than made up for the food which was definitely cooked by a chef who lacked technique and flair.

Royal Botanic Gardens. We had a lovely time in garden so much to to see. Gardens are so well looked after and lots of signage if you do not know your plants to see some plants in full flower was wonderful

Arboretum. I would call the Royal Botanic Gardens an arboretum, rather than a botanic garden. There are hundreds of beautiful trees around the property. The greenhouse is packed with plants, but is not properly ventilated (it was 110 degrees the day we were there). It is worth seeing.

peace!. a pleasant place to visit whilst in this busy bustling city.take the costal route pass the opera house as this offers the sea breeze and spendid views scenic!the gardens offer an abundance of plants and trees and birdlife and yes you can sit on the grass!

Beautiful Botanic. Spent an hour on our first morning just strolling through these wonderful gardens. Suggest a more focused and informed visit would be rewarding. You could spend a few hours here, there's a restaurant and you can right up closed to the water's edge.

If you love plants or just relax, see stunning views of Operahouse come here. I love plants and green around, and thisn place is great , not only for plant buffs - in which case one day will not be enough, you shoudl read each signposts on plants and gather knowledge of the origins of the plants and name which you might forget soon, but see the rose garden , when in full bloom , the reds, the pinks, the whites will bring joy, visit the various trees with Bats - there are lots of bats hanging there, have a sroll, do some running, or just relax and sit of the greens and enjoy views of Harbour, Opera house and the sea, or read a book its amazing - I love it

Great Place to Escape. A lovely space to walk around, take pictures or have picnic lunch. I especially enjoyed the lotus garden and many different kinds of trees that grow here. Also a good place to get more views of the Opera House.

Amazing layout, great photo sessions. Beautifully maintained, wonderful walking paths, great for families or romantic couples. Plenty of tourist friendly facilities nearby. Peaceful and beautiful. Locals are great for information and food references.

great area in the middle of the city. we spent few hours walking around Sydney beautiful Botanic gardens and have nice meal in the gardens cafe. This is a unique area to visit just in the City center!- highly recomended
A true delight. Such magnicifent gardens to stroll thru on the way to the Opera House. They are cared for beautifully & I felt safe walking thru them in the early evening.
Pre baby Holiday. This was a great way to spend a relaxing morning. Plenty of places to stop and rest along the way and enjoy the surroundings.
Great way to unwind in the cool & shade.. Great value bit of Sydney close to the city and on the bus route from Bondi. Not too precious and serious, very calming.

A Picnic in the Gardens. We met friends in the Royal Botanic Gardens for an afterwork drink and nibble. We were kept entertained with the views of Sydney Harbour, the Harbour Bridge and also people watching as locals and tourists walked between the Opera House and Mrs Macquarie Chair. A large contingent of kiddies marched across the lawns enmass from Macquarie Street to a nearby hill to watch ta production of the 'Wind in the Willows'. From the sounds of laughter floating down to us, we think they must have enjoyed themselves. Sitting and chatting in the midst of Sydney's verdant gardens was a lovely way to break up the work week and enjoy Sydney.
Unexpected beauty and variety. Walked around it on a lovely day and was impressed with the variety of vistas and plants. Enjoyed the shop and also a concurrent exhibition.
A Must if you like beauty. Tropical and temperate vegetation neatly planned and mature in growth and presentation. Take the "mini train" if pressed for time.
Take a stroll. Lovely spot for a picnic or just a casual walk around the gardens. Also great for photographers - get some great macro shots or close ups of the flowers.

Unmissable. A visit is a must!! The Gardens are very extensive and located right next to the Opera House and Harbour. I am by no means a gardener of any sort but the sheer variety of trees and plants is amazing. Why not take a picnic? If you have time, spend a day there wandering around. Best of all, it's completely free!

Gardens of Sydney. For any gardner, this is a must see. They are located with the harbor on one side and the city on the other. The local population obviously loves them. I loved the architectural features, the rose, and the herb gardens. There is a great walking and/or running path.
Beautiful gardens!. So much variety! A tropical oasis among the buildings of the city. I enjoyed the serenity and the various plants and birds within the gardens. As well, I loved the rose gardens.
Best in Sydney. Walking around the Botanic Gardens is one of the highlights of Sydney. It has an excellent position starting by the Opera House and meandering up to the NWS Art Gallery. A must.

Tranquility by the Sea. A fantastic place to stroll, right by the harbor, and take in some awesome trees. There are loads of grassy areas to relax with sodas from the Garden Cafe. An absolute must see for a visit to Sydney.

not to miss in sydney. Our sister , a resident of Sydney, had some task to achieve, so that left my wife and I to our own devices. We were staying in the port terminal area and so walked round by the Opera House to enter the Gardens at a lower level. A $10 "train" gave us a half hour overview of these very large gardens so we could plan the rest of our day. So much to see, and beautiful. Mrs Macquaries Point and Chair, Government House Grounds, Rose Garden, Herb Garden,Main Pond. Some lucky and talented musicians (200 of them) get to board at the Conservatory on edge of Gardens, what an inspiring place to be. First class Sydney sight.

Royal Botanic Gardens made my day!. At first I thought this was just an ordinary park, trees, people, grass, whatever. But the more I walked, the more entranced I was. It provided me many angles and areas at which I could take beautiful photos of the harbour bridge as well ad the iconic Sydney opera house! It was beautiful. Almost near the end of the walk near a swimming pool, there were wild cockatoos and rainbow lorikeets! I was so amazed, those birds were friendly too, one even landed on mt head to say hello!

loved it. we ar the type of people who like to wander around in a city but also to see something more than just buildings. These Gardens can't be missed as they are located next to the Opera House where everybody goes to anyhow! It's a wellmainained place, nice to just walk around in!
Lovely area. Great place to visit with areas to sit or lie in the sun. Lots of amazing plants to see. We enjoyed a nice picnic with great views, just superb.
