Wonderful green space. A lazy afternoon stroll through this beautiful space takes you all around the world with the variety of plants and trees present. So many great spaces and at one point it provides a beautiful view of the Harbour Bridge. I was taken back to my years in Hawaii with the ginger flowers and their amazing fragrance.
Beautiful gardens. Beautiful stroll past may endemic trees, shrubs, flowers, ponds. Great views of the harbour bridge and opera house.
An enjoyable walk. I love walking around the harbour and what better route to take than the Royal Botanic Gardens . The gardens themselves are lovely and the views are to die for.

A must do!. We visited the Royal Botanic Gardens on our last day in Sydney. What an awesome park. Stunning views, beautiful gardens. Just wished we'd been able to visit Government House. Nfortunaely it wasn't open the day we went.
One of the. most beautiful gardens I walk trough. Small irrigation rivers, magnificents plants and trees, lots of good place to sit and relax and/or read or what ever you like to do in a garden.

Beautiful and peaceful. Botanic gardens seems to be somthing they have in every Australian city. The Royal Botanic Gardens in Sydney are diverse and big. At any time you can see runners, families, weddings, backpackers, people relaxing. It's a great place to come and enjoy nature, have fun with friends, learn about some plants and just relax.I loved seeing the bats out and about in daylight just hanging fromt he trees, I'm not used to seeing them in daylight. They do destroy the trees they hang from with their, well, poo...You can see a great varity of birds and plants, walk to the Opera House, look at the Opera House & Harbour Bridge from famous vantage points. I went to the Botanic Gardens on a daily basis while in Sydney, it's just so lovely.
Large gardens by the sea. There is an amazing variety of plants and trees. Lovely to see parrots and other exotic birds. Government house is situated in the gardens, which canbe toured at weekends

Get away from it all !!. This is the best place to clear your head... so close to the city and you might as well be on holiday... I am lucky enough to live in Sydney, so I am a regular here, this is where I bring my dog for a walk... I love Lady Macquarie's chair... the walk around to Woolloomooloo wharf.. the stunning views of the Opera House and the Bridge along the foreshore ... the sound of the native birds... the healthy bodies out for their morning run... the only thing I don't like are the buses bringing in the hoards of tourists to have their photographs taken.... but even that can have a positive spin ...it one lives in a beautiful city like Sydney then one must share!!

Beautiful Gardens. Spent a lovely morning wandering through the gardens looking at the beautiful plants and flowers. Although close to the CBD, you are a world away from the hubbub. Mrs MacQuarie's Chair worth the walk, but beware the joggers over lunchtime.

a breath of fresh air in the heart of Sydney. I enjoyed every bit of my walk though these beautiful gardens. My 7 yr old had a good time too, however for lack of time I was forced to leave earlier than I desired to. The small pond with lotuses by the cafe was an awesome stop to take in the beauty of nature. The roses were breath takingly beautiful. I highly recommend this place to all nature lovers visiting Sydney

Beautiful place . I just happened to go to the gardens because I had some time to kill. But it turns out, it was more scenic than I imagined. And I would easily count this as one of the highlights of my Sydney trip. The view of the bridge and opera House from the gardens is amazing. And the garden itself wasn't very crowded and very zen. Must visit place in Sydney.

Beautiful place to visit. The Botanical Gardens on a beautiful day is a gorgeous day out in Sydney. You are right on the Harbour with great views. Its a one minute walk into the gardens from the Opera House. There is a hop on hop off train that kids love that gets you around if you are not up for walking. A lovely restaurant. Great picnic places. All smack in the middle of the city. Walk one way and you end up at the Art Gallery. Another and you end up at the Mitchell Library. Its a wonderful location full of beautiful native trees and flora.

Picture perfect. If there's a place in Australia that I want to visit again and again, its the botanic gardens. Set right in the heart of the city, these gardens provide a sense of calm in this fast, hurried city. Gardens are very well maintained and neatly kept. Some of the varieties grown here are very rare and some are native to Australia. It was a delightful experience for me. I walked through the botanic gardens starting from Hyde Park and ended up with a beautiful view of Opera House. Long walk but very pleasant.

What a lovely garden. I often visit these gardens, they are nice for a picnic, a walk, an exhibition, a casual or restaurant meal (there is a restaurant set in the garden as well as a cafe) or plant watching. Set on beautiful Sydney Harbour, it's not to be missed when visiting Sydney
Jewel in the Crown. What a lovely place! The gardens are just a magical place, unexpectedly found in between the skyscrapers of Sydney. You could easily spend hours here

Midnight at the Oasis. We saw the new year (2013) in the Botanical Gardens at Midnight at the Oasis - wow! Best new year celebrations I have ever been too - lovely gardens, great people and good food. Go if you get the chance.

Disappointed Photographer. I have to say I was disappointed. I expected all sorts of tropical flowers, but it seemed to be mostly trees. Spectacular trees admitedly, but trees and more trees. Having experienced the Chicao Botanic Gardens, many times, I can only say that I was disappointed.

So much to see and smell!. The gardens are just so beautifull and will not disapoint. Alot of work must go into these to keep them looking so inviting. A great place to relax and walk on the good pathway system running through out the park.
A very peaceful area fora walk. This is a great area for a walk in a beautiful setting.It is hard to get the feel you are in a large metropolitan area
NYE = Amazing. We went here on NYE and had tickets to Midnight at the Oasis- this was the most amaing New Year ever with world class views of the harbour. Worth every penny!!!
beautiful. A lovely place to walk. Lots of gorgeous plants & even a nice cafe at which to have lunch or coffee.
Oasis in the city. Short walk from the Opera House. Quiet, tranquil and great place to have a picnic lunch. Nice walks away from rraffic and noise

Love a stroll through the gardens. Always enjoy a stroll through the gardens. I love the herb garden and the new gazebo. Lots of people enjoying the coolness. Lots of birds and great plants. Worth a visit.
Good family outing. This is a good way to spend time with the kids and enjoy the outdoors. There is plenty of shady spots and the kids can run and jump and roll on the grass.

Take your time!. The Botanic Gardens begin outside the Opera House door and offer a spectacular, relaxing view over the Harbour. You don't need to be a plant lover to appreciate this gorgeous place (although it helps). You just need to sit, breathe and take it all in. Fabulous!
How to relax and be exhilerated. Take a stroll and soak up fantastic gardens while enjoying the sites of the most beautiful harbor in the World.

If the Opera house is the icon of Sydney, this is the natural beating heart only a stones throw away!. This is one of the best botanical gardens in the world. A short walk from Circular Quay it is possible to park and walk through the gardens towards the bridge and the Opera house with great views of both. It has open lawns, fern walk through, cactus garden and trees of all sorts with information. There is a cafe and greenhouse area (significant charge) and on a sunny day has a real community feel. The art gallery of New South Wales is also in the gardens and worth a visit. Take a picnic, visit the art gallery and walk for a couple of hours to really unwind. Great.

A must for the horticultural set.. These gardens are beautifully laid out over a vast area. We investigated most of it as we are keen gardeners and lovers of exotic plants. The views from the gardens of the harbour, opera house and bridge are really an added perk. The vast lawns, huge trees, the rose gardens, the lake and the tropical plant house made this a very worthwhile visit and I highly recommend it as a very pleasant outing for everyone. Apart from this the wonderful gardens there is a good souvenir shop as well as some restaurants, one being finer dining. A memorable experience.

Beautifully Clean. Lots of shady spots lovely and clean and plently of space without encroaching on someone else , if its wet there are alot of paved area's for you to sit . Lots of seats and bins and sunny spots as well. Overall a great garden right in the heart of a beautifly city. Grab a tasty lunch or coffee from pie face across the road and eat in the park simpy beautiful
Great place on a nice day. The location of the Royal Botanic Gardens is ideal, perhaps they could get some more exotic plants and trees from Brisbane and Melbourne's Botanic Garden

What a gem. This is a must for anyone who loves trees and birds. THere are so many varieties of mature trees and unfamiliar birds that you will find yourself in a state of awe from time to time. I loved it.

excellent gardens. This was a second visit to the botanical gardens, plants and flowers from all over the world, especially enjoyed seeing the bats!Large park with good walks some along the harbour, divided into various areas including lakes and and glasshouses.We had lunch in the restaurant which was excellent, the restaurant overlooks the lake which enhances the venue.
Excellent green. Great to see so much green in the middle of this city. The contrast with the buildings is enormous. Check out the flying foxes and the friendly cockatoos! Good for a morning jog.

Paradise. A wonderful spot to escape the noise and madness of the city. Easy walking tracks, eatery and some great themed areas to look at and explore. Or of not ...find a spot on the lawn and take in the harbour!!

Scenic gardens. Beautiful gardens covering a lot of grounds. Lots of interesting birds to see as well as plants. Great free activity for tourists or for going on a date. You could also pack a lunch. Personally I felt there was so much to see in Sydney that the gardens were worth a fairly quick walk through only on the way to the Opera House.
Very nice place. We enjoyed walking at the Royal botanic garden. Well-groomed with many interesing trees and plants. Nice view of Opera House and Harbor bridge.
Beautiful. A Place to see the beautiful Skyline, amazing gardens and wonderful coast all in one place! Go on a sunny day!
Beautiful!. Make sure you get a map when you start (go to the gift shop)-- this place is large and you don't want to miss the succulent garden or the fernery!

Well worth a visit...mind the joggers though!. Very well kept little sanctuary in the city. Superb views of the Opera House and Bridge. One annoyance is the hundreds of joggers all on the same path as the walkers. This really needs somethign doing about it as it becomes very, very irritaiting!

Simply Beautiful. The Botanical Gardens were beautiful......Serene and very well cared for. The staff were very, very helpful and NO question was too much trouble to answer. Thank you for a memorable visit!!
beautiful. This was a beautiful place to visit. It was incredibly relaxing and although there were many people there, it did not appear to be busy!
must go place.. wonderful view and lots of photography view. Bring water and wear good walking shoes. Sit at the shade and thank God for Sydney.

Unbelievably well kept grounds!. Wow, we spent almost half a day, went early in he morning, got the best of the day, not too many people, lots of amazing plant life, birds galore and specific areas dedicated to many different kinds of botanical species. Great views to the bay and Opera house as well.

Beautiful (and free) walking in the gardens. Yes, the gardens are a beautiful walk experience. The place is very well preserved, and the beauty of the trees and flowers and the landscape will pay for the tireness after the long walk.
Go there.

stroll among the ibis, rainbow lorikeets and bats - oh and gorgeous trees too. this garden has been there for long enough to have mature trees of extraordinary shape and variety. and they are memorable.But nothing is as memorable as the lorikeets for their colour, the ibis for their omnipresent pervasiveness, and the bats for their size (don't worry, they just hang in some of the trees and don't fly in daylight).Take a hat, or budget to buy one in the gift shop.

Well worth a visit. The gardens are a great place to walk whatever the weather or season. There are helpful leaflets everywhere, the first time I have seen this in similar attractions, useful maps at every turn and the gardens are well signposted. Don't miss the gift shop. Something for everyone.

I Love this Place. Great views and a pleasant walk through some of the most beautiful plants/flowers. Always peaceful considering it sits in the middle of a bustling city. I suggest a walk from Circular Quay to the Opera House, through the Gardens and come out at Macquarie Street to enter the city of Sydney. Easy and fun!

Probably the wrong time to visit.... What garden? There was practically nothing there when I went and it could have passed for a standard park. In fact, other Sydney parks were "better" with more greenery and flowers.
Beautiful setting. Loved the gardens. Very interesting trees and plants - lots of places to sit and relax and enjoy the views over the harbour. Really well kept

A HAPPY WALK HOME. We had spent a long time at the Chinese Gardens and the Rocks, so the walk home was potentially tiring, but going through the gardens was calming and lovely. The options for photography were great, so the photographer in our group has a lovely collection.

Stunning!. One of the best botanical gardens that we have ever visited. Well laid out, well signposted, with Aboriginal cultural artefacts, and Government House adjacent.Free to visit.Busy, excellent coffee shop.
nice way to spend a day in syd. a must see attraction, good for family who want to plan a picnic.choose a cool spot under a shade and you could spend all day here.

Botanical Gardens. Most visits to Sydney we enjoy walking through the Botanical gardens always something different to see, finishing of at the opera house then onto circular key - great views and a lovely way to escape the city

Excellent!. This is definitely one of my favorite tourist attractions when visiting Sydney. It's really big and just perfect for having a stress-free day in the city. You can sit on the grass or on a bench and read for hours with only the birds bothering you and taking a glance at the amazing view of the city, the Opera House and Harbour Bridge once in a while.

A beautiful place to take a beautiful person. This would be the ideal place to take your romantic partner. With historic walkways covered with a plethora of flora, this is a beautiful place to walk through and simply take in the beauty and the atmosphere
fantasic walks. this is a brilliant place to walk around you can spend a day here take a picnic and just chill out great views across the bay

A extremely pleasant afternoon. I the weather is not to hot, this is a extremely enjoyable walk around the gardens, even though a person whom is not a keen gardener it is very ipmpressive grounds and great views back drop vista to the Opera House and the CBD.
my favourite sydney city place. it's just a great place to be......... on the water, beautiful gardens, flying foxes.DEFINITELY GO IN SPRING they have special spring gardens which are soooo lovely
Huge and great gardens. Great gardens to walk around, can easily lose hours here, with spectacular views of Sydney harbour bridge, and of course the Opera house.It is a nice place to walk and relax.
Great gardens. These are beautiful gardens , well kept up, in the center of Sydney. I wish we had more time to see them, but they are great to walk through.
Lovely gardens. We liked the spectacular location and the walk around the gardens along Sydney Harbor. Also the parrots and other colorful birds were amazing!

Super Gardens and amazing location. These gardens are full of interest for even the least interested gardener. This time we particularly enjoyed teh Australian and then the NZ plant beds. Oh and the coffee and Gardens shop.
Great place to escape the hussle and bustle of the city. The gardens are a great place for a stroll and to relax between seeing the other sights of the city.

Great botanical garden. Excellent.
Take time to visit.
We spent app. 4 hours in this park.
We saw cockatoos, rainboow lorikeets, ibis, several species of ducks.
The trees and flowers amazing.
We were very happy to have spent time there.

Beautiful!. I had a short layover in sydney and was able to walk though the gardens a bit. They were stunning, and a great diversion from the hustle and bustle of the city. Highly recommended if you want a nice walk or need a morning workout routine.

Sydney Botantical Gardens. Beautiful gardens, well layed out , nice cafeteria , good views of the Sydney and circular keys. Species of trees were labelled so that we knew what we were looking at . Lots of space .
Amazing. Spend time just walking through these gardens, They are wonderful and well worth a visit. Easy to get to from our hotel they were a wonderful diversion on the walk to the harbour
Beautiful spot in the middle of the city. We walked all around the gardens all the way to Mrs Macquairies' Chair and then to the Opera House. Huge sanctuary in the city.
a tranquil oasis. We had a free morning to wander through these beautiful gardens. The views of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge are amazing too.

Beautiful botanical gardens. Sydney's Royal Botanic Gardens are stunning. The rose garden is very special, with very good signage explaining the displays. The plants and trees to be found here, because of the climate, are very different from what one would find in most US and European cities, and that adds to the pleasure of this visit. These gardens are very well maintained, and there is no admission charge.
nice and relaxing. Got completely lost in the vast grounds of the Botanic Gardens. Nice walk through to kill sometime. Plenty of places to sit down and relax.
Take your time. These extensive gardens warrant quite a few hours to enjoy fully. Easy to walk around, many garden areas to view. Highly recommended.

So beautiful but others are more beautiful!. I have seen so many botanic gardens when I travel all around the world. I think the one in Melbourne is more stunningly beautiful than the one in Sydney simply because the traffic around the garden disturb the beauty of the scene..The presentation was nice but more commercial, like the restaurant inside the garden and that small shop selling some junks! they ruins the beauty of the garden.

Soul food!. A perfect place to sit and relax .. and spend at least 5-6 hours. I went to this place three times during my stay in Sydney and couldn't get enough. Make sure you enter from the Opera House side and walk all around. You can easily spend an entire day here. Watch the sunset from one of the laws or set of steps. The view is breathtaking!

Gorgeous!. When you explore the world...you'll find mostly everyone imports trees and plants from Australia because the native species are just spectacular. The landscapers have done a tremendous job...you have to see in person.

Nice views, free to enter, central. Like everything in Sydeny, it is very easy and central to get to. It is right next tot he circular quai and you can walk here from the harbour or the central business district. We went for a jog, starting at the oepra house.

Huge Park. Great visit to what is effectively a huge park and botanical gardens centrally located and accessible from city or Opera House. Walk the park to the Art museum, St Mary's Cathedral and Hyde Park.

Good For The Soul........ Our daughter chose to marry in The Fern Garden area, some years past, so it is a special place for us. The gardens never fail to be food for the soul; they somehow recharge the batteries. We have never been disappointed by either the quality of food drinks or service from the restaurant. The fact that it sits right in the centre of The Royal Botanic Gardens and is cool and welcoming in summer. The bats so used to be such a fascination but also a big problem, now seem to be somewhat 'controlled' hurray! *If you should get a chance....just lay down under one of those Big Mama trees; and let the world go by, if only for a short while.....pure heaven in a big vibrant city.
Peace amidst the City. A beautiful place to walk at the end of a busy day in Sydney. Unique trees, fountains, birds galore. We walked there 2 different evenings and still didn't cover the whole area.

Great touch of serenity in the middle of all the chaos. Not, the only place, to get away from it all in the middle of the CBD but one of the loveliest. Fascinating history at your feet and above your head, the sort of green space that is the envy of other cities and their residents, accessible, free and always something new and interesting to discover which is often also something beautiful.
Worth a visit. If you need a break from downtown Sydney shopping, grab a cool drink and go for a wander in the park. Lots of wild life around and great gardens to look at.
Great. The gardens are a great place to go for a lovely walk in the sunshine by Sydney harbour. Lots of lovely birds to see and gives you various lookouts to the bridge and opera house.

Lovely Gardens.. We wished we would have had more time here. We were just killing some time before we went to the airport to catch our flight, and decided to walk through the Botanic Gardens. There lovely flowers, trees, and fountains, and they encouraged you to walk on the grass! There were a number of signs telling you about the various plants and trees, so we really appreciated that. We would have liked to tour Government House, but it was only open for tours on weekends.

Amazing and Relaxing. The botanic garden is an amazing place with fantastic back-drop views of Sydney CBD high-rise on one side and the Sydney harbour bridge on the other whilst you are surrounded by beautiful nature.

Gorgeous gardens to wander through on a sunny day. Beautiful gardens/park to walk through on a sunny day. I spent a lovely morning wandering around from the NSW Library down to the waterfront and along to the Opera House.I love how you can discover different areas of the park from English Cottage Rose Garden to California Promenade.

My favourite place. Well, this is a place to relax and rewind with a book - or - you can jog, learn about flora and fauna or have a picnic. My favourite activity is to sit with a book and watch the world go by. We loved it here. The walk in the gardens is interesting. Remember to go and look at the bats.We spent a few hours in the gardens and then wandered down along the path along the harbour. There is a place to get food and a shop to buy a few bits and pieces. Remember the shop, like many tourist places, is not cheap.Don't forget your camera.

Superb. We've been here before and it is still very impressive. Great views across Sydney harbour to the Opera House. Lovely well tended gardens, which are excellent and relaxing to stroll around. You could spend hours here admiring the trees and plants. If I lived nearby I would love to run around these gardens. The folk of Sydney are very lucky to have this gem on their doorstep - and it's free.

a must visit.. Not a bad place to veg out a hangover on the lawn with a blanket, a beautiful girl and a nice wine/cheese combo.... Nice herb garden, rose garden...Great views of the bridge and opera house. Good place for a jog.
Beautiful walk. The climate and secenery were beautiful. Easy walk, crowds were not bad, close to the Opera House, bridge in view on the way back. I would reccomend it.
A must see. We love nature and seeing new a different trees and birds was a real treat for us in this garden. Be sure to walk all the way out to Mrs Macquarrie's chair.
fun stroll. we enjoyed walking about and seeing the gardens. makes for a slow leasurly stroll. The eel's in the ponds scared me when they came to the surface
Beautiful. We had a very happy wander through the gardens and it was a lovely simple thing to do. You feel like you're miles from the hustle and bustle of the city
Very Diverse. The history of the indigenous population told through the gardens is very interesting. Spring walk was a riot of colour. Not quite Kew or Singapore, but pretty good

Gorgeous. This is an elegant huge greenscape on the waterfront. Beautiful and peaceful. All plants are labeled for botany fans. Signs invite you to walk on the grass and sit down to enjoy the view of boats sailing on the harbor. Two man made lakes are teeming with water birds.
Lovely sprawling place. This is a beautiful place to chill, only steps away from the hustle of the city and right on the harbour. So may hidden nooks and crannys.
Huge gardens. Sydney Botanic gardens are huge. Gardens themselves are OK but not spectacular. However it has by far the best view of the harbour bridge and opera house together.
A Beautiful Stroll. Went in just for a half hour or so and ended up spending half a day there, gorgeous with beautiful harbour views.

Beautiful gardens in a remarkable spot. These gardens are in a beautiful location on the harbour. They are incredibly well maitained with a wide selection of plants from different parts of the world. Very quiet and serene - a great place to relax.
Beautiful. We visited the Royal botanic Gardens in the spring and they were lovely. They are a short walk from the Sydney Opera House and well worth the visit.

Huge inner city park. One great thing about Sydney are its park lands. Plenty of them and very nice for picnics. Grab some food and some friends and go there on the weekend. The Botanic Gardens are a good place to be since you have beautiful views of harbour and opera house.

BOTANICAL BLISS. For a garden lover these gardens are wonderful with many different botanical nooks to explore and the wonderful old Ficus Trees that were planted by the early settlers must be seen to be believed. Wear a hat and sunscreen and also comfortable shoes. Allow for at least two hours to immerse yourself in this botanical bliss.

Enjoyable walk in a green space. liked the park like feel in walking around and loved the variety of palms and enjoyed the rose garden.
Did not pay to go into the tropical greenhouse but did expect to see more tropical plants in the garden
Summer repose!. A big garden, lots of open places for families and lovers alike just to relax and soak in the wonderful energies of nature in the city. Lovely walks too.

Nice Surprise. We walked to the Botanic Gardens and also got a tour of the Government Building on the premises. You can see the Opera house from the gardens. There are an interesting display of artifacts on the entry grounds. We later learned that these were pieces of buildings that had been torn down in Sydney.

Stunning scenery and nicer way to see the city. Great expanses of luscious green with a stunning back drop of the Sydney harbour, Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Lots of places to sit and contemplate, and great for walking and jogging, if you're so inclined

beautiful. Great gardens to walk around, can easily lose hours here, with spectacular views of Sydney harbour bridge, and of course the Opera house.
Don't leave Sydney without visiting the gardens,
N.B look out for a tree that's full of bats, it's incredible sight, all sleeping upside down during the day.

Immerse yourself in the bush in the heart of Sydney. In minutes you can be out of the city and in a rainforest where you can't see or hear the city,or under an ancient Moreton Bay fig. You can relax on well-manicured lawns, sit on a bench under ferns, walked through a cactus garden, or be down by the Harbour for a stroll round the water. And the kiosk is good too, for a quick meal downstairs, or a restaurant meal upstairs. Definitely worth a visit. Start at Curcular Quay (arrive by ferry of you can) walk round to the gardens by the sea walk, then immersive yourself in nature for a couple of hours, and a meal at the Kiosk is good too.

Interesting plants that do not grow at home in Ohio. There is a free tour most days in mid morning, meet at the building where the gift shop is. Use the internet to check time of these free tours. I am a master gardener in Ohio, and it was very interesting see the giant tree ferns and other plants that grow in the semi tropical climate of Sydney. The volunteer leading the tour gave information about the plants that was better than a simple "walk through". The garden was well cared for. The tour took about one hour.
Peaceful and Beautiful. An oasis in the city. Well worth a meander. Some quite stunning trees, all clearly labelled - interesting for the greenthumb and amateur alike.

Best photo spot!. Not only are there fantastic floral and tree plantations like rose garden, chinese garden...etc, but also there are 2 things I want to highlight.If you are a fan of photography - botanic garden has the great angle to capture both opera house and sydney harbour bridge together! Take a comfortable walk along the sea from opera house and you can't miss it.A bit further down the walk, you'll pass by Mrs.M's Chair. Great to sit there, think back 100 years before and enjoy the view.

Lots of color. There are many broad and inviting areas of green here and unlike parks we encountered in Germany you are encouraged to walk on the grass. There are many areas of beautifully maintained and colorful beds where masses of flowers can be enjoyed. There may be some areas where stair climbing is necessary so be advised because the gardens are located on a hilly slope.
Good for garden fans. There are heaps of native plants. The signs made the garden easy to get around. A place for people in Sydney to be proud of.

Plenty to see.. We took a walk from Hyde Park down to the Opera House and lingered a long time in the Botanical Gardens, there was so much to see. The wildlife was fairly tame and provided much entertainment at the cafe as some birds were very cheeky and stole food from tables, so beware! The cactus gardens were thoughtfully laid out and very tranquil. If you have not visited before, then I would recommend that you walk along the waters edge towards the Opera House rather than making that your starting point because the way the Opera House reveals itself is just thrilling.

Huge and great location. The gardens are in the perfect location; right next to the Opera House so before or after a long day of sightseeing they are fantastic to wander through and relax in. It had some beautiful sections, one in particular had a lovely water fountain right in the centre. However because of it's enormous size there is a lot of space between the different sections so at times it felt more like a park than a garden. I preferred the Melbourne Botanic gardens over Sydneys.While visiting I would definitely recommend a visit to Governor's house, which is at the end closest to the Opera House.

Place for everyone. The Biortabica gardens are very large and in a very desirable location. There is plenty of lawn space for parties (such as Christmas Parties) as there was on the day we visited. The walk to the tea rooms - restaurant was by a large footpath. We passed by and looked at many interesting trees and shrubs on the way - it was not overly crowded and we had plenty of time to take in the views.

A lovely way to spend an afternoon in Sydney. The gardens themselves are beautiful but the stand alone feature in my mind is the tropical plants greenhouse where you can see many beautiful exotic plants.

Stunning part of Sydney.. I absolute love the Botanic Gardens in Sydney, best in Australia. It's right next to the Opera House, it makes for a great location.I usually walk from Finger Wharf (Woolloomooloo Bay) all the way round to the Opera House. It does take at least half an hour, but it's totally worth it. Like with any Botanic Garden there's lots to see in terms of plants etc, but unlike others I've been too, there is more wildlife. Lots of spiders (harmless), a lot of birds including Parakeet's and Cockatoo's. I've also spotted a few Possum's in the evening.Best time to visit is dusk. Beautiful views over the Opera House and Harbour bridge. You also get a swarm of bats flying above the park (they roost in the trees at the gardens). The sky was thick large fruit bats, it was quite amazing too see, coming from the UK I'd not seen anything like it. You cannot go to Sydney without walking round the gardens. I walked through everyday while I was there to get to the city, and I always saw something new each day.

Great place for a run.. Now due to my dodgy knees I tend to stick to cycling nowadays. However, I always make an exception when visiting Sydney. Dump the hotel gym and head here. Fruit bats hanging from the trees, statues, odd plants, trees, birds and a view of the harbour, the bridge and the Opera House on the final leg back to most central hotels. I'm not the biggest fan of Sydney, I think it's a most overrated city, but I do enjoy my run there through the gardens!
Peace in the city.. Wide open grassy areas, bats and plants! Lots of places to just chill away from the busy CBD. Watch out for the bats n th entrees as walking under could get messy!

Lovely Strolling in Public Park. This is a beautiful and well-maintained public botantical park. I suggest starting at the Rose Garden and then walking North towards the Opera House. From the Gardens, the views of the Opera House are quite engaging. You can exit the Gardens at the foot of the steps to the Opera House, so I recommend checking out the Opera House next.
Contentment in heart of the city. 20-30 paces in to the Botanical Gardens and a serenity overcomes one. Second only to Hyde Park (London) and Central Park (New York) in my experience.
Perfect Wedding Venue. We had our wedding ceremony here and it was the perfect location. Beautiful back drop and lovely surroundings

I love this place. What a wonderful garden in the centre of the city. Stroll from Macquarie street across to the art gallery, stop on the way to ave coffee in the tea house or just take a picnic and pull up a view overlooking the harbour. You can get lost for hours and enjoy every minute. The rose gardens in spring, the herb gardens, the lovely old more ton bay figs, the ponds and even the bats folded up in the trees. All wonderful and lots to see, take your time.
Quiet in bustle of a busy city. Well laid out with wonderful views of the harbour and fascinating wildlife. A nice cafe in the middle and only a hop from Circular Quay

Very beautiful and well maintained garden.. This is a very beautiful garden. It is also a great place to view and photograph many of the local birds. We had some great photo ops for rainbow lorikeets. It is a nice place to walk and relax.

A haven of tranquility. Walking through the Gardens is amazing. It so peaceful and tranquil and yet so close to the hustle and bustle of the city. And it connects to the grounds of the Opera House and Circular Quay.
beautiful!. A lovely, well-kept place, with an amazing flora/fauna. Feeding the birds was one of the best-kept souvenirs we have of sydney!

A little disappointing. For such an iconic city I expected far more than we experienced. Maybe it was the time of year that we went but it all looked a bit 'tired' and unloved' in places. Some parts were well kept and tidy but these only managed to show up the more 'neglected' areas. Even the Palm House failed to impress. Sorry Sydney! However, on a sunny afternoon it is a pleasant place to stroll.

A stunning place for a picnic. It is a beautiful garden with stunning views. There is so much to see - I particularly love the succulent garden. It is a beautiful place for a picnic. You could spend hours watching the world pass by in this stunning location.

Beautiful & peaceful. Lovely to walk through the gardens, meet up with friends for a picnic or just lie reading a book. The gardens are lovely, the eatery there is excellent. Great place to go & chill out & enjoy the sunshine & of course the plants & trees.

What a place to go for a run in the morning!. No matter what path, you'll end up somewhere with an amazing view. I went for a run around and ended up forcing myself to do another lap it was that good! On a morning with sun out in Summer, not sure it gets much better than this.
Beautiful. A lovely wedding location and a beautiful reception venue with service excellence! An unforgettable evening.

Sydney's best kept secret. Some of the best views in Sydney without the hoards of tourists. Beautiful in Spring when everything is in bloom. But fabulous on any sunny day to enjoy a picnic overlooking the harbour. Just beautiful.

Wow...very pleasant!. I wasn't real excited about looking at trees and plants, but there are some really neat things here. An oasis inside the city. Such awesome views too. Well worth the visit. Don't forget your camera....great pics!!!
Excellent. I would urge anyone visiting Sydney to do this. Not only were the gardens superb, the views over the harbour were unmissable. It was a major highlight

Walking the gardens. One of my all time favourite things (if the weather not to hot) is to walk through the gardens, having a cuppa at the cafe and strolling down to the water front around the Opera House and back. Take your time, take in the gardens, the views and if you have time Mrs Macquarie's Chair. Never loses it's value as a great walk - I recommend the mornings. :)

A gem in the city. The number of flying foxes living in the Royal Botanical Gardens was probably the most surprising and stunning part of the whole experience. I know they are trying to get rid of them.

lovely park, Government house, lunch. Beautiful, huge park, easy walk from Circular Quay. Saw lots of birds and blooms. We ate lunch and saw outside of Government house (sometimes open) Closed for function the day we were there.
Well maintained interesting garden. Many specimens from both Australia & elsewhere. Many that we had never seen before. Cafe crowded , no where to sit

Variety and beauty in some good walks. The Royal Botanic Gardens are close to the Sydney Opera House and Circular Quary - so right in the heart of the area very attractive to tourists. The gardens have interesting flowers, as well as hot houses and other display areas. Worth several hours of meandering around. Work your way to the Opera House, then around the corner to a coffee on the Quay.

A place of many weddings. The Royal Botanical Garden is an awesome place to relax your mind, be it with families or simply alone. On weekend especially you would see many many weddings there and kids running around as the Sydney siders jog around the park, Amazing place!

worth a visit. We wandered through the gardens one morning for 2 hours and it's well worth the visit. The fern garden and lower garden near the water are very nice, it's also a great route to walk to the opera house if you're in the Kings cross area
Delightful gardens. A great walk in the park with very interesting plants - and it's all free! Well worth the walk. Very interesting fern house.

I love the Royal Botanic Gardens!. There is something for everyone in the Royal Botanic Gardens. Every time I visit, I see something new there. One time it was an owl sitting high in a tree. There are so many different corners to explore and plants to discover that it is impossible to see all of the gardens in one visit. On my last visit I spent a lot of time in the herb garden and found many herbs that I did not know. There are plenty of spots throughout the gardens to sit and contemplate the view or just enjoy the peace. It is my favourite place in central Sydney.

Well Groomed & Peaceful Gardens. A great place to meditate or read a book. Very quiet with a vast array of Australian Flora. Was sad to see that they removed/relocated the Flying Foxes due to the foxes stripping and killing 100+ year old trees. A very beautiful place to spend some time while in Sydney.
best gardens in Australia. Probably the best gardens in australia, I've been to Brisbane, Sydney, Perth and now Melbourne. The view over the harbour is fantastic, great place to have lunch.

Lovely, Lovely, Lovely. We had perfect weather, so the Gardens were a delight! Spring and lots in bloom, the air smelled wonderful! This is a terrific spot to enjoy a picnic, or just some quiet time to sit and chat. The museum is nearby, and worth a visit (and it's free!) Highly recommend this area.

Well Kept. For an English girl there were lots of very odd birds around! Its an awesome walk/run through these gardens and the views from the end are spectacular. The gardens close at 10pm though so you do have to walk around them if you are staying on the other side of the city. A bit of a mission.
Good location adjacent to Sydney Harbour. Well maintained gardens and parklands, not always a lot of colour on display. But views of the harbour are great.
Rejuvenating. So peaceful and yet in such a busy area of the city. Enjoyed our walk and the beautiful trees, flowers and birds.Great way to take a break and rejuvenate.

Lady Macquaries' Chair. This is the place where you can see so much of Australian History, both Indigenous and European. In 1988 it was the scene in which in one sector of Australian society it was celebrated as the genesis of Australian history; in another it was mourned as Invasion Day.
Great space in the City. This is a lovely place to get away from the noise of the City and it's minutes walk so easy to achieve this.Great for just sitting, picnics, jogging and events.
Beautiful day to see beautiful gardens.. Lovely walk through the gardens. Visiting Government house on our way by was great and interesting. We really enjoyed the views as well.

Lovely and Huge Garden!. This garden is so big and multifaceted that anyone can spend a full day or more here. It is a real treasure complimenting Sydney, a quiet respite from the bustle of downtown Sydney. We toured Government House, the Rose Garden and Pavilion, the Pioneer Garden, the Marden Pavilion, and walked out to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair. We visited here 3 or 4 times over several days since there is so much to see. Plan to see this wonderful garden if you have plenty of time!
Beautiful gardens with iconic views. These gardens are lovely to look at, easy to walk though and give great views of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.
Tranquility. An ideal place to get away from the hustle and bustle of the main tourist sites. A great variety of plants etc and good information on them

beautiful. beautiful gardens from native australian to chinese. there is a nice little shop and cafe within the grounds. From the botanic gardens you can walk to the opera house or to mrs macquaries chair which is well worth the walk

Beautiful gardens. Lovely walk around the gardens - cafe was noisy and manic - and closed very early! Apart from that, the gardens are beautiful and there are fabulous views across to the Opera House and Harbour Bridge. Well worth a visit.

Just awesome.. I love visiting gardens and the Royal Botanic Gardens of Sydney did not disappoint. These are beautiful and extensive gardens, on the world's most picturesque harbour. Kookaburra's, parrots, water birds and other birds were everywhere. If you love peaceful environments then don't miss these magnificent gardens.The sign that asks you to please walk on the grass and hug some trees is a nice 'Welcome'.
Lovely place to learn about the flora down under. Love walking around here. I learn something every time. The restaurant is a bit pricy but is a lovely setting. Don't walk under the flying foxes!

Excellent free attraction. We arrived on an overnight flight in Sydney and stuck for something to do at 7 am we walked to the Botanical Gardens. What a great walk we had through the gardens. The gardens were full of well kept flower beds and well sign-posted walks. If you get to the end (or bottom) of the gardens then you have the Sydney Opera House to enjoy.
impressive. take the train tour as you can get on and off at various stops. The gardens are relaxing and we loved it. The views are fantastic.

This is a Sydney 'Must Do'. There's not enough good words to describe this place, it's really beautiful and a good walking shortcut from the city to Kings Cross/ Potts Point, or to the Opera House. Walk right through and keep going to see Mrs Maquarie's chair on the point.
Beautiful and restful spot in the City. Well worth a visit - so much to see and experience. Some lovely shady areas too. Plenty of places to sit. Need longer than we had - at least a good half a day.

good and bad. It's nice. It's a huge garden or park in city center, but for some reasons, there are loads of flies landing on my head, shoulder, arm, legs, face. We are talking about 6 flies at the same time. It was scary, like being raped by zombies in resident evil. So we left after we were there for 2 minutes.We went back a few days later. There were less flies, maybe 1 or 2 flies trying to be close to you at a time, but there were lots of flies in Sydney everywhere. Not sure if it was the season, weather, temperature. For sure it's not just me, lots of people are being annoyed by flies there, sort of like flies casually landing on animals in Africa.
Lovely Gardens. I went for a walk through the beautiful Gardens on the weekend. They are a lovely oasis in the middle of a very busy city.

Interesting Birds!. We most always visit Botanic Gardens when we visit a city. This one was exceptional. The trees are huge and the flowers lovely. The birds are some we had never seen before. Very insteresting!

Very nice botanical garden. In the heart of Sydney. Having returned to Sydney for 6th time, I decided to return to the Royal Botanical Garden for a stroll because it was a nice spring day. The garden was splendid with many spring blooms. A great place to while away 1 to 3 hours of your day. Plus it is free!

Flock of Cockatoos were a surprise. Took the Bonza Bike Tour that took us through here. What a great surprise to come across the flock of friendly (if you had food) Cockatoos on the lawn. This park is a can't miss Steve in Sydney
A Beautiful, Quiet Area. It was a nice place to walk around after being in the busy harbour area. It's big, so there are alot of little different garden areas.

Relaxing. The gardens are very close to the city and harbour and provide relief from the hustle and bustle of the city streets. They are nicely laid out and well sign posted so finding your way around is not a problem. A nice relaxing spot with views over the harbour.

A great place for botanists and families. A beautiful place for a picnic for couples and families - and a nice place for some peace and quiet for a single. A little oasis if you like in the midst of a busy and bustling city!

Hail to the Queen. Take your hat of to the Queen, the Royal Gardens in Perth, Sydney and Melbourne are some of the finest in the world. It is really a great way to spend a sunny day in SYD just looking at the garden and having a coffee - The cafe in the middle of the garden doesn't look like much but it does make a good coffee.Plan for at least two hours
Excellent and free. We spent three hours on a fine spring day. We loved it, walking the bay and taking in the sights and the plants. Loved it.

Great spot to relax. The beautiful Royal Botanic Gardens is an excellent spot when you're looking to escape the city. Enjoy a casual stroll through the gardens or buy some lunch and enjoy it in the tranquillity of the gardens.You can also access the Sydney Opera House from the Gardens.

Take the train. We took the train through the garden in order to cut down on time. Otherwise, it'd taken a few hours to walk through the botanic garden. The train gave us great views in a quick time along with insightful history and knowledge of Sydney and the opera house.

Take a book. The botanic gardens are great for a few hours of peace. I love to take a book.. find a nice shady tree, enjoy the view and relax..... But if you are more energetic.. the hot house, terrerium and other attractions will lead you down to the Opera House and harbour...Ummm bring your own food and drink... it is pretty poor and expensive....

Way to relax in Sydney. Enjoyed spending a few hours in the gardens. A place to rest and meander at your own leisure. Rose gardens are beautiful and there are some amazing trees. Nice areas to sit and vies harbor. Extra cost to visit greenhouses, but you don't really need them. Plenty of flora and fauna outside.
A Feast for the senses.. A must for the visitors. The fantastic plant and animal life. The serenity close to such bustling city. Handy for opera house. Good eateries.
Stunning. These gardens are just beautiful. Wander, sit, enjoy, but DO visit. No matter what your age, this is well worth your time.

The Gardens. These gardens were in full bloom when I was there and there were many spectacular plants and trees. Although it was a very hot day there were a lot of shady trees and cool areas.They are situated near the Opera House.

Not to be missed!. My family love the Botanic Gardens for many reasons. Stand-out reason is The Wind In The Willows in the gardens every summer; if you're in Sydney in summer, make time for this play (children or no children) as you'll see the gardens at their entertaining best.Beyond events like this, it's the perfect place for a picnic or simply exploring the mature botanical specimens. Take time out from city explorations and recharge on one of the many benches. Plenty to see.
You will see lots of bats.. so good place to walk around.. You will see lots of boats parked along the park and see the view of Sydney city on the other side of park as well.

wonderful gardens. You can wander there for hours. I went there Saturday early morning - hardly anyone around except the wonderful birds singing amazing concert of nature. A great place for meditation, easy walk, reading, relaxing, breathing green and listening to the birds.
Beautiful. This is a great place to walk and see the natural beauty of Sydney. Most vegetation is marked. It is a great place to see landmarks and it's a very educational walk.
Lovely gardens. Great setting in the centre of Sydney. Could spend hours here just relaxing or finding out more about plant and trees. A real retreat from the hussle.

World class Gardens. I love it, I got married here once, its a garden that welcomes visitors to see and touch nature, unlike other gardens round the world. walking round the corner offers the best view of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge.

Great tour on a little train. To get an overview of the gardens, grab the little train where you enter the gardens from the Opera House. It's only $10 and the guides point out many special places in the gardens, e.g., the Governor's House, Mrs. Macquarie's chair, the herb garden, a glass pyramid, housing for bats, the oldest tree in Australia, etc. Kids love the train ride, and tourists (like us) appreciate the opportunity to see all the gardens and choose which parts to revisit.
Beautiful. spent a lovely afternoon in the gardens, what a view! On a lovely day no better way than to watch the world go by and just enjoy the scenery

Oasis. Love the Botanic Gardens, an Oasis in the City. Considering the surroundings it's possible to forget where you are and relax in the serenity and peace and quiet. the cafe also does great coffee and sandwiches
Not to be missed!. Peaceful and pretty with perfect views of the SydneyOpera House and Harbour Bridge - we spent an idyllic time strolling these gardens - just perfect.
Worth a visit !!. Would you believe we cycled all round this area on a bicyle tour ,lovely place fantastic views all round the harbour from different angles .

Peaceful spot in the middle of a bustling city. Took time out here to write some post cards and it was gorgeous! hard to believe somewhere so quite and peace can be found in the middle of a huge city, def worth a visit and walk around.

beautiful place, but too many stairs if you are walking with a baby in a pushchair. the gardens are amazing and beautifully taken care of... there are many many places to sit down and relax with your little one....if not the stairs. I was lucky to meet a lovely japanese tourist who helped me climb the stairs to get out at the end of the day....

Long Opening Hours. The greatest advantage of the gardens is their long opening hours. They open at seven in the morning, although the closing time varies depending on months. In summer (Nov-Feb), they are open until eight in the evening. Take this into account when you make a sightseeing plan for Sydney. After visiting the gardens, you may want to enjoy a great night view of Circular Quay.
beautiful. spent a very relaxed afternoon lying in the sun and enjoying the manicured gardens. We loved it and the views from there across the harbour are wonderful.
Beautiful Botanical Gardens. Go to the Botanical Gardens, have a picnic, watch the people go by, look at the plants, the view, soak up the rays. Its gorgeous! Do it, you know you want to.

Join a free guided walk. Volunteers lead walks twice a day. We really enjoyed ours (led by Glenn - a natural enthusiast). We learnt so much about the history of Sydney as well as the plants. A real treat.

Beautiful. Beautiful gardens with so much to do! We paid $10 for a 'train' ride around the garden. The guide was very informative and it was worth the money as you could get off on one of four stops and get back in at a later time.

Definitely worth the visit. We really liked this as a place to walk and sightsee. There are amazing birds there as well--very colorful and inquisitive parrots and quite noisy cockatoos as well. The flora and fauna are very relaxing. Of course the short walk to the Opera House is spectacular as well, and that tour is worth doing too.

Wonderful Walk. Had a wonderful walk around the Botonic Gardens - just beyond the Opera House - on my first day when I was trying to adjust to time zone. There are some really interesting specimen trees. One of the first things I noticed here was how semi tame the wild birds are - so easy to photograph! The Ibis, quite large/tall, and their long curving beaks hoping you will give them some food! Great place to stretch your longs after a long haul flight. Make sure you walk around to Mrs MacQuaries point to get one of the most stunning photo opportunities of the Opera House and Harbour Bridge in the same shot. PS the gardens have free entrance.

A great place to relax in.. The Botanic Gardens cover quite a large area. The lawns sweep down to the water and contain lakes and sculptures and fountains and conservatories and winding paths past all manner of interesting plants and trees. They are a very pleasant area to relax in, on the grass or by the lake and enjoy the views and sounds of the birds and different smells of the surrounding plants and trees. There is a restaurant and cafe and shop to visit, although sitting outside the cafe with food attracted some unwanted guests in the shape of large billed birds. The gardens were also a pleasant area to walk through on the way to the harbour and city.

Lush growth in a splendid location. The gardens are well tended and have a vast collection of tropical and more temperate plants. The scent of the blooms hangs heavy in the warm air. There used to be hundreds of flying foxes hanging upside down in the trees but they are absent this year. They were an interesting sight but they smelt awful and I'm glad they've gone. The ibises are scavengers and pests but the rainbow lorikeets and the sulphur crested cockatoos that fly about there are glorious. There is a huge old Moreton's fig tree that is splendid. There are lotuses in the lake. The pathway along the lower gardens runs right along by the sea. Fresh salads, good sandwiches and hot food can be bought at the cafe by the shop. It's pricey but worth it for the ambience. I have spent hundreds of hours in these gardens and never tire of them. If you don't have a lot of time hop on the little red train for a tour with commentary. It leaves from the opera house gate.
A great bit of nature right downtown. Such a great escape, so close to the city. Nice break to work in some nature, and a chance to see birds like cockatoos and kookaburras, and colorful lorikeets.

a beautiful relaxing park. When you see the sign which says 'Do walk on the grass. Hug the trees.' etc. you know you have come a park with a difference. Well worth a visit and an easy walk from the harbour. Enjoy.

A must!. I travel to many places for business but Sydney is definitely one of my favorite cities. To walk to and in the Botanical Gardens in the early morning and after a day of work and meetings is one of the highlights for me. The variety of plants, different places to explore or to sit and read or just watch the birds, the water, the people.... it is a gem inside the city.
beautiful. We were surprised by the beauty of the Gardens. It was a lovely walk and there was much to see and we were fortunate to have perfect weather to enjoy it all.
a truly lovely spot. IF the bats are there, it is an amazing sight to behold; additionally, the gardens are lovely and colorful especially during spring and summer.

so peaceful. such a lovely place to visit, always seems so peaceful and you can easily spend a day here looking around and soaking up the sun. we spend our boxing day here soaking up the rays and having a picnic, was beautiful - and gorgeous views of the opera house from here

We joined a free guided tour of the RBG and had a fantastic morning - highly recommend. Our guide was of course very expert on the flora but also had a lot of history knowledge that added to the experience

Well Worth A Visit. Only a stone's throw from the Central Business District and behind the Opera House, the Royal Botanic Gardens make a pleasant break from the hustle and bustle of Sydney. Be prepared for a bit of a walk - the gardens are extensive and if you want to take it all in you will need a few hours. We'd recommend the morning as it is slightly cooler, plus you can stop at one of the pleasnt eateries within for lunch. The gardens are beautifully maintained and there is much to interest even a non-gardener like me! I found the Herb Garden very interesting and whilst the Rose Garden did not impress me at first it was only when I understood the difficulty in growing them here that its significance sank in. One of the things I really liked was the city skyline visible through the tress at certain points during the walk - so close by and yet so peaceful inside the gardens. Lots to see and do here, too numerous to mention. Give it a go!

What a setting!. Right by the Harbour, with immacutely presented gardens, shrubs and bushes, all adequately signposted, friendly eating places, satuary and fountains, including the original Tank Stream which supplied the first white settlers with their drinking water, it's a relaxing and rewarding place to visit.

Do not miss this experience. We always try to visit botanic gardens in our travels.They provide wonderful, serene green spaces in an urban environment....usually with an intriguing layout.....Sydney's is The best overall Botanic Garden I have seen anywhere...Beautifully planned and structured to highlight the harbor, bridge and opera house. we loved the Fernery especially...Spend a few hours at least...

Beautiful Gardens. Unfortunately the gardens don't open until 7am so if you would like an early morning run through the gardens you will be disappointed. Very well laid out and very well cared for. Visited many times when in Sydney on business and found a new area every time
Get your first day legs here. Breath-taking views and vegetation, beautifully arranged. A nice long walk and good first orientation to Australian flora.

Awsome. Extremely beautiful place which is a must for all travellers to Sydney to take their time and visit. don't forget your camera on this minimum 3 hours tour! and for sure, check the flying fox area before the sunset
Great running route. My hotel was close to the gardens so I made this my running route. No traffic, beautiful, wonderful aromas, and rolling hills make this a great spot.
Lovely big gardens on Sydney Harbour. The gardens are well-kept and there are lots of fountains, ponds with ducks, statues and a lovely conservatory with hot house plants.

Cake. Seek out the pavillion cafe and have the cake with a coffee whilst you watch the world go past. Huge portions of fantastic, sticky cake will give you cake-guilt all week! Then walk it off in one of the world's most stunning public open spaces.

Free, next door to the CBD, on the harbour, with ducks and bats!. You can walk from circular quay to the opera house and directly into the gardens, then wrap your way around the harbourfront through Mrs Macquarie's chair to Woolloomoolloo. The southern end of the gardens has historic buildings and a rainforest garden. While in this area make sure you go to the central coffee shop and look up into the trees - you will see fruit bats (nocturnal) sleeping upside down and hanging from the trees. In summer as the sun sets thay migrate south and the image across the sky as they fly is amazing. The western edge (Macquarie St) has rose gardens and small hills. Northern edge fronts the harbour and has duck ponds. Bring a picnic to save money. You can always find an intimate spot or perch on the eastern side hills for a panoramic view of the harbour and city.

Beautiful. The gardens are well kept and there are so many different areas and plants to wander around. We had a picnic in the park and then wandered around the gift shop which was lovely and the staff were friendly.

Beautiful garden, nice walk, and great views. My boyfriend and I were just planning to visit the Opera House, but when we saw the gardens, we had to venture in. It was so quiet and pleasant! There were so many different plants and trees, we saw birds, and ended up walking around for over an hour. We also got a great shot of the Opera House and the Harbour Bridge along the water.
Amazing. Love the botanic gardens. Just amazing. Beautiful views and lovely flowers and plants. There is also a little pond where we seen ducklings and ducks etc..a lot of wildlife here also.

Peaceful and pleasant. My fiance and I spent most of an afternoon in Sydney just relaxing in the Botanic Gardens, they are absolutely amazing, the gardens are an unbelievably peaceful and pleasant place to relax for an afternoon after a busy morning or just a quiet day off. I would recommend anyone in Sydney to take a peaceful walk around the entire gardens, it is very nice, and safe.

Inner city quiet. A great spot to retreat from the city chaos and enjoy some peace and quiet, a cup of tea or a picnic. The plants on display are well ket and there are a number of historic plants in the area.

Well maintained garden, incredible view to Harbor Bridge, Opera House and the city.. We stayed at Victoria street, took a walk by Woolloomoolloo to Royal Botanical Garden, bough some pie from Harry's Cafe D'Wheels.The warmth of the sun, the moorning breeze, smile of the kids, and breath taking view of Opera House and Harbor Bridge. Unforgetable.

A Nice Location. We enjoyed our visit here. Great views from the Gardens. A great place to get a photo of you with the Sydney Opera House in the background and to get a picture of you in Mrs. Macquarie's Chair (a rock formation). It is also across from Australia Navy ships.

Beauty down under. Loved the variety of different plants and trees. Beautifully manicured walking paths will eventually lead you down to the Sydney Opera House and no trip to Sydney should be without a visit to the botanical gardens.
Amazing in spring. Go in the spring. It is amazing against the backdrop of the city. Take time to read some of the interpretation pannels as they add to the experience.
Nice relaxing walk. Had a quite pleasant walk around these gardens plenty to see and a cafe in the middle to have a drink and relax while walking round

Heavenly Bliss. Need to wind down? Need peace and quiet ( now that the bats have mostly gone), then this is the place for you. Walk around and admire the flowers and trees, go jogging or just lie on the grass and lookat the sky. Wonderful!

Enjoying the green in a big city. The botanic gardens is one of the best things the early governments gave to Sydney, this amazing green area by the harbour offers a peaceful and relaxing for whoever wants a break from the city. Also a great napping place after lunch for those lucky enough to work close by. A favorite place for lovers and newly weds to take pictures and families to play with kids. It provides an even more refreshing feeling to such a pleasant city
Beautiful Gardens for a Wedding. Wedding service in gardens (Lawn 33) beatiful view of Opera House & Harbour Bridge & thankyou for the great weather.

Live in the heart of the city. Truly beautiful, great location, superb greenery.
The views to the opera are amazing. Excellent for jogging or plain walk. Superb place to spend romantic time and refresh your mind and body.

Green tranquility in the City. How fortunte Sydney is to have this area of green so close that anyone can stroll trough the gardens and walkways. Other attractions that adjoin are also open to view making this area a very pleasant place to view and rest awhile.

If you love gardening. These gardens are beautiful, such a wonderful variety of plants, you can spend hours there and it is in such a great location, handy to everything, so close and yet when you walk in to the gardens it feels like you stepped back a few years to a quieter time, take a breather for a couple of hours and enjoy!

Relaxing Day. We had intended going shopping, but just werent up for anymore hussle and bussle, so decided to try out the gardens as we have never been there. It was a pleasant suprise, we are not into gardening, but it was beautiful and peaceful, with lots of shady spots to sit and relax, topped off by the walk around the harbour to the opera house & circular quay. Would highly recommend it as a "time out" day. Wear good shoes - LOTS of walking.
Lovely!!. Fantastic gardens, perfect for a relaxing afternoon. Great if you are a backpacker as free and a nice place to relax from the city

Beautiful!. Lovely well kept clean gardens beautiful colours and interesting flowers/trees. Lots of good photo opportunities. Its lovely to see something like this right in the centre of the city you forget where you are when your walking the gardens.

Must see in Sydney. Beautiful views and a peaceful oasis in the middle of the Sydney.Take a picnic or enjoy an exhibition at the nearby Art Gallery and be on the lookout for Blue Tongue Lizards, Owls and a variety of bird life.
BEAUTIFUL gardens, worth the visit. beautiful gardens in the heart of Sydney, always full of people enjoying the quiet, nature and views,

Wasn't too impressed.. My wife and I always make a point of seeing botanic gardens when we travel and we have now seen 3 in Australia. First off there is the complete lack of decent parking. The SBG website suggests street parking or covered parking at the hospital ajacent to the park but there are few available street spaces and the hospital charges $30 for one hour! We finally found another garage that charged $8 for an hour and $20 for 2 hours and more for more hours. Really a robbery!Then from the garage we walked about 2 K and finally entered the grounds. Nice layout and big trees but not much in the way of flowering gardens, even for October. There was more at the one in Melbourne and that was a month ago in early spring. So far we would rate the one at Geelong the best.

Sydney visit.. If you visit Sydney, the Opera House is a must see. Next to the Opera House is the Botanic Garden. It is extremely well planned, large, informative. Obviously popular, from trails to cafes to wedding receptions the area is truly alive and impressive.

Beautiful haven in the middle of the City.. The large range of different garden flowers and trees. The large expanse of lawns and the BATS, although a little scary, amazing to watch.
The Garden Shop was fantastic with little souvenirs at a reasonable price.
A great place to just chill out.
Lines of light. Even at high noon, the structures created lovely lines across the gardens. I think I took 100 photos. Not that crowded. Peaceful.

Mesmerizing. This was almost the highlight of my trip to Sydney. Unfortunately, the flying foxes had not yet flown in from foreign destinations, but the grounds are beautifully kept and the varieties of flora are impressive. The middle gardens were particularly beautiful as we arrived in the spring time when the fragrant wisteria made it seem heavenly....
beautiful. take your time to go there . have lunch there. take a sandwich sit down relax and enjoy a wonderful time there is a lot to walk
Beautifully laid out gardens. We were a little early in the spring to take full advantage of the gardens but they were, nevertheless a worthwhile excursion

Natural Jewel of Sydney. Beautiful gardens, well maintained right on Sydney harbour - have a walk through, look at the cactus gardens or best of all if you can, treat yourself to lunch at the cafe or the restaurant in the gardens.
Soso. I walked through the Botanical Gardens once many years ago and found it boring compared to other Bot. Gardens. However over the years they might have improved them.
Beautiful. Beautiful botanical gardens featuring numerous plants, shrubs and trees from all over the world located on the waterfront of Sydney Harbour.

Always an Absolute Pleasure. Start at the Art Gallery of NSW and walk down through the Botanic Gardens to the Harbour. There's a nice little Cafe in the gardens for lunch and even though you're right in the centre of the city you could be a million miles away. It's so relaxing. One of my favourite places in Sydney. See my Youtube video called Sydney - Jewel of the Pacific - it will show you this route. AW (Tony) Scott
Sydney Botanical Gardens. Beautiful gardens with views of the harbor. A nice place to relax and walk along holding hands. You can get a nice coffee in the centre of the park.
botanic gardens. i have seen many gardens around the world this isnt the best in the world but it is a lovely garden and if you are into gardens I am sure you will be pleased with ours.

Unexpected cool park. Was walking to Opera House and ventured up to the botanical gardens. Wow. So gladi did. Spent much more time here than anywhere else and plan to return. So much to look at love that the locals use their parks to relax, bring a picnic, book sunbath... Best of nature is right here

Oasis in the city. This is place between the Opera House and the NSW Art Gallery and a lovely place to stop between the two. There are various sections, good walking paths, lovely viewsof the harbour and places to eat.

So relaxing and varied. Such a wonderfully relaxing place on the doorstep of the city. You see new things around every corner and there are plenty of benches to sit and admire the surroundings. A great place to get away from the hustle and bustle of sightseeing!
Take a half day and a picnic. Bats, botanicals, cactus, succulents ... and much more. all close to Sydney Harbour and the NSW Art Gallery (and botantical art exhibitions). Fabulous!
I really love the Royal Botanic Gardens. Amazing flora and peaceful.Fantastic view.Really recommendation to anyone who loves nature:)))))Very beautiful walk.And it's free.Visit it on your trip

Lovely afternoon walk. From Circular Quar to Mrs. Macquarie's Chair, it was a lovely walk two hours before sunset. I only wished I had taken a walk through the gardens before so I could have at least two visits here.It's a peaceful place with a scattering of runners/joggers, tourists, and book readers and lawn loungers. And it's free!Do it early on your trip if you're visiting Sydney, then you can have time to revisit.
Beautiful walk. Peaceful amazing flora. Well maintained and managed. Wonderful view of Harbor. Short walk from Opera. House

Simply breathtaking and beautiful!. It is beautiful and breathtaking. I had fun enjoying the views and the fountain was amazing. This place made me had a peace of mind. A great recommendation to anyone who loves nature. :)

Very nice well worth a look. Visited the botanical gardens last week and thought it was well worth the trip. A lot of the flowers were in bloom so this added to the attractiveness. Overall very nice and manicured laws. Also a nice walk around the waterfront. Also an easy walk from the Opera house and the free city shuttle bus.

paradise even if your not into nature. take a book, ipod, food, drinks, friends, partner, or just by yourself you could have a wonderful day at the gardens. peaceful, relaxing and beautiful to look at. toilets, and cafes avalaible, i am not one to be close with nature i find it boring but these gardens are beautiful - the trees i have never seen anything like it! one shaped like an elephant! so big and kids could climb the trees, the flowers all different colours and alot of work haas been put in to keep the gardens clean and neat and tidy! loved it
Nice getaway from CBD. Good location for post marathon meeting up, had nice walk to loosen up. Lovely setting on sunny, spring day.
Beauuuuutiful!. - Clean and well kept garden- Lovely, colourful flowers, so many varieties- Super liked the tulips and camelias- cute birds drinking from the fountain

Well worth a visit. I like how one can walk into the gardens or park from any side and wonder through. It's a very casual visit. I was pleasantly surprised by the succulent garden. I spent some time watching cockatoos settle in for the evening. The variety of bird species is excellent. I looked for the flying foxes but they have been moved away because of the damage they cause. Overall, this is a casual, relaxing getaway in busy downtown Sydney.
scenic and beautiful. A scenic and beautiful walk and truly among the cleanest major cities I have ever visited anywhere in the world.
botanic garden walks. this was our very favorite aspect of Sydney. the gardens are absolutely beautiful, exquisitely maintained, and remarkably peaceful and calming. just a tremendous experience.
Relax in the gardens. The ambling pathways, the immense selection of trees and plants, the view of the harbour - such a special place in the city.
BeAuTfUl. A MUST DO!! Great for pictures, nap and weddings. We went 1 week ago and witness a wedding there, so romantic! Nice place for a picnic!
Simply elegant. Let's just put it this way - if you enjoy gardens, this is pretty great ..and pretty much as good as it gets (as far as gardens go) in Sydney ;-p

Very close to the Opera House. Brings a nice change whether you are visiting Sydney for business or pleasure. The gardens are beautiful and ideal if you want a rest and nice walk with beautiful surroundings. I could see myself reading many books there if I was living there.

Terrific Afternoon!. I really enjoyed walking though the Royal Botanic Gardens!There are bats, birds (cockatoos that will eat from your hands!), water features, trees (great for climbing!) and plants. It is truly an oasis in the city! There are some cafes, so take the time to have lunch here and enjoy the outdoors (well as "outdoors" as one can be in such a large city lol)!

Simply gorgeous. These garden are simply beautiful. There is so many variety of plants, flowers and trees that it feels a bit surreal. Also, while you are there, make sure to catch a glimpse of the Flying Fox Bats. A truely unique species in Sydney.
Great place to walk on a good day. We liked that the trees and some of the other plants were marked with botanical names. Wonderful views.

Nice stroll for late afternoon.. It's a nice walk around the garden. You get to see some interesting flora and bird species.If you go for a late afternoon stroll, make sure to be at Mrs Macquarie's Chair around Sunset to get amazing photos of the Opera House and the Harbor Bridge in the background.

Lovely relaxing walk. The botanic gardens are beautiful at the moment. We walked through the gardens on our way to the city to do some shopping and they are worth a visit. Government House is in the Gardens but you need to be there on a weekend if you want to visit.

Very nice and quite green island in the busy Sydney. Very nice and quite green island in the busy Sydney.It is a must. Anyway, you cannot miss it since it is on the way between the center and Opera House.
How relaxing. What a great place closeby. Enjoyed the gardens and the house and enjoyed the outdoor cafe there. Loved it.

Peaceful oasis. Killing a few hours before a flight back around the world, I found myself in Sydney's Royal Botanic Gardens. I spent a few hours reading by the herb garden and met my flight refreshed by the beautiful smells. A lovely place.
A Great Place for a Stroll. Always enjoy taking a walk around the park. Go and take in the view from Mrs Macquarie's Chair. The shop in the gardens is a good place for some interesting souvenirs too.
Very beautiful!. Very peaceful and relaxing after a hectic morning in the city. We didnot take the "Garden Train Tour. At $20 per person we thought it was a little pricey.
A lovely walk in the park. lovely views of the harbour, but the selection of plants felt quite limited. what i liked was the succulent garden, which is an enclosed area.
Gardens. What a wonderful place to visit and picnic, the Botanical Gardens around the Sydney Harbour foreshore is a must for everyone

Best of Sydney. Beautiful! Definately a top attraction in Sydney also free. You should definately take the time to walk through here. They have a huge variety of plants. If you are not from Australia you will notice so many birds that are unfamiliar. There are also outstanding views of the opera house and the harbour.I recommend at least 3-4 hours for a long walk.

Great for pictures. My favorite thing about this park is that it sits right in the middle of the action in sydney and, yet, once you're walking through it, it feels so calm and peaceful. The views of the harbor are great and the area is kept up well. The meticulously crafted arrangement of the trees and flowers make for a very nice walk.

A gardeners paradise. Anyone that takes a stroll through the Botanical gardens, (especially during a nice sunny day) is greeted by beautify surroundings. The gardens have got many great facilities like guided tours coffee shops and an amazing view of the city and the harbour. Many Sydney siders take the opportunity to walk or jog around the many paths, (no cycling allowed in the park) There is many grassy areas where you sit and take a break while enjoying a bite to eat or hydrate yourself after reading the many information plaques that are under all the featured plants and trees. Whether your are a botanical enthusiast or not a walk in the park will energise your soul and senses.
